test_cases.Title: DocumentiCollegati_XXX_RU_SportsbookPlatform_DocumentiGestiti_TEST_Desktop_verify_section_presence

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application containing the RU Sportsbook Platform documentation page.
Steps.Expected Result: Documentation page loads successfully and main page header is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Scroll to the section titled 'Documenti collegati' or use page navigation to jump to it.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Documenti collegati' section is visible on the page.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the section contains a table with column headers: 'N.', 'Titolo', 'Versione', 'Data'.
Steps.Expected Result: A table is present with the specified column headers.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm that at least one row exists in the table referencing an external/linked document.
Steps.Expected Result: At least one table row is displayed under the headers indicating linked documents.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has valid credentials to access the documentation portal if required; 2) Tester has network access to the documentation site; 3) The RU Sportsbook Platform documentation page (version 3.0) is published and reachable.
test_cases.Dataset: Document page URL or repository path for 'RU Sportsbook Platform - Anagrafica e Gestione Eventi Brand Spagna v3.0'.
test_cases.Expected Result: The 'Documenti collegati' section is present and displays a table with the required headers and at least one referenced document row.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates presence and basic layout of the 'Documenti collegati' section only; does not validate link targets or file contents.

test_cases.Title: DocumentiTabellaContenuti_XXX_RU_SportsbookPlatform_DocumentiGestiti_TEST_Desktop_verify_table_contents

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Documenti collegati' section of the RU Sportsbook Platform documentation page (v3.0).
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Documenti collegati' section and its table are visible.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect the first (or relevant) table row and read the 'Titolo' column text.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Titolo' column contains the text 'RU Sportsbook Platform - Anagrafica e Gestione Eventi Brand Spagna' or an exact matching title for the referenced document.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect the same row's 'Versione' column value.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Versione' column value equals '3.0'.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect the same row's 'Data' column value and verify format (DD/MM/YYYY or as per project standard) and presence.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Data' column is present; if a date is provided it follows the agreed project format. If the document has no date, an empty cell is shown or a placeholder like '-' is used as per documentation standard.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the table row numbering in 'N.' column is consistent and increments correctly for multiple rows.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'N.' column contains sequential integers starting from 1 and increments without duplication.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Documentation page v3.0 is published; 2) Tester has read access to the page; 3) The table contains the referenced RU Sportsbook document row.
test_cases.Dataset: Expected row content: {Titolo: 'RU Sportsbook Platform - Anagrafica e Gestione Eventi Brand Spagna', Versione: '3.0', Data: '<date or empty>'}
test_cases.Expected Result: Table displays the correct document title and version '3.0'; date cell is present and formatted correctly or appropriately empty per standard; numbering is sequential.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers verification of table textual metadata (title, version, date, numbering). Does not verify clickable link behavior or document content.

test_cases.Title: DocumentiLinkAccesso_XXX_RU_SportsbookPlatform_DocumentiGestiti_TEST_Desktop_verify_link_and_open_document

Steps.Step Description: From the RU Sportsbook documentation page, locate the 'Documenti collegati' table and identify the row for 'RU Sportsbook Platform - Anagrafica e Gestione Eventi Brand Spagna'.
Steps.Expected Result: The specific table row is located and the 'Titolo' cell appears as a clickable link or has a link icon indicating access to the referenced document.

Steps.Step Description: Click the linked 'Titolo' or link icon to open the referenced document (in new tab/window or inline viewer) and observe browser behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: The linked document opens in a new tab/window or in the provided viewer without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the opened document's title/header contains 'RU Sportsbook' and that the document version inside the file matches '3.0'.
Steps.Expected Result: Opened document contains an identifiable title referencing 'RU Sportsbook' and includes version '3.0' within its content or metadata.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to download the document (if download option is available) and open the downloaded file locally.
Steps.Expected Result: The document downloads successfully and opens locally; file is not corrupted and contents are readable.

Steps.Step Description: If the link is broken or access permission denied, capture the browser error, HTTP status (e.g., 404, 403) and screenshot for defect reporting.
Steps.Expected Result: If access fails, clear evidence (screenshot and error code) is available to log a defect; otherwise document is accessible.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application (Documentation CMS), Browser: Chrome/Firefox
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User has access permissions required to view/download linked documents; 2) Network allows access to document storage; 3) Document link for RU Sportsbook v3.0 exists in the table.
test_cases.Dataset: Document link URL from table row for 'RU Sportsbook Platform - Anagrafica e Gestione Eventi Brand Spagna v3.0'; browser type and version.
test_cases.Expected Result: Linked document opens and can be downloaded; document title and internal version match the table entry (3.0). If access fails, appropriate error information is captured.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Verifies link accessibility and basic content match (title/version). Does not perform full content review of the document body.

test_cases.Title: VerificaDefinizioni_XXX_REQ-DEFINIZIONI_GLOSSARIO_TEST_Computer_verify all acronyms and meanings present

Steps.Step Description: Open the application documentation page that contains 'Definizioni e Abbreviazioni' table.
Steps.Expected Result: Documentation page loads successfully and the 'Definizioni e Abbreviazioni' section is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Locate the definitions table and verify the presence of the following acronyms: 'Id Regolatore', 'Evento', 'Avvenimento', 'Concorrente', 'Prototipo', 'Prototipo Brand-Italia', 'GES', 'Manifestazione', 'Entità asseverata', 'Entità autorizzata'.
Steps.Expected Result: All listed acronyms are present as separate rows in the definitions table.

Steps.Step Description: For each acronym, open or expand the corresponding cell and read the meaning text.
Steps.Expected Result: Each acronym displays a complete description matching the requirement document (e.g., 'Id Regolatore' describes composition of Codice Palinsesto and Codice Avvenimento and link to Sport and Manifestazione).

Steps.Step Description: Search within the page for specific keywords: 'CodPal', 'CodAvv', 'Brand-ITALIA', 'GES', 'asseverazione'.
Steps.Expected Result: Each keyword is found at least once in the definitions text where applicable and highlights the expected context.

Steps.Step Description: Verify formatting and readability: table borders, columns (Acronimo, Significato) and no truncated text.
Steps.Expected Result: Table shows two columns (Acronimo, Significato) with full readable text; no truncated or overlapping content.

test_cases.Preconditions: Tester has access to the documentation site and valid credentials if protected; documentation version corresponds to the requirement under test.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A (documentation page URL), credentials if required
test_cases.Expected Result: Definitions and abbreviations table displays all required acronyms and complete meanings as specified in the requirement document.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates presence and readability of definitions only; does not validate downstream system behavior or linkage to backend entities.

test_cases.Title: IdRegolatoreFormat_XXX_REQ-IDREGOLATORE_BACKEND_TEST_Server_validate composition of Id Regolatore

Steps.Step Description: Using API client, send a request to create a new Avvenimento with valid Codice Palinsesto = 'CP-2025-001' and Codice Avvenimento = 'CA-1001', including Sport and Manifestazione fields.
Steps.Expected Result: API returns success (201 Created) and response contains created Avvenimento resource identifier.

Steps.Step Description: Retrieve the created Avvenimento via GET by its resource id and inspect the 'Id Regolatore' field in the response.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Id Regolatore' field exists and is composed by concatenating Codice Palinsesto and Codice Avvenimento (for example 'CP-2025-001-CA-1001' or per defined format), and Sport and Manifestazione associations are present.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the Avvenimento record references the provided Sport and Manifestazione identifiers.
Steps.Expected Result: Response includes Sport ID/name and Manifestazione ID/name matching the creation payload.

Steps.Step Description: Query backend database (or management UI) for the created Id Regolatore value and validate stored format and indexes.
Steps.Expected Result: Database record for Avvenimento contains matching Id Regolatore in expected format and linked foreign keys to Sport and Manifestazione.

test_cases.Preconditions: API endpoint for Avvenimento creation is available; tester has API credentials with create/read permissions; test environment database is accessible and clean for test data.
test_cases.Dataset: Payload: { 'codPal': 'CP-2025-001', 'codAvv': 'CA-1001', 'sport': 'Calcio', 'manifestazione': 'SerieA-2025' }, API credentials
test_cases.Expected Result: System generates Id Regolatore composed from Codice Palinsesto and Codice Avvenimento and correctly links Avvenimento to Sport and Manifestazione.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers generation and storage of Id Regolatore and link to Sport/Manifestazione; does not cover downstream propagation to other systems (e.g., GES).

test_cases.Title: AvvenimentoValidation_XXX_REQ-AVVENIMENTO_BACKEND_TEST_Server_prevent creation without CodPal or CodAvv

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to create an Avvenimento via API with missing Codice Palinsesto (omit 'codPal') but include 'codAvv', Sport and Manifestazione.
Steps.Expected Result: API responds with validation error (400 Bad Request) and error message indicating missing Codice Palinsesto/CodPal requirement.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to create an Avvenimento via API with missing Codice Avvenimento (omit 'codAvv') but include 'codPal', Sport and Manifestazione.
Steps.Expected Result: API responds with validation error (400 Bad Request) and error message indicating missing Codice Avvenimento/CodAvv requirement.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to create an Avvenimento via API with both 'codPal' and 'codAvv' empty strings.
Steps.Expected Result: API responds with validation error (400 Bad Request) and error details indicating both fields are mandatory.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to create Avvenimento with invalid format values for 'codPal' (e.g., very long or containing disallowed characters) but present.
Steps.Expected Result: API responds with validation error (422 Unprocessable Entity or 400) and clear message about allowed format for Codice Palinsesto or Codice Avvenimento.

test_cases.Preconditions: API endpoint is available; validation rules defined in spec; tester has access to API credentials.
test_cases.Dataset: Negative payloads: {missing 'codPal'}, {missing 'codAvv'}, {codPal:'', codAvv:''}, {codPal:'@@@@', codAvv:'CA-1'}
test_cases.Expected Result: System rejects creation requests missing Codice Palinsesto or Codice Avvenimento and returns clear validation errors per requirement.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers mandatory field validation for creation only; does not test UI form behavior or localization of error messages.

test_cases.Title: EntitaAsseverataWorkflow_XXX_REQ-ASSEVERAZIONE_BACKOFFICE_TEST_Computer_validate asseveration and authorization flow

Steps.Step Description: Login to Backoffice with concessionario test user that can request asseverazione.
Steps.Expected Result: Login successful and backoffice dashboard is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Submit a request for asseverazione for an entity of type 'manifestazione' providing required metadata and identification codes.
Steps.Expected Result: System accepts the request and shows submission confirmation with request identifier and status 'InReview' or equivalent.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate ER (Ente Regolatore) review and approve the asseverazione request (either via test ER UI or by updating status in staging DB/process).
Steps.Expected Result: Request status changes to 'Approved' and a notification is generated for the concessionario.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that upon approval, the concessionario is enabled to 'play' for the related entity: check entitlement flag or authorization list for the concessionario account.
Steps.Expected Result: Concessionario account shows entitlement for the entity and the entity status is marked as 'Entità autorizzata' or equivalent, enabling betting operations.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to perform an operation requiring authorization (e.g., enable betting model) using the concessionario account.
Steps.Expected Result: Operation succeeds and system permits actions only after asseverazione approval; if attempted while not approved earlier, operation would have been rejected.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Backoffice Application, Staging ER integration
test_cases.Preconditions: Backoffice and ER staging interfaces are available; test concessionario account exists; workflow for asseverazione approvals is enabled in test environment.
test_cases.Dataset: Concessionario user credentials, entity metadata for manifestazione: {name:'TestManifestazione2025', identifier:'MAN-2025-01'}
test_cases.Expected Result: Entities submitted for asseverazione follow the approval workflow; upon ER approval the concessionario becomes authorized to play for that entity as described in requirements.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates end-to-end approval flow and entitlement change; does not validate long-term persistence or external notifications beyond the staging environment.

test_cases.Title: PrototipoBrandItalia_XXX_REQ-PROTOTIPO_GES_INTEGRATION_TEST_Server_validate prototype brand-italia filtering and GES message

Steps.Step Description: Create a platform Event (Prototipo Brand-Italia) from Brand Master including updates intended for GES, and assign it the profile filter 'Brand-ITALIA -- Profilo Avvenimento'.
Steps.Expected Result: Platform accepts event creation and marks it as 'Prototipo Brand-Italia' with the assigned profile filter.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the process that collects updates from Prototipo events to be sent to GES (e.g., 'publish to GES' action or scheduled job).
Steps.Expected Result: Process starts successfully and the event is selected for GES transmission because of the Brand-ITALIA profile filter.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect the outgoing message queue or GES inbound endpoint to verify the message contents include the update types (creation of Avvenimento, insertion/modification of Lista Anagrafica, or definition of Lista Dinamica) as applicable.
Steps.Expected Result: Message sent to GES contains expected update payloads and includes identifiers that indicate origin as 'Prototipo Brand-Italia' and the applied filter.

Steps.Step Description: Validate GES acknowledged the update (simulate GES ack if needed) and that the platform records successful transmission/acknowledgement.
Steps.Expected Result: Platform shows successful transmission status and any ack message from GES is logged against the event; no transmission errors remain.

test_cases.Reference System: Linux, Integration Service between Platform and GES
test_cases.Preconditions: Integration endpoints to GES are reachable in PRE-PROD; Brand Master role available; tester can create prototype events and trigger publish jobs.
test_cases.Functionality: Prototipo Brand-Italia Filtering and GES Integration
test_cases.Dataset: Event payload marked as Prototipo Brand-Italia with updates: {createAvvenimento: true, listaAnagrafica: {...}, listaDinamica: {...}}; integration credentials
test_cases.Expected Result: Events created as Prototipo Brand-Italia and filtered by 'Brand-ITALIA -- Profilo Avvenimento' are selected and their updates are correctly packaged and transmitted to GES; acknowledgements are recorded.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers selection and packaging of updates for GES and basic acknowledgement handling; does not cover in-depth GES processing logic or downstream data reconciliation.

test_cases.Title: AddBrandSpain_XXX_PRJ0014382_Anagrafica_TEST_Desktop_create new Spain brand record

Steps.Step Description: Open the Anagrafica web application and log in with an administrative user account (username: admin_test, password: Admin@123).
Steps.Expected Result: Login successful and main dashboard of Anagrafica is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: From the main menu navigate to 'Anagrafica' -> 'Brands' (or 'Marchi').
Steps.Expected Result: Brands management page is displayed and lists existing brands.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Add New Brand' button to open the brand creation form.
Steps.Expected Result: Brand creation form/modal is displayed with input fields for Code, Name, Country, Locale, Currency, Status.

Steps.Step Description: Fill the form with valid values: Code = 'ES', Name = 'Spagna', Country = 'Spain', Locale = 'es-ES', Currency = 'EUR', Status = 'Active'.
Steps.Expected Result: All entered values are accepted by the form and no client-side validation errors are shown.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' to submit the new brand.
Steps.Expected Result: Form is submitted and a success message is displayed confirming brand creation.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the new brand appears in the Brands list (search/filter by Code = 'ES').
Steps.Expected Result: A record with Code 'ES', Name 'Spagna', Country 'Spain' is present in the list.

Steps.Step Description: Optionally verify backend persistence by calling the Brands API GET /brands?code=ES or checking the database table (if access available).
Steps.Expected Result: API returns the new brand with matching fields and database row exists for Code 'ES'.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Admin user account exists (admin_test). 2) Tester has network access to TEST environment. 3) No existing brand with Code 'ES' in TEST environment.
test_cases.Dataset: Admin credentials: admin_test / Admin@123; Brand payload: {code:'ES',name:'Spagna',country:'Spain',locale:'es-ES',currency:'EUR',status:'Active'}
test_cases.Expected Result: New Brand 'Spagna' with code 'ES' is successfully created, visible in UI list and persisted in backend.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI creation flow and basic backend persistence verification; detailed locale/currency downstream effects not covered.

test_cases.Title: EditBrandSpain_XXX_PRJ0014382_Anagrafica_TEST_Desktop_update brand details

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Anagrafica web application with an admin user.
Steps.Expected Result: Admin user is authenticated and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Anagrafica -> Brands and locate the brand with Code 'ES' (use search if necessary).
Steps.Expected Result: The brand with Code 'ES' is listed and available for selection.

Steps.Step Description: Open the brand details or click 'Edit' for Code 'ES'.
Steps.Expected Result: Brand edit form is displayed populated with current values.

Steps.Step Description: Change the Name from 'Spagna' to 'Marca Spagna' and change Status from 'Active' to 'Inactive' (or vice versa).
Steps.Expected Result: The form reflects the new values and accepts the changes (no validation errors).

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' to persist the changes.
Steps.Expected Result: A confirmation message is displayed and the brand record is updated.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the updated values are shown in the list and via GET /brands?code=ES (or database).
Steps.Expected Result: List and backend return updated Name = 'Marca Spagna' and Status = 'Inactive' (as edited).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Brand with Code 'ES' exists. 2) Admin user credentials available.
test_cases.Dataset: Admin credentials; Existing brand: Code 'ES', Name 'Spagna'.
test_cases.Expected Result: Brand 'ES' is updated with new values and changes are persisted to backend.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers edit/update UI flow; related caching/invalidation scenarios not covered.

test_cases.Title: CreateBrandSpainValidation_XXX_PRJ0014382_Anagrafica_TEST_Desktop_required fields validation

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica with an administrative user and open the brand creation form.
Steps.Expected Result: Brand creation form is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to save the form with all fields empty and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Client-side validation triggers and highlights required fields (Code, Name, Country). Save is blocked.

Steps.Step Description: Enter only Code = 'ES' and click 'Save' leaving Name and Country empty.
Steps.Expected Result: Validation error messages appear for missing Name and Country. Save is blocked.

Steps.Step Description: Enter Name but provide an invalid Code with special characters (Code = '!@#') and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Validation message shown for invalid Code format. Save is blocked.

Steps.Step Description: Enter Code = 'ES' and Name = 'Spagna' but select an unsupported Locale (e.g., 'xx-XX') and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Validation error displayed for unsupported locale or system rejects locale; save is blocked or corrected suggestion provided.

test_cases.Preconditions: Tester logged in as admin; brand creation form accessible.
test_cases.Dataset: Empty payloads; invalid Code '!@#'; unsupported locale 'xx-XX'.
test_cases.Expected Result: Form enforces required fields and input format validations; invalid submissions are rejected with clear error messages.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client-side validation; server-side sanitization and security checks not fully covered.

test_cases.Title: SearchFilterBrandSpain_XXX_PRJ0014382_Anagrafica_TEST_Desktop_search and filter brands by country code/name

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica and navigate to Brands list.
Steps.Expected Result: Brands list page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Use the search box to search by Code 'ES'.
Steps.Expected Result: List filters to show only entries with Code 'ES'.

Steps.Step Description: Clear search and use filter dropdown for Country = 'Spain'.
Steps.Expected Result: Only brands associated with Country 'Spain' are listed.

Steps.Step Description: Search by partial Name 'Spag' to validate partial match behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: Any brand with Name containing 'Spag' is returned (including 'Spagna', 'Marca Spagna').

Steps.Step Description: Combine filters (Country = 'Spain' AND Status = 'Active') and apply.
Steps.Expected Result: List shows only active brands for Spain; if none, list is empty and shows appropriate message.

test_cases.Preconditions: At least one brand for Spain exists (Code 'ES' or Name contains 'Spag').
test_cases.Dataset: Search terms: 'ES', 'Spag'; Filters: Country='Spain', Status='Active'.
test_cases.Expected Result: Search and filter return correct, consistent results and combinations behave as expected.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI search/filter; performance and pagination of large result sets not covered.

test_cases.Title: PermissionCreateBrandSpain_XXX_PRJ0014382_Anagrafica_TEST_Desktop_non-admin cannot create brand

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica with a non-admin user account (username: user_limited, password: User@123).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and dashboard is displayed with restricted menu options.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Anagrafica -> Brands and observe available actions for the user.
Steps.Expected Result: Create/Add New Brand action/button is not visible or is disabled for non-admin user.

Steps.Step Description: If the UI shows the Add button, attempt to access the brand creation URL directly (copy link or call endpoint) and perform create action.
Steps.Expected Result: Access denied message is shown or backend returns HTTP 403 Forbidden; brand is not created.

Steps.Step Description: Verify audit/log (if available) or backend logs that an unauthorized attempt was rejected.
Steps.Expected Result: Audit/log entry found indicating unauthorized create attempt by user_limited (if audit is available).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Non-admin user account exists (user_limited). 2) Admin created at least one brand previously to ensure list functionality.
test_cases.Dataset: Non-admin credentials: user_limited / User@123; Target brand payload attempted: {code:'ES2',name:'Spagna2',country:'Spain'}.
test_cases.Expected Result: Non-admin users cannot create new brands; create UI action is hidden/disabled and backend rejects direct calls with 403.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers permission enforcement for create operation; deeper role matrix variations not included.

test_cases.Title: APICreateBrandSpain_XXX_PRJ0014382_Anagrafica_TEST_Backend_validate brand creation via API

Steps.Step Description: Obtain a valid API token for an administrative service account to call Brand management APIs on TEST environment.
Steps.Expected Result: Valid Bearer token is available for API calls.

Steps.Step Description: Perform a POST request to the Brands API endpoint (e.g., POST https://api.test.anagrafica/brands) with payload: {"code":"ES_API","name":"Spagna API","country":"Spain","locale":"es-ES","currency":"EUR","status":"Active"} and Authorization header.
Steps.Expected Result: API responds with HTTP 201 Created and response body contains created brand details including ID and created timestamp.

Steps.Step Description: Perform a GET request to /brands?code=ES_API to verify the created brand is retrievable via API.
Steps.Expected Result: API returns the brand record with matching fields and status 'Active'.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to create a brand with duplicate Code = 'ES_API' via POST to validate uniqueness constraint.
Steps.Expected Result: API returns HTTP 409 Conflict (or appropriate error code) indicating duplicate code; second brand is not created.

Steps.Step Description: Verify downstream systems (if integrated) receive the brand creation event or check database row persisted.
Steps.Expected Result: Database contains single row for Code 'ES_API' and any configured integration queue/event contains corresponding event (if applicable).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) API endpoint reachable in TEST environment. 2) Admin API token available. 3) No existing brand with Code 'ES_API'.
test_cases.Dataset: API endpoint: POST /brands; Auth: Bearer <token>; Payload examples as detailed in steps.
test_cases.Expected Result: API allows creating new Spain brand, enforces uniqueness and returns proper HTTP status codes and payloads; record is persisted.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers API creation and uniqueness validation; security/token lifecycle and heavy load behavior not covered.

test_cases.Title: CreateBrand_XXX_REQ-BRAND-SPAIN_Anagrafica Configurazione e Gestione Eventi_TEST_Computer_Create new Brand for Spain with mandatory fields

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application with a user that has Brand management privileges.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and the application main dashboard is displayed with access to 'Brand' module.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Anagrafica > Configurazione e Gestione Eventi > Brand module.
Steps.Expected Result: Brand module screen is displayed with options to create, search, edit and delete brands.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Create New Brand' and fill mandatory fields: Name='MarcaEspana1', Code='ES-MA-001', Country='Spain', Status='Active'.
Steps.Expected Result: Mandatory fields accept input and form validation shows no errors.

Steps.Step Description: Optionally fill non-mandatory fields (Description, Tags) and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: System saves the brand and shows a success confirmation message.

Steps.Step Description: Search for the created brand by Code 'ES-MA-001' in Brand listing.
Steps.Expected Result: The created brand 'MarcaEspana1' is returned in the search results with correct details and Country='Spain'.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application - Anagrafica Configurazione e Gestione Eventi
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has a valid account with Brand create/edit/delete permissions. 2) Test environment is available and database is reachable. 3) No existing brand with Code 'ES-MA-001'.
test_cases.Dataset: Name='MarcaEspana1', Code='ES-MA-001', Country='Spain', Status='Active', Description='Test brand for Spain'
test_cases.Expected Result: Brand is created successfully and visible in listing with correct Spain country assignment.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only UI creation and listing; backend audit logs and downstream publication flows not covered.

test_cases.Title: CreateBrand_InvalidData_XXX_REQ-BRAND-SPAIN_Anagrafica Configurazione e Gestione Eventi_TEST_Computer_Verify validation on missing mandatory fields and country mismatch

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application with a user that has Brand management privileges.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and Brand module is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Brand module and click 'Create New Brand'. Leave Name empty, enter Code='ES-MA-002', Country='Spain' and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: System displays validation error indicating the Name field is mandatory and blocks save.

Steps.Step Description: Enter Name='MarcaEspanaInvalid' and Code with invalid characters 'ES-!@#', Country='Spain'. Click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: System displays validation error for Code format and blocks save.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to create a brand with Name='MarcaNonSpain', Code='ES-MA-003', but select Country='Italy' while publishing scope requires Spain-only for this module. Click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: If the module enforces Spain-only constraint, system either allows creation but warns on country mismatch or shows validation preventing creating brands for other countries in Brand Spagna module. Expected is validation message preventing country other than Spain.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application - Anagrafica Configurazione e Gestione Eventi
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has Brand create privileges. 2) Module Brand Spagna is enabled in the environment.
test_cases.Dataset: Empty Name, Code='ES-!@#', Country='Spain'; or Name='MarcaNonSpain', Code='ES-MA-003', Country='Italy'
test_cases.Expected Result: System enforces mandatory fields and input format; disallows creation when mandatory fields missing or code invalid; enforces Spain-only constraint for this module.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI input validation; server-side error logging and API responses not fully covered.

test_cases.Title: EditBrand_XXX_REQ-BRAND-SPAIN_Anagrafica Configurazione e Gestione Eventi_TEST_Computer_Modify existing Brand details for Spain

Steps.Step Description: Login and go to Brand module; ensure a brand with Code='ES-MA-001' exists (create if necessary).
Steps.Expected Result: Brand listing shows 'ES-MA-001' available for edit.

Steps.Step Description: Select the brand 'ES-MA-001' and click 'Edit'. Change Description to 'Updated description', change Status to 'Inactive' and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: System saves the changes and shows a success confirmation.

Steps.Step Description: Open the brand details again and verify the Description and Status reflect the updated values.
Steps.Expected Result: Brand details show Description='Updated description' and Status='Inactive'.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application - Anagrafica Configurazione e Gestione Eventi
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Brand 'ES-MA-001' exists. 2) Tester has edit privileges.
test_cases.Dataset: Existing Code='ES-MA-001', Updated Description='Updated description', Status='Inactive'
test_cases.Expected Result: Brand updates persist correctly and are visible in UI.

test_cases.Title: AssocSport_XXX_RU01_Sport_BrandSpagna_TEST_Computer_Associate_and_remove_BM_DGOJ_mappings

Steps.Step Description: Login to the Brand Spagna web module with a user having administrative mapping rights.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and lands on the Brand Spagna dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Anagrafica -> Sport section and open the list of DGOJ sports.
Steps.Expected Result: The list of DGOJ sports is displayed with pagination and search functionality.

Steps.Step Description: Select a DGOJ sport record and view details of existing associations (if any).
Steps.Expected Result: Detail pane shows current associations to one or more Brand Master (BM) sports and edit options.

Steps.Step Description: Use the 'Add Association' action: search for two BM sports by name/ID and associate both to the selected DGOJ sport. Save the associations.
Steps.Expected Result: System accepts the associations, displays both BM sports in the association list, and returns success confirmation.

Steps.Step Description: Reload the DGOJ sport detail or re-open the record and verify associations persist.
Steps.Expected Result: Both previously associated BM sports are still present in the association list.

Steps.Step Description: Remove one of the associated BM sports using 'Remove association' action and confirm the deletion.
Steps.Expected Result: Association is removed, and the association list updates accordingly with a success message.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to create an association with a non-existent BM sport ID (invalid input).
Steps.Expected Result: System validates input and shows an error indicating the BM sport was not found; association is not created.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Brand Spagna Web Application (Anagrafica Sport)
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user with mapping privileges exists. 2) Brand Master sports dataset contains at least 3 distinct sports. 3) Several DGOJ sports exist in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: Admin user credentials; BM sport IDs: BM-1001, BM-1002, BM-1003; DGOJ sport ID: DGOJ-200
test_cases.Expected Result: User can associate and remove BM<->DGOJ sport mappings; invalid associations are rejected; persistence across reloads is verified.
test_cases._polarion: Questo modulo conterrà delle funzionalità già presenti per il **Brand Italia**, ereditandone parte dell'architettura e del modello dati, ma introducendo al contempo una serie di **adattamenti specifici** richiesti dal **regolatore spagnolo**.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI mapping flows; bulk import/export of mappings and API-level validation not included.

test_cases.Title: ManifestazioniEnrichment_XXX_RU02_Manifestazioni_BrandSpagna_TEST_Computer_Complete_missing_attributes_for_regulator

Steps.Step Description: Login to Brand Spagna web module and navigate to Anagrafica -> Manifestazioni.
Steps.Expected Result: Manifestazioni list is displayed filtered by sports that have BM->DGOJ association.

Steps.Step Description: Select a Manifestazione that originates from Brand Master and that is flagged as having missing regulator-required attributes.
Steps.Expected Result: Manifestazione detail opens and fields missing for DGOJ requirements are clearly indicated (e.g., required by regulator marker).

Steps.Step Description: Edit the Manifestazione: fill in the missing attributes (e.g., regulation-specific code, event type, venue country) with valid values and save.
Steps.Expected Result: System accepts input, validates required fields, and shows a success confirmation; missing-attribute warnings are cleared.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to save the Manifestazione with an invalid regulator-required attribute value (e.g., invalid country code).
Steps.Expected Result: System displays field-level validation error preventing save, with a helpful error message.

Steps.Step Description: Filter the Manifestazioni list by the updated sport and confirm the manifestazione now shows as complete for publishing.
Steps.Expected Result: Manifestazione appears as complete and eligible for event creation/publishing.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) There is at least one Manifestazione originating from BM that is missing DGOJ-required attributes. 2) User has edit rights for Manifestazioni.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials; Manifestazione ID: MAN-500 (missing fields list: regulatorCode, eventType, venueCountry)
test_cases.Expected Result: Missing regulator-required attributes can be completed and validated; invalid inputs are rejected; manifestation becomes eligible for publishing.
test_cases._polarion: Questo modulo conterrà delle funzionalità già presenti per il **Brand Italia**, ereditandone parte dell'architettura e del modello dati, ma introducendo al contempo una serie di **adattamenti specifici** richiesti dal **regolatore spagnolo**.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers manual enrichment via UI; bulk enrichment and automated enrichment rules not covered.

test_cases.Title: PrototipiHandling_XXX_RU03_GestioneEventi_BrandSpagna_TEST_Computer_Handle_prototypes_and_publish_after_association

Steps.Step Description: Login and navigate to Gestione eventi -> Prototipi.
Steps.Expected Result: Prototipi list is displayed showing events with incomplete manifestations or unassociated BM sports.

Steps.Step Description: Select an event prototype whose sport is not associated to any DGOJ sport and open its detail.
Steps.Expected Result: Prototype detail highlights missing sport association and missing manifestation data required by DGOJ.

Steps.Step Description: From the prototype, initiate association: map the event's BM sport to an appropriate DGOJ sport using the provided association selector and confirm.
Steps.Expected Result: Association is created and displayed on the prototype; the missing-sport indicator is cleared.

Steps.Step Description: Complete any missing manifestation attributes from the prototype detail and click 'Publish'.
Steps.Expected Result: System validates completeness; if complete, event is published automatically (or queued for publishing) and status changes to 'Published' with a success message.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the event appears in Gestione eventi -> Avvenimenti with status 'Published' and includes the DGOJ mapping.
Steps.Expected Result: Event is listed under Avvenimenti with correct status and mapping details.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to publish a prototype with remaining missing mandatory manifestation attributes.
Steps.Expected Result: Publish action is blocked and a clear message lists missing attributes; event remains unpublished.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Brand Spagna Web Application (Gestione eventi - Prototipi)
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) At least one prototype event exists lacking sport association or manifestation attributes. 2) User has publish rights.
test_cases.Dataset: Prototype Event ID: EVT-PROT-800; BM sport: BM-1005; DGOJ sport to map: DGOJ-210
test_cases.Expected Result: User can perform missing associations and complete manifestation data, after which publish executes and event moves to Avvenimenti as Published. Incomplete events cannot be published.
test_cases._polarion: Questo modulo conterrà delle funzionalità già presenti per il **Brand Italia**, ereditandone parte dell'architettura e del modello dati, ma introducendo al contempo una serie di **adattamenti specifici** richiesti dal **regolatore spagnolo**.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers manual prototype resolution and publish flow; automatic background publishing scheduler behavior not covered.

test_cases.Title: ForceResend_XXX_RU16_ForceResend_BrandSpagna_TEST_Backend_Trigger_force_resend_to_DGOJ

Steps.Step Description: Login to Brand Spagna module with a user permitted to perform Force Resend actions and navigate to Configurazione -> Force Resend.
Steps.Expected Result: Force Resend page is displayed with controls to select events and trigger resend to DGOJ.

Steps.Step Description: Search for an event previously published that has a resendable state (e.g., published but flagged for resend).
Steps.Expected Result: Event is found and displayed with metadata including last send timestamp and status.

Steps.Step Description: Select the event and initiate 'Force Resend' action. Confirm the action when prompted.
Steps.Expected Result: System enqueues or triggers resend to DGOJ, shows acknowledgement, and updates event metadata (resend timestamp and status).

Steps.Step Description: Verify in Avvenimenti that the event shows a new resend timestamp and the status reflects resend in progress or completed.
Steps.Expected Result: Event metadata reflects the forced resend; status changes appropriately (e.g., Resent/Confirmed).

Steps.Step Description: Simulate a backend failure of the external DGOJ endpoint (if test environment supports) and perform Force Resend to observe error handling.
Steps.Expected Result: System reports failure with clear error details, does not lose event data, and marks resend attempt as failed with retry options.

test_cases.Reference System: Linux Server, Brand Spagna Backend and Web UI (Force Resend feature)
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User with Force Resend privilege exists. 2) At least one previously published event is available. 3) Test environment can simulate external DGOJ responses.
test_cases.Dataset: Admin user credentials; Event ID: EVT-200 (previously published), mocked DGOJ endpoint configurations
test_cases.Expected Result: Force Resend triggers a resend to DGOJ and updates event metadata; failures are reported and logged with retry options.
test_cases._polarion: Questo modulo conterrà delle funzionalità già presenti per il **Brand Italia**, ereditandone parte dell'architettura e del modello dati, ma introducendo al contempo una serie di **adattamenti specifici** richiesti dal **regolatore spagnolo**.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI-triggered force resend and immediate status updates; does not include deep integration logs or long-term retry scheduler behavior.

test_cases.Title: SearchFiltersConsistency_XXX_REQ-001_BrandSpainApp_TEST_Computer_Verify filters apply across sections

Steps.Step Description: Open the Brand Spain web application on a computer and log in with a valid test user account.
Steps.Expected Result: Brand Spain module home page loads and user is logged in successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Products' section and open the search/filter panel.
Steps.Expected Result: Search/filter panel is visible with available filter fields (category, brand, price range, availability).

Steps.Step Description: Apply a combination of filters (Category: 'Bebidas', Brand: 'MarcaX', Availability: 'In Stock') and execute the search.
Steps.Expected Result: Search results are displayed reflecting applied filters (only items matching Bebidas, MarcaX, In Stock).

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to a different section within Brand Spain module (e.g., 'Promotions') without clearing filters and open its search/filter panel.
Steps.Expected Result: Promotions section loads. If design requires filters to persist across sections, the same filter combination is pre-populated; otherwise filters are reset. The actual behavior is consistent with the documented 'to-be' specification for Brand Spain.

Steps.Step Description: Compare actual filter persistence behavior with documented 'to-be' requirement and with known 'as-is' behavior of Brand Italy (document provided to tester).
Steps.Expected Result: Observed behavior matches Brand Spain 'to-be' specification. Any intentional divergence from Brand Italy 'as-is' is confirmed and documented as per requirements.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has valid Brand Spain test account. 2) Test environment seeded with products including at least one item matching Category 'Bebidas' and Brand 'MarcaX'. 3) Documentation of Brand Spain 'to-be' filter behavior and Brand Italy 'as-is' behavior available.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials: test_spain_user; Product dataset containing items for Bebidas/MarcaX; Section names: Products, Promotions
test_cases.Expected Result: Filter application and persistence behavior in Brand Spain matches the documented 'to-be' requirements and any differences from Brand Italy 'as-is' are validated and recorded.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers filter application and cross-section persistence behavior; does not cover backend log validation or API-level filter parameter transmission.

test_cases.Title: LocalizationUI_XXX_REQ-002_BrandSpainApp_TEST_Computer_Verify Spanish localization and fallback behavior

Steps.Step Description: Open the Brand Spain web application on a computer and set user locale to Spanish (es-ES) in user profile or browser preferences.
Steps.Expected Result: Locale is set to Spanish; application reloads or reflects Spanish locale according to system behavior.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate through main Brand Spain sections (Home, Products, Promotions, Account) and observe UI labels, messages, and filter names.
Steps.Expected Result: All visible UI strings in Brand Spain module are displayed in Spanish as per localization files.

Steps.Step Description: Identify a set of known strings currently present in Brand Italy 'as-is' documentation and verify corresponding strings in Brand Spain.
Steps.Expected Result: If the string is in Brand Spain localization file, Spanish translation is shown. If intentionally missing, the application uses the defined fallback strategy (e.g., default language or key placeholder) documented in the requirements.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger an error message (e.g., perform an invalid search) to validate localized error text.
Steps.Expected Result: Error message is shown in Spanish. If not available, fallback behavior matches the requirement (e.g., shows English fallback or key placeholder) and is consistent across screens.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Brand Spain localization files deployed in test environment. 2) Tester account with locale change permission or browser configured for es-ES.
test_cases.Dataset: Test account: test_spain_locale; List of critical UI strings to verify
test_cases.Expected Result: UI strings and messages are presented in Spanish according to localization; fallback behavior conforms to the documented assumptions/limitations.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates UI-level localization and fallback; does not validate translation accuracy beyond verification of presence and correct fallback behavior.

test_cases.Title: FilterAvailabilityLimitation_XXX_REQ-003_BrandSpainApp_TEST_Computer_Verify unavailable filters documented as limitations

Steps.Step Description: Open Brand Spain web application and navigate to the page where Brand Italy currently exposes advanced filters (as per 'as-is' documentation), e.g., advanced price segmentation.
Steps.Expected Result: Target page loads successfully and filter panel is visible if implemented.

Steps.Step Description: Check for presence of the advanced filter controls that exist in Brand Italy (e.g., 'Region-specific Promotion', 'Bundle Type').
Steps.Expected Result: Advanced filters are either present or intentionally absent. If absent, absence should match the 'Limitazioni e assunzioni' documented list for Brand Spain.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to filter by an advanced filter control if present; otherwise log the missing control and validate the documented limitation explanation.
Steps.Expected Result: If control present, it functions correctly and returns appropriate results. If control absent, the documented limitation precisely explains the absence and no unexpected errors occur.

Steps.Step Description: Document any discrepancies between actual availability and documented limitations and raise an issue if limitation is not documented but feature is missing.
Steps.Expected Result: All discrepancies are captured. If undocumented absence found, issue is opened with reproduction steps.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has access to Brand Italy 'as-is' filter list for comparison. 2) Test environment prepared with sample data that would surface advanced filters if implemented.
test_cases.Dataset: Comparison matrix between Brand Italy filters and Brand Spain documented limitations; sample catalog data.
test_cases.Expected Result: Any missing advanced filters in Brand Spain are consistent with documented limitations/assumptions; no undocumented omissions exist.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers verification of presence/absence of advanced filters; does not test backend reasons for omission or migration plans.

test_cases.Title: FilterResponsePerformance_XXX_REQ-004_BrandSpainApp_TEST_Computer_Verify filter search response time under load

Steps.Step Description: Prepare the test environment with a realistic dataset (catalog of 100k items) and test user accounts. Ensure monitoring tools and response time measurement configured.
Steps.Expected Result: Test environment is ready with dataset loaded and monitoring active.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate 50 concurrent users applying the same filter combination (Category: 'Alimentación', Brand: 'MarcaY', Price range: 5-20€) and measure response times for initial search and results rendering.
Steps.Expected Result: Average server response time for filtered search is within acceptable threshold defined in non-functional requirements (e.g., average < 2s, 95th percentile < 5s).

Steps.Step Description: Increase load to 200 concurrent users applying varied filter combinations and measure response time and error rate.
Steps.Expected Result: System maintains acceptable performance or degrades gracefully as per performance acceptance criteria; error rate remains below defined threshold (e.g., <1%).

Steps.Step Description: Analyze results and compare with Brand Italy baseline performance if available; record any regressions or high execution time issues.
Steps.Expected Result: Performance metrics documented; any violations of thresholds are recorded as defects with logs and reproduction steps.

test_cases.Reference System: Linux load generators, Brand Spain Web Application (Test Environment)
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Performance test environment configured with realistic dataset. 2) Load generation and monitoring tools installed. 3) Performance acceptance criteria defined.
test_cases.Dataset: Catalog ~100k items, concurrent user scenarios (50, 200 users), predefined filter combinations
test_cases.Expected Result: Filter search under load meets performance acceptance criteria; response times and error rates within defined thresholds.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers performance under specified loads; does not cover extreme stress beyond defined scenarios or long-duration endurance tests.

test_cases.Title: FilterStatePersistence_XXX_REQ-005_BrandSpainApp_TEST_Computer_Verify filter state persists across navigation and sessions

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Brand Spain web application with a test user and navigate to 'Products' section.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and 'Products' section displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Apply filters (Category: 'Snacks', Brand: 'MarcaZ'). Verify results show correct items.
Steps.Expected Result: Results show items matching 'Snacks' and 'MarcaZ'.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to another page within the app (e.g., 'Account') and then return to 'Products'; verify whether previously applied filters remain active.
Steps.Expected Result: Filter state persists or resets according to Brand Spain 'to-be' specification; behavior matches documented requirement.

Steps.Step Description: Log out and log back in with the same test user and navigate to 'Products' again to verify session-level persistence of filters if specified.
Steps.Expected Result: If session persistence is required by design, previously saved filter state is restored; otherwise filters are cleared on new session as documented.

Steps.Step Description: If persistence is supported, clear filters and verify that results update accordingly.
Steps.Expected Result: Clearing filters removes filter constraints and product list updates to unfiltered view.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester account with persistent settings capability if supported. 2) 'To-be' specification clearly defines expected persistence behavior.
test_cases.Dataset: User: test_spain_persist; Product items for Snacks/MarcaZ
test_cases.Expected Result: Filter persistence behavior across navigation and sessions conforms to Brand Spain 'to-be' specification and is stable.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates UI and session-level filter persistence; does not assert storage mechanism (cookie vs server) nor cover multi-device sync behavior.

test_cases.Title: OpenIssue_XXX_Open Issue_IssueTracker_TEST_Computer_create new issue with valid data

Steps.Expected Result: Issue is created successfully; user receives confirmation (toast/message) and a unique Issue ID (e.g., ISSUE-123) is displayed. The new issue appears in the issue list with correct title, priority, reporter and status = 'Open' (or default).

Steps.Step Description: Open the newly created issue details from the list.
Steps.Expected Result: Issue detail view displays all submitted fields (Title, Description, Priority, Reporter, Created Date). No data loss and attachments (if any) are accessible.

test_cases.Title: OpenIssue_XXX_Open Issue_IssueTracker_TEST_Computer_submit with missing required fields

Steps.Step Description: Open the Issue Tracker creation form (as authenticated user with create permission).
Steps.Expected Result: Issue creation form opens and displays required fields including Title and Description.

Steps.Step Description: Leave the Title field blank, fill Description = 'Detail text', and click 'Submit'.
Steps.Expected Result: Form validation prevents submission; a clear validation message is shown next to the Title field indicating it is required (e.g., 'Title is required').

Steps.Step Description: Now provide Title but remove Description (leave blank) and attempt to submit if Description is required by the system.
Steps.Expected Result: If Description is required, form validation prevents submission and displays a 'Description is required' message. If not required, submission proceeds and created issue shows empty description as allowed (system-specific).

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to submit with only whitespace characters in Title (e.g., '   ').
Steps.Expected Result: System should trim/validate and show error that Title cannot be empty or only whitespace and prevent submission.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Firefox latest / Web Application - Issue Tracker
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Authenticated user with create permission. 2) Issue creation UI is available.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials: test_user_create; Empty Title value; Description sample text.
test_cases.Expected Result: Form validation prevents creation when required fields are missing or invalid; appropriate error messages are shown.
