test_cases.Title: OpenIssue_XXX_Open Issue_IssueTracker_TEST_Computer_attach file size limit and unsupported type handling

Steps.Step Description: Open issue creation form as authenticated user.
Steps.Expected Result: Issue creation form is displayed and 'Attach file' control is available.

Steps.Step Description: Attach a file that exceeds maximum allowed size (e.g., if limit 10MB, attach a 15MB file) and attempt to submit.
Steps.Expected Result: System rejects the file upload with a clear error message (e.g., 'File exceeds maximum allowed size of 10MB') and prevents submission until file is removed or replaced with acceptable size.

Steps.Step Description: Attach a file with an unsupported type/extension (e.g., .exe) and attempt to submit.
Steps.Expected Result: System blocks the unsupported file type with an informative message (e.g., 'File type not allowed') and prevents submission.

Steps.Step Description: Attach multiple files within allowed size and supported types (e.g., .png, .pdf) and submit the issue.
Steps.Expected Result: Files are uploaded successfully, issue is created, and attachments appear in the issue detail view and are downloadable/viewable.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Chrome latest / Web Application - Issue Tracker
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Authenticated user with create permission. 2) Known file size limit and allowed file types configured in system documentation.
test_cases.Dataset: Files for upload: large_file_15MB.zip, unsupported_file.exe, valid_image.png (200KB), valid_doc.pdf (500KB).
test_cases.Expected Result: System enforces file size and content-type restrictions; allowed attachments are stored and shown on issue details.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI upload validation and successful attach; does not cover backend virus-scan or long-term storage retention policies.

test_cases.Title: OpenIssue_XXX_Open Issue_IssueTracker_TEST_Computer_submit while network interruption

Steps.Step Description: Open the issue creation form, fill Title and Description with valid text.
Steps.Expected Result: Form fields accept input and submit button is enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate network interruption (disable network on test machine) and then click 'Submit'.
Steps.Expected Result: Submission fails gracefully. The UI displays an offline/network error (e.g., 'Network error: unable to reach server'). Form should not silently drop entered data.

Steps.Step Description: Re-enable network and attempt to re-submit the same form or use any 'Retry' option provided by the UI.
Steps.Expected Result: If retry is supported, submission succeeds and issue is created. If not supported, user can re-submit manually and data is preserved when possible.

Steps.Step Description: Verify whether any duplicate issues were created by the failed attempt by checking recent issue list and creation timestamps.
Steps.Expected Result: No duplicate issues should be created as a result of the failed attempt; if duplicate protection exists it should prevent multiple identical creates.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Chrome latest / Web Application - Issue Tracker
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Authenticated user with create permission. 2) Network simulation tools available to disable/enable connectivity.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials; Issue content sample; Steps to toggle network.
test_cases.Expected Result: System handles network interruptions gracefully, preserves user input, provides clear error messages, and prevents duplicate issue creation.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates client behavior under network outage; does not validate server-side queuing or offline-first advanced behaviors.

test_cases.Title: OpenIssue_XXX_Open Issue_IssueTracker_TEST_Computer_attempt create issue without permission

Steps.Step Description: Log in with a user account that does NOT have permission to create issues.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and lands on Issue Tracker page but UI does not present 'New Issue' or create controls (or the controls are disabled).

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the issue creation URL/form directly via entering the create form URL or API endpoint.
Steps.Expected Result: System blocks access: either redirects to an error/permission denied page or shows an authorization error message (e.g., 'You do not have permission to create issues').

Steps.Step Description: If the UI displays a disabled create button, try clicking it.
Steps.Expected Result: Click is blocked and appropriate tooltip/message explains lack of permission; no form opens and no creation attempt is sent to server.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Edge latest / Web Application - Issue Tracker
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user without create permission exists. 2) Tester knows direct URL to creation form.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials: test_user_readonly (password); Create form direct URL if applicable.
test_cases.Expected Result: Users without permission cannot create issues; system enforces authorization both in UI and server-side endpoints.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers authorization checks in UI and direct access; does not verify RBAC configuration storage or admin remediation.

test_cases.Title: AppLaunch_XXX_NA_MyApp_TEST_Mobile_VerifyHomeScreen

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the test device is powered on, charged >50%, connected to network, and MyApp is installed.
Steps.Expected Result: Device is ready and MyApp is installed and visible on the home/app drawer.

Steps.Step Description: Tap the MyApp icon to launch the application (cold start).
Steps.Expected Result: Application process starts and splash screen is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Observe behaviour until the Home screen is displayed (wait up to 10 seconds).
Steps.Expected Result: Home screen is displayed with primary navigation and no error dialogs.

Steps.Step Description: Verify key UI elements on Home screen: header, main menu, and user greeting (if logged in).
Steps.Expected Result: All expected UI elements are present, readable and interactive (buttons enabled).

Steps.Step Description: Close the application and relaunch (warm start) and observe behaviour.
Steps.Expected Result: App returns to Home screen quickly without crashes or visual corruption.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test device charged and network connected. 2) MyApp v1.0 installed. 3) No background heavy processes running. 4) Test account present (if app requires login).
test_cases.Dataset: Device: Pixel 5 (or equivalent), MyApp APK v1.0, optional test user credentials
test_cases.Expected Result: App launches successfully on cold and warm starts; Home screen displays correctly without errors.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers app cold/warm start and Home screen rendering; does not cover deeper navigation or backend data validation.

test_cases.Title: Login_XXX_NA_Authentication_TEST_Smartphone_VerifySuccessAndFailure

Steps.Step Description: Open MyApp on the smartphone and navigate to Login screen.
Steps.Expected Result: Login screen is displayed with Username/Email and Password fields and Login button.

Steps.Step Description: Enter valid username 'testuser@example.com' and valid password 'P@ssw0rd!' then tap 'Login'.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and redirected to Home screen; no error message displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Sign out (if required) to return to Login screen.
Steps.Expected Result: User is signed out and Login screen is shown.

Steps.Step Description: Enter valid username 'testuser@example.com' and incorrect password 'wrongpass' then tap 'Login'.
Steps.Expected Result: Login is rejected and a clear error message 'Invalid credentials' (or equivalent) is displayed; fields are not cleared unless specified.

Steps.Step Description: Leave username field empty and enter any password then tap 'Login'.
Steps.Expected Result: Validation prevents submission and an inline message 'Please enter username/email' is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Enter username and leave password empty then tap 'Login'.
Steps.Expected Result: Validation prevents submission and an inline message 'Please enter password' is displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) MyApp installed. 2) Test user 'testuser@example.com' exists with password 'P@ssw0rd!'. 3) Network connectivity available.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid credentials: testuser@example.com / P@ssw0rd!; Invalid password: wrongpass; Empty inputs for validation checks.
test_cases.Expected Result: Valid credentials lead to successful login; invalid or empty inputs trigger appropriate validation messages.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers basic credential validation and UI error messages; multi-factor authentication and account lockout behavior are not covered.

test_cases.Title: PasswordReset_XXX_NA_PasswordReset_TEST_Computer_VerifyEmailResetFlow

Steps.Step Description: Open MyApp web application in Chrome on the test computer and navigate to the Login page.
Steps.Expected Result: Login page is displayed with a 'Forgot Password' or 'Reset Password' link visible.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Forgot Password' and enter a registered email 'testuser@example.com', then submit the request.
Steps.Expected Result: A confirmation message appears indicating that a password reset email has been sent (generic message if account exists).

Steps.Step Description: Access the test mailbox for 'testuser@example.com' and check for the reset email within 5 minutes.
Steps.Expected Result: A password reset email is received containing a reset link and instructions.

Steps.Step Description: Click the reset link in the email and navigate to the password reset page. Enter a new password 'NewP@ss1!' and confirm it, then submit.
Steps.Expected Result: Password is accepted if it meets policy and a confirmation message indicates password successfully changed.

Steps.Step Description: Return to Login page and attempt login with 'testuser@example.com' and new password 'NewP@ss1!'.
Steps.Expected Result: User is able to log in successfully with the new password.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Registered test user 'testuser@example.com' exists. 2) Test mailbox accessible via test automation or manual check. 3) SMTP/email delivery available in test environment.
test_cases.Dataset: Registered email: testuser@example.com; Test mailbox credentials; New password: NewP@ss1!
test_cases.Expected Result: Password reset email is delivered, reset link works, and user can log in with the new password.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates email delivery and reset flow; does not cover link expiry scenarios or rate limiting.

test_cases.Title: StartupPerf_XXX_NA_Performance_TEST_Tablet_VerifyStartupTime

Steps.Step Description: Prepare a test tablet: fully charged, connected to stable network, reboot device, ensure no other apps running, clear MyApp cache and data.
Steps.Expected Result: Test tablet is in a clean state ready for performance measurement.

Steps.Step Description: Using a performance measurement tool or stopwatch, perform a cold start of MyApp (launch after process not resident) and record the time from tap to Home screen readiness. Repeat for 10 cold starts.
Steps.Expected Result: Each cold start time is recorded accurately for 10 runs.

Steps.Step Description: Calculate average startup time and check individual run times against thresholds.
Steps.Expected Result: Average startup time is under 3 seconds and each individual run is under 5 seconds.

Steps.Step Description: Document any startup failures, crashes, or long hangs and capture logs for runs exceeding thresholds.
Steps.Expected Result: Any anomalies are documented and logs attached for analysis.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test tablet prepared as described. 2) Performance tool available and calibrated. 3) Network in consistent state.
test_cases.Dataset: Performance script to perform 10 cold starts; tablet hardware spec; MyApp APK v1.0
test_cases.Expected Result: Average cold startup time < 3 seconds; no single run > 5 seconds; no crashes during measured runs.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers cold-start startup performance; does not cover warm starts, memory/leak analysis, or network variability impacts.

test_cases.Title: InheritBrandEntities_XXX_RU01_BrandManagement_TEST_Computer_Verify inheritance of BM entities and editable translations

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Backoffice as an operator with Brand-Spain administration privileges.
Steps.Expected Result: Operator is authenticated and lands on the Brand configuration dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Brand-Spain > Entities section and select a BM Master entity (e.g., SPORT) that exists in the BM.
Steps.Expected Result: The Master entity details are displayed showing inherited anagraphic elements from BM and their default values.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect the displayed fields for the entity and verify that translation fields are available (language selector or per-language edit controls) for the Brand.
Steps.Expected Result: Translation fields or edit controls are present and show the inherited values; locale for Brand-Spain is selectable.

Steps.Step Description: Edit the translation for one text field (e.g., 'Description') in Spanish and save the change.
Steps.Expected Result: Change is accepted and persisted only for Brand-Spain; UI shows updated Spanish translation for that Brand.

Steps.Step Description: Switch to another Brand (not Spain) that uses the same BM language and check the same entity field value.
Steps.Expected Result: The other Brand continues to show the previous inherited/its own value and is not affected by the change done for Brand-Spain.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) BM Master entities exist with default values. 2) Operator account with Brand-Spain privileges. 3) Two Brands that share the same BM entity language present in system.
test_cases.Dataset: Operator credentials; BM entity: SPORT (id: SPORT_001); Brands: Spain_Brand, Other_Brand
test_cases.Expected Result: Brand inherits BM anagraphic elements; operator can edit translations per Brand; edits apply only to that Brand.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates inheritance and per-brand translation editing only; deeper translation propagation across cascades not covered.

test_cases.Title: PlatformEntityLanguageFallback_XXX_RU03_Display_TEST_Computer_Verify platform entities displayed in Brand supported language with fallback

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Backoffice as Brand-Spain operator and access Entities list.
Steps.Expected Result: Entities list is displayed for Brand-Spain.

Steps.Step Description: Locate a BM platform entity that has a Spanish translation available and open its details.
Steps.Expected Result: Entity details are displayed in Spanish.

Steps.Step Description: Locate a different BM platform entity that does NOT have a Spanish translation but has a fallback language (paracadute) translation available and open details.
Steps.Expected Result: Entity details are displayed in fallback language as configured for Brand-Spain.

Steps.Step Description: Locate a BM platform entity that lacks both Spanish and fallback translations and open details.
Steps.Expected Result: System displays a default placeholder or master-language value indicating missing translation and flags for operator attention.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Brand-Spain configured with Spanish as supported language and a fallback language configured. 2) Entities exist in BM with varying translation availability.
test_cases.Dataset: Brand-Spain configuration; Entities: Entity_A (Spanish present), Entity_B (only fallback present), Entity_C (no translations)
test_cases.Expected Result: Entities render in Brand-supported language if present, otherwise in fallback; missing translations handled gracefully.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers display fallback and missing translation UI; translation creation flows are out of scope.

test_cases.Title: SportEntityProperties_XXX_RU06_SportManagement_TEST_Computer_Verify required sport properties defined

Steps.Step Description: Log in as operator and navigate to Sport entity configuration page.
Steps.Expected Result: Sport entity configuration page is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Create or open a Sport entity and verify fields: Codice DGOJ, Descrizione DGOJ, Type (JUC), Visibility.
Steps.Expected Result: All four properties are present and editable (or visible) in the entity form.

Steps.Step Description: Input valid values for each required property: Codice DGOJ = 'DGOJ123', Descrizione DGOJ = 'Futbol', Type = 'JUC_TYPE', Visibility = 'Visible'. Save the entity.
Steps.Expected Result: Entity saves successfully and stored values are displayed in entity summary.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to save a Sport entity leaving Codice DGOJ blank and observe validation.
Steps.Expected Result: System blocks save and shows validation error for missing Codice DGOJ if the field is mandatory per RU06.

test_cases.Preconditions: Operator has Sport management rights; Sport management page available.
test_cases.Dataset: Sport sample data: {Codice:'DGOJ123',Descr:'Futbol',Type:'JUC_TYPE',Visibility:'Visible'}
test_cases.Expected Result: Sport properties defined per RU06 and validation prevents missing mandatory fields.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates presence and basic validation of properties; does not validate downstream sync with other systems.

test_cases.Title: CreateDeleteSport_XXX_RU07_RU08_SportManagement_TEST_Computer_Verify create and conditional deletion of sport entity

Steps.Step Description: Log in as operator and navigate to 'Nuovo sport' CTA in Sport management.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Nuovo sport' CTA is visible and enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Nuovo sport' and fill required fields using valid data (Codice DGOJ='DGOJDEL', Descrizione='TestDelete', Type='JUC', Visibility='Visible'), then save.
Steps.Expected Result: New Sport entity is created and appears in Sport list.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to delete the newly created sport when it is NOT present in any palinsesto (no schedules or events associated).
Steps.Expected Result: System performs physical deletion (record removed) and confirms success.

Steps.Step Description: Recreate the same Sport entity and then create an associated palinsesto/event linking to it. Attempt to delete the sport again.
Steps.Expected Result: System prevents physical deletion and performs logical deletion (mark as deprecated/removed); UI shows 'deleted/deprecated' status.

test_cases.Preconditions: Operator rights; ability to create and link events/palinsesto.
test_cases.Dataset: Sport create payloads; Event/palinsesto sample to link sport
test_cases.Expected Result: System allows creation via CTA and enforces physical deletion only when no references exist, otherwise logical deletion.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers creation and deletion modes for sport; complex cascading effects not covered.

test_cases.Title: AssociateSportToBM_XXX_RU09_SportAssociation_TEST_Computer_Verify n_to_m association between regulated sport and BM elements

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Backoffice and open the Sport entity detail intended for association.
Steps.Expected Result: Sport detail page is shown with option to manage associations.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Associate BM elements' and search BM elements using search box; select multiple BM Sport entities (e.g., BM_SPORT_1, BM_SPORT_2).
Steps.Expected Result: Search returns matching BM elements; multiple selections allowed.

Steps.Step Description: Save associations and verify the Sport entity now shows the related BM elements in its relationships list.
Steps.Expected Result: Associations persist; relationships list shows each associated BM element (n:m supported).

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to remove one association and ensure the system updates relationship accordingly.
Steps.Expected Result: Selected association is removed; remaining associations remain intact.

test_cases.Preconditions: Existing Sport entity and multiple BM elements available for association.
test_cases.Dataset: Sport id: SPORT_001; BM elements: [BM_SPORT_1, BM_SPORT_2]
test_cases.Expected Result: System supports n:m associations; add/remove operations work and persist.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates association UI and persistence; bulk import of associations not covered.

test_cases.Title: ViewManifestationsAndProperties_XXX_RU10_RU11_Events_TEST_Computer_Verify manifestations listing and property definition

Steps.Step Description: Log in and navigate to Brand-Spain > Manifestazioni for a given sport DGOJ that has associations with Master entity.
Steps.Expected Result: Manifestazioni list relevant to the sport is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Open a manifestazione that is linked via DGOJ relation to a Master entity.
Steps.Expected Result: Manifestazione detail displays and shows linkage to Master entity.

Steps.Step Description: Within the manifestazione detail, verify the presence of properties defined in RU11: Genere, Categoria, Internazionale, Sigla ISO (Nazione).
Steps.Expected Result: All RU11 properties are present in the manifestazione detail form and show current values or empty state if not set.

Steps.Step Description: Edit the Genere and Categoria values, save and confirm persistence.
Steps.Expected Result: Changes are saved and displayed on the manifestazione summary.

test_cases.Preconditions: Manifestazioni exist for the sport and operator has edit rights.
test_cases.Dataset: Sport DGOJ id; Manifestazione id sample
test_cases.Expected Result: Manifestations for sport DGOJ visible; RU11 properties present and editable.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Checks display and edit of RU11 fields; downstream publishing flows not included.

test_cases.Title: BrandConfigurationFields_XXX_RU12_Config_TEST_Computer_Verify Brand-Spain configuration fields set externally and non-editable via UI

Steps.Step Description: Log in as Brand-Spain operator and open Brand configuration section.
Steps.Expected Result: Brand configuration page shows fields defined for configuration (Nome Brand, Sigla, Valuta, Formato quote, Lingua paracadute, Lingua supportata).

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to edit any of the fields from the UI.
Steps.Expected Result: Fields are not editable from UI (read-only) as per project note; edit controls are disabled or absent.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that values shown correspond to externally provided configuration (verify with known external config dataset).
Steps.Expected Result: Displayed values match expected externally provided configuration for Brand-Spain.

test_cases.Preconditions: Brand-Spain configuration must be prepopulated externally before test.
test_cases.Dataset: Expected Brand config values (provided externally) e.g., {Nome:'BrandSpain',Sigla:'SP',Valuta:'EUR',Formato:'Decimal',LinguaPar:'en',LinguaSupport:'es'}
test_cases.Expected Result: Configuration fields present and non-editable; values match external config.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates read-only behaviour in UI only; external config process not tested.

test_cases.Title: PrototypesAndIncompleteEvents_XXX_RU16_RU17_RU19_TEST_Computer_Verify prototype list and incomplete event rules

Steps.Step Description: Log in and open the 'Prototipi' section for Brand-Spain.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Prototipi' section displays list of events published by BM that are configured for Brand-Spain and flagged as available for offer.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect list and identify events that are marked as 'incomplete' because sport of platform is not associated to regulator's sport or manifestazione lacks RU11 properties.
Steps.Expected Result: Events meeting RU17 conditions are present in the 'incomplete' list and are clearly annotated with missing reasons (e.g., 'Sport not associated', 'Missing Genere').

Steps.Step Description: Select an incomplete event where the sport is not associated and attempt to define missing properties; first try to assign platform sport association then fill required RU11 fields and save.
Steps.Expected Result: System allows assignment only if platform sport is associated; once associated, missing properties can be set and event moves out of incomplete list.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to define RU11 properties for an event where the sport is NOT associated (without creating association) and save.
Steps.Expected Result: System prevents saving complete RU11 properties if association prerequisite is not met, as per RU19.

test_cases.Preconditions: BM has published prototype events; some events intentionally incomplete to reflect RU17 cases; operator has edit rights.
test_cases.Dataset: Prototypes list with events: E_INCOMP_1 (missing association), E_INCOMP_2 (missing RU11 fields)
test_cases.Expected Result: Incomplete events listed with clear reason; operator can only complete missing properties when sport association exists.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI flows for identifying and resolving incomplete events; automated reconciliation not covered.

test_cases.Title: CreatePrototypeFromEvent_XXX_RU21_Prototypes_TEST_Computer_Verify operator can propose new prototype and update RU11 fields

Steps.Step Description: Open a Manifestazione detail for a regulator event and click 'Propose new Prototipo' (available in Brand-Spain Prototipi section).
Steps.Expected Result: 'Propose new Prototipo' action is available and opens the creation form pre-populated with event details.

Steps.Step Description: Modify RU11 properties (Genere, Categoria, Internazionale, Sigla ISO) in the new prototype creation form and submit proposal.
Steps.Expected Result: Submission succeeds; new prototype appears in Brand-Spain Prototipi list with the updated RU11 values.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to propose a prototype without filling mandatory RU11 fields (if any) and submit.
Steps.Expected Result: System returns validation errors preventing submission until required fields are supplied.

test_cases.Preconditions: Operator permissions to create prototypes; source event available.
test_cases.Dataset: Source event id; RU11 sample values
test_cases.Expected Result: Operator can create a new prototype and update RU11 properties; validations apply.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates prototype proposal UI and RU11 edits; approvals and publication flows not included.

test_cases.Title: PersonalizeAndResetNationGender_XXX_RU23_RU24_RU25_RU30_MANAGEMENT_TEST_Computer_Verify brand personalization of Nazione and Genere and reset to master

Steps.Step Description: Log in as Brand-Spain operator and open a Manifestazione that has Genere and Nazione fields inherited from BM.
Steps.Expected Result: Manifestazione shows current Genere and Nazione values (inherited from BM).

Steps.Step Description: Modify Genere and Nazione fields for the Brand (customize locally) and save changes.
Steps.Expected Result: Changes are saved and the manifestazione shows the personalized values for Brand-Spain.

Steps.Step Description: Change the Master BM values (simulate a change in BM) for the same fields and verify that Brand-Spain does NOT receive those BM changes for the personalized manifestazione.
Steps.Expected Result: Master changes are not applied to the manifestazione previously personalized by Brand-Spain (as per RU26).

Steps.Step Description: Use the 'Reset personalizations' functionality on the manifestazione to revert personalization for Nazione and Genere to Master values.
Steps.Expected Result: Personalized values are reset and manifestazione reflects master values again; subsequent BM updates will apply normally.

test_cases.Preconditions: Manifestazione exists with BM values; operator rights to personalize and to reset.
test_cases.Dataset: Manifestazione id; BM initial values; new BM values for simulation
test_cases.Expected Result: Brand-specific personalization overrides are persisted; master updates do not override personalized data; reset restores master.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates personalization and reset flows; conflict resolution policies beyond reset not covered.

test_cases.Title: DisambiguationDuringPublication_XXX_RU31_Publication_TEST_Computer_Verify popup disambiguation for sport association at publish time

Steps.Step Description: Open an event ready for publication to Brand-Spain where the system cannot automatically reconcile which platform regulated element corresponds to the Master element (ambiguous match).
Steps.Expected Result: Publication flow starts and system detects ambiguity.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to publish; verify that a popup/modal is presented asking the operator to select and define unequivocally the element to associate.
Steps.Expected Result: Disambiguation popup is displayed listing candidate platform elements and clear instructions to choose one.

Steps.Step Description: Select the correct platform element from the popup and confirm selection, then proceed with publication.
Steps.Expected Result: Selection is accepted, publication continues and completes successfully with the chosen association recorded.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger another ambiguous publish and dismiss the popup (cancel) to verify handling of operator cancellation.
Steps.Expected Result: Publication is halted/cancelled and no association or publish action is committed; system returns to event detail.

test_cases.Preconditions: Event exists with ambiguous mapping to platform elements; operator has publish rights.
test_cases.Dataset: Ambiguous event id with candidate platform elements list
test_cases.Expected Result: Operator is prompted to disambiguate; chosen association is used for publication; cancel halts publish.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers interactive disambiguation popup flows; automated matching heuristics not validated here.

test_cases.Title: CountryPrepopulationAndSearchLanguage_XXX_RU28_RU29_Search_TEST_Computer_Verify nation prepopulation and language-aware search

Steps.Step Description: Log in and navigate to Nazione entity management in BM; open the creation or edit form for Nazione.
Steps.Expected Result: Nazione list is displayed with prepopulated list of countries for which ISO codes exist; operator can modify only description and icon fields.

Steps.Step Description: Select a prepopulated country and attempt to change ISO code or other locked attributes.
Steps.Expected Result: ISO code and locked attributes are not editable; only description and icon are editable.

Steps.Step Description: Use global search to locate entities (e.g., Sport or Manifestazione) using terms in Spanish and in fallback language to validate language-aware search behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: Search returns appropriate results according to language management rules: matches in Brand supported language prioritized, fallback matches returned when primary not available.

Steps.Step Description: Perform search using a term whose translation exists only for another Brand and verify that modification by one Brand does not affect results for other Brands (per RU02).
Steps.Expected Result: Search results reflect per-brand translations and modifications; changes from another Brand do not alter Brand-Spain results.

test_cases.Preconditions: BM prepopulated with countries and translations; search index up-to-date.
test_cases.Dataset: Prepopulated countries list; search terms in Spanish and fallback language; Brands dataset
test_cases.Expected Result: Nazione prepopulated and only description/icon editable; search follows language management rules and per-brand translation isolation.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates prepopulation and primary search behaviors; search performance and ranking not exhaustively covered.

test_cases.Title: VerifyActorsSection_XXX_REQUISITO_UseCases_TEST_Desktop_check presence of Actors section

Steps.Step Description: Open the application in a supported browser and navigate to the 'Use Cases' page (menu: Documentation -> Use Cases).
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Use Cases' page loads without errors and the header shows 'Use Cases' or equivalent title.

Steps.Step Description: Scroll to the section labeled 'Attori' / 'Actors' on the Use Cases page.

test_cases.Expected Result: The Actors section exists on the Use Cases page, lists actor names with descriptions, allows viewing details (if supported) and remains present after refresh.

test_cases.Title: VerifyUseCasesList_XXX_REQUISITO_UseCases_TEST_Desktop_validate use cases list and details

Steps.Step Description: Log in as a user with read access and navigate to Documentation -> Use Cases.
Steps.Expected Result: Use Cases page is displayed for the logged-in user.

Steps.Step Description: Locate the 'Casi d'uso' / 'Use Cases' list on the page and count the visible entries.
Steps.Expected Result: The page shows a list of use cases and the number of items matches the expected dataset (e.g., 5 entries).

Steps.Step Description: Click the first use case entry to open its detail view or modal.
Steps.Expected Result: The use case detail view opens showing title, actors involved, preconditions, main flow and alternative flows (if available).

Steps.Step Description: Verify that mandatory fields in the detail view (title, actors, main flow) are populated and non-empty.
Steps.Expected Result: Mandatory fields are present and contain non-empty values consistent with dataset.

Steps.Step Description: Use the page search/filter (if available) to filter use cases by actor name and observe results.
Steps.Expected Result: Filter returns only use cases associated with the specified actor.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test dataset has at least 5 use cases with complete details. 2) User account has read permission. 3) Search/filter feature is enabled in UI.
test_cases.Functionality: Use Cases Page - List and Details
test_cases.Dataset: User: reader_user@example.com (role=reader); Use Cases dataset: UC-001..UC-005 with actors and flows.
test_cases.Expected Result: Use Cases list displays expected number of entries; detail view shows required fields; filtering returns correct subset.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates listing, details and filtering; does not cover editing, creation, or deletion of use cases.

test_cases.Title: PermissionsVisibility_XXX_REQUISITO_UseCases_TEST_Desktop_validate actor and usecase visibility per role

Steps.Step Description: Log in as an admin user and navigate to Use Cases page, note the number of visible use cases and actors.
Steps.Expected Result: Admin user sees the full list of use cases and actors as defined in the dataset.

Steps.Step Description: Log out and log in as a limited-role user (e.g., 'guest' or 'external'), navigate to Use Cases page and note visible items.
Steps.Expected Result: Limited-role user sees only the use cases/actors permitted by role-based access control; restricted items are not visible or are shown as 'not authorized'.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access a restricted use case detail URL directly (copy direct link from admin session) while logged in as limited-role user.
Steps.Expected Result: Access is denied or a permission error is shown; content is not displayed to the limited-role user.

Steps.Step Description: Log back in as admin and change a use case visibility setting (if UI supports it) to hide it from guests; log out and log in as guest to confirm.
Steps.Expected Result: Use case hidden by admin is no longer visible to guest users while still visible to admin.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test environment configured with at least two roles (admin, guest). 2) Role-based access control configured for use cases visibility. 3) Test accounts for both roles available.
test_cases.Dataset: Admin user: admin_user@example.com; Guest user: guest_user@example.com; Use Cases with role-based visibility flags.
test_cases.Expected Result: Use case and actor visibility respect role-based permissions; direct access to restricted content is prevented for unauthorized roles.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers visibility and direct-access denial; does not cover role management UI beyond simple visibility toggle.

test_cases.Title: ExportUseCases_XXX_REQUISITO_UseCases_TEST_Desktop_export print and download functionality check

Steps.Step Description: Open the Use Cases page as a user with export/print permissions and locate the 'Export' or 'Print' controls.
Steps.Expected Result: Export/Print controls (buttons or menu options) are visible and enabled for the user.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Export' and choose available formats (e.g., PDF, DOCX, CSV) if options are presented.
Steps.Expected Result: Export process initiates and the chosen file format is generated for download without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Open the downloaded PDF/DOCX and validate that it contains the Use Cases list and actor information for the exported scope.
Steps.Expected Result: Exported document contains expected sections: Use Case titles, actors, main flows and preconditions; formatting is readable.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Print' (or Print Preview) and observe print dialog and preview content.
Steps.Expected Result: Print preview shows the Use Cases content as expected and print dialog is displayed; printing to PDF works and content matches preview.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt export as a user without export permissions.
Steps.Expected Result: Export control is disabled or an authorization error is shown and the export cannot be performed.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User accounts set up with and without export permissions. 2) Export service/feature enabled in test environment. 3) PDF/DOCX generator available in environment.
test_cases.Dataset: User: exporter_user@example.com (role=exporter); Use Cases dataset with multiple entries to validate pagination/export completeness.
test_cases.Expected Result: Users with permissions can export/print Use Cases and resulting documents include required sections; users without permission cannot export.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates export and print happy paths and permission denial; does not cover large-scale export performance or very large documents.

test_cases.Title: ViewProfile_XXX_AttoriAnagrafica_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_Verify_user_profile_display

Steps.Step Description: Verify that fields 'First Name', 'Last Name', 'Email', 'Date of Birth', 'Address' are visible and show current stored values.

test_cases.Title: EditProfile_XXX_AttoriAnagrafica_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_Save_valid_changes

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application as 'Utente Anagrafica' (username: anagrafica_user, password: Password123!).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and lands on the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to 'Anagrafica' and click 'Edit' to modify profile fields.
Steps.Expected Result: Edit mode is enabled and profile fields become editable.

Steps.Step Description: Update First Name to 'Mario', Last Name to 'Rossi', Email to 'mario.rossi.test@example.com', and Address to 'Via Roma 1, Milano'.
Steps.Expected Result: Fields accept input and display the new values in the form.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' to persist the changes.

Steps.Step Description: Refresh the page and verify the profile fields reflect the saved values.

test_cases.Title: EditProfile_InvalidInput_XXX_AttoriAnagrafica_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_Validate_field_errors

Steps.Step Description: Log in as 'Utente Anagrafica' (anagrafica_user / Password123!).
Steps.Expected Result: Login successful and dashboard displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to 'Anagrafica' and enter edit mode.
Steps.Expected Result: Edit form becomes editable.

Steps.Step Description: Enter invalid email format 'invalid-email' and a too-long First Name (300 characters).
Steps.Expected Result: Form fields accept input but will be validated on save.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' to submit the form with invalid data.
Steps.Expected Result: Client-side and/or server-side validation prevents save; appropriate error messages shown: 'Enter a valid email address' and 'First Name must be less than 255 characters'.

Steps.Step Description: Correct the fields: set Email to 'valid.email@example.com' and First Name to 'Luigi', then click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Form validates successfully and changes are saved; success confirmation displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User exists and has edit privileges. 2) Validation rules are configured (email pattern, max length constraints).
test_cases.Dataset: username=anagrafica_user, password=Password123!; invalid inputs: email=invalid-email, firstname=<300 chars>; valid inputs for recovery: email=valid.email@example.com, firstname=Luigi
test_cases.Expected Result: System enforces input validation and displays clear error messages; after correction, data is saved.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers syntactic validation; does not cover internationalization-specific validations or backend sanitization tests.

test_cases.Title: RequiredFields_XXX_AttoriAnagrafica_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_Enforce_mandatory_fields

Steps.Step Description: Login as 'Utente Anagrafica' (anagrafica_user / Password123!).
Steps.Expected Result: Authentication successful.

Steps.Step Description: Open 'Anagrafica' edit form and clear mandatory fields such as 'First Name' and 'Email'.
Steps.Expected Result: Fields are emptied and can be modified.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' while mandatory fields are empty.
Steps.Expected Result: System blocks save and displays mandatory field error messages: 'First Name is required' and 'Email is required'.

Steps.Step Description: Re-enter valid values for mandatory fields and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Form validates and saves successfully; confirmation displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User has edit permission. 2) System defines 'First Name' and 'Email' as mandatory fields.
test_cases.Dataset: username=anagrafica_user, password=Password123!; empty values for mandatory fields

test_cases.Title: AccessControl_XXX_AttoriAnagrafica_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_Restrict_non_anagrafica_roles

Steps.Step Description: Login with a user that does NOT have the 'Utente Anagrafica' role (username: general_user, password: Password123!).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and lands on their dashboard with role-specific menu.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the 'Anagrafica' URL directly via browser address bar or click the 'Anagrafica' menu if visible.
Steps.Expected Result: System denies access: either 'Anagrafica' menu is not visible, or direct URL returns access denied (HTTP 403) or a 'Not Authorized' message.

Steps.Step Description: Try to perform an API call to retrieve profile details for another user using the logged-in credentials (if API console available).
Steps.Expected Result: API returns 403 Forbidden or limited data according to permissions; no PII is exposed.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) A non-anagrafica user 'general_user' exists. 2) Role-based access control is configured in the environment.

test_cases.Expected Result: Users without 'Utente Anagrafica' role cannot view or edit Anagrafica data; system enforces authorization.

test_cases.Title: AuditLog_XXX_AttoriAnagrafica_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_Verify_audit_entry_on_update

Steps.Step Description: Login as 'Utente Anagrafica' (anagrafica_user / Password123!).
Steps.Expected Result: Authentication successful.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to 'Anagrafica', enter edit mode, change a field (e.g., Address to 'Via Test 99'), and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Changes are saved and success confirmation is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Access the Audit Log section (or query the audit API/database) to find the latest audit entry for that user/profile change.
Steps.Expected Result: An audit entry exists recording the change, including timestamp, user identifier (anagrafica_user), changed fields, old and new values, and operation type 'UPDATE'.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the audit entry cannot be modified via UI by normal users and that only authorized admin accounts can view extended audit details if applicable.
Steps.Expected Result: Audit entry is immutable for normal users and access to detailed audit can be restricted to admin role; unauthorized modification attempts are blocked.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application - Anagrafica Module; Audit Service/DB
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Audit logging is enabled in the environment. 2) Tester has access to Audit Log UI or API. 3) Test user exists and has permission to update profile.
test_cases.Dataset: username=anagrafica_user, password=Password123!; change: Address=Via Test 99
test_cases.Expected Result: Profile update generates a verifiable immutable audit record containing actor, timestamp, changed fields, and old/new values.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates creation and basic access restrictions of audit logs; retention and tamper-proof features not covered.

test_cases.Title: LoginSuccess_XXX_REQ-COM-USECASES_Authentication_TEST_Computer_Verify successful login and redirect

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the application's login page (Web).
Steps.Expected Result: Login page loads within 5 seconds and displays username and password fields and a 'Login' button.

Steps.Step Description: Enter valid username 'user_test@example.com' and valid password 'P@ssw0rd!' into the respective fields.
Steps.Expected Result: Entered credentials are visible (masked for password) and no field-level validation errors are shown.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Login' button.
Steps.Expected Result: Authentication request is sent and a successful response is received (HTTP 200 or equivalent).

Steps.Step Description: Observe the application behavior after successful authentication.
Steps.Expected Result: User is redirected to the Home/Dashboard page within 3 seconds; user name is displayed in the header; a valid session token/cookie is set.

Steps.Step Description: Verify session persistence by refreshing the page and navigating to an authenticated-only page (e.g., Profile).
Steps.Expected Result: User remains authenticated and can access the authenticated-only page without re-login.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1) Test user account 'user_test@example.com' exists and is active.
2) Test environment backend services are available.
3) Browser cache cleared or a new incognito session started.
test_cases.Dataset: username: user_test@example.com; password: P@ssw0rd!; test URL: https://test.example.com/login
test_cases.Expected Result: User successfully authenticates and is redirected to the Dashboard with an active session.
test_cases._polarion: Descrizione dei casi d'uso comuni agli applicativi impattati
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers standard successful login flow on desktop web. Does not cover SSO, MFA, or social-login variants.

test_cases.Title: LoginInvalidPwd_XXX_REQ-COM-USECASES_Authentication_TEST_Computer_Verify invalid credentials handling

Steps.Step Description: Open the application's login page (Web).
Steps.Expected Result: Login page is displayed with username and password fields.

Steps.Step Description: Enter valid username 'user_test@example.com' and incorrect password 'WrongPass123'.
Steps.Expected Result: Credentials entered; no client-side validation error shown for format.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Login'.
Steps.Expected Result: Authentication request sent to backend; backend returns authentication failure (HTTP 401 or equivalent).

Steps.Step Description: Observe the error message shown to the user.
Steps.Expected Result: A clear, non-sensitive error message is displayed (e.g., 'Invalid username or password') and password field is cleared or offers ability to re-enter. No stack traces or sensitive info exposed.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to log in 5 times with wrong password and observe account lockout behavior (if implemented).
Steps.Expected Result: If account lockout is implemented, after configured attempts account is temporarily locked and appropriate message shown; if not implemented, repeated attempts are allowed.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1) Test user exists and is active.
2) No existing account lockout currently applied to the test account.
3) Backend authentication logs accessible for verification (optional).
test_cases.Dataset: username: user_test@example.com; invalid password: WrongPass123; backend lockout threshold: 5 attempts
test_cases.Expected Result: Application responds with safe, user-friendly error on invalid credentials and enforces account lockout policy if configured.
test_cases._polarion: Descrizione dei casi d'uso comuni agli applicativi impattati
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates invalid password handling and account lockout. Does not cover credential enumeration or rate-limiting outside lockout context.

test_cases.Title: OfflineSync_XXX_REQ-COM-USECASES_DataSync_TEST_Smartphone_Verify offline data storage and sync when online

Steps.Step Description: Install and open mobile application on a smartphone with a valid test user logged in.
Steps.Expected Result: App opens and user is authenticated to a screen where they can create or modify data (e.g., a note or form).

Steps.Step Description: Disable network connectivity (airplane mode) on the device.
Steps.Expected Result: Device shows no network connectivity; the app indicates offline status if applicable.

Steps.Step Description: Create a new record (e.g., new note titled 'OfflineTest' with content) in the application while offline.
Steps.Expected Result: App accepts new record locally and displays it in UI; record is marked as 'pending sync' or with an offline indicator.

Steps.Step Description: Re-enable network connectivity on the device.
Steps.Expected Result: Device reconnects; app detects connectivity change and attempts background sync.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the locally created record is uploaded to the server and available from another client or backend data view.
Steps.Expected Result: Record 'OfflineTest' is present on server; status in app changes from 'pending' to 'synced'; no data duplication occurs.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1) Test user account exists and is logged in.
2) App has permission to use local storage.
3) Backend endpoint for sync is reachable when online.
test_cases.Dataset: Test user account; sample note content: 'OfflineTest - sync verification'; device: Android 13 emulator or physical device.
test_cases.Expected Result: App correctly stores changes offline and synchronizes them to backend when connection is restored without data loss or duplication.
test_cases._polarion: Descrizione dei casi d'uso comuni agli applicativi impattati
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers basic offline create then sync. Does not cover conflict resolution between concurrent edits or large binary attachments sync.

test_cases.Title: PushNotificationDisplay_XXX_REQ-COM-USECASES_Notifications_TEST_Tablet_Verify push notification arrival and in-app handling

Steps.Step Description: Ensure tablet device has the app installed and push notifications enabled; user is logged in and app is backgrounded.
Steps.Expected Result: Device settings allow notifications for the app; app ready to receive push messages.

Steps.Step Description: Send a test push notification from the backend with title 'Test Alert' and body 'This is a test message' targeting the test user.
Steps.Expected Result: Push notification is delivered to push service (FCM/APNs) and a delivery acknowledgement is logged on backend.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the tablet when the notification arrives while the app is backgrounded.
Steps.Expected Result: System displays the push notification in the notification shade with correct title and body; tapping the notification brings the app to foreground and navigates to the specified deep link or opens the main app screen.

Steps.Step Description: Send a silent push notification that should trigger an in-app update while the app is in foreground.
Steps.Expected Result: App receives the silent push and performs the expected background task (e.g., refresh content). No visible system notification appears; in-app content updates as per payload.

test_cases.Reference System: Android 12 Tablet, Mobile App (Test build 1.2.0), FCM/APNs
test_cases.Preconditions:
1) Push token for the device is registered on the backend.
2) Backend has permission and configuration to send test notifications.
3) Device is connected to network and not in Do-Not-Disturb blocking notifications.
test_cases.Dataset: Push payload examples: visible push {title:'Test Alert', body:'This is a test message', deep_link:'/alerts/123'}; silent push {content_available:1, action:'refresh'}
test_cases.Expected Result: Visible and silent push notifications are handled correctly: visible pushes show in system tray and deep link works; silent pushes trigger expected background behavior.
test_cases._polarion: Descrizione dei casi d'uso comuni agli applicativi impattati
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates basic visible and silent pushes. Does not validate push behavior under Do-Not-Disturb, battery optimization restrictions, or multi-account scenarios.

test_cases.Title: ExportCSV_XXX_REQ-COM-USECASES_DataExport_TEST_Server_Verify CSV export generation and download

Steps.Step Description: Log into the backend web console as a user with export privileges.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and authorized controls for data export are available in the UI.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the data listing page, apply a known filter (e.g., date range 2025-01-01 to 2025-01-31), and click 'Export CSV'.
Steps.Expected Result: Export action is initiated and the UI indicates export job started (immediate download or job queued).

Steps.Step Description: If export is immediate, confirm browser downloads a CSV file; if queued, wait for email/notification and download generated file from provided link.
Steps.Expected Result: CSV file is downloaded successfully and filename encodes filter metadata (e.g., data_export_20250101_20250131.csv).

Steps.Step Description: Open the downloaded CSV and validate header columns and a sample of data rows against the filtered results displayed in the UI.
Steps.Expected Result: CSV headers match expected schema, rows correspond to the filtered dataset, and no personal data is truncated or malformed. File encoding is UTF-8.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to export a very large dataset (e.g., >100k rows) and observe system behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: For large exports, system either streams download successfully or creates a background job with notification when ready. System should not crash or timeout unexpectedly.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1) User has export permissions.
2) Dataset for the selected date range exists and contains sample records.
3) Export service and storage (for queued exports) are operational.
test_cases.Dataset: Filter: date_from=2025-01-01; date_to=2025-01-31; expected sample rows: IDs 1001..1010
test_cases.Expected Result: CSV export generates a correctly formatted file containing the filtered data and handles large exports via background processing without data loss.
test_cases._polarion: Descrizione dei casi d'uso comuni agli applicativi impattati
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers export content and basic large-file handling. Does not cover encrypted export, GDPR deletion requests, or export performance under very heavy concurrency.

test_cases.Title: ConcurrentSession_XXX_REQ-COM-USECASES_SessionManagement_TEST_Computer_Verify concurrent session policy enforcement

Steps.Step Description: Log in with the test user 'concurrent_user@example.com' on Device A (Web on Computer).
Steps.Expected Result: Device A is authenticated and session token issued.

Steps.Step Description: Without logging out on Device A, log in with the same user on Device B (Mobile App or another browser instance).
Steps.Expected Result: Device B authenticates and behavior follows configured policy: either both sessions remain active or previous session is invalidated depending on requirement.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to perform an authenticated action on Device A after Device B login (e.g., access Profile or perform a data change).
Steps.Expected Result: If policy is single active session, Device A receives an authentication error and is redirected to login; if multiple sessions allowed, Device A continues to operate normally.

Steps.Step Description: Verify backend session records/logs to confirm session tokens issuance and invalidation timestamps.
Steps.Expected Result: Backend logs show session token creation for both devices and, if single-session policy, explicit invalidation event for the prior token with correct timestamp.

Steps.Step Description: Log out from Device B and verify revocation of session tokens and ability to re-login on Device A.
Steps.Expected Result: Logging out on Device B invalidates its token. Device A can log in again if previous token was invalidated or resumes if still valid according to policy.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10 and Android 13, Web and Mobile App, Authentication Service v2
test_cases.Preconditions:
1) Test account exists and has no active sessions prior to test.
2) Two test devices or browser instances available.
3) Session management configuration (single vs multi-session) is known for the environment.
test_cases.Dataset: user: concurrent_user@example.com; password: Concurrent1!; devices: Computer (Chrome), Mobile (Android App)
test_cases.Expected Result: Concurrent session behavior aligns with configured policy: either single active session enforced with prior sessions invalidated, or multiple sessions allowed; backend logs reflect correct session lifecycle events.
test_cases._polarion: Descrizione dei casi d'uso comuni agli applicativi impattati
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates concurrent session enforcement and token invalidation. Does not validate SSO third-party token propagation or edge cases with long-lived refresh tokens.

test_cases.Title: UnderlineVariations_XXX_ConvenzioniGrafiche_DocumentViewer_TEST_Computer_verify_underlined_variations

Steps.Step Description: Open the Document Viewer web application and load the test document 'conventions_sample.docx' that contains a use case with intentional variations marked by underlining.
Steps.Expected Result: Document loads successfully in the viewer and the specified document 'conventions_sample.docx' is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Visually inspect the use case sections where variations to pre-existing use cases are present and check for underlining on the altered text portions.
Steps.Expected Result: All variations to pre-existing use cases are rendered with clear underlining matching the document content.

Steps.Step Description: Hover the mouse over an underlined text segment and attempt to select and copy the underlined text into a text editor.
Steps.Expected Result: Selection works; copied text includes the same textual content (underline style may not be preserved in plain text).

Steps.Step Description: Open the same document in an alternative supported browser (if available) and repeat the visual check for underlining.
Steps.Expected Result: Underlining for variations is consistently displayed across supported browsers.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has access to the Document Viewer application. 2) Test document 'conventions_sample.docx' containing underlined variations is available in the test repository. 3) Network connectivity to the application is established. 4) Tester is logged into the application if authentication is required.
test_cases.Dataset: conventions_sample.docx (contains sections: preexisting_usecase_1 with underlined modifications)
test_cases.Expected Result: All variations to pre-existing use cases are displayed with underlining in the Document Viewer consistently across supported browsers.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers visual verification of underlining in viewer; does not verify underlying document source formatting beyond rendering and does not include mobile device rendering.

test_cases.Title: GreyExistingUseCase_XXX_ConvenzioniGrafiche_DocumentViewer_TEST_Computer_verify_grey_indication

Steps.Step Description: Open the Document Viewer and load 'conventions_sample.docx' which contains references to pre-existing use cases that are not reproduced in the document.
Steps.Expected Result: Document loads and displays references to pre-existing use cases.

Steps.Step Description: Identify references to pre-existing use cases that are expected to be displayed in grey color according to the conventions.
Steps.Expected Result: All references to pre-existing use cases that are not included in the document are rendered in grey color.

Steps.Step Description: Use browser developer tools or an accessibility inspector to capture the computed color value (hex or rgb) for the greyed text.
Steps.Expected Result: Computed color is a grey shade; value is consistent with documented style guide (e.g., hex value matches style spec if available).

Steps.Step Description: Switch to a high-contrast or custom CSS theme (if the application supports themes) and verify whether the grey indicator is still distinguishable.
Steps.Expected Result: Greyed references remain visually distinct; if theme overrides colors, an alternate indicator (e.g., italic or specific class) is present to preserve the semantic meaning.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) 'conventions_sample.docx' includes references to pre-existing use cases that should appear grey. 2) Tester has rights to inspect DOM/CSS with developer tools.
test_cases.Dataset: conventions_sample.docx (contains references labeled as 'existing_usecase_ref' intended to be greyed)
test_cases.Expected Result: References to pre-existing use cases not reproduced in the document are displayed in grey color and remain semantically distinguishable even under alternate themes.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates visual grey rendering and DOM/cs s properties; does not validate exact color contrast thresholds across all OS-level display settings.

test_cases.Title: BrownAlternativeSteps_XXX_ConvenzioniGrafiche_DocumentViewer_TEST_Computer_verify_brown_for_alternative_paths

Steps.Step Description: Open the document 'conventions_sample.docx' in the Document Viewer; navigate to the Use Case description that includes a base path step with at least one defined alternative path.
Steps.Expected Result: Use Case description with base step and its alternative path(s) is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Locate the base-path step that has alternative paths and verify the text color used for that base step is brown as per the conventions.
Steps.Expected Result: The base-step text where alternative path exists is rendered in brown color.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect the styling (via developer tools) to confirm the presence of the CSS class or inline style indicating brown color and that it is applied only to the intended step(s).
Steps.Expected Result: A specific style or class attributing brown color is present and applied only to the steps that have alternative paths.

Steps.Step Description: Expand or collapse the alternative path detail (if the viewer supports expand/collapse) and confirm the brown color remains associated with the corresponding base step.
Steps.Expected Result: Brown color remains associated and visible to clearly indicate which base steps have alternatives regardless of expansion state.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Document includes at least one base step with alternative path(s). 2) Viewer supports CSS inspection or provides style metadata.
test_cases.Dataset: conventions_sample.docx (contains usecase_with_alternatives section)
test_cases.Expected Result: Base steps that have at least one alternative path are rendered in brown color and are identifiable via styling attributes.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers color cue for alternative-path base steps in viewer; does not include automated color validation across all browsers or mobile devices.

test_cases.Title: ExportToPDF_PreserveConventions_XXX_ConvenzioniGrafiche_DocumentViewer_TEST_Computer_verify_export_preserves_styles

Steps.Step Description: Open 'conventions_sample.docx' in the Document Viewer and verify the presence of underlined variations, greyed existing use cases, and brown-marked base steps with alternatives.
Steps.Expected Result: All three conventions are visible in the viewer before export.

Steps.Step Description: Use the Document Viewer's 'Export to PDF' feature to generate a PDF of the document and save it as 'conventions_export.pdf'.
Steps.Expected Result: Export completes without errors and 'conventions_export.pdf' is generated.

Steps.Step Description: Open the generated PDF using a standard PDF reader and visually inspect the locations where underlining, grey color, and brown color should appear.
Steps.Expected Result: Underlining for variations is present in the PDF; references to pre-existing use cases are displayed in grey; base steps with alternatives are indicated in brown or by a clear alternate indicator if color is not preserved.

Steps.Step Description: If any of the styles are not preserved in color, verify that an alternate semantic indicator (such as italic, parentheses note, or a legend) is present in the PDF to preserve meaning.
Steps.Expected Result: If color is not preserved in the export, the PDF includes alternate indicators or a legend that conveys the same semantic information.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application Document Viewer, PDF Reader (e.g., Adobe Reader)
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Export to PDF function enabled in the viewer. 2) Sufficient disk space to save exported files. 3) 'conventions_sample.docx' contains the three conventions.
test_cases.Dataset: conventions_sample.docx; output file conventions_export.pdf
test_cases.Expected Result: Exported PDF preserves underlining and either preserves grey/brown colors or provides alternative semantic indicators so the conventions remain interpretable in the exported document.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates export behavior for conventions in PDF; does not test every PDF reader or printer output variations.

test_cases.Title: AccessibilityColorBlind_XXX_ConvenzioniGrafiche_DocumentViewer_TEST_Computer_verify_alternate_indicators_for_color_blind_users

Steps.Step Description: Load 'conventions_sample.docx' in the Document Viewer and identify instances of greyed references and brown-colored base steps.
Steps.Expected Result: Greyed references and brown-colored base steps are visible in the Document Viewer.

Steps.Step Description: Enable a color-blind simulation mode in the browser or use a color blindness simulation tool to simulate common types (e.g., deuteranopia).
Steps.Expected Result: Viewer display is altered by the simulation tool to reflect the color-blind user experience.

Steps.Step Description: Re-evaluate whether the greyed references and brown-marked base steps remain distinguishable under the simulated color-blind conditions.
Steps.Expected Result: If color alone would make these indicators indistinguishable, the viewer provides alternate indicators (e.g., underline plus grey, icon, legend, or textual prefix) so that meaning is preserved for color-blind users.

Steps.Step Description: Use an accessibility checker (AXE or similar) against the document view and capture any accessibility violations related to reliance on color alone.
Steps.Expected Result: No critical accessibility violations remain; issues identified are documented and recommendations provided if color is used without alternate indicators.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application Document Viewer, Accessibility tools (e.g., AXE, Color Oracle)
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Accessibility tools or color-blind simulator available. 2) Document contains color-based conventions (grey and brown).
test_cases.Dataset: conventions_sample.docx; accessibility checker report saved as accessibility_report.json
test_cases.Expected Result: The viewer does not rely solely on color to convey the three conventions; alternate semantic indicators exist for color-blind users, and accessibility checker reports no severe failures for reliance on color.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Checks presence of alternate indicators for color-blind scenarios; does not perform full WCAG compliance audit.

test_cases.Title: VisualizzaListaSport_XXX_Visualizza lista Sport_App_TEST_Smartphone_Display all sports

Steps.Step Description: Install and open the Sports application on the smartphone. Ensure the user is logged in if the app requires authentication.
Steps.Expected Result: Application opens to the home screen without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Sport' or 'Lista Sport' section via the main menu or bottom navigation.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Lista Sport' screen is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the list of sports loaded on the screen.
Steps.Expected Result: A list of available sports is displayed; each item shows sport name and an optional icon/image.

Steps.Step Description: Tap on 3 different sports items sequentially to verify they are selectable and do not cause crashes.
Steps.Expected Result: Each tap highlights/opens the sport details (if applicable) or triggers expected navigation, and the app remains responsive.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) SportsApp v1.0 installed on device. 2) Network connection available (Wi-Fi or mobile data). 3) User logged in if required. 4) Backend service reachable and populated with at least 5 sports.
test_cases.Dataset: User account: test_user@example.com / password; Backend contains at least 5 sports: Football, Basketball, Tennis, Volleyball, Swimming.
test_cases.Expected Result: The app displays the list of sports correctly with name and icon; selecting items behaves as expected without crashes.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Does not verify full sport detail page content or deep-linking; focuses only on list display and basic item selection.

test_cases.Title: VisualizzaListaSport_XXX_Visualizza lista Sport_App_TEST_Smartphone_Empty list handling

Steps.Step Description: Prepare backend to return an empty sports list for the test user (or use a test account with no sports).
Steps.Expected Result: Backend is configured to return empty list (0 items) for the request.

Steps.Step Description: Open the Sports application and navigate to 'Lista Sport'.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Lista Sport' screen is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Observe how the app displays the empty state (no sports).
Steps.Expected Result: A clear empty state message is shown (e.g., 'No sports available') with an optional graphic and a retry or refresh action; no errors or crashes occur.

Steps.Step Description: Tap the 'Retry' or 'Refresh' button (if available).
Steps.Expected Result: App attempts to reload the list, and either remains in empty state if backend returns empty, or displays items if backend now returns data; no crashes.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test account configured to receive empty sports list. 2) Device network connected. 3) App installed and ready.
test_cases.Dataset: Backend returns JSON: {"sports": []}
test_cases.Expected Result: Empty state UX is shown with an informative message and an actionable retry option; no UI glitches.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Does not validate content of potential help links from empty state or analytic events.

test_cases.Title: VisualizzaListaSport_XXX_Visualizza lista Sport_App_TEST_Smartphone_Search and filter

Steps.Step Description: Ensure backend contains a diverse list of sports (e.g., Football, Fencing, Formula 1, Futsal, Basketball).
Steps.Expected Result: Backend has at least 10 sports with varied names.

Steps.Step Description: Open the app and navigate to 'Lista Sport'.
Steps.Expected Result: Sport list screen is visible with search box and filter controls (if applicable).

Steps.Step Description: Enter search term 'Fu' in the search field (case-insensitive partial match).
Steps.Expected Result: List is filtered live to show items containing 'Fu' (e.g., Futsal, Fencing if matched); items not matching are hidden.

Steps.Step Description: Clear search and open filter options to filter by category (if supported), e.g., 'Indoor' or 'Motor sports'.
Steps.Expected Result: Filter modal opens and selecting a category filters the list accordingly; applied filters are visible and removable.

Steps.Step Description: Combine search and filter (search 'For' and filter by 'Motor sports' if available).
Steps.Expected Result: Results reflect both search and filter constraints; no errors and counts update correctly.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) App installed. 2) Network available. 3) Backend populated with sports and category metadata for filtering.
test_cases.Dataset: Sports names include 'Futsal','Formula 1','Football','Fencing','Basketball'; categories assigned for filters.
test_cases.Expected Result: Search and filters work together; displayed list matches criteria and UI shows active filters; no stale results.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Does not cover backend search API performance or internationalization of search terms.

test_cases.Title: VisualizzaListaSport_XXX_Visualizza lista Sport_App_TEST_Smartphone_Sorting and ordering

Steps.Step Description: Ensure backend returns at least 8 sports with varied names and popularity metadata.
Steps.Expected Result: Backend contains sports with name and popularity fields.

Steps.Step Description: Open 'Lista Sport' in the app and locate sorting controls (e.g., Sort by Name, Sort by Popularity).
Steps.Expected Result: Sorting controls are visible on the list screen.

Steps.Step Description: Select 'Sort by Name (A-Z)'.
Steps.Expected Result: List is re-ordered alphabetically ascending by sport name.

Steps.Step Description: Select 'Sort by Name (Z-A)'.
Steps.Expected Result: List is re-ordered alphabetically descending.

Steps.Step Description: Select 'Sort by Popularity' (descending).
Steps.Expected Result: List is ordered by popularity metric with highest popularity first.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) App installed and logged in. 2) Backend provides popularity metric and name fields.
test_cases.Dataset: Sports with names: Aikido, Basketball, Cricket, Football, Rugby; popularity values: varied integers.
test_cases.Expected Result: Sorting options reorder the list correctly according to selected criteria with no UI glitches.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Does not include tests for combined multi-field sorting or locale-specific alphabetical ordering.

test_cases.Title: VisualizzaListaSport_XXX_Visualizza lista Sport_App_TEST_Smartphone_Pagination and infinite scroll

Steps.Step Description: Ensure backend is populated with a large number of sports (e.g., 120 items) to trigger pagination or infinite scroll.
Steps.Expected Result: Backend returns 120 sport items accessible via API.

Steps.Step Description: Open the app and navigate to 'Lista Sport'.
Steps.Expected Result: First page or initial chunk of the list (e.g., 20 items) is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Scroll down to the bottom of the list to trigger load of next page or next chunk (infinite scroll) until at least 3 loads have occurred.
Steps.Expected Result: New items are appended and visible; a loading indicator may appear while fetching; no duplicate items and no visual overlap.

Steps.Step Description: If pagination controls are present, tap 'Next' to navigate to the next page and then 'Previous' to return.
Steps.Expected Result: Pagination changes pages correctly and returns to the previous page without losing state or causing errors.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate slow network (throttle to 2G/slow 3G) and repeat scrolling to load additional pages.
Steps.Expected Result: Loading indicators are displayed; the app gracefully handles slow responses and displays items when data arrives; appropriate timeout/error message if backend fails.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) App installed. 2) Backend seeded with 120 sports. 3) Device supports network throttling or test lab can simulate slow networks.
test_cases.Dataset: 120 sport items returned in pages of 20 items per request.
test_cases.Expected Result: Pagination or infinite scroll loads additional items reliably; app remains responsive and handles slow network gracefully.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Does not validate deep-linking to a specific page index or server-side pagination offsets beyond basic behavior.

test_cases.Title: VisualizzaListaSport_XXX_Visualizza lista Sport_App_TEST_Smartphone_Performance with large dataset

Steps.Step Description: Prepare backend to return a large dataset of sports (e.g., 10,000 items) or simulate heavy load using test data.
Steps.Expected Result: Backend or test stub is ready to provide large dataset or simulate large response.

Steps.Step Description: Start a stopwatch and open the app, then navigate to 'Lista Sport'.
Steps.Expected Result: Stopwatch started at navigation action.

Steps.Step Description: Measure time from navigation to first meaningful paint of list items (time-to-first-item) and to full load of the initial chunk (e.g., 20 items).
Steps.Expected Result: Time-to-first-item is recorded and should be under the defined SLA (e.g., < 2s on 4G); initial chunk load within acceptable limit (e.g., < 4s).

Steps.Step Description: Perform scrolling through multiple chunks to verify UI responsiveness and measure frame drops or jank.
Steps.Expected Result: Scrolling stays smooth with acceptable frame rate; no long janks (>100ms) that degrade UX.

Steps.Step Description: Record memory usage of the app during list viewing for potential leaks or excessive consumption.
Steps.Expected Result: Memory usage remains within acceptable thresholds; no continuous growth indicative of leak.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Performance testing tools available. 2) Backend or stub able to return 10k items or simulate. 3) Device has profiling enabled.
test_cases.Dataset: 10,000 sport items dataset; profiling configuration.
test_cases.Expected Result: List rendering performance meets SLA for time-to-first-item and initial load; scrolling is smooth and memory within limits.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Does not include backend stress testing under concurrent user load beyond the client-side view performance.

test_cases.Title: AccessoSport_XXX_REQ_ANAGRAFICA_SPORT_TEST_Desktop_Verify_DGOJ_sports_list_for_Brand_Spain

Steps.Step Description: Open the Backoffice web application and navigate to the login page.
Steps.Expected Result: Login page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Log in using valid credentials for a user with access to Anagrafica and permissions to view Brand Spain (e.g., user: spain_viewer, password: ValidPass123).
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the Backoffice home/dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: From the main menu, navigate to 'Anagrafica' then select the 'Brand' selector and choose 'Spain'.
Steps.Expected Result: Brand selector shows 'Spain' as selected and Anagrafica context is set to Brand Spain.
