Steps.Step Description: Within Anagrafica for Brand Spain, click on the 'Sport' section/link.
Steps.Expected Result: The Sport section for Brand Spain is opened.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the Sport list displayed in the Sport section.
Steps.Expected Result: A list/table of DGOJ sports inserted for Brand Spain is displayed. Each row shows expected fields (e.g., Sport Name, DGOJ Code/ID, Status).

Steps.Step Description: Open details of one listed sport (click on a row or detail icon).
Steps.Expected Result: Sport detail view displays details including a DGOJ identifier/flag, name and status confirming it's a DGOJ sport for Brand Spain.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has network access to the TEST Backoffice environment. 2) A user account with read permissions to Anagrafica Brand Spain exists (credentials available). 3) At least one DGOJ sport is inserted for Brand Spain in the TEST environment.
test_cases.Dataset: User: spain_viewer / ValidPass123; Brand: Spain; Test environment contains >0 DGOJ sports for Brand Spain.
test_cases.Expected Result: Authenticated user can access Anagrafica -> Sport for Brand Spain and view the list of DGOJ sports with correct details and ability to open sport details.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers viewing the list and opening details of DGOJ sports for Brand Spain. Creation/edit/deletion of sports and performance/pagination edge cases not covered.

test_cases.Title: AccessoSport_XXX_REQ_ANAGRAFICA_SPORT_TEST_Desktop_Verify_empty_state_when_no_DGOJ_sports_present

Steps.Step Description: Open the Backoffice web application and log in with a valid user having access to Anagrafica Brand Spain.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and lands on the Backoffice dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Set the Brand selector to 'Spain' within Anagrafica context.
Steps.Expected Result: Brand Spain is selected.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Sport' section for Brand Spain.
Steps.Expected Result: Sport section for Brand Spain opens.

Steps.Step Description: If the TEST environment has zero DGOJ sports for Brand Spain, observe the list area; if not, temporarily remove/filter out sports to simulate zero results (use a test filter or request admin to toggle visibility).
Steps.Expected Result: An appropriate empty state is displayed (e.g., 'No sports found' message), with guidance or action button if applicable (e.g., 'Create Sport' disabled for viewers). No erroneous rows are shown.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has credentials with read access to Anagrafica Brand Spain. 2) The TEST environment must be in a state where no DGOJ sports exist for Brand Spain (or a safe filter to simulate zero results).
test_cases.Dataset: User: spain_viewer_empty / ValidPass123; Brand: Spain; Dataset with zero DGOJ sports.
test_cases.Expected Result: When no DGOJ sports are present for Brand Spain, the Sport section shows a clear empty state message and no data rows.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates UI empty-state behavior only; creation or permission behavior not covered.

test_cases.Title: AccessoSport_XXX_REQ_ANAGRAFICA_SPORT_TEST_Desktop_Unauthenticated_user_blocked_from_Sport_section

Steps.Step Description: Open the Backoffice web application without logging in (e.g., new private browser session).
Steps.Expected Result: Login page is displayed (user is not authenticated).

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to directly open the Sport section URL for Brand Spain (paste known Sport section URL for Brand Spain into browser address bar) without authentication.
Steps.Expected Result: System redirects to the login page or shows an access denied message. No sports data is exposed.

Steps.Step Description: After being redirected to login, attempt to use browser back navigation or API endpoint to fetch sports list without valid authentication token.
Steps.Expected Result: Access remains denied; API returns 401/403 and UI does not render the sports list.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester must not be authenticated in the Backoffice session. 2) Knowledge of the Sport section URL for Brand Spain or ability to attempt direct API calls.
test_cases.Dataset: No credentials (unauthenticated session); Sport section URL or API endpoint.
test_cases.Expected Result: Unauthenticated users cannot access the Anagrafica Sport section for Brand Spain; system redirects to login or returns proper authorization error without exposing data.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers unauthenticated access and API authorization behavior; does not cover misconfigured SSO flows or token expiry nuances.

test_cases.Title: BrandSelectionSpain_XXX_REQ_ANAGRAFICA_SPORT_TEST_Desktop_Verify_only_Spain_DGOJ_sports_displayed_when_Spain_selected

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Backoffice as a user with rights to view multiple brands (e.g., user: multi_brand_viewer / ValidPass123).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated successfully and can access brand selector.

Steps.Step Description: From Anagrafica, set the Brand selector to 'Spain'.
Steps.Expected Result: Brand selection updates to Spain and context is applied.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Sport section and list all displayed sports. Record identifiers/names of the displayed sports.
Steps.Expected Result: List displays sports associated with Brand Spain only.

Steps.Step Description: Change the Brand selector to a different brand (e.g., Portugal) and navigate again to Sport section; record the list and compare with Spain list.
Steps.Expected Result: The list for the other brand differs and does not include Spain-only DGOJ sports. Spain-specific sports are not visible when another brand is selected.

Steps.Step Description: Switch back to Brand Spain and verify the previously recorded Spain sports reappear.
Steps.Expected Result: Upon selecting Spain again, the Spain DGOJ sports list is restored and consistent with prior observation.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has multi-brand view permissions. 2) TEST environment contains distinct sports for Spain and at least one other brand to compare.
test_cases.Functionality: Anagrafica - Brand Filtering and Sport Listing
test_cases.Dataset: User: multi_brand_viewer / ValidPass123; Brand data: Spain sports list and other brand(s) sports list in TEST environment.
test_cases.Expected Result: Selecting Brand Spain in Anagrafica shows only the DGOJ sports inserted for Spain; switching brands updates the sport list accordingly and isolates brand-specific data.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates brand-scoped listing of sports; does not test bulk sync, cross-brand permissions, or deep data integrity between environments.

test_cases.Title: View_Anagrafica_XXX_Attore_UtenteAnagrafica_TEST_Desktop_Verify viewing user profile

Steps.Step Description: Open the application and log in with valid backoffice user credentials (role: USER_VIEW).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and main dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to 'Anagrafica' (User Registry) section from main menu.
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica listing page is displayed with list of users and search/filter controls.

Steps.Step Description: Search for an existing user by surname or email (use dataset: surname='Rossi', email='m.rossi@example.com') and select the user from results.
Steps.Expected Result: Matching user record is displayed in the list and selection opens user detail view.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect the user detail view fields: name, surname, date of birth, fiscal code, address, email, phone and roles.
Steps.Expected Result: All expected fields are present and populated with correct data consistent with dataset.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to click 'Edit' button and observe whether fields are editable for this role.
Steps.Expected Result: For role USER_VIEW, the 'Edit' action is either disabled or leads to read-only view. No edit is allowed.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test environment up and reachable. 2) Backoffice user account with USER_VIEW role exists. 3) Test dataset user (m.rossi@example.com) exists in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: User: Name='Marco', Surname='Rossi', Email='m.rossi@example.com', DOB='1985-06-15', FiscalCode='RSSMRC85H15H501U'
test_cases.Expected Result: Authorized user can view full personal record in Anagrafica. No edit allowed for view-only role.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI display and role-based view access; does not cover API responses or downstream integrations.

test_cases.Title: Create_Anagrafica_XXX_Attore_UtenteAnagrafica_TEST_Desktop_Create new user with valid data

Steps.Step Description: Log in with a backoffice user having create permission (role: USER_ADMIN).
Steps.Expected Result: User logged in and navigation menu available including 'Anagrafica > New User'.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to 'Anagrafica' and click 'New User' or equivalent button to open the creation form.
Steps.Expected Result: User creation form is displayed with empty required fields and validation hints.

Steps.Step Description: Populate the form with valid data: Name='Giulia', Surname='Bianchi', DOB='1990-03-22', FiscalCode='BNCGUL90C62H501B', Email='g.bianchi+test@example.com', Phone='+39061234567', Address='Via Roma 10, Milano'.
Steps.Expected Result: All input fields accept data and inline validations (if any) show no errors.

Steps.Step Description: Submit the creation form by clicking 'Save' or 'Create'.
Steps.Expected Result: System processes request and shows success notification (e.g., 'User created successfully') and new user appears in the listing.

Steps.Step Description: Open the newly created user record and verify persisted values match submitted data.
Steps.Expected Result: User details page shows all fields with values equal to the input dataset and system-assigned identifiers (e.g., User ID).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Backoffice account with USER_ADMIN role exists. 2) No existing user with the same fiscal code and email in the test tenant.
test_cases.Dataset: Name='Giulia', Surname='Bianchi', DOB='1990-03-22', FiscalCode='BNCGUL90C62H501B', Email='g.bianchi+test@example.com', Phone='+39061234567', Address='Via Roma 10, Milano'
test_cases.Expected Result: New user record is created and persisted with all provided data; confirmation message displayed.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers creation form and persistence; does not cover duplicate handling or external verification (e.g., email delivery).

test_cases.Title: CreateInvalid_Anagrafica_XXX_Attore_UtenteAnagrafica_TEST_Desktop_Validate missing and invalid inputs

Steps.Step Description: Log in with a backoffice user having create permission (role: USER_ADMIN).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and can access Anagrafica creation form.

Steps.Step Description: Open the 'New User' creation form.
Steps.Expected Result: Creation form is displayed with required field indicators.

Steps.Step Description: Leave required fields empty (Name blank, Surname blank, FiscalCode blank) and enter invalid email 'invalid-email' and invalid phone 'ABC123'.
Steps.Expected Result: Client-side inline validations highlight required fields and invalid formats where applicable.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to submit the form with the invalid/missing data.
Steps.Expected Result: Form submission is blocked; server returns validation errors; UI displays clear error messages mapping to each invalid/missing field.

Steps.Step Description: Correct the fields one by one (enter Name and Surname, correct email to 'test.invalid@example.com', enter phone '+39069998877', set FiscalCode to an invalid length like 'ABC'), and attempt submission.
Steps.Expected Result: Only valid fields are accepted; FiscalCode invalid length is rejected with a specific error message; submission blocked until all required validations pass.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Backoffice account with permission to attempt create. 2) Validation rules defined: required fields, email format, phone numeric+prefix, fiscal code length & pattern.
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid inputs example: Name='', Surname='', Email='invalid-email', Phone='ABC123', FiscalCode='ABC'
test_cases.Expected Result: System enforces required and format validations, prevents creation, and displays user-friendly error messages.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client/server validation flow; does not cover localization of error messages.

test_cases.Title: Update_Anagrafica_XXX_Attore_UtenteAnagrafica_TEST_Desktop_Edit existing user details

Steps.Step Description: Log in with a backoffice user with edit permission (role: USER_EDITOR).
Steps.Expected Result: User authenticated and navigation to Anagrafica allowed.

Steps.Step Description: Search and open an existing user record (use dataset: Email='g.bianchi+test@example.com').
Steps.Expected Result: User detail page is loaded showing current values.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Edit', change phone from '+39061234567' to '+39069876543' and update address field, then click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: System validates changes and returns success message; detail view reflects updated phone and address.

Steps.Step Description: Refresh the record from listing and verify persisted changes remain after page reload.
Steps.Expected Result: Reloaded record shows the updated phone and address, confirming persistence.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to change fiscal code to a value already present in another user to test unique constraint (set FiscalCode to an existing user's fiscal code).
Steps.Expected Result: System rejects the change and shows an error indicating fiscal code must be unique; original value remains unchanged.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) USER_EDITOR account available. 2) Target user exists (g.bianchi+test@example.com). 3) Another user exists with fiscal code to test uniqueness.
test_cases.Dataset: Existing user Email='g.bianchi+test@example.com'; NewPhone='+39069876543'; DuplicateFiscalCode='BNCDUP90X02H501Y'
test_cases.Expected Result: Edits to non-unique fields succeed; changes persist. Attempts to set unique-key collisions are blocked with clear error messages.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers edit flows and uniqueness enforcement; does not cover audit trail or history reconciliation.

test_cases.Title: Delete_Anagrafica_XXX_Attore_UtenteAnagrafica_TEST_Desktop_Delete user and verify soft-delete behavior

Steps.Step Description: Log in using a backoffice user with delete permission (role: USER_ADMIN).
Steps.Expected Result: User authenticated and can navigate to Anagrafica.

Steps.Step Description: Locate a test user created for deletion (e.g., Email='delete.me+test@example.com').
Steps.Expected Result: Test user is present in the listing and selectable.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Delete' for the selected user and confirm the deletion in the confirmation dialog.
Steps.Expected Result: System prompts confirmation. After confirmation, system shows success message and user is no longer visible in default listing.

Steps.Step Description: Search for the deleted user using filter 'Include Inactive/Deleted' or access 'Trash/Deleted' view if available.
Steps.Expected Result: Deleted user appears in the deleted/trash view if soft-delete is implemented, with status 'Deleted' or 'Inactive'.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to log in as the deleted user or use the user's email to trigger invitation/resend flows.
Steps.Expected Result: Deleted/inactive users cannot authenticate; invitation/resend flows should be blocked or indicate user is inactive.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) USER_ADMIN account present. 2) Test user 'delete.me+test@example.com' exists. 3) System supports soft-delete or hard-delete (tester must know expected behavior).
test_cases.Dataset: User to delete: Email='delete.me+test@example.com', Name='Delete', Surname='Me'
test_cases.Expected Result: User deletion flow completes successfully; deleted users are removed from active listing and behave as inactive according to system design.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers delete UI and inactive listing; does not cover permanent data purge or backup restore.

test_cases.Title: Permission_Anagrafica_XXX_Attore_UtenteAnagrafica_TEST_Desktop_Validate role-based access restrictions

Steps.Step Description: Log in with a user account that has minimal privileges (role: USER_LIMITED) which should not allow create/edit/delete operations.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and can access only allowed sections per role policy.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Anagrafica listing and attempt to click 'New User'.
Steps.Expected Result: 'New User' button is either not visible or disabled for USER_LIMITED role.

Steps.Step Description: Select an existing user and attempt to click 'Edit' or 'Delete'.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Edit' and 'Delete' controls are not available or actions are blocked; if attempted, system returns 'Access Denied' or appropriate authorization error.

Steps.Step Description: Directly access the creation/edit/delete endpoints (if tester has URL/API access) by entering the URL or invoking API with this user's token.
Steps.Expected Result: Server responds with 403 Forbidden or equivalent; no changes are made to the data.

Steps.Step Description: Log out and log in as an admin (USER_ADMIN) to verify that the restricted operations are available for admin users.
Steps.Expected Result: Admin user can perform create/edit/delete operations confirming role-based restriction is enforced.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) USER_LIMITED and USER_ADMIN accounts exist. 2) Authorization rules defined in system (RBAC). 3) Testers have ability to attempt direct URL/API calls for authorization verification.
test_cases.Dataset: USER_LIMITED credentials, USER_ADMIN credentials, target user in listing
test_cases.Expected Result: RBAC enforced: limited users cannot perform restricted actions; admin can. Direct endpoint access is forbidden for insufficient privileges.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers role-based UI and API access restrictions; does not cover detailed permission matrix for every role variant.

test_cases.Title: Create_Anagrafica_Record_XXX_REQ-ANAG-001_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_create a new anagrafica record

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application with a user account that has Anagrafica create permissions.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and the application main dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Anagrafica' module from the main menu.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Anagrafica' list view is displayed with existing records (if any) and a 'New' or 'Crea' button is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'New' / 'Crea' button to open the new record form.
Steps.Expected Result: A new record form is displayed with input fields for required attributes (e.g., Nome, Cognome, Codice Fiscale/ID, Data di Nascita, Indirizzo).

Steps.Step Description: Populate the form with valid test data: Nome='Mario', Cognome='Rossi', CodiceFiscale='RSSMRA80A01H501U', DataNascita='1980-01-01', Indirizzo='Via Roma 1'.
Steps.Expected Result: All fields accept the input and no inline validation errors are shown.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' or 'Salva' to persist the new anagrafica record.
Steps.Expected Result: System confirms successful creation (toast/message) and the new record appears in the Anagrafica list with the provided details.

Steps.Step Description: Open the created record from the list and verify stored values match the input data.
Steps.Expected Result: Record details page shows Nome='Mario', Cognome='Rossi', CodiceFiscale='RSSMRA80A01H501U', DataNascita='1980-01-01', Indirizzo='Via Roma 1'.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user account exists with create permission on Anagrafica. 2) Test environment reachable. 3) No pre-existing record with CodiceFiscale 'RSSMRA80A01H501U'.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; example new record data: {Nome:'Mario', Cognome:'Rossi', CodiceFiscale:'RSSMRA80A01H501U', DataNascita:'1980-01-01', Indirizzo:'Via Roma 1'}
test_cases.Expected Result: New anagrafica record is created successfully and persisted with exact provided values.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers creation of a standard anagrafica record; attachments, advanced fields, and integrations not covered.

test_cases.Title: Prevent_Duplicate_Anagrafica_XXX_REQ-ANAG-002_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_duplicate record prevention

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application with a user having create permission.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and can access Anagrafica module.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Anagrafica and open the 'New' form.
Steps.Expected Result: New record form is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Enter data where the unique identifier matches an existing record (e.g., CodiceFiscale='RSSMRA80A01H501U' which exists). Fill other mandatory fields with valid values.
Steps.Expected Result: Form accepts inputs but system recognizes duplicate on save attempt.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' to attempt to create the duplicate record.
Steps.Expected Result: System blocks creation and displays a clear validation error indicating duplicate unique identifier (e.g., 'Codice Fiscale già presente'). No new record is created.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the existing record remains unchanged after the failed create attempt.
Steps.Expected Result: Existing record data is unchanged and no additional records with the same identifier exist in the list.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) An existing Anagrafica record with CodiceFiscale 'RSSMRA80A01H501U' is present. 2) Test user has create permission.
test_cases.Dataset: Existing record CodiceFiscale 'RSSMRA80A01H501U'; new record attempt uses same codice fiscale.
test_cases.Expected Result: System prevents duplicate creation and displays an appropriate error; database remains with single record for the identifier.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers prevention of duplicates based on primary unique field (CodiceFiscale/ID). Other unique constraints not covered.

test_cases.Title: Update_Anagrafica_Record_XXX_REQ-ANAG-003_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_update existing anagrafica

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application with a user that has edit permission.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and Anagrafica module accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Locate an existing anagrafica record using search or from the list (e.g., record with CodiceFiscale='RSSMRA80A01H501U').
Steps.Expected Result: The target record is found and displayed in the list.

Steps.Step Description: Open the record in edit mode (click 'Edit'/'Modifica').
Steps.Expected Result: Edit form loads populated with the record's current values.

Steps.Step Description: Modify a field value (e.g., change Indirizzo to 'Via Milano 10') and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Save completes successfully and confirmation message is shown.

Steps.Step Description: Re-open the record details or refresh the list and verify the updated value is persisted.
Steps.Expected Result: Indirizzo is 'Via Milano 10' for the record with CodiceFiscale='RSSMRA80A01H501U'.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) An existing record with CodiceFiscale 'RSSMRA80A01H501U' exists. 2) Test user has edit permission.
test_cases.Dataset: Existing record identifier 'RSSMRA80A01H501U'; updated address 'Via Milano 10'.
test_cases.Expected Result: Record updated successfully and new values are persisted and displayed in the UI.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers basic field update scenario; concurrency and audit/versioning checks not included.

test_cases.Title: Delete_Anagrafica_With_Dependencies_XXX_REQ-ANAG-004_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_delete blocked when referenced

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application with delete permission for Anagrafica.
Steps.Expected Result: User logged in and can access Anagrafica module.

Steps.Step Description: Identify an anagrafica record that is referenced by another module (e.g., linked transaction or order).
Steps.Expected Result: Record with known dependencies is identified.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to delete the referenced record by clicking 'Delete'/'Elimina' and confirm the delete action.
Steps.Expected Result: System prevents deletion and shows a clear message indicating existing dependencies preventing deletion (e.g., 'Impossibile eliminare: record referenziato da altre entità').

Steps.Step Description: Identify an anagrafica record without dependencies and attempt deletion, confirming when prompted.
Steps.Expected Result: System successfully deletes the record and shows a success confirmation; record no longer appears in the list.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) There is at least one anagrafica record with external dependencies and one without. 2) Test user has delete permission.
test_cases.Dataset: IDs of referenced and non-referenced records; example referenced id 'RF-1001', non-referenced id 'NR-2002'.
test_cases.Expected Result: Deletion is blocked for records with dependencies and allowed for records without dependencies; appropriate messages displayed.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers deletion behavior with/without dependencies; cascade delete policies and soft-delete retention not covered.

test_cases.Title: Search_Filter_Anagrafica_XXX_REQ-ANAG-005_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_search and filter records

Steps.Step Description: Login and navigate to Anagrafica list view.
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica list view is visible with search and filter controls.

Steps.Step Description: Use the search box to search by Cognome='Rossi' and trigger the search.
Steps.Expected Result: List updates to show only records where Cognome matches 'Rossi'.

Steps.Step Description: Apply additional filters: set DataNascita range from '1970-01-01' to '1990-12-31' and filter by city 'Roma', then apply.
Steps.Expected Result: List shows only records matching all applied criteria (Cognome='Rossi', DataNascita in range, city='Roma').

Steps.Step Description: Clear filters and perform a search using a non-existent value (e.g., Cognome='NonEsistente').
Steps.Expected Result: System displays empty state or 'no results' message and does not crash.

Steps.Step Description: Sort the result set by Nome ascending and verify order.
Steps.Expected Result: Records are ordered by Nome in ascending alphabetical order.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Multiple anagrafica test records with varied Cognome, DataNascita and city values exist. 2) User has view permission.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample dataset with at least 10 records covering various names, dates and cities; search terms 'Rossi', date range '1970-01-01' to '1990-12-31', city 'Roma'.
test_cases.Expected Result: Search and filters return accurate, consistent results; sorting works; system handles no-results gracefully.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers basic search, filter and sort; advanced full-text search and performance under large dataset not covered.

test_cases.Title: Field_Validation_Boundary_Anagrafica_XXX_REQ-ANAG-006_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_field validation and boundary checks

Steps.Step Description: Login and open a new Anagrafica form.
Steps.Expected Result: New record form is displayed with validation indicators for required fields.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to save the form with mandatory fields left empty (e.g., Nome empty, Cognome empty, CodiceFiscale empty).
Steps.Expected Result: System displays validation messages for each required field and prevents save.

Steps.Step Description: Enter an invalid format for CodiceFiscale (e.g., 'INVALID123') and attempt to save.
Steps.Expected Result: Inline validation message shown specifying invalid format and save is blocked.

Steps.Step Description: Enter maximum length values for text fields (e.g., Nome 255 chars, Cognome 255 chars) and attempt to save.
Steps.Expected Result: If field limits allow, save succeeds and values are stored truncated/fully as per spec; if limits exceeded, validation error is shown. (Tester should verify expected behavior against system specification.)

Steps.Step Description: Enter special characters and whitespace-only values for fields and attempt to save.
Steps.Expected Result: System either sanitizes inputs or shows validation errors; whitespace-only mandatory fields rejected.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User with create permission. 2) Validation rules specification available (to compare expected behavior for boundary cases).
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid CodiceFiscale samples e.g., 'INVALID123'; long string samples for boundary testing (255+ chars).
test_cases.Expected Result: Mandatory fields are enforced; format and length validations behave according to spec and prevent invalid data from being stored.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers mandatory, format and length validations; internationalization and locale-specific validation not covered.

test_cases.Title: NavigateBrandSpain_XXX_Precondizioni_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_verify navigation to Spain brand records

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the tester is logged into the Backoffice application with a user account that has the 'Brand Spain' navigation permission.
Steps.Expected Result: Tester is logged in and user profile shows permission to navigate Brand Spain in Anagrafica.

Steps.Step Description: From the main menu, navigate to 'Anagrafica' (Registry) section.
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica page loads successfully and displays brand selection controls (e.g., dropdown or tabs).

Steps.Step Description: Select 'Brand: Spain' from the brand selector.
Steps.Expected Result: Brand selector accepts Spain selection and the UI updates to show records filtered for Brand Spain.

Steps.Step Description: Open a record from the Brand Spain list (click on a record entry).
Steps.Expected Result: Selected record details for Brand Spain are displayed in the detail view without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Use the search/filter within Anagrafica while Brand Spain is selected (search by name or ID known to exist in Spain brand).
Steps.Expected Result: Search returns only records belonging to Brand Spain and results are consistent with expected dataset.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. The Actor is correctly logged into the application. B. The Actor is enabled to navigate within the Brand Spain of the Anagrafica.
test_cases.Dataset: User: spain_user_test (role includes Brand Spain navigation); Sample Spain record: ES-1001 (name: 'Cliente ES Test')
test_cases.Expected Result: A user with Brand Spain navigation enabled can select Brand Spain and view/search Spain-specific records in Anagrafica without errors.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI navigation and read-only viewing/searching of Brand Spain records; does not cover create/update/delete operations or audit logs.

test_cases.Title: AccessDenied_NoBrandPermission_XXX_Precondizioni_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_verify access denied when not enabled for Spain

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Backoffice application with a user account that does NOT have 'Brand Spain' navigation permission but is otherwise active.
Steps.Expected Result: Tester is logged in successfully and user profile shows absence of Brand Spain navigation permission.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Anagrafica' section from the main menu.
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica page loads and brand selection controls are visible (brands accessible to the user are shown).

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to select 'Brand: Spain' from the brand selector (if Spain is not visible, attempt to construct the Spain-specific URL or use any UI element that would switch to Spain).
Steps.Expected Result: System prevents selection of Brand Spain: either Spain is not present in brand list, selection is disabled, or the system displays an access denied message when attempting to switch to Spain.

Steps.Step Description: If an access denied message is shown, note the message text and system behavior (no records shown, redirect, or error dialog).
Steps.Expected Result: An explicit and user-friendly access denied message is displayed (e.g., 'You do not have permission to access Brand Spain'), and no Brand Spain records are displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. The Actor is correctly logged into the application. B. The Actor is NOT enabled to navigate within the Brand Spain of the Anagrafica.
test_cases.Dataset: User: non_spain_user_test (role excludes Brand Spain navigation)
test_cases.Expected Result: Users without Brand Spain navigation permission cannot access or view Brand Spain data; the UI prevents selection and displays an appropriate access denied response.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Verifies UI-level authorization and messaging for missing Brand Spain permission; backend audit and log entries not verified here.

test_cases.Title: UnauthenticatedAccess_XXX_Precondizioni_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_verify redirect to login when not logged

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the browser session is cleared of authentication cookies / tokens (user is NOT logged in).
Steps.Expected Result: No active session exists; accessing protected Backoffice pages will require authentication.

Steps.Step Description: Directly access the Anagrafica URL or the Brand Spain Anagrafica URL (/anagrafica/brand/spain) in the browser address bar.
Steps.Expected Result: System does not show Anagrafica content and redirects the user to the login page or displays a login required screen/modal.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to interact with page elements (if any visible) before logging in.
Steps.Expected Result: Interactions are blocked; any action triggers a prompt to log in or is prevented by the application.

Steps.Step Description: Log in using valid credentials that have Brand Spain navigation permission and repeat accessing the same URL.
Steps.Expected Result: After login, the user is redirected to Anagrafica or the requested resource and can access Brand Spain if permitted.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. The Actor is NOT logged into the application. (Precondition A violated intentionally to test unauthenticated behavior.)
test_cases.Dataset: Anonymous session; valid user: spain_user_test (for step 4)
test_cases.Expected Result: Unauthenticated users are redirected to login when attempting to access Anagrafica or Brand Spain resources; upon successful login with appropriate permissions, access is granted.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers redirect-to-login behavior and post-login access; session timeout and multi-tab session edge cases not covered.

test_cases.Title: CrossBrandAccess_XXX_Precondizioni_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_verify user enabled for Spain cannot access other brands without permission

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Backoffice application with a user account that is enabled for Brand Spain only (no permissions for Brand Portugal or Brand France).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and their profile indicates permission limited to Brand Spain.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Anagrafica and attempt to select another brand (e.g., Brand Portugal) from the brand selector.
Steps.Expected Result: Selection of Brand Portugal is disabled or not present; the system should prevent switching to brands for which the user lacks permission.

Steps.Step Description: If Brand Portugal can be selected due to UI bug, attempt to view records or open a record belonging to Brand Portugal.
Steps.Expected Result: System blocks access and displays an access denied message, or returns an empty list/403 response indicating lack of permission.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the user can continue to access Brand Spain records without interruption.
Steps.Expected Result: Brand Spain access remains functional and unaffected by attempts to access other brands.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. The Actor is correctly logged into the application. B. The Actor is enabled to navigate within the Brand Spain of the Anagrafica and NOT enabled for other brands.
test_cases.Dataset: User: spain_only_user_test; Other brand sample records: PT-2001, FR-3001 (should be inaccessible)
test_cases.Expected Result: A user permitted for Brand Spain only cannot access records of other brands; Brand Spain functionality remains available and correct.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates cross-brand access restrictions at the UI level; does not include API-level permission verification or admin permission management flows.

test_cases.Title: PercorsoBase_XXX_REQ-SportList_WebApp_TEST_Computer_verify grid columns and mandatory fields

Steps.Step Description: Open browser and navigate to the Brand Spain homepage URL (e.g., https://brand-spain.example.com).
Steps.Expected Result: Brand Spain homepage is loaded and visible; page header shows brand logo and navigation.

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the user is authenticated with a valid account or access the public homepage if authentication is not required.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in (if required) and homepage shows sections including 'Sport' in the central area and left menu.

Steps.Step Description: From the central area of the homepage, click the 'Sport' section tile or link.
Steps.Expected Result: The application navigates to the Sports page; URL and page title indicate 'Sports'.

Steps.Step Description: On the Sports page, locate the grid/list view that presents the sports list.
Steps.Expected Result: Grid/list view is present and visible on the Sports page.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the grid contains the following columns: DGOJ Code, DGOJ Description, Type, Associazione BM, Visibilità.
Steps.Expected Result: All five columns (DGOJ Code, DGOJ Description, Type, Associazione BM, Visibilità) are present and labeled as expected.

Steps.Step Description: For each row in the grid, inspect the values in DGOJ Code and DGOJ Description columns.
Steps.Expected Result: DGOJ Code and DGOJ Description fields are not empty for every row (mandatory fields populated).

Steps.Step Description: For each row, inspect the Type column value.
Steps.Expected Result: Type value is present and must be either 'ADC' or 'AOC' for every row.

Steps.Step Description: For each row, inspect the Visibilità column value.
Steps.Expected Result: Visibilità field is present and not empty for every row (mandatory field populated).

Steps.Step Description: Scroll or paginate through the grid to inspect multiple rows (if pagination exists, navigate to next pages).
Steps.Expected Result: Mandatory columns remain present and populated on all pages; no blank mandatory fields encountered.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has valid credentials (if required). 2) Test environment reachable at given Brand Spain homepage URL. 3) Tester has access rights to view Sports section.
test_cases.Dataset: Homepage URL: https://brand-spain.example.com; Valid user credentials (if required): user@test.com / Password123
test_cases.Expected Result: User can navigate to Sports page and the grid shows columns DGOJ Code, DGOJ Description, Type (ADC/AOC), Associazione BM, Visibilità; mandatory fields (DGOJ Code, DGOJ Description, Type, Visibilità) are populated for all rows.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers presence and basic validation of columns and mandatory non-empty values; data correctness beyond ADC/AOC and BM association content not validated.

test_cases.Title: PercorsoBase_XXX_REQ-SportList_WebApp_TEST_Computer_select Sport from left menu_navigation verification

Steps.Step Description: Open browser and navigate to the Brand Spain homepage.
Steps.Expected Result: Homepage is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Locate the left navigation menu and find the 'Sport' entry.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Sport' item is present in the left menu navigation.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Sport' entry in the left menu.
Steps.Expected Result: Application navigates to the Sports page; URL and page title indicate 'Sports'.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the Sports page grid is displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: Grid/list view of sports is visible on the page.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm that the required columns (DGOJ Code, DGOJ Description, Type, Associazione BM, Visibilità) are present.
Steps.Expected Result: All required columns are present and visible in the grid.

test_cases.Preconditions: Homepage accessible; tester logged in if required.
test_cases.Dataset: Homepage URL and valid user credentials if needed.
test_cases.Expected Result: Selecting 'Sport' from the left menu lands the user on the Sports page and displays the sports grid with required columns.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates navigation from left menu only; does not validate content of each grid row.

test_cases.Title: PercorsoBase_XXX_REQ-SportList_WebApp_TEST_Computer_type column accepts only ADC or AOC

Steps.Step Description: Open Brand Spain homepage and navigate to the Sports page (via central tile or left menu).
Steps.Expected Result: Sports page and grid are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect the 'Type' column values for all visible rows in the grid.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Type' values are visible for each row.

Steps.Step Description: For each row, verify that the value in 'Type' is either 'ADC' or 'AOC' (case-sensitive if UI enforces case).
Steps.Expected Result: Every 'Type' value equals 'ADC' or 'AOC'. Any other value is reported as a defect.

Steps.Step Description: If the grid supports pagination or filtering, navigate through all pages or apply filters to inspect additional rows.
Steps.Expected Result: All inspected rows across pages/filters comply with ADC/AOC constraint.

test_cases.Preconditions: Access to Sports page and ability to view all rows (or paginate).
test_cases.Dataset: N/A (live grid data); if using test dataset, ensure some rows contain ADC and some AOC.
test_cases.Expected Result: All Type column values are either 'ADC' or 'AOC'. Any deviation should be flagged as non-compliant with requirement.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only allowed values for Type field; does not validate source data generation or backend constraints.

test_cases.Title: PercorsoBase_XXX_REQ-SportList_WebApp_TEST_Computer_mandatory fields not empty detection

Steps.Step Description: Open the Sports page on Brand Spain site.
Steps.Expected Result: Sports grid is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Identify mandatory columns: DGOJ Code, DGOJ Description, Type, Visibilità.
Steps.Expected Result: Mandatory columns are visible and correctly labeled.

Steps.Step Description: Scan the grid rows and detect any row where one or more mandatory columns are empty or show placeholder like '-' or 'null'.
Steps.Expected Result: No rows should have empty or null values in any mandatory column. If any are found, record them as defects with row identifier.

Steps.Step Description: If backend access available, cross-check a sample row's mandatory values via API or admin panel to determine whether data is missing at source.
Steps.Expected Result: Sample verification confirms whether the empty value is a UI rendering issue or missing data at source; document findings.

test_cases.Preconditions: Access to Sports page and, for step 4, access to backend/API credentials if available.
test_cases.Dataset: List of sample row identifiers to cross-check via API (if available).
test_cases.Expected Result: Mandatory fields are never empty in the UI; if empty values exist they are reproducible and logged as defects with evidence.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Detects missing mandatory data in UI and optionally correlates to backend; does not fix source data.

test_cases.Title: PercorsoBase_XXX_REQ-SportList_WebApp_TEST_Computer_associazione BM and visibilità column presence

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Brand Spain Sports page and display the sports grid.
Steps.Expected Result: Sports grid is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the column 'Associazione BM' exists and is visible in the grid header.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Associazione BM' column header is present.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect several rows to see the content of 'Associazione BM' (may be empty or populated depending on data).
Steps.Expected Result: 'Associazione BM' column is displayed for each row; if values are present, they are rendered correctly; empties are allowed per requirement (field optional).

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the 'Visibilità' column exists and contains a value for each row (mandatory).
Steps.Expected Result: Visibilità column is present and each row shows a non-empty visibility value.

test_cases.Preconditions: Sports page reachable and grid populated.
test_cases.Dataset: N/A (use production-like test data).
test_cases.Expected Result: Associazione BM column is present (optional content allowed) and Visibilità column is present with non-empty content for each row.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Verifies presence and basic content of BM association and visibility columns; does not validate permitted visibility values or semantics.

test_cases.Title: NonRaggiungibilitaSport_XXX_REQ_NonRaggiungibilita_Sport_Brand_Spain_TEST_Smartphone_verify_errorpage_offline

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the test device (Smartphone) has the Brand Spain app installed and user is logged in. Set the app's active Brand to 'Spain'.
Steps.Expected Result: App is installed, user is logged in, and the active Brand is Spain.

Steps.Step Description: Disable all network connectivity on the Smartphone (Airplane Mode ON or Wi-Fi and Mobile Data OFF).
Steps.Expected Result: Device has no network connectivity.

Steps.Step Description: Open the Brand Spain app and attempt to navigate to the 'Sport' section from the main menu or the dedicated navigation element.
Steps.Expected Result: App attempts to load the Sport section but cannot retrieve the list due to lack of connectivity; the app displays the error page.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the error page content and layout match the 'as is' error page used in production for other Brands: check presence of standard error title, explanatory message, a retry action/button, and optional support/contact link or info.
Steps.Expected Result: Error page displays the expected standard elements (error title, message, retry button, support link) and layout consistent with other Brands' production error page.

Steps.Step Description: Tap the 'Retry' button on the error page while the device is still offline.
Steps.Expected Result: Retry should not succeed and the same error page remains visible or a brief indication of retry attempt is shown followed by the error page.

Steps.Step Description: Re-enable network connectivity and tap 'Retry' again.
Steps.Expected Result: The Sport section successfully loads the list of sports for Brand Spain or the app handles new connectivity and transitions to the Sport list screen.

Steps.Step Description: Conclude scenario and return to Home screen.
Steps.Expected Result: Use case terminates; app is stable and returns to Home or Sport list as expected.

test_cases.Reference System: Android 11/12/13, Brand Spain Mobile App (Test environment)
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester account exists and is logged in. 2) Brand set to Spain. 3) Tester has access to device settings to toggle network. 4) Test environment configured to match production error page layout.
test_cases.Dataset: User: test_spain_user@example.com / Password: Test1234; App build: SpainApp vX.Y (TEST); Device: Pixel 5 (Android 12)
test_cases.Expected Result: When the Sport section is unreachable due to no network, the app shows the standard production-equivalent error page with retry and support options; retry behaves correctly when connectivity is restored.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Non raggiungibilità della sezione Sport del Brand Spagna
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers offline connectivity scenario and verification of error page UI/behavior; backend error types (4xx/5xx) covered in other tests.

test_cases.Title: NonRaggiungibilitaSport_XXX_REQ_NonRaggiungibilita_Sport_Brand_Spain_TEST_Tablet_verify_errorpage_5xx

Steps.Step Description: Prepare test environment where backend endpoint for Brand Spain Sport list can be stubbed to return HTTP 500 (Internal Server Error). Ensure Tablet is connected to the test environment network.
Steps.Expected Result: Test environment is ready and the Sport list endpoint will return HTTP 500 when called.

Steps.Step Description: Open the Brand Spain app on the Tablet and navigate to the Sport section.
Steps.Expected Result: App sends request to Sport list endpoint which responds with HTTP 500; app detects server error.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the screen displayed by the app after receiving the 500 response.
Steps.Expected Result: The app displays the standardized error page as per production for other Brands (title, descriptive text, retry button, support/contact information).

Steps.Step Description: Verify that technical details (stack traces, raw error codes) are not shown to the end user and that the message respects the production wording.
Steps.Expected Result: No raw technical details or stack traces are exposed; only user-friendly error content is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Tap the 'Retry' button and confirm that the app attempts to reload the Sport list; repeat after setting the backend to return normal 200 with valid list.
Steps.Expected Result: On retry the app attempts the request; when backend returns 200, the Sport list is displayed correctly.

Steps.Step Description: Document logs (if accessible) and capture screenshots of the error page for traceability.
Steps.Expected Result: Screenshots and logs show the error page and the 500 response scenario for defect reporting or confirmation.

test_cases.Reference System: Android 12 Tablet, Brand Spain App (Test environment)
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test backend/stub is available to simulate HTTP 500. 2) Tester has access to backend config to flip responses. 3) Tester account logged in and Brand set to Spain.
test_cases.Functionality: Sport Section Availability / Server Error Handling

test_cases.Title: EditAnagraficaPermissions_XXX_REQ-ANAGRAFICA_UserProfileApp_TEST_Computer_Verify edit is blocked for read-only user

Steps.Step Description: Open the application and log in with a user that has read-only role: Username 'user_anagrafica_readonly', Password 'P@ssRead1'.
Steps.Expected Result: Login succeeds and dashboard is visible for the read-only user.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to 'Profile/Anagrafica' section.
Steps.Expected Result: Profile page is displayed in read-only mode; no 'Edit' button is visible or the 'Edit' button is disabled.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to modify a field using the UI (if fields are editable due to UI bug) and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Either the UI prevents editing (fields are disabled) or an authorization error message is shown and the save action is blocked. No changes are persisted.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the edit endpoint directly (e.g., POST to /api/profile/{id} with changed data) using developer tools or API client while authenticated as read-only user.
Steps.Expected Result: Server returns HTTP 403 Forbidden or equivalent authorization error and the modification is not applied.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Chrome 120, Web Application and API Gateway
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Read-only role 'readonly' exists and is assigned to 'user_anagrafica_readonly'. 2) API endpoint protections configured. 3) Tester has credentials for the readonly user.
test_cases.Dataset: Username: user_anagrafica_readonly, Password: P@ssRead1; API endpoint: POST /api/profile/{id}.
test_cases.Expected Result: Read-only user cannot edit anagraphic data through UI or API; system enforces authorization returning appropriate error and preventing persistence.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Does not cover admin role checks or role assignment workflows; focuses only on enforcement for read-only users.

test_cases.Title: CreatePerson_XXX_Anagrafica_Creazione_TEST_Computer_Create a new person record

Steps.Step Description: Launch the Anagrafica application and log in with a user account that has 'Create' permissions.
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica application home screen is displayed and user is authenticated with access to the 'New' button.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Anagrafica' -> 'Persone' section and click the 'New' (Nuovo) button to open the create form.
Steps.Expected Result: The create person form is displayed with empty input fields for mandatory and optional attributes.

Steps.Step Description: Fill in mandatory fields with valid data: Name = 'Mario', Surname = 'Rossi', Date of Birth = '1985-05-20', Fiscal Code = 'RSSMRA85E20H501X', Address = 'Via Roma 1, Milano', Phone = '+39021234567', Email = 'mario.rossi@example.it'.
Steps.Expected Result: All entered values are accepted by the UI and displayed correctly in the form fields.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' (Salva) to submit the new person record.
Steps.Expected Result: A success notification is displayed (e.g., 'Record creato con successo') and the form closes or returns to the person list.

Steps.Step Description: Search for the created person using Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA85E20H501X' from the search bar or list filters.
Steps.Expected Result: The search returns the newly created person record with all entered details matching the data provided.

Steps.Step Description: Open the person detail view and verify stored values match the input (Name, Surname, DOB, Fiscal Code, Address, Phone, Email).
Steps.Expected Result: All fields display the exact values entered at creation; no unexpected truncation or encoding issues are present.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1) Tester has valid credentials with 'Create' permission in Anagrafica.
2) Test environment is up and reachable (TEST environment).
3) Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA85E20H501X' does not exist in the system prior to test.
4) Database rollback mechanism available to clean test data after execution.
test_cases.Dataset: Name='Mario', Surname='Rossi', DOB='1985-05-20', FiscalCode='RSSMRA85E20H501X', Address='Via Roma 1, Milano', Phone='+39021234567', Email='mario.rossi@example.it'
test_cases.Expected Result: A new person record is created successfully in Anagrafica, visible in the list and detail view with all fields accurately stored.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers single-record creation flow for mandatory and standard optional fields. Does not cover bulk import, attachments, or integration with external identity providers.

test_cases.Title: CreatePerson_MissingFields_XXX_Anagrafica_Validations_TEST_Computer_Attempt create with missing mandatory fields

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Anagrafica application with a user that has 'Create' permission and navigate to 'Anagrafica' -> 'Persone'.
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica person list is displayed and 'New' button is available.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'New' button to open the create person form.
Steps.Expected Result: Create person form is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Leave mandatory fields blank (e.g., Fiscal Code empty, Surname empty) and fill other non-mandatory fields with valid values.
Steps.Expected Result: Form shows empty mandatory fields; no client-side automatic population occurs.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' (Salva) to attempt to create the person record.
Steps.Expected Result: The application prevents saving and displays inline validation errors for each mandatory field left blank (e.g., 'Campo obbligatorio'). No success notification is shown.

Steps.Step Description: Correct only one mandatory field and attempt to save again (still leaving at least one mandatory field empty).
Steps.Expected Result: Save is still blocked and validation message remains for each remaining empty mandatory field.

Steps.Step Description: Check server-side response (if accessible) or audit logs to ensure no partial record has been created.
Steps.Expected Result: No record is present in the database/list with incomplete mandatory data; no partially populated records exist.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1) Tester has valid account with 'Create' permission.
2) Test environment available.
3) No prior record with the test identifier exists.
test_cases.Dataset: Name='', Surname='', FiscalCode='', Email='test@example.it'
test_cases.Expected Result: The system blocks creation and displays clear validation messages for all missing mandatory fields; no incomplete record is created.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates client and server-side mandatory field checks for single-record creation. Does not cover format validations (e.g., email format) beyond required presence.

test_cases.Title: UpdatePerson_XXX_Anagrafica_Modifica_TEST_Computer_Update existing person contact details

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica with a user that has 'Edit' permissions and ensure a target person record exists (e.g., Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA85E20H501X').
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica list is displayed and the target person record is present in the environment.

Steps.Step Description: Search for the person by Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA85E20H501X' and open the record in edit mode by clicking 'Edit' (Modifica).
Steps.Expected Result: Person edit form opens populated with existing data.

Steps.Step Description: Change contact details: Phone from '+39021234567' to '+39021666666' and Address from 'Via Roma 1, Milano' to 'Via Milano 10, Milano'.
Steps.Expected Result: Changed values are accepted by the UI and visible in the form fields.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' to commit changes.
Steps.Expected Result: A success message is shown (e.g., 'Modifiche salvate con successo'). Form closes or returns to detail view.

Steps.Step Description: Re-open the person detail view and verify Phone and Address reflect the updated values.
Steps.Expected Result: Person detail displays updated Phone '+39021666666' and Address 'Via Milano 10, Milano'; other fields remain unchanged.

Steps.Step Description: Optional: Query database or API to confirm persisted changes.
Steps.Expected Result: Backend shows updated values consistent with UI; change audit/log entry exists indicating the modification and user who performed it.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1) Test record with Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA85E20H501X' exists.
2) Tester has Edit permissions.
3) Environment connectivity to backend available for optional verification.
test_cases.Dataset: Existing record FiscalCode='RSSMRA85E20H501X'; Updated Phone='+39021666666'; Updated Address='Via Milano 10, Milano'
test_cases.Expected Result: Person contact details are updated successfully in the UI and persisted in the backend; audit/log reflects the change.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers editing of standard personal/contact fields. Does not cover cascading impacts, referential integrity with other modules, or bulk update behavior.

test_cases.Title: DeletePerson_XXX_Anagrafica_Cancellazione_TEST_Computer_Delete an existing person record

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica with a user who has 'Delete' permissions and ensure the person record to delete exists (e.g., Fiscal Code 'DELTEST85A01H501B').
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica list is displayed and the target test record is present.

Steps.Step Description: Search for the record by Fiscal Code 'DELTEST85A01H501B' and select it in the list.
Steps.Expected Result: The target record is located and selectable.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Delete' (Elimina) button for the selected record and confirm the deletion in the confirmation modal by clicking 'Confirm' (Conferma).
Steps.Expected Result: A deletion confirmation modal is shown with clear warning. After confirmation, a success message appears (e.g., 'Record eliminato con successo').

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to search again using the same Fiscal Code 'DELTEST85A01H501B'.
Steps.Expected Result: No records are returned; the deleted record is no longer visible in the list.

Steps.Step Description: Optional: Verify backend/database to ensure record is either removed or flagged as deleted, depending on system soft-delete policy, and check audit logs for deletion entry.
Steps.Expected Result: Backend shows record removed or flagged as deleted per policy; an audit log entry exists indicating deletion, timestamp, and acting user.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1) Test record with Fiscal Code 'DELTEST85A01H501B' exists.
2) Tester has Delete permission.
3) Database snapshot/backout plan available to restore deleted data after test if needed.
test_cases.Dataset: Target record FiscalCode='DELTEST85A01H501B' exists prior to test
test_cases.Expected Result: The record is deleted (or marked deleted) successfully and no longer accessible via the UI; audit log records the deletion action.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates the standard delete flow including confirmation and audit logging. Does not test referential integrity, cascade deletes, or interactions with external systems.

test_cases.Title: BrandSpainNavigation_XXX_PRECONDIZIONI_BrandNavigation_TEST_Computer_LoggedEnabledAccess

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application on the test machine and navigate to the application URL.
Steps.Expected Result: The application login page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Enter valid credentials for a user account that is enabled for Brand Spain (e.g., username: spain_user, password: Password123) and submit the login form.
Steps.Expected Result: The user is successfully authenticated and redirected to the application home/dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the user session is active (check presence of user avatar/name or session indicator in UI).
Steps.Expected Result: User session indicator is visible confirming the user is logged in.

Steps.Step Description: From the navigation/menu, select or navigate to the Brand Spain area (or choose Spain from brand selector if present).
Steps.Expected Result: Brand Spain section is accessible; navigation completes without permission errors and Spain-specific options/pages are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Open several pages/features within the Brand Spain area (e.g., Spain home, promotions, category pages).
Steps.Expected Result: All opened pages load successfully and Spain-specific content is shown; no access denied or 403 errors encountered.

Steps.Step Description: Log out from the application.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged out and redirected to the login page.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. The Actor is correctly logged into the application. B. The Actor is enabled to navigate within the Brand Spain (user account has Brand Spain permission).
test_cases.Dataset: Credentials: spain_user / Password123 (user with Brand Spain enabled); test URLs for Spain-specific pages
test_cases.Expected Result: A user who is logged in and enabled for Brand Spain can navigate to and access Spain-specific sections and pages without permission errors.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Verifies front-end navigation and access for Brand Spain when preconditions are met. Does not cover backend logging or permission configuration workflows.

test_cases.Title: BrandSpainNavigationBlocked_XXX_PRECONDIZIONI_BrandNavigation_TEST_Computer_LoggedNotEnabledAccess

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application and navigate to the login page.
Steps.Expected Result: Login page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Log in using credentials of a valid user account that is NOT enabled for Brand Spain (e.g., username: no_spain_user, password: Password123).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and redirected to the application home/dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access or select Brand Spain area via the brand selector or by navigating to a Spain-specific URL.
Steps.Expected Result: The application prevents access to Brand Spain: either the Spain brand option is not visible, the navigation option is disabled, or an access denied message (403 or equivalent) is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that all attempts to open Spain-specific pages result in an explicit denial or redirect to an allowed area, and confirm that no Spain-specific content is shown.
Steps.Expected Result: Spain-specific pages are not accessible; user remains within allowed brands and an appropriate message/redirect occurs.

Steps.Step Description: Log out and attempt direct access to a Spain-specific URL without logging in.
Steps.Expected Result: User is redirected to the login page (if unauthenticated) or shown login prompt/denied access consistent with application behavior.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. The Actor is correctly logged into the application. B. The Actor is NOT enabled to navigate within the Brand Spain (user account lacks Brand Spain permission).
test_cases.Dataset: Credentials: no_spain_user / Password123 (user without Brand Spain permission); Spain-specific page URLs
test_cases.Expected Result: A logged-in user without Brand Spain permission cannot access Spain-specific areas; the system blocks access and shows appropriate denial or hides Spain options.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI-level enforcement of brand-based access restrictions. Does not validate backend authorization logs or role-assignment UI.

test_cases.Title: BrandSpainNavigationUnauth_XXX_PRECONDIZIONI_BrandNavigation_TEST_Computer_NotLoggedAccessAttempt

Steps.Step Description: On the test machine, open a browser and attempt to navigate directly to a Spain-specific page URL without logging in.
Steps.Expected Result: The application redirects the user to the login page or displays an authentication prompt.

Steps.Step Description: From the login page, attempt to access Spain area links (if any are shown unauthenticated) or use browser back/forward navigation to reach Spain-specific pages.
Steps.Expected Result: Unauthenticated navigation to Spain pages is blocked; the login page remains required.

Steps.Step Description: Log in with valid credentials for a user who is enabled for Brand Spain (e.g., spain_user / Password123).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and redirected to dashboard; Spain brand becomes accessible per permissions.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that after login the Spain-specific pages are accessible only if the account has Brand Spain permission, otherwise access is denied.
Steps.Expected Result: Post-login behavior respects Brand Spain permission: allowed users can access Spain pages; non-enabled users cannot.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. The Actor is NOT logged into the application. B. (Varies per step) Account used for subsequent login may be enabled or not for Brand Spain.
test_cases.Dataset: Spain-specific page URLs; credentials: spain_user / Password123 (enabled) and no_spain_user / Password123 (not enabled)
test_cases.Expected Result: Unauthenticated users cannot access Brand Spain pages and are redirected to login. After authentication, brand access is enforced according to the user's Brand Spain permission.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates authentication gating and subsequent permission enforcement for Brand Spain. Does not cover multi-factor authentication or SSO integration specifics.

test_cases.Title: RicercaTestualeContains_XXX_REQ_SearchFilter_SportBackoffice_TEST_Computer_verify_text_contains_returns_results

Steps.Step Description: Ensure user is logged in and has navigated to the Sport section of Brand Spain according to the 'Visualizza lista Sport' base path.
Steps.Expected Result: Sport section of Brand Spain is displayed and ready; search filters (including 'Descrizione o codice DGOJ') are visible and enabled.

Steps.Step Description: In the 'Descrizione o codice DGOJ' search field, enter the text 'fútbol' to test 'testuale contiene' behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: The text 'fútbol' is entered in the search field; other search filters remain enabled/unmodified.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Avvia ricerca' (Start search) button.
Steps.Expected Result: Search is executed and the results area is updated.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the displayed results include entries whose Descrizione DGOJ or Codice DGOJ contains the substring 'fútbol'.
Steps.Expected Result: Result rows include only items where either Descrizione DGOJ or Codice DGOJ contains 'fútbol' (case-insensitive).

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the result table shows the required columns: 'Codice DGOJ', 'Descrizione DGOJ', 'Type', 'Assoc. BM', and 'Visible'.
Steps.Expected Result: All five columns are present as headers; matching rows show values under each column.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user with appropriate permissions exists and is logged in. 2) User navigated to Sport section of Brand Spain per 'Visualizza lista Sport' base path. 3) Network connectivity available.
test_cases.Dataset: Search term: 'fútbol' (textual contains); expected matching items pre-seeded in test environment.
test_cases.Expected Result: Search returns rows where Descrizione DGOJ or Codice DGOJ contains 'fútbol' and displays columns Codice DGOJ, Descrizione DGOJ, Type, Assoc. BM, Visible.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso Base – Esecuzione ricerca per 'testuale contiene'/'testuale inizia per'/'numerica contiene'
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers textual 'contains' search behavior and result columns; does not cover pagination, sorting, or filter persistence across navigation.

test_cases.Title: RicercaTestualeStartsWith_XXX_REQ_SearchFilter_SportBackoffice_TEST_Computer_verify_text_starts_with_returns_results

Steps.Step Description: Ensure user is on the Sport section of Brand Spain and the 'Descrizione o codice DGOJ' filter is visible.
Steps.Expected Result: Sport section displayed and search filters enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Enter 'Ten' in the 'Descrizione o codice DGOJ' field to test 'testuale inizia per' (text starts with).
Steps.Expected Result: 'Ten' is entered; other filters remain enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Select or set the search mode to 'testuale inizia per' if mode selection is required by UI (or implicitly use the starts-with option).
Steps.Expected Result: Search mode is set to 'testuale inizia per'.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Avvia ricerca'.
Steps.Expected Result: Search is executed and results update.

Steps.Step Description: Validate that returned items have Descrizione DGOJ or Codice DGOJ starting with 'Ten'.
Steps.Expected Result: Only rows beginning with 'Ten' in Descrizione DGOJ or Codice DGOJ are displayed; required columns are present.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Valid test user logged in and at Sport section. 2) Test data includes items starting with 'Ten'.
test_cases.Dataset: Search term: 'Ten' (textual starts with); test data includes 'Tennis', 'Tendencias' etc.
test_cases.Expected Result: Search returns entries where Descrizione DGOJ or Codice DGOJ starts with 'Ten' and displays the five required columns.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso Base – Esecuzione ricerca per 'testuale contiene'/'testuale inizia per'/'numerica contiene'
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates 'starts with' behavior and column visibility; does not validate interaction with combined filters like date ranges or pagination.

test_cases.Title: RicercaNumericaContains_XXX_REQ_SearchFilter_SportBackoffice_TEST_Computer_verify_numeric_contains_partial_code_search

Steps.Step Description: Open Sport section for Brand Spain and verify 'Descrizione o codice DGOJ' filter is active.
Steps.Expected Result: Sport section visible; search filters active.

Steps.Step Description: Enter the numeric substring '123' into the 'Descrizione o codice DGOJ' field to test 'numerica contiene' behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: '123' is entered in the field; field accepts numeric input and other filters remain enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Set the search mode to 'numerica contiene' if required, otherwise proceed.
Steps.Expected Result: Search mode is set to numeric contains or system interprets the input as numeric contains.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Avvia ricerca'.
Steps.Expected Result: Search runs and results are shown.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm that results include entries whose Codice DGOJ contains the digit sequence '123' and that Descrizione DGOJ non-matching textual values are excluded if code-only match applies.
Steps.Expected Result: Rows are displayed where Codice DGOJ contains '123'; result table headers include Codice DGOJ, Descrizione DGOJ, Type, Assoc. BM, Visible.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User on Sport section logged in. 2) Test dataset contains Codice DGOJ values with substring '123'.
test_cases.Dataset: Numeric search term: '123'; sample Codice DGOJ values: 'A123B', '00123', '12345'.
test_cases.Expected Result: Search returns rows where Codice DGOJ contains '123' and displays required columns.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso Base – Esecuzione ricerca per 'testuale contiene'/'testuale inizia per'/'numerica contiene'
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Focuses on numeric contains behavior on Codice DGOJ; does not cover mixed alphanumeric parsing beyond contains semantics.

test_cases.Title: RicercaCaseSensitivity_XXX_REQ_SearchFilter_SportBackoffice_TEST_Computer_verify_case_insensitive_behavior

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Sport section (Brand Spain) and ensure the 'Descrizione o codice DGOJ' field is empty.
Steps.Expected Result: Sport section visible; search field empty and ready for input.

Steps.Step Description: Enter 'BaSeBall' into the search field to test case sensitivity for 'testuale contiene'.
Steps.Expected Result: 'BaSeBall' is entered correctly; other filters remain enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Avvia ricerca'.
Steps.Expected Result: Search executes successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Verify whether entries labeled 'Baseball', 'baseball', or 'BASEBALL' are returned (test expects case-insensitive match).
Steps.Expected Result: Entries matching the substring ignoring case are displayed; the five required columns are visible.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user in Sport section. 2) Test data includes 'Baseball' entries in various case forms.
test_cases.Dataset: Search term: 'BaSeBall'; dataset includes 'Baseball','baseball','BASEBALL'.
test_cases.Expected Result: Search treats input case-insensitively and returns matching entries irrespective of letter case; columns shown.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso Base – Esecuzione ricerca per 'testuale contiene'/'testuale inizia per'/'numerica contiene'
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates case sensitivity behavior for textual searches only.

test_cases.Title: RicercaEmptyInput_XXX_REQ_SearchFilter_SportBackoffice_TEST_Computer_verify_empty_input_behaviour

Steps.Step Description: Access Sport section of Brand Spain and ensure 'Descrizione o codice DGOJ' filter is empty.
Steps.Expected Result: Sport section displayed; search field blank; other filters remain enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Leave the 'Descrizione o codice DGOJ' field empty and click 'Avvia ricerca'.
Steps.Expected Result: Search action is processed by the system (no client-side error).

Steps.Step Description: Observe the behavior: verify whether system returns the full unfiltered list or prompts the user for input.
Steps.Expected Result: If system design returns full list, all items in Sport section are shown and required columns are visible; if system requires input, a validation message is displayed indicating input is required. (Tester to confirm which behavior is implemented.)

test_cases.Preconditions: User on Sport section with visibility of filters and result table.
test_cases.Dataset: Empty input (no characters); environment with multiple sport entries.
test_cases.Expected Result: System either returns full list (all rows displayed with required columns) or shows a validation message; tester must record actual implemented behavior for acceptance.

test_cases.Title: RicercaNoResults_XXX_REQ_SearchFilter_SportBackoffice_TEST_Computer_verify_no_results_message_and_columns

Steps.Step Description: Open Sport section (Brand Spain) and ensure user is ready to perform a search.
Steps.Expected Result: Sport section visible and search filters enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a non-existing term 'ZZZ_NON_EXISTENT_999' into the 'Descrizione o codice DGOJ' field.
Steps.Expected Result: The term is entered; other filters unchanged.
