test_cases.Title: RicercaNumerica_XXX_Esecuzione ricerca numerica puntuale_Backoffice_TEST_Computer_positive exact match

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Backoffice application and navigate to the 'Ricerca' (Search) page containing the 'Descrizione o codice DGOJ' filter and other search filters.
Steps.Expected Result: Backoffice Search page is displayed with the 'Descrizione o codice DGOJ' field, other filters (e.g., Type, Assoc. BM, Visibilità) and 'Avvia ricerca' button visible and enabled.

Steps.Step Description: In the 'Descrizione o codice DGOJ' field activate/select the search mode 'numerica puntuale' (exact numeric) and enter the known existing Codice DGOJ value '12345'.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Descrizione o codice DGOJ' field accepts the numeric input '12345'. Immediately after entering the numeric value in this mode, all other search filters become disabled (greyed out/uneditable) and the 'Visibilità' filter is reset to 'Tutti'.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Avvia ricerca' button to execute the search using the numeric exact filter.
Steps.Expected Result: The search executes successfully and returns results.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the results list contains the element with Codice DGOJ = '12345'. Inspect the result row columns.
Steps.Expected Result: The searched element is displayed in the results table. The following columns are present and visible for the result row: a) Codice DGOJ (shows '12345'), b) Descrizione DGOJ (non-empty description text), c) Type (value present), d) Assoc. BM (value or indicator present), e) Visibile (indicator showing visibility).

Steps.Step Description: Click the displayed row to open details (if standard behavior), or inspect row data for correctness (non-functional).
Steps.Expected Result: Row details match expected item data for Codice DGOJ '12345' and no other unexpected results are shown. Use case ends.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has valid Backoffice credentials and is logged in. 2) Dataset contains an item with Codice DGOJ = '12345' and populated Descrizione DGOJ, Type, Assoc. BM, Visibile fields. 3) Network and backend services are reachable.
test_cases.Dataset: Existing Codice DGOJ: 12345; corresponding Descrizione DGOJ, Type, Assoc. BM, Visibile values
test_cases.Expected Result: When performing a numeric exact search for Codice DGOJ '12345' in 'numerica puntuale' mode, other filters are disabled, Visibilità resets to 'Tutti', and the correct single element is displayed with columns Codice DGOJ, Descrizione DGOJ, Type, Assoc. BM, Visibile.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Esecuzione ricerca numerica puntuale
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers positive exact numeric search path and verification of result columns; does not cover edit/delete actions on result item.

test_cases.Title: RicercaNumerica_XXX_Esecuzione ricerca numerica puntuale_Backoffice_TEST_Computer_filters disabled on input

Steps.Step Description: Open the Backoffice Search page where the 'Descrizione o codice DGOJ' input and other search filters are available.
Steps.Expected Result: Search page loads with all filters enabled and default 'Visibilità' selection visible (may be any default).

Steps.Step Description: Switch the 'Descrizione o codice DGOJ' filter to 'numerica puntuale' mode and begin entering the numeric value '67890' (do not press 'Avvia ricerca' yet).
Steps.Expected Result: As soon as the user enters numeric input in 'numerica puntuale' mode, the UI disables all other search filters (they become uneditable) and the 'Visibilità' filter is automatically reset to value 'Tutti'.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to change any other filter (for example select a Type or modify Assoc. BM) while numeric input is present.
Steps.Expected Result: Other filters remain disabled and cannot be modified until numeric input is cleared or mode changed; 'Avvia ricerca' remains available to run the numeric search.

Steps.Step Description: Clear the 'Descrizione o codice DGOJ' numeric input (remove text and/or switch mode off).
Steps.Expected Result: Other filters become enabled again and 'Visibilità' returns to previous/default selection or allows user selection.

test_cases.Title: NoResultsSearch_XXX_REQ-NoResults_PreciseSearchApp_TEST_Computer_Verify no results message and return to numeric search input

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application and navigate to the search page or module where numeric precise search (ricerca numerica puntuale) is available.

Steps.Expected Result: Precise numeric search mode is active and numeric input field has focus.

Steps.Expected Result: The numeric value '9999999999' is entered in the input field.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Search' button (or press Enter) to execute the precise numeric search.
Steps.Expected Result: Search request is sent to the application and search progress indicator (if any) is shown.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the front end after the search completes.
Steps.Expected Result: Front end displays a clear message indicating that no elements were found for the performed search (for example: 'Nessun elemento trovato per la ricerca effettuata' or equivalent). No search results are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Check the application behavior after the no-results message is shown: verify that the user is returned to the numeric precise search step (step 2a.1 of the alternative path), meaning the numeric search input is available and focused allowing the user to perform another numeric search.
Steps.Expected Result: The UI returns to the numeric precise search state: numeric input remains visible and focused, user can enter a new numeric value immediately. The no-results message remains visible until dismissed or a new search is started.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has a valid session and access to the application search module. 2) The system dataset is in known state where numeric value '9999999999' does not exist. 3) Network connectivity is available.

test_cases.Title: NoResultsMessageContent_XXX_REQ-NoResults_PreciseSearchApp_TEST_Computer_Verify message text and accessibility

Steps.Step Description: Verify the exact displayed message text shown to the user when no results are returned (check localized copy for Italian).

Steps.Step Description: Check ARIA and accessibility attributes for the no-results message (e.g., role='alert' or aria-live='polite') and that screen readers will announce the message.
Steps.Expected Result: No-results message has appropriate accessibility attributes (role/aria-live) and is announced by assistive technologies when triggered.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the no-results message is visible and readable on different viewport sizes (desktop width, narrow window resized) and contrasts meet accessibility color contrast requirements.
Steps.Expected Result: Message remains visible, properly wrapped/responsive, and color contrast passes accessibility thresholds.

test_cases.Expected Result: The front end displays the correct localized 'no results' message with proper accessibility attributes and correct responsive rendering.

test_cases.Title: NoResults_NoStaleResults_XXX_REQ-NoResults_PreciseSearchApp_TEST_Computer_Verify no stale results shown when backend returns empty

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the search page where a previous successful search (e.g., returning result set A) was performed and results are currently visible.
Steps.Expected Result: Previous search results (result set A) are visible on the page.

Steps.Step Description: Switch to precise numeric search mode, enter a numeric identifier that does not exist (example: '8888800000') and execute the search.
Steps.Expected Result: Search request is executed and backend returns an empty set for the precise numeric query.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the results area and no-results message after completion of the search.
Steps.Expected Result: Result area does not show stale data from previous searches. The UI clears prior results and displays the 'no elements found' message instead.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to interact with any previously visible result items (if any remain visible due to UI bug) such as clicking a result link.
Steps.Expected Result: No previously visible/stale result items are interactable; they must not be present. If any are present, this is a defect.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the user can immediately perform another numeric search (UI returned to step 2a.1): enter a new valid/invalid numeric value to confirm input is active.
Steps.Expected Result: Numeric input is active and accepts a new value; performing another search behaves normally.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) A previous successful search result set is present on the page. 2) Non-existent numeric id '8888800000' returns zero results in backend.
test_cases.Dataset: Initial previous results present; numeric search input: 8888800000 (non-existent).
test_cases.Expected Result: When backend returns no results for a precise numeric search, the front end clears prior results, displays the 'no elements found' message, and returns the UI to the numeric search input state allowing a new search (covers steps 1-3 of the alternative path).
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Nessun risultato dalla ricerca puntuale
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates absence of stale UI results and correct UI reset; does not validate backend caching policies or network-layer retries.

test_cases.Title: ApplyVisibilityFilter_XXX_Visibilita_FiltroApp_TEST_Computer_Verify single visibility option filters results

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application and navigate to the listing page that contains the 'Visibility' filter control.
Steps.Expected Result: Listing page is loaded and the 'Visibility' filter control is visible and enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Observe and record the current total number of items displayed before applying any filter.
Steps.Expected Result: Total number of items is displayed and recorded (baseline count).

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Visibility' filter dropdown and select a single option (e.g., 'Public').
Steps.Expected Result: 'Public' option is selected in the filter UI.

Steps.Step Description: Apply the filter by clicking 'Apply' or waiting for auto-apply, if the UI auto-applies selection.
Steps.Expected Result: Filter is applied and the listing refreshes to show only items with 'Public' visibility.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that every item in the updated listing has the visibility attribute set to 'Public' and that the count is less than or equal to the baseline.
Steps.Expected Result: All displayed items have visibility 'Public'. The displayed count is consistent with filtered results and <= baseline count.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has access to the web application environment (TEST). 2) At least one item exists with visibility 'Public'. 3) Tester is authenticated if the listing requires login. 4) Browser cache cleared or in a clean session.
test_cases.Dataset: Listing with mixed visibility items; example: ItemA(Private), ItemB(Public), ItemC(Public).
test_cases.Expected Result: Selecting a single visibility option (Public) filters the list to display only items whose visibility equals 'Public' and updates the count accordingly.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only UI application of single visibility option; does not cover backend query logs or API contract verification.

test_cases.Title: ApplyMultipleVisibilityOptions_XXX_Visibilita_FiltroApp_TEST_Computer_Verify multiple selections combine as OR

Steps.Expected Result: Baseline count recorded.

Steps.Expected Result: Both 'Public' and 'Internal' options are selected and the filter is applied.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the updated listing contains only items whose visibility is either 'Public' OR 'Internal' and that items with other visibility values are excluded.
Steps.Expected Result: Displayed items have visibility attribute 'Public' or 'Internal' only; no other visibility values are present.

Steps.Expected Result: Only 'Public' remains selected and the listing updates to include only 'Public' items.

test_cases.Title: ClearVisibilityFilter_XXX_Visibilita_FiltroApp_TEST_Computer_Verify clear resets filters and restores baseline

Steps.Step Description: On the listing page, apply a visibility filter (e.g., select 'Private') and confirm filtered results are shown.
Steps.Expected Result: Filtered listing shows only 'Private' items.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Clear' or 'Reset' action for filters (or unselect the visibility option) to remove the visibility filter.
Steps.Expected Result: Filter UI shows no selection for visibility after clearing.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the listing after clearing the filter and compare to the baseline unfiltered listing.
Steps.Expected Result: The listing returns to baseline (unfiltered) state showing all items and baseline count restored.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm that other filters (if any) are either preserved or cleared according to product specification (document the observed behavior).
Steps.Expected Result: Behavior of other filters matches specification (documented); no unintended filter retention occurs unless specified.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) There exists a baseline unfiltered listing state recorded. 2) Filter UI includes a 'Clear'/'Reset' control or supports manual de-selection.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample listing with mixed visibility values.
test_cases.Expected Result: Clearing the visibility filter restores the unfiltered listing and baseline item count; filter UI reflects cleared state.

test_cases.Title: VisibilityFilterPersistence_XXX_Visibilita_FiltroApp_TEST_Computer_Verify filter persists across navigation and back

Steps.Step Description: On the listing page, select a visibility filter option (e.g., 'Internal') and apply it.
Steps.Expected Result: Filter is applied and listing updates to show only 'Internal' items.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away from the listing page to another page within the application (e.g., open an item detail or go to dashboard).
Steps.Expected Result: Navigation to another page completes successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Use the browser back button or navigate back to the listing page via application menu.
Steps.Expected Result: Listing page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify whether the previously applied visibility filter selection is still active and the listing still shows filtered results.
Steps.Expected Result: Filter persistence behavior matches requirements: either filter remains active (persisted) or is cleared, according to spec. If persistence is required, 'Internal' remains selected and listing shows only 'Internal' items.

Steps.Step Description: If persistence is expected, reload the page (F5) and confirm whether filter selection persists after full page reload.
Steps.Expected Result: After reload, filter remains selected and results remain filtered if persistence is part of requirements; otherwise the filter clears per specification.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Product specification defines expected persistence behavior for visibility filter. 2) User is on listing page with items present.
test_cases.Dataset: Listing with items having 'Internal' visibility.
test_cases.Expected Result: Filter persistence behavior matches the requirement: either selection persists across navigation and reloads or is cleared; listing behavior corresponds accordingly.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client-side persistence only; server-side session persistence and multi-tab scenarios are not covered.

test_cases.Title: VisibilityFilterPerformance_XXX_Visibilita_FiltroApp_TEST_Computer_Verify response time under load

Steps.Step Description: Ensure performance test environment is prepared with representative dataset (large number of items) and monitoring tools are configured.
Steps.Expected Result: Performance environment ready and baseline metrics available.

Steps.Step Description: From the listing page, select a visibility filter option (e.g., 'Public') and apply the filter while recording response time.
Steps.Expected Result: Filter request initiated and response time is recorded by monitoring tools or test script.

Steps.Step Description: Repeat the filter apply action under simulated concurrent load (e.g., 50 concurrent users) and measure average and percentile response times.
Steps.Expected Result: Under load, average response time and 95th percentile are captured for evaluation.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that response times meet the performance acceptance criteria (for example: <= 2s average, <= 5s 95th percentile) and that no functional errors occur.
Steps.Expected Result: Measured response times satisfy acceptance thresholds and the listing displays correct filtered results without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Collect and document any errors, timeouts, or degraded behavior observed during the test.
Steps.Expected Result: All observed metrics and errors are logged and compared against SLAs; if thresholds exceeded, defects must be raised.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application, Performance Test Harness (JMeter/Gatling)
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Performance environment configured with large dataset and test harness. 2) Acceptance criteria for response times defined. 3) Monitoring tools active.
test_cases.Dataset: Large dataset (e.g., 100k items) with mixed visibility attributes; simulated 50 concurrent virtual users.
test_cases.Expected Result: Visibility filter operations complete within defined performance thresholds under load and return correct filtered results; no functional failures.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Measures response time and correctness under load; does not include long-term endurance testing or backend resource consumption profiling.

test_cases.Expected Result: New user record is created successfully and visible in the registry search results with all provided details.

test_cases.Title: CreateUserMissingRequired_XXX_Attore_UtenteAnagrafica_TEST_Computer_attempt to create user without mandatory fields

test_cases.Title: DeleteUser_XXX_Attore_UtenteAnagrafica_TEST_Computer_remove an existing user record

test_cases.Title: SearchAndFilterUser_XXX_Attore_UtenteAnagrafica_TEST_Computer_search and filter users by criteria

test_cases.Title: CreatePerson_XXX_REQ-Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_create a new person record

Steps.Step Description: Open the Anagrafica application URL and log in with a valid backoffice user (username: anagrafica_admin, password: Password!23).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and the Anagrafica dashboard/homepage is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: From the dashboard, navigate to 'Anagrafica' -> 'Create New Person' or equivalent menu item.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Create New Person' form page is displayed with all mandatory fields visible (First Name, Last Name, Date of Birth, Fiscal Code/ID, Address, Email, Phone).

Steps.Step Description: Fill the form with valid data: First Name = 'Mario', Last Name = 'Rossi', DOB = '1985-07-12', Fiscal Code = 'RSSMRA85L12H501X', Address = 'Via Roma 1, Milano', Email = 'mario.rossi.test+001@example.com', Phone = '+390212345678'.
Steps.Expected Result: All fields accept the input and no inline validation errors are shown for the provided data.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Save' or 'Create' button to submit the new person record.
Steps.Expected Result: The system validates input, saves the record, displays a success confirmation message (e.g., 'Record created successfully') and shows the newly created record ID.

Steps.Step Description: Use the Anagrafica search functionality to search for the created record using Fiscal Code or Email.
Steps.Expected Result: The search returns the newly created record. The displayed record details match the input data (First Name, Last Name, DOB, Fiscal Code, Address, Email, Phone).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has valid backoffice credentials (anagrafica_admin). 2) The Anagrafica application is deployed in TEST environment and accessible. 3) No existing record with the same Fiscal Code or Email used in Test Data. 4) Network connectivity to application and database is available.
test_cases.Dataset: First Name: Mario; Last Name: Rossi; DOB: 1985-07-12; Fiscal Code: RSSMRA85L12H501X; Address: Via Roma 1, Milano; Email: mario.rossi.test+001@example.com; Phone: +390212345678
test_cases.Expected Result: A new person record is created in the Anagrafica system, persisted in the database, and retrievable by search with matching data.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers basic successful create flow and retrieval. Does not cover negative validation scenarios, duplicate handling beyond precondition, permission boundary cases, bulk import, or API-level verification.

test_cases.Title: UpdatePerson_XXX_REQ-Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_update an existing person record

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Anagrafica application with a user who has edit permissions (username: anagrafica_editor, password: Password!23).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and the Anagrafica dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Search for an existing person record by Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA85L12H501X' (created in TC-ANAG-001 or pre-existing test fixture).

Steps.Step Description: Open the record and click the 'Edit' button to enable modification of fields.

Steps.Step Description: Modify the Last Name from 'Rossi' to 'Verdi' and change Address to 'Via Milano 10, Milano'.
Steps.Expected Result: The new values are accepted in the input fields without inline validation errors.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' to persist the changes and confirm if a confirmation dialog appears.
Steps.Expected Result: The system saves changes, displays a success message (e.g., 'Record updated successfully'), and the displayed record shows Last Name = 'Verdi' and updated Address.

Steps.Step Description: Re-run the search for Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA85L12H501X' and open the record to verify data persisted.
Steps.Expected Result: The record displays the updated Last Name and Address; audit log (if available) shows an 'Update' entry with timestamp and editing user.

test_cases.Expected Result: The existing person record is updated with the new values and changes are persisted and discoverable via search; update action recorded in audit log if provided.

test_cases.Title: DeletePerson_XXX_REQ-Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_delete an existing person record

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Anagrafica application with a user that has delete permissions (username: anagrafica_admin, password: Password!23).
Steps.Expected Result: User authenticates successfully and the Anagrafica dashboard is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Search for the person record to delete using Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA85L12H501X' or the ID obtained after creation.

Steps.Step Description: Open the person record and click the 'Delete' or 'Remove' action. If a confirmation dialog appears, confirm the deletion.
Steps.Expected Result: A confirmation dialog is displayed (if applicable). After confirming, the system deletes the record and displays a success message (e.g., 'Record deleted successfully').

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to search again for the same Fiscal Code or ID using the Anagrafica search feature.
Steps.Expected Result: The system returns no results for the deleted record or indicates the record is not found.

Steps.Step Description: Verify audit/logging area (if available) to confirm a 'Delete' entry exists with timestamp and user performing the deletion.
Steps.Expected Result: Audit/log contains a delete entry referencing the record ID or Fiscal Code and the deleting user; deletion timestamp is recorded.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has valid admin credentials with delete permission. 2) The person record with Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA85L12H501X' exists prior to deletion. 3) Backup or test DB reset strategy is available if needed.
test_cases.Dataset: Fiscal Code: RSSMRA85L12H501X; Record ID: (use the ID from creation step or fixture)
test_cases.Expected Result: The specified person record is removed from active Anagrafica datasets; subsequent searches do not return the record and audit log shows delete action.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers single-record deletion and verification. Does not cover soft-delete vs hard-delete policy variations, recovery/restore, dependencies (e.g., linked transactions), or mass-delete behavior.

test_cases.Title: PreconditionsCheck_XXX_PRECONDIZIONI_Visibility_Backoffice_TEST_Computer_Verify all preconditions are satisfied

Steps.Step Description: Open the Backoffice web application on the test environment.
Steps.Expected Result: Backoffice login page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Log in using valid actor credentials that are expected to have Brand Spain access (use provided test user).
Steps.Expected Result: Actor is authenticated and redirected to the Backoffice landing page.

Steps.Step Description: From the user profile or brand selector, verify that the actor is enabled for navigation within Brand Spain.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the page/section where the 'Visibilità' (Visibility) field is expected (e.g., content/item edit page).
Steps.Expected Result: The content/item edit page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Locate the 'Visibilità' field on the page and verify its control state (enabled/disabled).
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Visibilità' field control is present and is enabled (interactable).

test_cases.Preconditions: A. Actor is correctly logged into the Application. B. Actor is enabled to navigate within Brand Spain. C. The 'Visibilità' field must be enabled.

test_cases.Expected Result: Actor is logged in, has Brand Spain navigation enabled, and the 'Visibilità' field is present and enabled on the relevant page.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates only that preconditions A, B, C are met and the visibility field is enabled; does not validate persistence or downstream effects.

test_cases.Title: VisibilityToggle_XXX_FUNCTIONAL_Visibility_Backoffice_TEST_Computer_Verify toggling and persistence of Visibilità field

Steps.Step Description: Ensure preconditions: actor is logged in, actor enabled for Brand Spain, and 'Visibilità' field is enabled (use same setup as TC-001).
Steps.Expected Result: Preconditions satisfied and content/item edit page accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Open an existing test content item (ITEM-TEST-001) in edit mode where 'Visibilità' is available.
Steps.Expected Result: Content item edit page is displayed with current 'Visibilità' value visible.

Steps.Step Description: Record the current state of 'Visibilità' (e.g., 'Visible' or 'Hidden'). Then change the state (toggle from Visible to Hidden or vice versa).
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Visibilità' control reflects the new state after interaction (control toggles).

Steps.Step Description: Save the content item using the Save/Update action.
Steps.Expected Result: Save action completes successfully and a confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Item saved successfully').

Steps.Step Description: Refresh the page or re-open the same content item in edit mode to verify persisted state.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Visibilità' field shows the state set in Step 3, confirming persistence.

Steps.Step Description: If available, verify the public/frontend representation of the item (for Brand Spain) reflects visibility change (e.g., item not shown when Hidden).
Steps.Expected Result: Frontend behavior corresponds to the 'Visibilità' state: item is visible when set to Visible and not visible when set to Hidden.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. Actor logged in. B. Actor enabled for Brand Spain. C. 'Visibilità' field enabled and accessible for the actor.
test_cases.Dataset: Test actor credentials with Brand Spain access, content item ITEM-TEST-001
test_cases.Expected Result: The 'Visibilità' state can be toggled by the actor, saved successfully, and the changed state persists and affects frontend visibility appropriately.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI toggle, save, persistence and basic frontend effect; does not cover audit logs or multi-replica cache invalidation.

test_cases.Title: BrandAccessRestriction_XXX_SEC_REQ_BrandAccess_Backoffice_TEST_Computer_Verify access denied when actor not enabled for Brand Spain

Steps.Expected Result: 'Visibilità' control is not present or is non-interactable; user cannot change visibility for Brand Spain items.

test_cases.Title: VisibilityFieldDisabled_XXX_REQ_VISIBILITY_Backoffice_TEST_Computer_Verify behavior when 'Visibilità' field is disabled

Steps.Step Description: Ensure actor is logged in and enabled for Brand Spain navigation but configure the system (or test fixture) so that the 'Visibilità' field is disabled for the content type or environment under test.
Steps.Expected Result: Actor is logged in and Brand Spain navigation available; the 'Visibilità' field is disabled or not available per configuration.

Steps.Step Description: Open an editable content item where the 'Visibilità' field is expected but currently disabled by configuration.
Steps.Expected Result: Content item edit page is displayed but the 'Visibilità' control is either absent, greyed out, or marked as read-only/disabled.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to interact with the 'Visibilità' control (click/toggle) if visible, or attempt to change visibility via direct form submission or API if tester has access to developer tools.
Steps.Expected Result: UI prevents interaction (control disabled) and client-side actions do not allow change; backend rejects attempts to change visibility if attempted via direct calls.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to save any attempted changes and observe system response.
Steps.Expected Result: No changes to 'Visibilità' are saved; if user attempted direct API call, server returns an authorization/validation error.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. Actor logged in. B. Actor enabled for Brand Spain. C. The 'Visibilità' field is disabled by system configuration for this content type or environment.
test_cases.Dataset: Test actor credentials with Brand Spain access, content item ITEM-TEST-002, configuration flag: visibility_enabled=false
test_cases.Expected Result: When 'Visibilità' is disabled per configuration, the actor cannot interact with or change visibility; attempted changes are rejected and no persistence occurs.

test_cases.Title: FiltroVisibilita_XXX_REQ-SPORT_VISIBILITA-Filter_TEST_Computer_Verify only visible items are shown when filter set to visibili

Steps.Step Description: Open the web browser and navigate to the Brand Spain home page; from the main menu follow the path to the Sport section (as per 'Visualizza lista Sport' base path).
Steps.Expected Result: The Sport section of Brand Spain is displayed and the list view of sport items is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm that the 'Visibilità' filter field is present on the Sport section page.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Visibilità' filter field is visible in the filters area.

Steps.Step Description: Open the 'Visibilità' dropdown and select the option labeled 'visibili'.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'visibili' option is selected in the dropdown.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Avvia ricerca' button to apply the filter.
Steps.Expected Result: The page triggers the search and refreshes the list according to selected filters.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect all items displayed in the resulting list (all pages if pagination is present) and verify each item's visibility attribute or badge, or open item details to check its 'visibilità' property.
Steps.Expected Result: Every displayed item has visibility set to 'visibile' (no item with visibility 'non visibile' or equivalent is shown).

Steps.Step Description: Optionally, verify that items known in the dataset that have visibility 'non visibile' are not present in the displayed results.
Steps.Expected Result: Known non-visible items do not appear in the results.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application - Brand Spain (Sport section)
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has network access to the test environment for Brand Spain. 2) Test data exists: at least 3 sport items marked as 'visibile' and at least 2 items marked as 'non visibile'. 3) Tester has a browser session with necessary access rights to view the Sport section (no special login required unless environment requires). 4) Pagination and item detail views are functional.
test_cases.Dataset: Sport items dataset: itemA(visibile), itemB(visibile), itemC(visibile), itemD(non visibile), itemE(non visibile)
test_cases.Expected Result: After applying 'visibili' in the 'Visibilità' filter and starting search, the list shows only items whose visibility attribute equals 'visibile'.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers applying the 'visibili' visibility filter and verifying displayed items; does not cover advanced filter combinations, sorting interactions, or API-level verification.

test_cases.Title: DefaultVisibilita_XXX_REQ-SPORT_VISIBILITA-DefaultValue_TEST_Computer_Verify default filter value is Tutti

Steps.Expected Result: No security breach occurs; UI remains responsive; special character search returns expected results or no results, SQL injection attempt does not expose data or cause errors.

test_cases.Dataset: Operator credentials; inputs: "' OR 1=1; --" and 'Calcio & Fútbol / Test'.

test_cases.Title: ModificaAnagraficaInvalid_XXX_AttoreAnagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Verify validation for invalid email

test_cases.Title: AccessoNonAutorizzato_XXX_AttoreAnagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Prevent viewing another user's profile

Steps.Step Description: Log in as a standard user A (username: userA, password: P@ssw0rdA).

Steps.Expected Result: System prevents access and returns HTTP 403 Forbidden or redirects to an 'Access Denied' or own profile page.

Steps.Expected Result: No PII of User B is exposed; backend response code is 403 or similar; UI shows appropriate access denied message.

Steps.Expected Result: API returns authentication/authorization error; user B data not returned.

test_cases.Title: ModificaAnagraficaMandatory_XXX_AttoreAnagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Verify mandatory field validation

Steps.Expected Result: Edit form is loaded with current values.

Steps.Step Description: Clear mandatory fields one at a time (for example clear 'Name' then attempt save), then attempt to save the form.
Steps.Expected Result: Client-side validation prevents submission and shows required-field error next to the empty field.

Steps.Step Description: Repeat clearing for other mandatory fields (e.g., Surname, Email) and attempt submission each time.
Steps.Expected Result: Each empty mandatory field triggers a validation error and prevents save until valid data is provided.

Steps.Step Description: Provide valid values back to all mandatory fields and save.
Steps.Expected Result: Save succeeds and changes are persisted only when all mandatory fields are valid and non-empty.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User exists and can edit profile. 2) List of mandatory fields available (Name, Surname, Email).

Steps.Expected Result: The new record creation form is displayed with empty fields for mandatory and optional attributes.

Steps.Step Description: Populate mandatory fields using test data (First Name: 'Mario', Last Name: 'Rossi', DOB: '1980-05-12', Tax ID: 'RSSMRA80M12H501X', Address: 'Via Roma 1, Milano'). Fill optional phone and email fields.
Steps.Expected Result: All entered values are visible in the form fields and input controls accept the provided values.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Save' (Salva) button to persist the record.
Steps.Expected Result: The system validates inputs, saves the new record, shows a success confirmation message, and assigns a unique record identifier.

Steps.Step Description: Search for the created record by Tax ID or by the assigned unique identifier in the Anagrafica list view.
Steps.Expected Result: The newly created record appears in the search results/list with all entered details matching the input data.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user exists with 'create' permission in Anagrafica. 2) Application and DB are available and reachable. 3) No duplicate Tax ID exists for the test data.
test_cases.Dataset: Firstname=Mario; Lastname=Rossi; DOB=1980-05-12; TaxID=RSSMRA80M12H501X; Address='Via Roma 1, Milano'; Phone=+39021234567; Email=m.rossi@example.com
test_cases.Expected Result: New anagrafica record is created successfully, visible in the list, and contains all entered data.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI-based creation of a single person record. Does not cover bulk import, downstream integrations or performance under load.

test_cases.Title: Mandatory_Fields_Validation_XXX_Anagrafica_Validation_TEST_Computer_Verify mandatory field validation

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica with a user having create/edit rights and open the new record form.
Steps.Expected Result: New record form is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to save the form without filling any fields (leave all mandatory fields empty) and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: System blocks save and shows validation messages indicating required fields (e.g., First Name, Last Name, Tax ID).

Steps.Step Description: Enter invalid formats in fields: Tax ID = 'ABC123', Email = 'notanemail', DOB = '31-02-2000' and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: System prevents save and displays field-specific validation errors for Tax ID format, email format, and invalid date.

Steps.Step Description: Enter maximum length strings in name fields (exceeding allowed length) and attempt save.
Steps.Expected Result: System enforces length constraints and shows corresponding error messages or truncates input per specification.

Steps.Step Description: Provide valid values for all mandatory fields and correct invalid formats, then click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Record is saved successfully and no validation errors are shown.

test_cases.Preconditions: User account with appropriate rights exists. Validation rules configured in environment as per requirements.
test_cases.Dataset: Empty input; TaxID_invalid=ABC123; Email_invalid=notanemail; DOB_invalid=31-02-2000; OverlengthName=string(500)
test_cases.Expected Result: System enforces mandatory and format validations; upon correction the record can be saved.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client-side and server-side validation; does not include validation messages localization checks.

test_cases.Title: Edit_Record_XXX_Anagrafica_Edit_TEST_Computer_Modify existing anagrafica record

Steps.Step Description: Log in and search for an existing test record (e.g., Tax ID 'RSSMRA80M12H501X').
Steps.Expected Result: The target record is located and displayed in the list.

Steps.Step Description: Open the record detail view and click 'Edit' (Modifica).
Steps.Expected Result: Record fields become editable and edit controls are enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Change editable fields (e.g., Address to 'Via Milano 10, Milano', Phone to '+39021230000') and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: The system validates changes, persists them, and displays a confirmation message.

Steps.Step Description: Re-open the record details or refresh the list and verify that the updated values are displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: Updated values are persisted and visible in UI; last-modified metadata (user/timestamp) reflects the change.

Steps.Step Description: Check audit/log view for the record to confirm that the edit action is recorded with previous and new values.
Steps.Expected Result: Audit log contains an entry for the edit with user, timestamp, and the changed field values.

test_cases.Preconditions: An existing record is present in the system that the test user can edit. Audit logging is enabled.
test_cases.Dataset: Existing TaxID=RSSMRA80M12H501X; NewAddress='Via Milano 10, Milano'; NewPhone=+39021230000
test_cases.Expected Result: Record is updated correctly, displayed changes match inputs, and audit log contains the change entry.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Does not cover permission escalation scenarios or downstream replication to other systems.

test_cases.Title: Delete_Record_XXX_Anagrafica_Delete_TEST_Computer_Remove anagrafica record

Steps.Step Description: Log in as a user with delete permission and locate the target record to delete in Anagrafica.
Steps.Expected Result: Target record is located and accessible for delete operation.

Steps.Step Description: Initiate the delete action by clicking 'Delete' (Elimina) and confirm the delete in the confirmation dialog.
Steps.Expected Result: System asks for confirmation and upon confirmation proceeds with deletion.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the record is no longer visible in the normal list and search results.
Steps.Expected Result: Record is removed from standard views; either fully deleted or moved to a 'deleted/archived' state depending on system design.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to delete a record that is referenced by another module (if available) to check referential constraint handling.
Steps.Expected Result: System blocks deletion and shows an informative error when referential integrity prevents delete OR performs soft delete per specification. No unhandled errors occur.

Steps.Step Description: If soft-delete is implemented, navigate to 'Deleted Records' or 'Recycle Bin' and restore the record; verify restoration.
Steps.Expected Result: Restored record returns to active list with previous data intact.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has delete permission. Test records include one standalone and one referenced record to validate both paths.
test_cases.Dataset: StandaloneRecordTaxID=DELTEST01; ReferencedRecordTaxID=REFTEST01
test_cases.Expected Result: System deletes or archives records per specification; referential constraints are enforced and restore (if present) functions correctly.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI delete and restore flows; does not cover batch deletion via APIs or deletion impact on external integrations.

test_cases.Title: Search_and_Filter_XXX_Anagrafica_Search_TEST_Computer_Verify search, filter and pagination

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica and navigate to the list/search view.
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica list and search/filter controls are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Perform a search by full name (e.g., 'Mario Rossi') using the search box and execute search.
Steps.Expected Result: Search returns records that match the full name; relevant columns show matching entries.

Steps.Step Description: Perform a search by partial name (e.g., 'Mar') and verify partial matching behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: System returns records containing the partial substring according to specification (starts-with or contains).

Steps.Step Description: Apply filters (e.g., Status = 'Active', City = 'Milano') and verify combined filtering results.
Steps.Expected Result: List is filtered combining criteria and only matching records are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify pagination by setting page size to a small number and navigating across pages; ensure consistent ordering.
Steps.Expected Result: Pagination works correctly, records are not duplicated/missing between pages, and order is stable or per specified sort.

Steps.Step Description: Export the filtered results to CSV/Excel (if export feature exists) and open the exported file to validate content.
Steps.Expected Result: Exported file downloads successfully and contains the same rows and columns as the filtered view.

test_cases.Preconditions: Multiple test records exist to exercise search, filter and pagination. Export feature enabled if required by spec.
test_cases.Dataset: Records: Mario Rossi (Milano), Maria Bianchi (Roma), Marco Verdi (Milano); PageSize=10; Filters=Status:Active; City=Milano
test_cases.Expected Result: Search and filter return correct records; pagination and export behave as specified.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI search/filter/pagination and export. Does not include advanced search syntax or API search endpoints.

test_cases.Title: Concurrent_Edit_XXX_Anagrafica_Concurrency_TEST_Computer_Validate concurrent editing handling

Steps.Step Description: Open two separate sessions (Session A and Session B) as two different users with edit rights and load the same existing record in both sessions.
Steps.Expected Result: Both sessions display the same current record values and can enter edit mode.

Steps.Step Description: In Session A, change a field (e.g., Phone) and save the record.
Steps.Expected Result: Session A save succeeds and the record is updated; a confirmation message is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: If the system prompts to reload, follow the prompt: reload record in Session B and re-apply intended edit, then save.
Steps.Expected Result: After reload changes from Session A are visible; Session B can re-apply and save changes; resulting record contains both permitted changes if merge allowed or only the latest consistent state per spec.

test_cases.Preconditions: Two user accounts available; target record exists; concurrency control mechanism is configured (optimistic/pessimistic) per system spec.
test_cases.Dataset: Existing TaxID=CONCTEST01; SessionAUser=userA; SessionBUser=userB
test_cases.Expected Result: System prevents silent overwrites: concurrent edits are handled according to specification (user notified and data integrity preserved).
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates UI-level concurrency handling only. Does not cover low-level DB transaction isolation testing or multi-node replication conflicts.

test_cases.Title: VerificaDescrizioneSport_XXX_REQ-BRAND-SP_FunzionalitaBrandSpagna_TEST_Computer_Verify sport description in Spanish displayed

Steps.Step Description: Ensure tester account exists with access to Brand Spain and valid credentials. Start the Backoffice web application and navigate to the login page.
Steps.Expected Result: Login page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Log in using a valid user account that is enabled for Brand Spain navigation (use credentials from Test Data).
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully authenticated and home/dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: From the main menu, navigate to 'Brand Configuration' for Brand: Spain and open language configuration.
Steps.Expected Result: Brand Configuration page for Spain is displayed and language supported is set to 'Spanish' and a fallback language is set.

Steps.Step Description: Open the Brand Master (BM) 'Sport' section and locate the target Sport entity that is expected to contain the description in Spanish.
Steps.Expected Result: The Sport entity is present in the BM Sport list and can be opened for details.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect the 'Description' field of the Sport entity and verify that a Spanish (es) description is present and populated.
Steps.Expected Result: A Spanish description text is present in the Description field; the language tag (if shown) indicates Spanish or content is clearly Spanish.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate the end-user view by navigating to the front-end area or preview that displays the Sport description for Brand Spain and view the Sport details.
Steps.Expected Result: The front-end displays the Sport description in Spanish (the supported language) for Brand Spain.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. Tester account is created and valid. B. The tester account is enabled for Brand Spain navigation. C. In Brand Configuration for Spain the supported language is set to Spanish and a fallback language is defined. D. The target Sport entity exists in Brand Master and contains a Spanish description.
test_cases.Dataset: User: spain_tester@example.com / Password: Test@123; Brand: Spain; Sport entity ID: SPORT-ES-001 (contains Spanish description)
test_cases.Expected Result: When all preconditions are met and the Sport entity contains a Spanish description, the Backoffice and front-end display the Sport description in Spanish for Brand Spain.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers presence and display of Spanish description; does not verify content correctness beyond presence or rendering.

test_cases.Title: VerificaDescrizioneSportFallback_XXX_REQ-BRAND-SP_FunzionalitaBrandSpagna_TEST_Computer_Verify fallback language used when Spanish missing

Steps.Step Description: Prepare test data: ensure the Brand Spain configuration lists Spanish as supported language and defines a fallback language (e.g., English). Ensure the target Sport entity in BM does NOT have a Spanish description but DOES have the fallback language description.
Steps.Expected Result: Brand configuration shows Spanish supported and fallback English. Sport entity exists with English description and no Spanish description.

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Backoffice with a user enabled for Brand Spain navigation.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and can access Brand Spain areas.

Steps.Step Description: Open the BM Sport entity details for the target sport and confirm Spanish description is absent and fallback (English) description is present.
Steps.Expected Result: Spanish description field is empty or missing; fallback (English) description is present and populated.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the front-end preview or user-facing page for Brand Spain and view the Sport details.
Steps.Expected Result: Since Spanish description is not available, the front-end displays the description in the configured fallback language (English).

Steps.Step Description: If the application provides language-labeling or metadata, verify that a note or language tag indicates fallback usage (optional).
Steps.Expected Result: Application either displays the fallback description without language tag or provides an explicit indication that fallback language is used.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. Tester account logged in. B. Tester enabled for Brand Spain. C. Brand Spain configured with Spanish supported and English fallback. D. Sport BM entity contains only English description (fallback) and no Spanish description.
test_cases.Dataset: User: spain_tester@example.com / Password: Test@123; Brand: Spain; Sport entity ID: SPORT-ES-002 (English description only)
test_cases.Expected Result: When Spanish description is missing, the system displays the Sport description in the configured fallback language (English) for Brand Spain.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates fallback behavior only; does not validate every possible fallback language or multi-fallback chains.

test_cases.Title: VerificaDescrizioneSportMancante_XXX_REQ-BRAND-SP_FunzionalitaBrandSpagna_TEST_Computer_Verify handling when description missing in both Spanish and fallback

Steps.Step Description: Prepare test data: Brand Spain configured with Spanish supported and English fallback. Ensure the target Sport entity in BM has neither a Spanish nor an English description.
Steps.Expected Result: Brand configuration shows Spanish supported and English fallback. Sport entity exists with no description for Spanish and no description for English.

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Backoffice with a user enabled for Brand Spain navigation and navigate to the BM Sport entity page.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and can open the Sport entity details page.

Steps.Step Description: Open the Sport entity and verify that the Description field is empty for both Spanish and fallback languages.
Steps.Expected Result: Description fields for Spanish and fallback languages are empty or not present.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the front-end preview or user-facing page for Brand Spain and open the Sport details view.
Steps.Expected Result: Front-end displays an appropriate placeholder or message indicating the description is not available (for example: 'Description not available' or the description area is hidden), and no untranslated or erroneous content is shown.

Steps.Step Description: Record the exact message or behavior shown to the end-user; verify it meets localization/usability expectations (no technical errors, no stack traces).
Steps.Expected Result: Application shows a user-friendly message or hides the description area; no errors, and behavior is consistent with product requirements.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. User logged in and enabled for Brand Spain. B. Brand Spain configured with Spanish supported and English fallback. C. Target Sport entity exists but lacks descriptions in both Spanish and fallback language.
test_cases.Dataset: User: spain_tester@example.com / Password: Test@123; Brand: Spain; Sport entity ID: SPORT-ES-003 (no descriptions)
test_cases.Expected Result: When neither Spanish nor fallback descriptions are present, the system should gracefully show a user-friendly 'description not available' message or hide the description, with no technical errors.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers missing-description scenario and front-end behavior; backend logging and admin notifications not covered.

test_cases.Title: VerificaAccessoBrandSpagna_XXX_REQ-BRAND-SP_FunzionalitaBrandSpagna_TEST_Computer_Verify access denied when user not enabled for Brand Spain

Steps.Step Description: Prepare a user account that is NOT enabled for navigation within Brand Spain; ensure the account exists and credentials are known.
Steps.Expected Result: User account exists and is disabled for Brand Spain navigation (permissions removed).

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Backoffice with the user account that is not enabled for Brand Spain.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and lands on the allowed landing/dashboard screen.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to navigate to Brand Configuration or the Brand Spain area (menu item or direct URL) using the application's navigation controls.
Steps.Expected Result: Access to Brand Spain area is denied: menu item is hidden/disabled or an authorization error/forbidden message is shown; user cannot reach Brand Spain configuration pages.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to directly access a known Sport BM entity URL belonging to Brand Spain (if direct link is possible) while logged in as the not-enabled user.
Steps.Expected Result: Direct access is blocked with an appropriate authorization error (e.g., 403 Forbidden) or application-level message indicating insufficient permissions; no sensitive data shown.

Steps.Step Description: Log out and log in again with a user that is enabled for Brand Spain to confirm that the area is accessible when permissions are present.
Steps.Expected Result: User enabled for Brand Spain can access Brand Configuration and Sport BM entity details; validates that restriction is based on user permission.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. Test user account without Brand Spain privileges exists. B. Another control user exists with Brand Spain privileges. C. Application is reachable.
test_cases.Dataset: User without access: no_spain_user@example.com / Password: Test@123; Control user: spain_admin@example.com / Password: Test@123
test_cases.Expected Result: Users not enabled for Brand Spain cannot access Brand Spain configuration or Sport BM entities; authorized users can access them. System returns appropriate UI or HTTP authorization responses.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates authorization gating for Brand Spain; does not validate role assignment workflows or audit logging.

test_cases.Title: RicercaTestuale_XXX_REQ_Search_SportSpagna_TEST_Desktop_VerificaTestualeContiene

Steps.Step Description: Aprire il browser web e navigare alla pagina principale dell'applicazione del Brand Spagna; accedere con credenziali valide se richiesto.
Steps.Expected Result: La pagina principale del Brand Spagna è visualizzata correttamente; l'utente è autenticato se necessario.

Steps.Step Description: Seguire il percorso del Caso d'uso 'Visualizza lista Sport' per navigare alla Sezione Sport del Brand Spagna (menu principale > Cataloghi > Sport o percorso equivalente).
Steps.Expected Result: L'Attore atterra correttamente nella Sezione Sport del Brand Spagna e la pagina lista Sport è visualizzata.

Steps.Step Description: Verificare che la Dropdown 'Associati BM' sia impostata su 'associati' come precondizione della ricerca.
Steps.Expected Result: La Dropdown 'Associati BM' è visibile e il valore selezionato è 'associati'.

Steps.Step Description: Nel campo filtro 'Descrizione o codice BM' inserire il testo di ricerca in modalità 'testuale contiene' (es. inserire 'fut' per cercare 'fútbol'); assicurarsi che la lingua usata sia supportata dal Brand Spagna (Spanish) o fallback alla lingua paracadute se applicabile.
Steps.Expected Result: Il testo 'fut' viene accettato nel campo e la modalità di ricerca testuale contiene è considerata dal sistema (input testo registrato).

Steps.Step Description: Premere il pulsante 'Avvia ricerca'.
Steps.Expected Result: La ricerca viene avviata e il sistema esegue il filtro sulla lista Sport.

Steps.Step Description: Verificare che nella lista dei risultati vengano mostrati tutti gli elementi la cui Descrizione o Codice BM contengono la stringa immessa ('fut').
Steps.Expected Result: Sono visualizzati solo gli elementi che contengono 'fut' nella Descrizione o nel Codice BM; gli elementi non pertinenti non sono mostrati.

Steps.Step Description: Verificare che per ogni elemento risultato siano presenti le colonne: Codice DGOJ, Descrizione DGOJ, Type, Assoc. BM, Visibile e che i valori in colonna siano coerenti.
Steps.Expected Result: La griglia dei risultati mostra le colonne Codice DGOJ, Descrizione DGOJ, Type, Assoc. BM, Visibile; i valori sono popolati correttamente per ogni riga.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Accesso all'applicazione disponibile; 2) L'utente ha permessi per visualizzare la Sezione Sport; 3) Il catalogo Sport contiene elementi con descrizioni in lingua Spagna; 4) Dropdown 'Associati BM' impostata su 'associati' o disponibile per la selezione.
test_cases.Dataset: Esempio testo ricerca (testuale contiene): 'fut' -> atteso match 'fútbol', 'futbol sala'; Brand: Spain; Dropdown: associati
test_cases.Expected Result: La ricerca testuale con modalità 'contiene' restituisce tutti gli sport la cui Descrizione o Codice BM contengono la stringa immessa; la lista mostra le colonne Codice DGOJ, Descrizione DGOJ, Type, Assoc. BM, Visibile.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso base – Esecuzione ricerca per 'testuale contiene'/ 'testuale inizia per'/'numerica contiene'
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Verifica ricerca testuale 'contiene' e la presenza/colonne dei risultati; non verifica paginazione o ordinamenti avanzati.

test_cases.Title: RicercaTestualeInizia_XXX_REQ_Search_SportSpagna_TEST_Desktop_VerificaTestualeIniziaPer

Steps.Step Description: Controllare che la Dropdown 'Associati BM' sia impostata su 'associati'.

test_cases.Title: RicercaNumerica_XXX_REQ_Search_SportSpagna_TEST_Desktop_VerificaNumericaIniziaPer

test_cases.Title: RicercaNessunRisultato_XXX_REQ_Search_SportSpagna_TEST_Desktop_VerificaNessunRisultato

Steps.Step Description: Aprire l'applicazione e navigare alla Sezione Sport del Brand Spagna.
Steps.Expected Result: Sezione Sport visualizzata correttamente.

Steps.Step Description: Assicurarsi che la Dropdown 'Associati BM' sia impostata su 'associati'.
Steps.Expected Result: Dropdown 'Associati BM' impostata su 'associati'.

Steps.Step Description: Inserire nel campo 'Descrizione o codice BM' una stringa che non corrisponde a nessun elemento presente (es. 'zzzxxyy') in modalità 'testuale contiene' o 'inizia per' a seconda della selezione.

Steps.Step Description: Premere 'Avvia ricerca'.

Steps.Step Description: Verificare la risposta dell'applicazione quando non ci sono elementi che soddisfano i criteri di ricerca.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Accesso all'applicazione; 2) L'insieme di dati di test non contiene elementi con la stringa di ricerca utilizzata; 3) Dropdown 'Associati BM' impostata su 'associati'.

test_cases.Title: RicercaPuntualeNumerica_XXX_REQ-Ricerca_BM_TEST_Desktop_VerifyExactNumericResult

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Backoffice application with a user who has search permissions.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and the Backoffice landing page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'BM Search' screen or module where 'Descrizione o codice BM' filter is available.
Steps.Expected Result: 'BM Search' screen is displayed with search filters including 'Descrizione o codice BM', 'Visibilità', 'Associati BM' and other filters.

Steps.Step Description: Set the search input mode for 'Descrizione o codice BM' to 'puntuale' (exact).

Steps.Expected Result: The system performs the search and the results grid is displayed.

Steps.Expected Result: Exactly the item with BM code '100200' is displayed in the results. The grid includes columns 'Codice DGOJ', 'Descrizione DGOJ', 'Type', 'Assoc. BM', 'Visibile' populated with correct values for the item.

Steps.Step Description: Select the found item to inspect details (if applicable).
Steps.Expected Result: Item details open (or are viewable) and correspond to the row values; no additional non-matching items are present.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user exists with search permissions. 2) At least one BM item with numeric code '100200' exists in the system. 3) Tester is connected to the test Backoffice environment.

test_cases.Expected Result: When searching in 'puntuale' mode with numeric code '100200', the system displays only the exact matching BM item and shows the columns Codice DGOJ, Descrizione DGOJ, Type, Assoc. BM, Visibile.

test_cases.Title: RicercaPuntualeNumerica_XXX_REQ-Ricerca_BM_TEST_Desktop_VerifyFiltersLockedAndImmutable

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Backoffice application with a user who has search permissions.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and the Backoffice landing page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'BM Search' screen and note the default state of 'Visibilità', 'Associati BM' and other filters.

Steps.Step Description: Set the search input mode for 'Descrizione o codice BM' to 'puntuale'.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the filter values and attempt to change 'Visibilità' from 'Tutti' to another value.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to change 'Associati BM' from 'Associati' to another value and attempt to enable other disabled filters.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Associati BM' remains 'Associati' and is not changeable; other filters remain locked/disabled and cannot be modified while 'puntuale' is active.

Steps.Step Description: Try to bypass UI locks (e.g., clear 'puntuale' mode or use keyboard) and change filters; then set 'puntuale' again to ensure consistent locking.
Steps.Expected Result: Filters only become editable again after 'puntuale' mode is explicitly turned off. Re-enabling 'puntuale' returns filters to 'Tutti'/'Associati' and re-locks them.

test_cases.Title: NoResultsContains_XXX_REQ-SEARCH-ALT_SearchFrontend_TEST_Computer_Verify no results message for text contains

Steps.Step Description: Use the UI control to return to the search criteria entry (e.g., click 'Modify search', 'Back to search' or the provided navigation that corresponds to returning to step 3 of the base search flow).

test_cases.Title: SearchNoResults_XXX_REQ-ALT-NORESULT_SearchModule_TEST_Computer_Verify no results displayed and return to search

test_cases.Title: SearchNoResultsMessage_XXX_REQ-ALT-NORESULT_UI_TEST_Computer_Verify message content accessibility and localization

test_cases.Title: SearchNoResults_RetryFlow_XXX_REQ-ALT-NORESULT_Flow_TEST_Computer_Verify return to step 2a.1 allows retry or modification

Steps.Expected Result: Search term is entered.

Steps.Step Description: Execute the search by pressing the 'Search' button.
Steps.Expected Result: The system performs the search and displays the no-results message/state.

Steps.Step Description: Click the UI control that implements the return to precise search (labelled e.g., 'Modifica ricerca', 'Riprova' or a Back arrow) as specified by the flow.
Steps.Expected Result: The application navigates back to the precise search screen corresponding to step 2a.1.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the state of the search input after returning: check whether the previous search term is preserved or cleared according to the product specification; attempt to edit the term and submit a new search.
Steps.Expected Result: Search input is editable. If spec requires preserving the term, the previous term remains; if spec requires clear, the field is empty. User can modify and submit a new search which triggers a new search request.

Steps.Step Description: Perform a new search using a valid term that is known to return results to confirm normal search flow resumes.
Steps.Expected Result: New search returns results and the results list is displayed, confirming that the application correctly returned to the precise search step and allowed retry.

test_cases.Expected Result: From the no-results state the user can return to the precise search step (2a.1), modify or retry the search, and a subsequent valid search returns results as expected.

test_cases.Title: ApplyFilterAssociatoBM_XXX_impostaFiltroAssociatoBM_FilterApp_TEST_Computer_VerifyOnlyAssociatedBMRecords

Steps.Step Description: Launch the web application and log in with a user that has permission to view the list of items containing 'Associato BM' attribute.

1) Tester has valid credentials with access to the list page.

test_cases.Title: RemoveFilterAssociatoBM_XXX_impostaFiltroAssociatoBM_FilterApp_TEST_Computer_VerifyFilterRemovalRestoresAllRecords

Steps.Step Description: Start from the list page with the 'Associato BM' filter already applied (precondition: filter active).

test_cases.Expected Result: After removal of the 'Associato BM' filter, the list displays the full set of records and UI reflects cleared filter state.

test_cases.Title: PersistFilterAssociatoBM_XXX_impostaFiltroAssociatoBM_FilterApp_TEST_Computer_VerifyPersistenceOnRefreshAndNavigation

Steps.Step Description: Log in and navigate to the list page; apply the 'Associato BM' filter.
Steps.Expected Result: Filter applied and results show only 'Associato BM' records.

Steps.Step Description: Refresh the browser page (F5) and wait for the page to reload.
Steps.Expected Result: After reload, the page should either retain the applied filter (if persistence is required) or show a cleared state depending on the requirement; for this test we verify defined behavior: filter persists.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away to another page in the app (e.g., dashboard) and then navigate back to the list page.
Steps.Expected Result: Upon returning to the list page, the 'Associato BM' filter remains applied and the results are still filtered.

Steps.Step Description: Log out and log back in with the same user and navigate to the list page.
Steps.Expected Result: Filter persistence across sessions is verified according to requirement: if requirement states persistence across sessions, filter is still applied; otherwise filter is cleared. This test expects persistence and verifies it.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1) Tester account exists and can log in.
2) Application supports filter persistence requirement (clarify requirement before test).
3) Test dataset includes 'Associato BM' records.
test_cases.Dataset: User session state; same dataset with known 'Associato BM' records
test_cases.Expected Result: Filter remains applied after page refresh, navigation away and back, and (if requirement) across user logout/login. If requirement says not persistent, expected result changes accordingly; this test verifies persistence behavior as defined.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers persistence scenarios on UI; does not cover server-side session storage validation beyond UI observation.

test_cases.Title: FilterAssociati_XXX_REQ_DGOJ_AssociatoBM_TEST_Computer_VerifyAssociatiIncludesDeprecated

Steps.Step Description: Confirm that non-associated entities (e.g., BM-NONASSOC-01) are not present in the results.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Backoffice Web Application (Brand Spain - Sport DGOJ)

test_cases.Title: FilterOptions_XXX_REQ_DGOJ_AssociatoBM_TEST_Computer_VerifyFilterOptionsAndBehavior

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Backoffice and open Brand Spain -> Sport DGOJ section with admin_spain_test account.

Steps.Expected Result: The dropdown lists exactly three options: 'Tutti', 'Associati', 'Non associati'.

Steps.Expected Result: Counts update accordingly: 'Associati' shows only associated, 'Non associati' only non-associated, and 'Tutti' shows combined set including deprecated entities. 'Tutti' count >= counts of individual filters and contains entries from both lists.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that deprecated/non-visible entities appear in lists for the appropriate selections (e.g., BM-DEPR-01 appears under 'Tutti' and under its correct association state).
Steps.Expected Result: Deprecated/non-visible entities appear in the results when their association state matches the filter or when 'Tutti' is selected.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to use a search or apply additional filters combined with 'Associato BM' (if supported) to ensure deprecated entities remain included in combined filter results.
Steps.Expected Result: When combining filters/search, deprecated entities that match all criteria are still included in results.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Backoffice Web Application (Brand Spain - Sport DGOJ)

test_cases.Expected Result: The filter dropdown contains 'Tutti', 'Associati', 'Non associati'. Filter combinations behave correctly and deprecated entities are included when matching criteria.
