test_cases.Title: ViewAnagrafica_XXX_UtenteAnagrafica_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_verify view personal data

Steps.Step Description: Open the web browser and navigate to the Anagrafica application URL.
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica application login page is displayed within expected load time.

Steps.Step Description: Log in using valid credentials for an account with role 'Utente Anagrafica' (username: utente.anagrafica@example.com, password: Password123!).
Steps.Expected Result: Login is successful and the user is redirected to the application home/dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: From the dashboard, click the 'Anagrafica' menu entry or direct link to open the personal data page.
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica page is opened and the header/title indicates it is the personal data registry.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the displayed personal data fields for the logged-in user (e.g., Full Name, Date of Birth, Address, Fiscal Code, Contact Phone, Email).
Steps.Expected Result: All expected personal fields are visible, populated with the correct data for the user, formatted correctly (dates, phone), and no sensitive fields are masked incorrectly.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that read-only fields are not editable and that any 'Edit' buttons are present only where permitted.
Steps.Expected Result: Fields that should be read-only cannot be edited; 'Edit' button is present only if the role permits editing.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test environment is up. 2) Test user account 'utente.anagrafica@example.com' exists with role 'Utente Anagrafica' and has pre-populated personal data. 3) Tester has network access and valid browser session. 4) No concurrent maintenance windows.
test_cases.Dataset: User: utente.anagrafica@example.com / Password123!; Expected user data: Name='Mario Rossi', DOB='1980-05-15', FiscalCode='RSSMRA80M15H501X', Phone='+39 0123456789'.
test_cases.Expected Result: User with role 'Utente Anagrafica' can access and view their personal data correctly; fields display correct values and read-only restrictions apply.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only view/display of personal data for the primary actor; does not include editing, validation rules, or audit logging.

test_cases.Title: EditAnagrafica_XXX_UtenteAnagrafica_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_update phone and address

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica web application as a user with 'Utente Anagrafica' role (utente.anagrafica@example.com / Password123!).
Steps.Expected Result: Login succeeds and user lands on dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Anagrafica' page and click the 'Edit' button for the personal data section.
Steps.Expected Result: Edit form is displayed with current personal data fields enabled for editing where permitted.

Steps.Step Description: Change the Phone field to '+39 0987654321' and the Address field to 'Via Nuova 10, 00100 Roma'.
Steps.Expected Result: The form accepts the input in the phone and address fields and shows the new values in the input controls.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Save' button to persist changes.
Steps.Expected Result: System validates inputs, shows a success confirmation (e.g., 'Data saved successfully') and returns to view mode with updated values.

Steps.Step Description: Reload the Anagrafica page or log out and log back in to verify persistence of changes.
Steps.Expected Result: The updated phone and address remain saved and are displayed correctly after reload or new session.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User account with edit permissions exists. 2) Tester is able to authenticate. 3) Back-end services and DB are available and writable.
test_cases.Dataset: User: utente.anagrafica@example.com; New Phone: +39 0987654321; New Address: Via Nuova 10, 00100 Roma
test_cases.Expected Result: User can edit permitted personal data fields; changes are validated, saved to the system, and persist across sessions.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers basic edit and save functionality for permitted fields; does not cover complex business rules or downstream integration side effects.

test_cases.Title: ValidationAnagrafica_XXX_UtenteAnagrafica_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_verify input validation rules

Steps.Step Description: Authenticate as 'Utente Anagrafica' (utente.anagrafica@example.com / Password123!) and open the Anagrafica edit form.
Steps.Expected Result: Edit form is accessible and current values are displayed in editable controls.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to enter an invalid Fiscal Code 'INVALIDCODE123' in the Fiscal Code field and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Client-side or server-side validation rejects the fiscal code and displays a relevant error message (e.g., 'Fiscal Code format invalid'). Save is blocked.

Steps.Step Description: Set Date of Birth to a future date (e.g., today's date + 30 days) and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: System displays validation error preventing future DOB (e.g., 'Date of Birth cannot be in the future') and prevents save.

Steps.Step Description: Enter an extremely long value exceeding allowed length into the Full Name field (e.g., 1024 characters) and attempt to save.
Steps.Expected Result: System enforces max length constraint and either truncates input with a warning or rejects input with error 'Maximum length exceeded'. Save is not successful.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a phone number with letters (e.g., 'ABC123') and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Validation error is shown for invalid phone format and save is blocked.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Edit permissions granted to the test account. 2) Validation rules are deployed in the environment. 3) No client-side caching interfering with form behavior.
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid fiscal code: INVALIDCODE123; Future DOB: 30 days ahead; Long name: string of 1024 'A' characters; Invalid phone: ABC123
test_cases.Expected Result: System enforces validation rules for Fiscal Code, Date of Birth, field length, and phone format; invalid inputs are rejected with clear messages and no changes are saved.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers common input validation rules only; edge-case rules and localization-specific validations may not be covered.

test_cases.Title: UnauthorizedAccessAnagrafica_XXX_UtenteAnagrafica_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_block unauthorised user

Steps.Step Description: Log in using credentials of a user without 'Utente Anagrafica' role (e.g., other.role@example.com / Password123!).
Steps.Expected Result: Login succeeds for the other-role account and dashboard is displayed for that user.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to navigate directly to the Anagrafica page using the UI link or by entering the Anagrafica URL in the browser address bar.
Steps.Expected Result: Access is denied: system either hides the menu option or returns an authorization error/redirect (HTTP 403 or redirect to 'Access Denied' page).

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to call Anagrafica API endpoint (e.g., GET /api/anagrafica/{userId}) with the other-role user's session token via a REST client.
Steps.Expected Result: API returns 403 Forbidden (or equivalent) and does not expose personal data for the target user.

Steps.Step Description: Verify error messages do not leak sensitive information and that the UI provides a generic 'Access Denied' message.
Steps.Expected Result: Error message is generic, does not reveal system internals, and provides next steps (e.g., 'Contact administrator').

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) A user account without Anagrafica permissions exists (other.role@example.com). 2) The authorization system is active. 3) Tester has API access for request checks.
test_cases.Dataset: Other role user credentials: other.role@example.com / Password123!; Target API endpoint: /api/anagrafica/{userId}
test_cases.Expected Result: Users without the 'Utente Anagrafica' role cannot access the Anagrafica UI or API; attempts result in proper authorization errors without sensitive info leakage.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates authorization enforcement for UI and API level; does not cover role management workflows.

test_cases.Title: AuditLogAnagrafica_XXX_UtenteAnagrafica_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_verify audit trail for changes

Steps.Step Description: Log in as 'Utente Anagrafica' (utente.anagrafica@example.com / Password123!) and navigate to the Anagrafica edit form.
Steps.Expected Result: Edit form is accessible and current values are visible.

Steps.Step Description: Modify one or more permitted fields (e.g., change Phone from '+39 0123456789' to '+39 0987654321') and save the changes.
Steps.Expected Result: Changes are saved and success confirmation is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Open the Audit/History section in the UI (or query audit API / database audit table) to retrieve the latest audit entries for the user record.
Steps.Expected Result: A new audit entry exists with the timestamp, the acting user identifier, the changed fields, previous and new values, and an action type 'UPDATE'.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the audit entry contains acceptable timestamp format, correct username, and that no sensitive full values are exposed in plain text beyond permitted scope.
Steps.Expected Result: Audit entry metadata is correct (timestamp, username, action) and field-level change details are recorded; sensitive data handling complies with policy (e.g., partial masking if required).

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to modify data and verify that concurrent modifications create separate audit entries and that sequence is consistent.
Steps.Expected Result: Each save results in a distinct audit record with a chronological order; no audit entries are missing for successful updates.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Anagrafica Web Application v1.0, Audit DB/table configured
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Audit logging is enabled in the environment. 2) Tester has permission to view audit records or DB read access. 3) Test user exists and can perform updates.
test_cases.Dataset: User: utente.anagrafica@example.com; Change: Phone +39 0123456789 -> +39 0987654321; Audit API endpoint: /api/audit/anagrafica/{userId}
test_cases.Expected Result: All updates to personal data produce correct audit entries recording user, timestamp, fields changed, old and new values, and action type; audit sequence is consistent for concurrent updates.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates creation and content of audit records for updates; retention, archival, and advanced compliance scenarios not covered.

test_cases.Title: BrandSpainNavigation_XXX_PRECOND_BrandNavigation_TEST_Smartphone_verify navigation to Brand Spain when user is logged and enabled

test_cases.Title: FiltroAssociatoBM_XXX_ASSOCIATO_BM_Sport_DGOJ_TEST_Desktop_VerifyOnlyAssociatiDisplayed

Steps.Step Description: Open the Brand Spain web application home page and navigate to the Sports section following the 'Visualizza lista Sport' base path.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the page corresponds to the DGOJ Sports section (presence of DGOJ header/label or badge).

test_cases.Title: SelectMaxItems_XXX_seleziona-numero-massimi_tabella-Sport_TEST_Computer_select-100-items

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application and navigate to the Sports management page (URL: https://app.example/sports).
Steps.Expected Result: Sports page loads successfully and the Sports table is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the page size control (dropdown or selector) is present near the Sports table and click it to open available options.
Steps.Expected Result: Page size control opens and displays the available options (e.g., 10, 25, 50, 100).

Steps.Step Description: Select the maximum available value '100' from the page size control.
Steps.Expected Result: The control accepts the selection and changes to show '100' as the selected page size.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the Sports table after selecting '100' and wait until data reload completes.
Steps.Expected Result: The Sports table displays up to 100 rows on the first page; loading indicator (if any) disappears and no JS errors occur.

Steps.Step Description: Verify pagination area and total items indicator (if shown) reflect that up to 100 items are shown per page.
Steps.Expected Result: Pagination updates correctly (fewer pages if page size increased) and the total-items label (e.g., 'Showing 1-100 of N') is consistent with the data.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user 'test_user' exists and is logged in with permissions to view Sports page. 2) The Sports list contains >=100 items. 3) Network connection is stable. 4) Browser cache cleared or in known state.
test_cases.Dataset: URL: https://app.example/sports; user: test_user / Pass123; expected page size options: [10,25,50,100]; dataset includes at least 150 sports entries.
test_cases.Expected Result: Selecting the maximum page size (100) displays up to 100 rows in the Sports table, updates pagination correctly, and the UI remains stable without errors.
test_cases._polarion: Caso d'uso: seleziona il numero di elementi massimi della tabella degli Sport

test_cases.Title: SelectMaxItems_XXX_seleziona-numero-massimi_tabella-Sport_TEST_Computer_selection-persistence-after-navigation

Steps.Step Description: Open the Sports page and ensure the default page size is known (e.g., 25).
Steps.Expected Result: Sports page is displayed and current page size is visible (e.g., 25).

Steps.Step Description: Change the page size to the maximum option (100) using the page size control.
Steps.Expected Result: Page size control shows '100' and table updates to display up to 100 rows.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to another section of the application (e.g., click on 'Home' or 'Dashboard') and wait for the page to load.
Steps.Expected Result: Navigation succeeds and target page loads correctly.

Steps.Step Description: Return to the Sports page (via menu or back button) and observe the page size control value.
Steps.Expected Result: The page size control still shows '100' (persistence in session/local storage or user preference) and the table displays up to 100 rows.

Steps.Step Description: Refresh the browser while on the Sports page and verify the selected page size remains.
Steps.Expected Result: After refresh, page size remains '100' and table displays up to 100 rows (if persistence required by spec).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User is logged in. 2) Sports page contains >=100 items. 3) Application is configured to persist page size in session or local storage as per requirement.
test_cases.Dataset: User: test_user; dataset size: >=150 items; browsers: Chrome, Firefox
test_cases.Expected Result: Selected maximum page size persists across navigation and page reloads according to the persistence policy (session/local storage or user preference).
test_cases._polarion: Caso d'uso: seleziona il numero di elementi massimi della tabella degli Sport
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates client-side persistence only; does not verify persistence across different devices or long-term user preference stored on server.

test_cases.Title: SelectMaxItems_XXX_seleziona-numero-massimi_tabella-Sport_TEST_Computer_invalid-high-value-is-capped

Steps.Step Description: Open the Sports page and confirm the page size control is present with known allowed options (e.g., max = 100).
Steps.Expected Result: Page size control displays allowed options and max is identified as 100.

Steps.Step Description: Using the browser developer console, attempt to set the page size value programmatically to an invalid large number (e.g., set dropdown value to 1000 and trigger change event).
Steps.Expected Result: The page processes the change event without throwing unhandled JS errors.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the page size control and table after the attempt to set 1000.
Steps.Expected Result: The application caps the value to the maximum allowed (100) or rejects the invalid value and reverts to previous safe value. No crash or display corruption occurs.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect network calls (if applicable) to ensure server received a valid page-size limit (<=100) and returned a valid response.
Steps.Expected Result: Any request sent uses a page size <=100. Server responds with valid data and no errors.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User is logged in and on Sports page. 2) Tester has access to browser developer tools. 3) Max allowed page size per spec is 100.
test_cases.Dataset: User: test_user; attempt value: 1000 (invalid); allowed max: 100
test_cases.Expected Result: Application rejects or caps invalid high page-size values to the documented maximum (100) without errors or unpredictable behavior.
test_cases._polarion: Caso d'uso: seleziona il numero di elementi massimi della tabella degli Sport
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client-side validation and basic server request validation; does not perform in-depth security testing of tampered payloads.

test_cases.Title: Create Anagrafica_XXX_REQ-ANAG-001_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_create a new anagrafica record

Steps.Step Description: Open the workstation and launch the Anagrafica Backoffice application. Log in with a user having 'Create' privileges (username: test.creator, password: Test@123).
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica Backoffice application opens and user is logged in successfully to the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: From the main menu, navigate to 'Anagrafica' -> 'Manage Persons' and click the 'New' or 'Create' button.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Create New Person' form is displayed with fields for Name, Surname, Date of Birth, Fiscal Code, Email, Phone, Address and Save/Cancel buttons.

Steps.Step Description: Fill in the form using test data: Name: 'Mario', Surname: 'Rossi', Date of Birth: '1980-05-20', Fiscal Code: 'RSSMRA80E20H501U', Email: 'mario.rossi.test@example.com', Phone: '+39061234567', Address: 'Via Roma 1, Milano'.
Steps.Expected Result: All entered values are accepted by the form controls and visible in the UI fields.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Save' button to persist the new record.
Steps.Expected Result: The application confirms successful creation (toast/confirmation message) and returns to the list view with the new record present.

Steps.Step Description: Search the list for Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA80E20H501U' or for 'Mario Rossi' and open the created record details.
Steps.Expected Result: The created record is listed and details view shows the exact data entered. Creation timestamp and created-by user are recorded in audit fields.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test environment available and reachable. 2) Test user 'test.creator' exists with Create permissions. 3) No existing record with Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA80E20H501U'. 4) Database connectivity present.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials: test.creator/Test@123; New person data as in steps
test_cases.Expected Result: A new anagrafica (person) record is successfully created, visible in lists and details, and audit metadata set.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers creation via Backoffice UI only; bulk-import, API-based creation and role/permission matrix not covered.

test_cases.Title: Update Anagrafica_XXX_REQ-ANAG-002_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_update existing anagrafica record

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica Backoffice with a user that has 'Edit' privileges (username: test.editor, password: Edit@123).
Steps.Expected Result: User logs in successfully and main dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Search for an existing person record using Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA80E20H501U' (created in TC-ANAG-001) and open the record in edit mode by clicking 'Edit'.
Steps.Expected Result: The person record is displayed in edit mode with current values populated in the form.

Steps.Step Description: Modify the Phone to '+390698765432' and Email to 'm.rossi.updated@example.com'.
Steps.Expected Result: Changed values appear correctly in the editable fields and are validated inline by the UI.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' to persist changes.
Steps.Expected Result: Application shows a success confirmation and returns to the details/list view where updated values are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Re-open the person details and verify that Phone and Email reflect the updated values and that 'Last Modified By' and 'Last Modified At' fields updated.
Steps.Expected Result: Updated values are persisted, and audit fields display the editor user and a recent timestamp.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user 'test.editor' exists with Edit privileges. 2) Target record with Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA80E20H501U' exists. 3) Network and DB available.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials: test.editor/Edit@123; Existing record fiscal code and updated field values
test_cases.Expected Result: Record updates are saved and visible; audit metadata updated accordingly.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers single-record update flow via UI; concurrent edit conflict resolution and API updates not covered.

test_cases.Title: Delete Anagrafica_XXX_REQ-ANAG-003_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_delete an anagrafica record

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica Backoffice with a user that has 'Delete' privileges (username: test.deleter, password: Delete@123).
Steps.Expected Result: User authenticates and dashboard is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Locate the person record with Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA80E20H501U' in the list using search or direct navigation.
Steps.Expected Result: The target record is displayed in the listing.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Delete' action for the record. In the confirmation modal, verify the summary of the record to be deleted and click 'Confirm'.
Steps.Expected Result: A deletion confirmation modal shows correct record summary; after confirming, the system processes the deletion.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the record no longer appears in the list when searching by fiscal code and that a deletion audit entry exists (if audit accessible).
Steps.Expected Result: Record is removed from active list; search returns no results for the fiscal code. If soft-delete implemented, record marked as inactive; if hard-delete implemented, record absent from DB.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user 'test.deleter' exists with Delete privileges. 2) Target record (RSSMRA80E20H501U) exists. 3) Backup/restore procedures in place for test data if needed.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials: test.deleter/Delete@123; Target fiscal code
test_cases.Expected Result: Record deletion succeeds and record is no longer accessible in the active list; deletion audit recorded if applicable.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI-triggered delete and immediate list behavior; bulk delete, archival retention policies and full DB-level validation not covered.

test_cases.Title: Validation Anagrafica_XXX_REQ-ANAG-004_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_mandatory and format validation on create

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica Backoffice as a user with Create privileges (test.creator/Test@123) and open the 'Create New Person' form.
Steps.Expected Result: Create form is displayed and ready for input.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to save the form with all mandatory fields empty and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: The system prevents saving and displays validation messages for each mandatory field (e.g., Name, Surname, Fiscal Code).

Steps.Step Description: Enter an invalid Fiscal Code 'INVALID123' and invalid Email 'not-an-email' and attempt to save.
Steps.Expected Result: Field-level validation messages indicate fiscal code format invalid and email format invalid; save is blocked until corrected.

Steps.Step Description: Enter boundary values: Name length 1 character and maximum allowed length (e.g., 255 chars) for Surname and verify acceptance/rejection accordingly.
Steps.Expected Result: System accepts minimum length if within business rules and either truncates or rejects input exceeding max length with a clear error message per field.

Steps.Step Description: Provide duplicate Fiscal Code that already exists in system and attempt to save.
Steps.Expected Result: System detects duplicate fiscal code and shows a uniqueness constraint error preventing save.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user with Create privileges available. 2) At least one existing record in DB to test duplicate detection.
test_cases.Dataset: Various invalid and boundary inputs (empty, 'INVALID123', 'not-an-email', duplicate fiscal code)
test_cases.Expected Result: Form enforces mandatory fields, format validations, and uniqueness constraints; appropriate error messages shown and save prevented for invalid input.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client-side and server-side validation for the Create flow; localization of error messages and accessibility validation not covered.

test_cases.Title: Search and Filter Anagrafica_XXX_REQ-ANAG-005_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_search filter sort pagination behavior

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica Backoffice (test.viewer/View@123) and navigate to the 'Manage Persons' list view.
Steps.Expected Result: List view displays with search box, filter panel, column headers and pagination controls.

Steps.Step Description: Perform a simple search by entering partial surname 'Ros' and click Search.
Steps.Expected Result: Results list shows only records whose surname contains the partial string 'Ros' (case-insensitive).

Steps.Step Description: Apply combined filters: Date of Birth range (1970-01-01 to 1990-12-31) and Location 'Milano' and apply filters.
Steps.Expected Result: List updates to show only records matching both filters; count reflects filtered results and pagination updates accordingly.

Steps.Step Description: Sort results by Surname ascending and verify the order, then switch to descending and verify.
Steps.Expected Result: Records are ordered correctly by surname in ascending and descending order respectively.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to next page using pagination and verify consistent results; then clear filters and verify full list restored.
Steps.Expected Result: Pagination moves to next page showing the next subset of records. Clearing filters returns to unfiltered list and resets pagination to first page.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user exists with view privileges. 2) Dataset contains sufficient records spanning date ranges and locations to validate filters and pagination.
test_cases.Dataset: Multiple person records with varying surnames, DOBs and locations (e.g., many 'Rossi' and 'Rossi' variations; DOB between 1960-2000; locations including Milano).
test_cases.Expected Result: Search, filters, sorting and pagination work together correctly and produce consistent, reproducible results.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI list search/filter/sort/pagination interactions; performance under large datasets and export of filtered results not covered.

test_cases.Title: AccessBrandSpain_XXX_PRECOND_A-B_AppAndroid_TEST_Mobile_SuccessfulNavigationWhenLoggedAndEnabled

Steps.Step Description: Ensure device is powered on, network is available and the App Android is installed. Launch the application.
Steps.Expected Result: Application launches successfully and displays the initial screen or splash screen.

Steps.Step Description: On the app login screen, enter valid username 'user_spain@example.com' and valid password 'P@ssw0rd' and tap 'Login'.
Steps.Expected Result: Login completes successfully and user is redirected to the application home/dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the logged-in user's profile/roles indicate the user is enabled for Brand Spain (role: 'SpainUser' or equivalent).
Steps.Expected Result: Profile/roles show the user has Spain navigation entitlement (SpainUser role present).

Steps.Step Description: From the home/dashboard navigate to Brand selection or directly attempt to access a Spain brand page/section (e.g., tap 'Brands' then select 'Spain' or open a Spain-specific URL/resource inside the app).
Steps.Expected Result: Brand Spain appears in the list and the Spain-specific pages/sections are accessible (pages load, content visible).

Steps.Step Description: Perform basic interactions on Spain brand pages (open an article/product page, navigate between Spain brand sub-sections).
Steps.Expected Result: Interactions succeed; pages render with Spain-specific content and no access errors are shown.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. The actor is correctly logged into the application. B. The actor is enabled for navigation within Brand Spain (has Spain navigation entitlement). Device has network connectivity.
test_cases.Dataset: User: user_spain@example.com, Password: P@ssw0rd, Role: SpainUser; Device: Android 13
test_cases.Expected Result: When preconditions A and B are satisfied (user logged in and enabled for Brand Spain) the user can successfully navigate to and interact with Brand Spain pages without access restrictions.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers navigation access gating for Brand Spain and basic page rendering; does not cover backend entitlement provisioning or audit logging.

test_cases.Title: AccessBrandSpain_XXX_PRECOND_A_AppAndroid_TEST_Mobile_BlockedWhenNotLoggedIn

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the device is powered on, network is available and the App Android is installed. Launch the application and ensure no user is logged in (log out if necessary).
Steps.Expected Result: Application launches to login or anonymous entry point and no user session is active.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access Brand Spain content by selecting 'Brands' -> 'Spain' or by entering a Spain-specific deep link/URL within the app while not logged in.
Steps.Expected Result: The application blocks access to Spain content and either redirects to the login screen or displays an appropriate message indicating authentication is required.

Steps.Step Description: On the presented login screen (or access denied message), verify the message text and available actions (e.g., 'Login' button, 'Cancel').
Steps.Expected Result: A clear message is shown such as 'Please log in to access this content' and the login action is available to proceed; no Spain content is displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions: User must not be logged into the application (Precondition A is intentionally not met). Device has network connectivity.
test_cases.Dataset: Anonymous user (no credentials entered); Device: Android 13
test_cases.Expected Result: When the actor is not logged in (precondition A not met), access to Brand Spain is blocked and the system prompts the user to authenticate; Spain content is not accessible.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates authentication gating only; does not validate post-login entitlement assignment or login credential correctness beyond basic login prompt presence.

test_cases.Title: AccessBrandSpain_XXX_PRECOND_B_AppAndroid_TEST_Mobile_BlockedWhenNotEnabledForSpain

Steps.Step Description: Ensure device is powered on, network is available and the App Android is installed. Launch the application and log in with a valid account 'user_nonspain@example.com' / 'P@ssw0rd2'.
Steps.Expected Result: Login completes successfully and the user is redirected to the application home/dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the logged-in user's profile/roles indicate the user is NOT enabled for Brand Spain (SpainUser role absent).
Steps.Expected Result: Profile/roles do not contain Spain navigation entitlement; confirmation that user lacks Spain access.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to navigate to Brand Spain content by selecting 'Brands' -> 'Spain' or using a Spain deep link inside the app.
Steps.Expected Result: The application prevents access to Spain content and displays an access-denied message or hides/omits Spain from the Brand list.

Steps.Step Description: If an access-denied message is shown, verify the exact message text and any available remediation actions (e.g., 'Contact support', 'Request access').
Steps.Expected Result: A clear access-denied message is present (e.g., 'You do not have permissions to access Brand Spain') and appropriate remediation actions are visible where applicable.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. The actor is logged into the application. B. The actor is NOT enabled for navigation within Brand Spain (Spain entitlement not assigned). Device has network connectivity.
test_cases.Dataset: User: user_nonspain@example.com, Password: P@ssw0rd2, Role: StandardUser (no Spain entitlement); Device: Android 13
test_cases.Expected Result: When the actor is logged in but not enabled for Brand Spain (precondition B not met), the system prevents navigation to Spain and shows an access-denied response; Spain content remains inaccessible.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Tests authorization gating for Brand Spain; does not validate entitlement assignment workflows or administrator UI changes.

test_cases.Title: SelectMaxItems_XXX_REQ-SPORTS-001_SportsSection_TEST_Computer_verify default 50 on load

Steps.Step Description: Open the Brand Spain website in a supported browser and navigate to the Sports section following the 'Visualizza lista Sport' base path.
Steps.Expected Result: The Sports DGOJ section for Brand Spain is displayed and the sport list page is loaded.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the 'items per page' dropdown (as shown in Figure 5) on the sports list table without interacting with it.
Steps.Expected Result: The dropdown is visible and the default selected value is '50'.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the number of rows currently displayed in the sports table.
Steps.Expected Result: Up to 50 rows are displayed in the table (if total records >= 50). If total records < 50, all available records are displayed and count equals total records.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application - Brand Spain (DGOJ) Sports Section
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has network access to the Brand Spain web environment in UAT; 2) The Sports list data is loaded and accessible; 3) Tester follows the base navigation from 'Visualizza lista Sport' and arrives at Sports DGOJ section.
test_cases.Dataset: No specific user credentials required; sports dataset present in UAT with >= 50 records (if available).
test_cases.Expected Result: On initial load the 'items per page' control shows '50' and the table displays up to 50 entries (or all entries if total < 50).
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers default selection and displayed row count on initial page load; does not validate server-side pagination API performance or sorting/filter interactions.

test_cases.Title: SelectMaxItems_XXX_REQ-SPORTS-001_SportsSection_TEST_Computer_set items to 25 and verify grid update

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Brand Spain Sports DGOJ section and ensure the sports table is visible.
Steps.Expected Result: Sports table and the 'items per page' dropdown are visible.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'items per page' dropdown and select the value '25'.
Steps.Expected Result: The dropdown selection changes to '25' and the selection is accepted by the UI.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the sports table and count the number of rows displayed after selection.
Steps.Expected Result: The table updates and displays up to 25 rows. If total records < 25 then table shows all available records.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the next page of the table (if more records exist) and verify that the pagination behaves correctly with page size 25.
Steps.Expected Result: Pagination controls reflect page size 25 and records on subsequent pages are consistent without duplication or missing rows.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application - Brand Spain (DGOJ) Sports Section
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Sports list is available; 2) At least 30 records exist to verify pagination across pages (for full validation of step 4).
test_cases.Dataset: Sports dataset with >=30 records recommended for full pagination verification.
test_cases.Expected Result: After selecting 25 the grid updates to show up to 25 rows per page and pagination controls behave accordingly.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates client-side update of visible rows and pagination for selection 25; backend consistency and load not covered.

test_cases.Title: SelectMaxItems_XXX_REQ-SPORTS-001_SportsSection_TEST_Computer_set items to 75 and verify grid update

Steps.Step Description: Open the Sports DGOJ section of Brand Spain and ensure the sports table with pagination controls is visible.
Steps.Expected Result: Sports table and 'items per page' dropdown are visible.

Steps.Step Description: Open the dropdown and select '75' as the maximum number of elements to display.
Steps.Expected Result: Dropdown shows '75' as selected and the selection event is triggered.

Steps.Step Description: Count the number of rows displayed in the table after the selection completes.
Steps.Expected Result: The table displays up to 75 rows. If total records < 75, then all available records are shown.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm the table responsiveness and vertical scroll behavior when 75 rows are displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: Table remains usable: scrolling is possible and no UI layout break occurs; rows are readable and controls are accessible.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application - Brand Spain (DGOJ) Sports Section
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Sports data accessible; 2) Recommended dataset with >=75 records for complete verification.
test_cases.Dataset: Sports dataset; ideally >=75 records to fully populate page.
test_cases.Expected Result: Table updates to show up to 75 rows and UI remains usable and consistent.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI behavior when showing 75 items; performance under heavy DOM load not included.

test_cases.Title: SelectMaxItems_XXX_REQ-SPORTS-001_SportsSection_TEST_Computer_set items to 100 and verify grid update

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Brand Spain Sports DGOJ section and locate the items-per-page dropdown.
Steps.Expected Result: Items-per-page dropdown is visible and active.

Steps.Step Description: Select '100' from the dropdown options (options available: 25, 50, 75, 100).
Steps.Expected Result: The dropdown updates to '100' and selection is accepted by the client.

Steps.Step Description: Wait for the grid to refresh and then count displayed rows.
Steps.Expected Result: Up to 100 rows are displayed. If total records < 100, table shows all available records.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that selecting 100 does not break other table features (sorting, filters, action buttons) and that the UI remains responsive.
Steps.Expected Result: Sorting and filters continue to work and UI remains responsive; no visual regressions on table layout.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application - Brand Spain (DGOJ) Sports Section
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Sports table accessible; 2) Test environment should contain enough records (>=100) if possible to validate full page population.
test_cases.Dataset: Sports dataset; >=100 records recommended to fully verify UI with 100 rows.
test_cases.Expected Result: After selecting 100 the grid updates and up to 100 rows are visible; other table features remain functional.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates client-side rendering with 100 rows; does not include stress or performance testing of rendering large DOM.

test_cases.Title: SelectMaxItems_XXX_REQ-SPORTS-001_SportsSection_TEST_Computer_set items greater than total records and verify behavior

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Sports DGOJ section in Brand Spain and confirm the total number of available sports records (displayed via total count indicator if present).
Steps.Expected Result: Total record count is visible or can be inferred; note the total number of records (example: 18).

Steps.Step Description: Open the 'items per page' dropdown and select a value greater than the total count (e.g., select 25 when total = 18).
Steps.Expected Result: Dropdown selection changes to the chosen value and the client accepts the change.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the table after selection and count visible rows.
Steps.Expected Result: The table displays exactly the total number of available records (18 in example), not empty rows or placeholders; no errors occur.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm pagination controls adapt (if present) and do not allow empty pages beyond the available data.
Steps.Expected Result: Pagination shows a single page with all available records and next/previous controls are disabled or hidden appropriately.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application - Brand Spain (DGOJ) Sports Section
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Sports dataset in UAT contains fewer records than the selected dropdown option (e.g., total < 25); 2) Sports page reachable.
test_cases.Dataset: Sports dataset with total record count less than 25 to validate behavior when selected page size exceeds total records.
test_cases.Expected Result: When selecting a page size greater than total records the grid displays all available records (no empty rows) and pagination adjusts accordingly.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI behavior when requested page size exceeds total records; does not test server-side intent to return fewer records.

test_cases.Title: ScorrimentoPagine_XXX_REQ_DGOJ_SportsTable_TEST_Computer_Scroll next and previous pages

Steps.Step Description: Open the DGOJ web application in a supported browser and navigate to the 'Tabella degli Sport' page.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Tabella degli Sport' page is displayed with the paginated table visible and pagination controls (Next, Previous, page numbers) present.

Steps.Step Description: Observe current page number and note visible rows per page (e.g., 10 rows).
Steps.Expected Result: Current page is highlighted (e.g., page 1) and the number of rows equals the configured rows per page.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Next' pagination control once.
Steps.Expected Result: Table updates showing the next set of rows and the highlighted current page increments by 1; URL (if paginated via query) updates to reflect new page (e.g., ?page=2) or state updates accordingly.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Previous' pagination control.
Steps.Expected Result: Table returns to the previous set of rows and the highlighted current page decrements by 1; URL or state updates accordingly.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that table headers and row structure remain consistent after navigation.
Steps.Expected Result: Table headers remain visible and each row contains expected columns; no row data corruption or UI displacement occurs.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1) Tester has access to the test environment.
2) 'Tabella degli Sport' contains at least 3 pages of data (minimum 25 items with 10 rows per page configured).
3) Network connectivity is available.
4) Browser cache cleared or in a clean state before test.
test_cases.Dataset: Test environment dataset containing at least 25 sport records; default rowsPerPage=10.
test_cases.Expected Result: User can navigate forward and backward through pages using Next and Previous controls; table content and page indicator update correctly.
test_cases._polarion: Caso d'uso: scorre pagine della Tabella degli Sport DGOJ
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers basic Next/Previous pagination functionality and UI stability; does not cover deep link/bookmark behavior or backend pagination APIs.

test_cases.Title: JumpToPage_XXX_REQ_DGOJ_SportsTable_TEST_Computer_Jump to specific page by number

Steps.Step Description: Open the 'Tabella degli Sport' page in the test environment and confirm pagination controls with page numbers are visible.
Steps.Expected Result: Pagination control displays page numbers (e.g., 1,2,3,...) and current page is indicated.

Steps.Step Description: Click on a non-adjacent page number (e.g., page 3) in the pagination control.
Steps.Expected Result: Table updates to display data for the selected page (page 3) and that page number becomes highlighted; URL or state reflects the selected page.

Steps.Step Description: Directly enter a page number in a page input control if available (or change page query parameter manually in URL to ?page=2) and submit/refresh.
Steps.Expected Result: Application navigates to the requested page and displays correct rows for that page; invalid numbers are handled (see negative case TC-003).

Steps.Step Description: Verify that selecting a page number preserves any active filters or sorting applied to the table.
Steps.Expected Result: Filters and sort state remain applied after navigation; returned rows reflect filters and sort order.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1) Dataset contains at least 3 pages of results.
2) If filters/sorts are used in step 4, they are applied before jumping pages.
test_cases.Dataset: Dataset with 30 sport records; existing filters: category=TeamSports; sort=date desc.
test_cases.Expected Result: Page jump via numbered controls and direct page input navigates correctly and preserves table state.
test_cases._polarion: Caso d'uso: scorre pagine della Tabella degli Sport DGOJ
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers navigation via page numbers and direct page parameter; does not validate server-side analytics or deep linking beyond query param.

test_cases.Title: BoundaryPages_XXX_REQ_DGOJ_SportsTable_TEST_Computer_First and last page behavior

Steps.Step Description: Open 'Tabella degli Sport' and navigate to the first page (page 1).
Steps.Expected Result: First page is displayed and 'Previous' control is disabled or not actionable.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to click the 'Previous' control on the first page.
Steps.Expected Result: No navigation occurs; control either disabled or application remains on page 1 and no error is thrown.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the last available page via page numbers or repeatedly using 'Next' until the last page is reached.
Steps.Expected Result: Last page data is displayed and 'Next' control is disabled or not actionable; page indicator equals last page number.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to click the 'Next' control on the last page.
Steps.Expected Result: No navigation occurs; control is disabled or application remains on last page without error.

Steps.Step Description: If an input accepts page numbers, enter an out-of-range page number (0, negative, or greater than last page) and submit.
Steps.Expected Result: Application prevents navigation and shows a validation message or clamps to valid page (e.g., navigates to last or first page) according to spec; no uncaught errors.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1) Table contains a known last page (e.g., 3 pages).
2) Pagination controls implement disabled state for boundaries.
test_cases.Dataset: Dataset with 25-30 sport entries to create multiple pages.
test_cases.Expected Result: First/Last page behave correctly: previous disabled on first, next disabled on last, and out-of-range input is handled gracefully.
test_cases._polarion: Caso d'uso: scorre pagine della Tabella degli Sport DGOJ
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates boundary control behavior and input validation; does not check server-side error logs.

test_cases.Title: PerformancePagination_XXX_REQ_DGOJ_SportsTable_PRE-PROD_Computer_Load time when switching pages

Steps.Step Description: Open the 'Tabella degli Sport' page in pre-production environment with a large dataset (1000+ records).
Steps.Expected Result: Page loads and displays first page within acceptable baseline time.

Steps.Step Description: Measure time to switch from page 1 to page 10 using pagination controls (single jump via page number or repeated 'Next').
Steps.Expected Result: Page transition completes within the performance SLA (e.g., under 2 seconds).

Steps.Step Description: Measure time to jump to last page and back to first page repeatedly (5 cycles) and observe for UI freezes or errors.
Steps.Expected Result: All transitions complete without UI freezes, errors, or memory leaks; average response time meets SLA.

Steps.Step Description: Capture network requests to ensure pagination requests are properly paginated (page parameter present) and responses contain only expected number of records.
Steps.Expected Result: Each pagination request contains correct page/limit parameters and response payload size corresponds to rowsPerPage; no unnecessary data payload returned.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1) Pre-prod environment contains 1000+ sport records.
2) Performance measurement tooling available (browser devtools network/timing or external tool).
3) Test executed during controlled network conditions.
test_cases.Dataset: Pre-prod dataset with >1000 records, rowsPerPage configured to 20 for the test.
test_cases.Expected Result: Pagination performance meets SLA (<2s per page transition), network payloads are correct and stable under repeated navigation.
test_cases._polarion: Caso d'uso: scorre pagine della Tabella degli Sport DGOJ
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Focuses on load/performance characteristics of pagination; functional correctness of data content validated in other tests.

test_cases.Title: AccessibilityPagination_XXX_REQ_DGOJ_SportsTable_TEST_Computer_Keyboard and screen reader accessibility

Steps.Step Description: Open 'Tabella degli Sport' page and enable a screen reader or accessibility tool.
Steps.Expected Result: Page and table content are announced by the screen reader; pagination controls are focusable.

Steps.Step Description: Use keyboard only (Tab, Shift+Tab, Enter, Space) to navigate to pagination controls and activate 'Next' and specific page numbers.
Steps.Expected Result: Pagination controls receive focus in a logical order, and activating controls via keyboard navigates pages as expected.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect pagination controls for ARIA attributes (aria-label, aria-current for current page) and semantic roles.
Steps.Expected Result: Pagination controls expose ARIA attributes: page numbers have aria-current on the active page; controls have descriptive aria-labels for screen readers.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that focus remains in a logical place after pagination (e.g., focus moves to page container or first cell in the table).
Steps.Expected Result: After page change, focus stays logical and visible; screen reader announces updated content without losing context.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application (Chrome + NVDA / VoiceOver on macOS if applicable)
test_cases.Preconditions:
1) Accessibility tools (NVDA, VoiceOver) installed and configured.
2) Table has multiple pages.
3) Tester familiar with keyboard accessibility patterns.
test_cases.Dataset: Standard test dataset with multiple pages; accessibility checklist.
test_cases.Expected Result: Pagination is fully keyboard operable and screen-reader friendly; ARIA attributes present and focus handling is correct.
test_cases._polarion: Caso d'uso: scorre pagine della Tabella degli Sport DGOJ
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers keyboard and screen reader accessibility for pagination; full WCAG compliance audit not included.

test_cases.Title: StabilityUnderInvalidInput_XXX_REQ_DGOJ_SportsTable_TEST_Computer_Invalid page input and error handling

Steps.Step Description: Open 'Tabella degli Sport' page and locate any page input control or URL page parameter.
Steps.Expected Result: Page input control and pagination UI are visible and editable if supported; URL shows page parameter if applicable.

Steps.Step Description: Enter an invalid page input (non-numeric string, e.g., 'abc') into the page input and submit or change URL to include page=abc and press Enter.
Steps.Expected Result: Application validates input and either ignores it, shows a validation message, or defaults to page 1; no JavaScript or server errors are displayed to the user.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a negative page number (e.g., -5) and submit.
Steps.Expected Result: Application prevents navigation to negative pages and handles gracefully (clamps to valid page or shows message) without throwing errors.

Steps.Step Description: Enter an extremely large page number (e.g., 9999999) and submit.
Steps.Expected Result: Application responds by clamping to last page, returning a 'no data' state, or showing a validation message; server should not crash and client displays meaningful feedback.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1) Pagination supports page input or URL parameter page.
2) Test environment logs accessible for investigation if errors occur.
test_cases.Dataset: Standard dataset; invalid input examples: 'abc', '-5', '9999999'.
test_cases.Expected Result: Invalid inputs are handled gracefully without exposing errors to user; navigation remains stable and server does not return 5xx errors.
test_cases._polarion: Caso d'uso: scorre pagine della Tabella degli Sport DGOJ
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates client-side and basic server-side handling of invalid pagination inputs; does not include deep security validation of inputs (see separate VAPT tests).

test_cases.Title: TabPageNavigation_XXX_SportDGOJ_Table_Pagination_TEST_Desktop_Navigate_NextPage

Steps.Step Description: Open the Brand Spain site and navigate to the Sport DGOJ section, then open the Table page where rows are paginated.
Steps.Expected Result: Sport DGOJ section is displayed and the table with pagination controls (Next, Previous, First, Last, page numbers) is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the current page number displayed in the pagination control (e.g., Page 1).
Steps.Expected Result: Current page number is shown (e.g., 1) and table shows the rows for that page.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Next' pagination button once.
Steps.Expected Result: The table updates to display the next page of rows and the current page number increments by 1.

Steps.Step Description: Repeat clicking 'Next' until the last page is reached.
Steps.Expected Result: Each click navigates to the next page. On the last page, the 'Next' button becomes disabled or no longer changes the page.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect that table data corresponds to expected dataset for each navigated page (compare with Dataset).
Steps.Expected Result: Displayed rows match the expected dataset for each page; no duplicate or missing rows across sequential pages.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has access to Brand Spain environment. 2) Table contains multiple pages (>=3). 3) Network connection available. 4) Test dataset uploaded to environment.
test_cases.Dataset: Table with 45 rows, page size 10 (pages 1..5), known content per row for verification.
test_cases.Expected Result: Clicking 'Next' advances pages sequentially, table content and page indicator update correctly until last page where 'Next' is disabled.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers forward pagination via 'Next' only; does not verify keyboard navigation or deep linking to specific pages.

test_cases.Title: TabPageNavigation_XXX_SportDGOJ_Table_Pagination_TEST_Desktop_Navigate_PreviousPage

Steps.Step Description: Open the Sport DGOJ table and navigate to a page other than the first (e.g., Page 3).
Steps.Expected Result: Table displays rows for Page 3 and pagination shows current page as 3.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Previous' pagination button once.
Steps.Expected Result: The table updates to display the previous page (Page 2) and the current page indicator updates accordingly.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Previous' button repeatedly until the first page is reached.
Steps.Expected Result: Each click moves to the previous page; on first page, 'Previous' is disabled or has no effect.

Steps.Step Description: On the first page, click 'Previous' and observe behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Previous' does not change the page and remains disabled (or shows no action). No errors are produced.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Table has at least 3 pages. 2) Tester has access and can navigate to a non-first page.
test_cases.Dataset: Table dataset with known page contents to validate movement backwards.
test_cases.Expected Result: Clicking 'Previous' moves backward through pages correctly and stops at first page with 'Previous' disabled.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers backward pagination behavior; does not include concurrent updates or server error handling.

test_cases.Title: TabPageNavigation_XXX_SportDGOJ_Table_Pagination_TEST_Desktop_FirstLastJump

Steps.Step Description: Open the Sport DGOJ table with multiple pages.
Steps.Expected Result: Pagination controls including 'First' and 'Last' are visible.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Last' pagination button.
Steps.Expected Result: Table immediately navigates to the last page and the page indicator shows the last page number.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the 'Next' button is disabled (or no-op) when on the last page and that table contents match expected last-page dataset.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Next' is disabled and last-page rows match the expected dataset.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'First' pagination button.
Steps.Expected Result: Table navigates to the first page; page indicator shows page 1 and 'Previous' is disabled.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to click 'First' while already on the first page and observe behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: Clicking 'First' on first page produces no change and no errors.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Table has at least 4 pages. 2) Known dataset for first and last page available.
test_cases.Dataset: Dataset defining first page rows (rows 1..10) and last page rows (rows 41..45).
test_cases.Expected Result: First/Last controls jump directly to respective pages, controls disable appropriately at boundaries, and content matches expected data.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers direct jumps to first/last pages; not covering page number input or deep links.

test_cases.Title: TabPageNavigation_XXX_SportDGOJ_Table_Pagination_TEST_Mobile_Responsive_Pagination

Steps.Step Description: Open the Brand Spain Sport DGOJ table page on a smartphone (portrait mode) using Chrome on Android.
Steps.Expected Result: Table and pagination controls are displayed in a mobile-friendly layout (either condensed controls or swipeable table).

Steps.Step Description: Verify presence and visibility of pagination controls (Next/Prev or mobile equivalents).
Steps.Expected Result: Pagination controls are visible and tappable without layout overlap or horizontal scrolling.

Steps.Step Description: Tap the 'Next' control to move to the next page.
Steps.Expected Result: Page updates to show next rows; UI transitions smoothly and content remains readable.

Steps.Step Description: Rotate device to landscape and tap pagination controls again.
Steps.Expected Result: Pagination continues to work after rotation; state persists and table content is correct for the selected page.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt swipe gesture (if supported) on table rows to change pages.
Steps.Expected Result: If swipe pagination supported, swipe navigates pages; otherwise swipe scrolls table content only and pagination controls remain functional.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Mobile device or emulator available. 2) Table supports mobile rendering. 3) Dataset with multiple pages configured.
test_cases.Dataset: Mobile-friendly dataset with known content per page; at least 3 pages.
test_cases.Expected Result: Pagination controls are accessible and functional on mobile in both portrait and landscape; content remains correct and readable.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates mobile rendering and interactions; does not test all device/browser combinations.

test_cases.Title: TabPageNavigation_XXX_SportDGOJ_Table_Pagination_TEST_Tablet_Accessibility_Keyboard

Steps.Step Description: Open Sport DGOJ table in a tablet device or tablet emulator with keyboard attached (or on desktop with tablet viewport).
Steps.Expected Result: Table and pagination controls are visible and keyboard focus can be moved to the controls.

Steps.Step Description: Use Tab key to navigate focus to the 'Next' pagination button.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Next' button receives visible focus as per accessibility guidelines (outline or focus ring).

Steps.Step Description: Press Enter/Space to activate the focused 'Next' button.
Steps.Expected Result: Table navigates to the next page and focus moves to an appropriate element (e.g., first cell of the updated table or the page indicator).

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to 'Previous' and 'First'/'Last' controls using keyboard and activate them to verify behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: All pagination controls are operable via keyboard and result in expected page changes; no inaccessible controls.

Steps.Step Description: Verify ARIA attributes on pagination controls (e.g., aria-disabled when disabled, aria-current on current page).
Steps.Expected Result: ARIA attributes are present and correctly reflect control state to assistive technologies.

test_cases.Reference System: iPadOS Safari or Chrome with keyboard attached
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Keyboard available for tablet or desktop with tablet viewport. 2) Accessibility tools (e.g., browser devtools) available to inspect ARIA attributes.
test_cases.Dataset: Table with multiple pages and stable content; accessibility checklist for expected attributes.
test_cases.Expected Result: Pagination controls are fully keyboard-accessible and expose correct ARIA attributes for assistive technologies.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers keyboard accessibility and ARIA attributes; does not validate screen reader spoken output.

test_cases.Title: TabPageNavigation_XXX_SportDGOJ_Table_Pagination_TEST_Desktop_ErrorHandling_DisabledButtons

Steps.Step Description: Open Sport DGOJ table on desktop and note current page (first, middle, last).
Steps.Expected Result: Pagination shows correct initial state and buttons display enabled/disabled states according to current page.

Steps.Step Description: On first page, attempt to click 'Previous' and 'First' and observe application behavior and network requests.
Steps.Expected Result: Clicks on disabled controls produce no page change; no network request is sent; no JavaScript errors occur.

Steps.Step Description: On last page, attempt to click 'Next' and 'Last' similarly and observe behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: Disabled controls do not trigger navigation or errors; UI remains stable.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate a server error when requesting a new page (use devtools to mock 500 response) and click 'Next'.
Steps.Expected Result: An appropriate user-friendly error message is displayed (e.g., 'Unable to load page, please try again') and the table remains on the current page; pagination controls remain usable after error.

Steps.Step Description: After error, click 'Next' again after server recovers and confirm navigation works.
Steps.Expected Result: On successful server response, table updates to the requested page and no residual error messages remain.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application (Chrome latest) with devtools
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester can intercept/mimic network responses. 2) Table has multiple pages. 3) Error messaging specification available.
test_cases.Dataset: Standard multi-page dataset; error simulation configuration to return 500 on page request.
test_cases.Expected Result: Disabled boundary buttons do nothing and are stable; server failures produce user-friendly error and do not leave UI in inconsistent state; normal navigation resumes after recovery.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates disabled controls and basic server error handling for pagination; does not cover prolonged outages or retry policies.

test_cases.Title: ViewAnagrafica_XXX_AttorePrincipale_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_view_user_profile

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application and navigate to the login page.
Steps.Expected Result: Login page is displayed with Username and Password fields.

Steps.Step Description: Authenticate using valid Utente Anagrafica credentials (username: anag_user, password: ValidPass123).
Steps.Expected Result: Authentication succeeds and the user is redirected to the application home/dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: From the dashboard, click on the 'Anagrafica' menu or module.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Anagrafica' list page is displayed showing searchable records.

Steps.Step Description: In the search field, enter a valid Person ID (e.g., PERSON-1001) and press Search.
Steps.Expected Result: Search results include the record with ID PERSON-1001.

Steps.Step Description: Click on the record 'PERSON-1001' to open the detailed profile view.
Steps.Expected Result: Detailed profile page is displayed showing fields: Full Name, Date of Birth, Address, Email, Phone, and Fiscal Code.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that all mandatory fields are populated and that the displayed values match the expected dataset for PERSON-1001.

test_cases.Dataset: User credentials: anag_user / ValidPass123; Person ID: PERSON-1001 (Mario Rossi, DOB 1980-05-12, email mario.rossi@example.com, phone +39 331 0000000).
test_cases.Expected Result: Utente Anagrafica can successfully search and view the full details of a person record; displayed values match the dataset.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers viewing single record details only; does not cover export, bulk operations, or mobile rendering.

test_cases.Title: EditAnagrafica_XXX_AttorePrincipale_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_update_mandatory_fields

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the application as Utente Anagrafica (anag_user / ValidPass123).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and lands on the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to 'Anagrafica' and open record PERSON-1001.
Steps.Expected Result: Record PERSON-1001 detail page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Edit' to enter edit mode for the record.
Steps.Expected Result: Edit form is presented with editable fields populated with current values.

Steps.Step Description: Modify the Phone field to '+39 331 1111111' and Address to 'Via Nuova 10, Milano', then click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: System validates input and returns to record view with updated values saved.

Steps.Step Description: Refresh the page and search again for PERSON-1001 to ensure persistence.
Steps.Expected Result: The updated Phone and Address fields persist and show '+39 331 1111111' and 'Via Nuova 10, Milano' respectively.

Steps.Step Description: Check application audit/history for the record to confirm the edit operation by 'anag_user' with timestamp.
Steps.Expected Result: Audit log contains an entry indicating the edit by user 'anag_user', fields modified, and timestamp.

test_cases.Title: EditAnagrafica_InvalidData_XXX_AttorePrincipale_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_validation_on_save

Steps.Step Description: Log in as Utente Anagrafica (anag_user / ValidPass123) and open record PERSON-1001 in edit mode.
Steps.Expected Result: Edit form for PERSON-1001 is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Clear the mandatory Full Name field and set Date of Birth to an invalid value (e.g., '31-02-2020'), then click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Client-side and/or server-side validation prevents save and displays validation messages indicating Full Name is required and Date of Birth is invalid.

Steps.Step Description: Enter an invalid email format 'mario.rossi@invalid@' and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Validation error message indicates 'Invalid email format' and the record is not saved.

Steps.Step Description: Provide extremely long input in Address field (e.g., 5000 characters) and attempt to save.
Steps.Expected Result: System either truncates input according to schema limits or returns a validation error indicating field length exceeded; no data corruption occurs.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) anag_user has edit rights. 2) PERSON-1001 exists. 3) Validation rules are configured in the application.
test_cases.Dataset: anag_user / ValidPass123; Person ID: PERSON-1001; Invalid inputs: Full Name: '', DOB: 31-02-2020, Email: 'mario.rossi@invalid@', Address: 5000-char string.
test_cases.Expected Result: Application enforces validation rules on mandatory fields, formats, and length; invalid data is rejected and appropriate error messages are shown to the user.

test_cases.Title: AccessControlAnagrafica_XXX_AttorePrincipale_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_unauthorized_access_prevention

Steps.Step Description: Log in as a user with a different role that should not have Anagrafica edit rights (role: Viewer user credentials viewer_user / ViewerPass123).
Steps.Expected Result: User authenticated and lands on dashboard; role is identified as 'Viewer'.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to navigate to the 'Anagrafica' module and open record PERSON-1001.
Steps.Expected Result: Viewer can open and view the record only if view rights exist; Edit button should not be visible for this role.

Steps.Step Description: Directly invoke the edit URL or API endpoint for PERSON-1001 (e.g., /anagrafica/edit/PERSON-1001) while logged as viewer_user.
Steps.Expected Result: System returns '403 Forbidden' or redirects to an access denied page; no edit form or sensitive operations are exposed.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to call the backend update API (simulate POST /api/anagrafica/update) with modified payload while authenticated as viewer_user.
Steps.Expected Result: API denies the operation with appropriate HTTP status (403) and does not apply any changes to the record.

Steps.Step Description: Log out and log in as an administrator; verify that no unauthorized changes were applied to PERSON-1001.
Steps.Expected Result: Administrator confirms PERSON-1001 data unchanged; audit logs show no successful update attempts by viewer_user.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Anagrafica Web Application v1.0, API layer
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) viewer_user exists with view-only permissions. 2) An admin account exists. 3) Audit logging enabled. 4) Test API access available for negative testing.
test_cases.Dataset: viewer_user / ViewerPass123; admin_user / AdminPass123; Person ID PERSON-1001.
test_cases.Expected Result: Users without Utente Anagrafica role cannot perform edit/update/delete operations; unauthorized API calls are rejected and no changes are persisted.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Tests role-based access for UI and API; does not cover advanced permission inheritance or SSO/LDAP role sync scenarios.

test_cases.Title: CreateAnagrafica_XXX_Anagrafica_Applicativo_TEST_Computer_Create valid anagrafica record

Steps.Expected Result: The 'Create Anagrafica' form is displayed with all input fields (e.g., Name, Surname, Birthdate, Tax Code, Email, Phone).

Steps.Expected Result: All fields accept the input and no inline validation errors are shown.

Steps.Expected Result: The system saves the record and displays a success message (e.g., 'Anagrafica creata con successo'); the new record appears in the list with the provided data.

test_cases.Title: CreateAnagrafica_XXX_Anagrafica_Applicativo_TEST_Computer_Mandatory fields validation

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application with a user account that has 'Anagrafica Create' permission and navigate to the 'Create New' form.

test_cases.Title: DeleteAnagrafica_XXX_Anagrafica_Applicativo_TEST_Computer_Delete anagrafica with and without dependencies

Steps.Step Description: Login with a user account that has 'Anagrafica Delete' permission and identify two records: one with no linked dependent records and one that has dependent links (e.g., transactions or orders).

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Browser, Anagrafica module, connected DB

test_cases.Expected Result: System allows deletion of independent records and prevents deletion of records with dependencies, providing clear feedback; soft-delete/restore and audit behaviors verified.

test_cases.Title: SearchAnagrafica_XXX_Anagrafica_Applicativo_TEST_Computer_Search and filter anagrafica records

test_cases.Title: AccessBrandSpain_XXX_REQ-BRAND-SPAIN_BrandNavigationApp_TEST_Smartphone_Verify_access_to_Spain_brand_content

Steps.Step Description: Launch the mobile application and verify the app loads to the home screen.
Steps.Expected Result: The application opens and home screen is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the tester is logged in with credentials for a user enabled for Brand Spain (user_spain@example.com / Password123).
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and user profile shows permission/role enabling Brand Spain navigation.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. The Actor is correctly logged into the application. B. The Actor is authorized/enabled to navigate within Brand Spain (user assigned to Brand Spain). App installed and user network connectivity available.

test_cases.Title: AccessBrandSpain_XXX_REQ-BRAND-SPAIN_BrandNavigationApp_TEST_Smartphone_Verify_access_denied_for_user_without_permission

Steps.Step Description: Launch the mobile application and log in with credentials for a user NOT enabled for Brand Spain (user_nospain@example.com / Password123).

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to open the brand selector or Brands section and look for 'Spain' (Brand España) option.

Steps.Step Description: If Spain is visible and selectable, attempt to select it and navigate to Spain-specific content.
Steps.Expected Result: Selection is blocked or an authorization error message is displayed (e.g., 'Access denied', 'You are not authorized for this brand'). No Spain-specific content is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Verify no Spain-specific data is displayed and app remains in the currently authorized brand context.
Steps.Expected Result: The application continues to show only content allowed for the user's assigned brand(s); no Spain content is accessible.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. The Actor is correctly logged into the application. B. The Actor is NOT enabled for Brand Spain (user does not have Spain navigation permission).
test_cases.Dataset: user_nospain@example.com / Password123 (account without Brand Spain permission); Mobile App v2.1.0
test_cases.Expected Result: Users without Brand Spain permission cannot access or navigate Brand Spain content; Spain brand option is not selectable or returns an authorization error.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates permission enforcement for Brand Spain. Does not cover audit logging or admin permission assignment workflows.

test_cases.Title: AccessBrandSpain_XXX_REQ-BRAND-SPAIN_BrandNavigationApp_TEST_Smartphone_Unauthenticated_user_redirects_to_login

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the mobile application is launched and the actor is NOT logged in (start with cleared session).

Steps.Expected Result: The app prevents access and redirects the user to the login screen or displays an authentication-required message.

Steps.Expected Result: Access is blocked; the app prompts for login. No Spain-specific content is shown until proper authentication and authorization.

test_cases.Preconditions: Actor is NOT authenticated (no active session). App installed and network connectivity available.
test_cases.Dataset: No authenticated user session; Mobile App v2.1.0
test_cases.Expected Result: Unauthenticated users cannot access Brand Spain content and are redirected to the login screen or shown an authentication-required message.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers enforcement of authentication for Brand Spain content. Does not include tests for login success or multi-factor authentication flows.

test_cases.Title: AccessBrandSpain_XXX_REQ-BRAND-SPAIN_BrandNavigationApp_TEST_Smartphone_UI_and_localization_for_Spain_brand

Steps.Step Description: Launch the mobile application and log in with a user enabled for Brand Spain (user_spain@example.com / Password123).

Steps.Expected Result: Prices (if displayed) use the expected Spain currency/format and offers/contact details correspond to Spain region.

Steps.Expected Result: UI remains responsive, elements render correctly without layout issues, and navigation returns consistent Spain context.

test_cases.Expected Result: UI is localized for Spain and displays Spain-specific assets, text, and region data; navigation and rendering are correct and consistent.
