test_cases.Title: SelezionaPagina_XXX_VisualizzaListaSport_SportDGOJ_TEST_Desktop_Navigate_pages_using_prev_next_buttons

Steps.Step Description: Open browser and navigate to the Brand Spain home page (use provided URL).
Steps.Expected Result: Brand Spain home page loads successfully with top navigation visible.

Steps.Step Description: From home page, follow the Percorso base of 'Visualizza lista Sport' to enter the Sport section for Brand Spain (click the menu items or links as per the base use case).
Steps.Expected Result: The user lands on the Sport DGOJ section of the Brand Spain site; the Sport table is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Locate the pagination controls in the Sport DGOJ table and identify the two buttons indicated in Figura 6 (previous and next arrows inside red rectangles).
Steps.Expected Result: Pagination controls are displayed. The previous and next buttons are visible and their initial enabled/disabled state is correct (previous disabled on first page).

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Next' button once to go to the following page of the Sport DGOJ table.
Steps.Expected Result: The client returns and displays the next page of the Sport table; the page indicator updates to the next page number and table rows refresh accordingly.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Previous' button to go back to the previous page.
Steps.Expected Result: The client returns and displays the previous page (original page); the page indicator updates back and table rows reflect the previous page data.

Steps.Step Description: Repeat clicking 'Next' multiple times (if more pages exist) to traverse through available pages and observe behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: Each click of 'Next' loads the subsequent page; the client returns the selected page and page indicator increments sequentially until last page.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10 / macOS, Web Application - Brand Spain Sports (DGOJ) section, Chrome/Firefox
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has network connectivity. 2) Tester has URL to Brand Spain site. 3) Sport DGOJ section contains at least two pages of results. 4) Tester is not authenticated (if page is public) or has valid test credentials if required.
test_cases.Dataset: Brand Spain home URL; path to Sport DGOJ section; knowledge that table has >=2 pages (example: 3 pages).
test_cases.Expected Result: User can navigate forward and backward through the Sport DGOJ table using the previous and next buttons; the client returns the selected page and the page indicator and table data update correctly.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers navigation between pages using previous/next buttons; does not cover direct page number entry or deep link/bookmark behavior.

test_cases.Title: SelezionaPagina_XXX_VisualizzaListaSport_SportDGOJ_TEST_Desktop_Attempt_navigate_beyond_last_page

Steps.Step Description: Open the Brand Spain Sport DGOJ section as per the base path and determine the current last page number (navigate to last page by clicking 'Next' until the button becomes disabled or page indicator shows maximum).
Steps.Expected Result: Tester reaches the last page of the Sport table and notes the last page number shown by the page indicator.

Steps.Step Description: On the last page, click the 'Next' button one more time.
Steps.Expected Result: The client does not navigate to a non-existent page; either the 'Next' button is disabled or clicking it produces no change. The page indicator remains at the last page and the table data does not change.

Steps.Step Description: Observe any visual feedback or error message after clicking 'Next' on last page (if applicable).
Steps.Expected Result: No error page is shown; appropriate UI behavior is present (disabled button, no change, or subtle feedback). No client error is thrown and page remains stable.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10 / macOS, Web Application - Brand Spain Sports (DGOJ) section, Chrome/Firefox
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Sport DGOJ table must have at least one page and a determinable last page. 2) Tester has access to the Sport section.
test_cases.Dataset: Brand Spain Sport DGOJ URL; known last page or method to reach last page.
test_cases.Expected Result: System prevents navigation beyond the last page: 'Next' is disabled or clicking it has no effect and the client continues to display the last page without errors.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates boundary behavior at last page only; does not test server-side handling for dynamic concurrent updates that change page count.

test_cases.Title: SelezionaPagina_XXX_VisualizzaListaSport_SportDGOJ_TEST_Desktop_Previous_button_disabled_on_first_page

Steps.Step Description: Open the Brand Spain Sport DGOJ section following the base use case and ensure the table is displaying the first page (page indicator shows 1).
Steps.Expected Result: The Sport table loads and the page indicator shows '1' (first page).

Steps.Step Description: Verify the state of the 'Previous' button associated with the pagination controls (the left button shown in Figura 6).
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Previous' button is disabled or visually indicates it cannot be used on the first page.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to click the 'Previous' button on the first page.
Steps.Expected Result: Clicking 'Previous' produces no navigation; the page remains the first page, no error occurs, and table data does not change.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10 / macOS, Web Application - Brand Spain Sports (DGOJ) section, Chrome/Firefox
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester reached the first page of the Sport table. 2) Pagination controls are visible.
test_cases.Dataset: Brand Spain Sport DGOJ URL; confirmation that table default loads to first page.
test_cases.Expected Result: The 'Previous' button is disabled on the first page and clicking it does not change the displayed page; the client reliably returns the first page without errors.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates first-page behavior and previous-button disabling; does not cover keyboard navigation or accessibility focus states.

test_cases.Title: OrdinamentoSport_XXX_ordinamento_lista_sport_SportsApp_TEST_AndroidPhone_alphabetical_ascending

Steps.Step Description: Launch the Sports mobile application on the Android phone and navigate to the 'Sports' list screen.
Steps.Expected Result: Sports application opens and the 'Sports' list screen is displayed with the list of sports visible.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the initial sort order indicator (if present) and take note of the current ordering.
Steps.Expected Result: Current sort order is displayed or noted (e.g., 'A-Z', 'Z-A', 'Popularity') and initial order is recorded.

Steps.Step Description: Tap the sort control and select 'Alphabetical (A-Z)' or an equivalent 'Sort Ascending' option.
Steps.Expected Result: Sort control accepts input and 'Alphabetical (A-Z)' is selected; UI shows a visual indicator for ascending alphabetical order.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the list after sorting and inspect the first 10 visible items.
Steps.Expected Result: The list is re-ordered alphabetically in ascending order (A to Z). The first items are alphabetically smallest and sequence follows standard alphabetical rules (case-insensitive).

Steps.Step Description: Scroll to the bottom of the list to verify global ordering across entire dataset.
Steps.Expected Result: Ordering remains alphabetical A to Z across entire list from first to last element.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester is logged into the app if required. 2) Sports list contains at least 20 distinct sport items with varied starting letters. 3) Network connectivity available if list is fetched remotely.
test_cases.Dataset: Dataset: 20+ sport names (e.g., Archery, Basketball, Boxing, Cricket, Diving, Equestrian, Fencing, Football, Golf, Gymnastics, Handball, Ice Hockey, Judo, Kayaking, Lacrosse, Motorsport, Netball, Orienteering, Polo, Rugby)
test_cases.Expected Result: When 'Alphabetical (A-Z)' is selected, the sports list is sorted from A to Z across the entire dataset, ordering is case-insensitive and visually indicated.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI-triggered alphabetical ascending sort; does not cover backend sort algorithm unit tests or persistence across sessions.

test_cases.Title: OrdinamentoSport_XXX_ordinamento_lista_sport_SportsApp_TEST_AndroidPhone_alphabetical_descending

Steps.Step Description: Open the SportsApp on the Android device and go to the 'Sports' list screen.
Steps.Expected Result: Sports list screen is displayed with current items visible.

Steps.Step Description: From the sort control, select 'Alphabetical (Z-A)' or 'Sort Descending' option.
Steps.Expected Result: Sort control accepts selection and indicates descending alphabetical order.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the first visible items correspond to the alphabetically last sport names and that the ordering proceeds toward A as you scroll down.
Steps.Expected Result: List is ordered from Z to A; first items are alphabetically highest and ordering is preserved throughout the list.

Steps.Step Description: Change sort back to 'Alphabetical (A-Z)' and confirm toggling behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: Sort toggles back to A-Z; indicators and list update accordingly.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) App installed and launched. 2) Sports list populated with 10+ sport items. 3) Tester knows location of sort control.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample dataset: [Tennis, Swimming, Volleyball, Water Polo, X-country, Yachting, Zorbing, ...]
test_cases.Expected Result: Selecting 'Z-A' sorts entire sports list in descending alphabetical order and toggling back restores ascending order.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates UI toggling between ascending and descending alphabetical order; does not validate server-side persisted user preference.

test_cases.Title: OrdinamentoSport_XXX_ordinamento_lista_sport_SportsApp_TEST_AndroidPhone_sort_by_popularity

Steps.Step Description: Launch the app and navigate to the 'Sports' list screen that displays popularity metric (e.g., number of players or popularity score).
Steps.Expected Result: Sports list shows popularity metric for each sport or has a 'Sort by Popularity' option available.

Steps.Step Description: Select 'Sort by Popularity (High to Low)' from sort controls.
Steps.Expected Result: Sort control accepts selection and UI reflects 'Popularity' sort mode.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the list items are ordered with the highest popularity score at the top and decreasing values down the list.
Steps.Expected Result: Items are ordered from highest popularity score to lowest throughout the list. Ties are handled deterministically (e.g., secondary alphabetical order).

Steps.Step Description: Select 'Sort by Popularity (Low to High)' if available and verify reverse ordering.
Steps.Expected Result: Items reorder from lowest to highest popularity correctly.

test_cases.Reference System: Android 12, SportsApp v1.2.0 with popularity attribute provided by backend
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Backend returns popularity scores for sports. 2) Dataset includes varied popularity values including duplicates. 3) User has network connectivity.
test_cases.Dataset: Dataset with popularity scores: Football(95), Basketball(80), Cricket(70), Rugby(70), Archery(20), Curling(5)
test_cases.Expected Result: Sort by popularity orders list correctly by numeric popularity descending (or ascending when selected), with defined tie-breaking behavior.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers numeric-based sorting (popularity) at UI level; does not cover real-time updates to popularity or backend ranking algorithm tests.

test_cases.Title: OrdinamentoSport_XXX_ordinamento_lista_sport_SportsApp_TEST_AndroidPhone_duplicates_and_case_sensitivity

Steps.Step Description: Populate or ensure the sports list contains entries with duplicate names and varying letter cases (e.g., 'football', 'Football', 'FOOTBALL', 'Handball', 'handball').
Steps.Expected Result: List displays duplicates and case-variant entries.

Steps.Step Description: Apply 'Alphabetical (A-Z)' sorting using the sort control.
Steps.Expected Result: List is reordered; duplicates and case variants are placed per the defined sorting rules (expected: case-insensitive grouping, duplicates preserved in stable relative order).

Steps.Step Description: Verify stability of sort: for duplicate sport names with different metadata (e.g., different popularity), check secondary ordering behavior (e.g., preserve original order or apply secondary sort by popularity/ID).
Steps.Expected Result: Sorting behavior for duplicates follows specification: either stable (original relative order kept) or a defined secondary key; tester verifies expected policy.

Steps.Step Description: Repeat the same steps using 'Z-A' sorting to confirm symmetric behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: Descending sort handles duplicates and case-insensitivity consistently with ascending case.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test data includes duplicated sport names and case variants. 2) Tester knows expected duplicate-handling policy (case-insensitive and stable sort or defined secondary sort).
test_cases.Dataset: Dataset: ['football', 'Football', 'FOOTBALL' (popularity 50, 60, 55)], ['handball', 'Handball' (popularity 30, 30)]
test_cases.Expected Result: Sorting is case-insensitive and handles duplicates according to specification (stable or with specified secondary key); no inconsistent interleaving occurs.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates duplicate and case-sensitivity handling on UI sort; does not test backend normalization routines.

test_cases.Title: OrdinamentoSport_XXX_ordinamento_lista_sport_SportsApp_TEST_AndroidPhone_large_list_performance

Steps.Step Description: Prepare dataset with a very large number of sport-like entries (e.g., 5000 items) in the backend or local test DB and ensure the app fetches the dataset.
Steps.Expected Result: Large dataset is available to the app and initial list loads successfully (possibly with pagination or lazy loading).

Steps.Step Description: On the Sports list screen, trigger 'Alphabetical (A-Z)' sort or 'Sort by Popularity' as applicable.
Steps.Expected Result: Sorting operation starts; UI shows loading indicator if required.

Steps.Step Description: Measure the time from sort command initiation to completion of re-ordering (visual stabilization of the list).
Steps.Expected Result: Sorting completes within acceptable performance threshold (e.g., under 2 seconds for client-side, or under 5 seconds if server-side sorting with network latency).

Steps.Step Description: Verify UI responsiveness during and after sort (no freezes, scroll remains smooth, no crashes).
Steps.Expected Result: App remains responsive, no crashes, and user can scroll through sorted results smoothly; memory usage remains within acceptable limits.

test_cases.Reference System: Android 12, SportsApp v1.2.0, Test backend with large dataset
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test environment populated with 5000 sport entries. 2) Performance measurement tools available (stopwatch, profiler). 3) Device meets minimum hardware profile for app.
test_cases.Dataset: Large dataset: 5000 items with randomized names and popularity scores; backend API endpoint /test/sports-large
test_cases.Expected Result: Sort operation completes within defined performance thresholds without UI freezes or crashes; list remains correctly sorted across entire dataset.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers performance and responsiveness of sorting with a large dataset; does not validate minute backend algorithm optimizations or memory profiling deep-dive.

test_cases.Title: DefaultSortByDescrizione_XXX_REQ_SORT_DGOJ_SPORTS_TEST_Computer_verify default ordering

Steps.Step Description: Launch browser and navigate to the application. Log in with a user having access to Brand Spain and navigate to the Sport DGOJ section.
Steps.Expected Result: Login successful and Sport DGOJ section for Brand Spain is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the sports table that lists the entries with columns 'Descrizione', 'Codice' and 'Type'.
Steps.Expected Result: The table is displayed with column headers 'Descrizione', 'Codice' and 'Type' and the default sorting icon state is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Without interacting with any sorting icons, record the order of the first 20 visible rows by the 'Descrizione' column.
Steps.Expected Result: Rows are ordered by 'Descrizione' in ascending order (alphabetical). The sorting icon for 'Descrizione' indicates ascending order.

Steps.Step Description: Refresh the page and verify the initial ordering again.
Steps.Expected Result: After refresh, the table is still ordered by 'Descrizione' ascending by default.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester is registered and has permissions for Brand Spain. 2) Test data contains at least 20 sports entries. 3) The tester is on the Sport DGOJ section.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample dataset with at least 20 sports entries, each with fields: Descrizione (string), Codice (alphanumeric), Type (string). Example entries: [{Descrizione:'Atletica',Codice:'A01',Type:'Indoor'},{Descrizione:'Calcio',Codice:'C02',Type:'Outdoor'}, ... ]
test_cases.Expected Result: By default the sports table is ordered by 'Descrizione' ascending and this ordering persists on page refresh.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Verifies default ordering only; does not validate behavior of sorting icons when clicked or performance with very large datasets.

test_cases.Title: SortToggle_Descrizione_XXX_REQ_SORT_DGOJ_SPORTS_TEST_Computer_toggle ascending descending

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Sport DGOJ section for Brand Spain and ensure the table is loaded.
Steps.Expected Result: Sport table displayed and rows visible.

Steps.Step Description: Click the sorting icon (or the 'Descrizione' column header) once to change the sort order.
Steps.Expected Result: Table is re-sorted and the sorting icon indicates the opposite order (if default was ascending, it changes to descending).

Steps.Step Description: Record the first 10 rows values of the 'Descrizione' column and verify they are in descending alphabetical order.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Descrizione' values are ordered in descending (Z -> A).

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Descrizione' sorting icon again.
Steps.Expected Result: Table is re-sorted back and the sorting icon indicates ascending order.

Steps.Step Description: Record the first 10 rows again and verify they are in ascending alphabetical order.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Descrizione' values are ordered ascending (A -> Z), matching the default ascending ordering.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User is on Sport DGOJ section. 2) Table contains at least 10 rows with distinct 'Descrizione' values.
test_cases.Dataset: At least 10 entries with distinct Descrizione values.
test_cases.Expected Result: Clicking the 'Descrizione' header toggles the sort between ascending and descending and the displayed order and icon reflect the selected order.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers toggle behavior on 'Descrizione' only; does not include keyboard accessibility or multi-column sort interactions.

test_cases.Title: SortByCodice_XXX_REQ_SORT_DGOJ_SPORTS_TEST_Computer_verify code sort asc desc

Steps.Step Description: Open the Sport DGOJ table and ensure it is fully loaded.
Steps.Expected Result: Table and headers are visible.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Codice' column header or its sorting icon once to sort by Codice.
Steps.Expected Result: Table is sorted by 'Codice' and sorting icon indicates current order (ascending or descending).

Steps.Step Description: Verify the rows are ordered by 'Codice' in ascending alphanumeric order (numbers before letters as per UI convention).
Steps.Expected Result: Rows are displayed in ascending alphanumeric order by 'Codice'.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Codice' header again to reverse the order.
Steps.Expected Result: Rows reorder to descending alphanumeric order and the sort icon updates accordingly.

Steps.Step Description: For entries that have identical 'Codice' values, verify there are no duplicates and relative ordering is consistent (stable).
Steps.Expected Result: Identical 'Codice' rows remain present once; relative order between identical keys remains consistent before and after sort operations (no unexpected shuffling).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester is in Sport DGOJ section. 2) Dataset contains codes with numeric and alphanumeric values and some duplicates.
test_cases.Dataset: Entries example: [{Descrizione:'A',Codice:'001',Type:'T1'},{Descrizione:'B',Codice:'010',Type:'T2'},{Descrizione:'C',Codice:'010',Type:'T1'}]
test_cases.Expected Result: Clicking 'Codice' sorts rows alphanumerically ascending/descending. Duplicate codes are handled correctly and order is stable.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Tests sorting on 'Codice' including duplicates; does not cover locale-specific collation beyond basic alphanumeric ordering.

test_cases.Title: SortByType_XXX_REQ_SORT_DGOJ_SPORTS_TEST_Computer_verify type sorting asc desc

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Sport DGOJ table for Brand Spain and ensure the 'Type' column is visible.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Type' column header and sorting icon are present.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Type' column header once to sort by Type.
Steps.Expected Result: Table is sorted by 'Type' and the sorting icon reflects the chosen order.

Steps.Step Description: Verify rows are ordered by Type in ascending alphabetical order and that all rows are displayed correctly.
Steps.Expected Result: Rows appear sorted by Type ascending (A->Z).

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Type' header again to toggle to descending order and verify the new order.
Steps.Expected Result: Rows appear sorted by Type descending (Z->A) and icon indicates descending.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User has access and table contains at least 6 different Type values. 2) Table fully loaded.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample entries with Type values: ['Indoor','Outdoor','Virtual','Mixed'] across multiple rows.
test_cases.Expected Result: 'Type' column sorts entries alphabetically ascending/descending when header/icon clicked and icon displays correct state.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers basic Type column sorting; does not include combined multi-column sorting or advanced collation rules.

test_cases.Title: StableSortWithIdenticalDescrizione_XXX_REQ_SORT_DGOJ_SPORTS_TEST_Computer_verify stability on identical keys

Steps.Step Description: Prepare dataset where multiple rows share identical 'Descrizione' values but have different 'Codice' and 'Type'. Load the dataset in Sport DGOJ section.
Steps.Expected Result: Table displays multiple rows with identical 'Descrizione' values.

Steps.Step Description: Note the current relative order of rows that have identical 'Descrizione'.
Steps.Expected Result: Relative order among identical 'Descrizione' rows is recorded.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Descrizione' header to sort descending then click again to return to ascending.
Steps.Expected Result: After toggling sort, rows with identical 'Descrizione' retain their relative order (stable sort) or follow documented secondary sort rule (e.g., by 'Codice').

Steps.Step Description: If the application documents a secondary sort rule (for example by 'Codice'), verify the secondary ordering is applied consistently.
Steps.Expected Result: Secondary ordering (if documented) is applied consistently. If no secondary rule documented, relative order remains unchanged.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Dataset loaded with at least 3 groups of identical Descrizione values. 2) Tester able to identify and record original relative ordering.

test_cases.Expected Result: Sorting operations do not unpredictably shuffle rows with identical Descrizione; they remain stable or follow the documented secondary sort.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates stability behavior for identical keys; does not define which secondary sort to apply if not documented by product.

test_cases.Title: SortOnEmptyTable_XXX_REQ_SORT_DGOJ_SPORTS_TEST_Computer_no errors on empty dataset

Steps.Expected Result: No JavaScript errors related to sorting are logged in the console.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Table has zero rows either by data state or applied filter. 2) Tester has developer tools access to check console.
test_cases.Dataset: Empty dataset or filter resulting in zero rows.
test_cases.Expected Result: Sorting actions on an empty table do not cause errors and UI behaves gracefully (no crashes or unexpected messages).
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Checks behavior with empty dataset only; does not test performance or large dataset handling.

test_cases.Title: CreateUser_XXX_UtenteAnagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Create new user record

Steps.Step Description: Open the Backoffice web application and navigate to the login page.
Steps.Expected Result: Backoffice login page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Log in with a valid administrator account (username: admin_test, password: Admin@123).
Steps.Expected Result: Administrator is authenticated and the Backoffice dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: From the dashboard, navigate to 'Anagrafica Utente' (User Registry) module.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Anagrafica Utente' module page is loaded and shows a list of users or an empty state.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Create New User' and fill mandatory fields with valid data: First Name: Mario, Last Name: Rossi, Email: mario.rossi.test+1@example.com, Fiscal Code: RSSMRA80A01H501U, Date of Birth: 1980-01-01. Select role 'Standard User'.
Steps.Expected Result: All entered values are accepted by the form (no validation errors shown).

Steps.Step Description: Submit the form by clicking 'Save' or 'Create'.
Steps.Expected Result: System confirms user creation (confirmation message/toast) and the new user appears in the user list with correct details.

Steps.Step Description: Search the user list by the created email or fiscal code to verify persistence.
Steps.Expected Result: Search returns the newly created user and displayed details match submitted data.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has valid administrator credentials (admin_test). 2) Backoffice application is up and accessible. 3) No existing user with email mario.rossi.test+1@example.com in the system. 4) Tester internet connection stable.
test_cases.Dataset: Admin credentials; New user data: {FirstName: 'Mario', LastName: 'Rossi', Email: 'mario.rossi.test+1@example.com', FiscalCode: 'RSSMRA80A01H501U', DOB: '1980-01-01', Role: 'Standard User'}
test_cases.Expected Result: New user record is created successfully, confirmation is shown, and the record is persisted and searchable in the Anagrafica Utente list.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers creation using valid mandatory fields; does not cover optional fields, email confirmation flows, or integration with external identity providers.

test_cases.Title: ViewUser_XXX_UtenteAnagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Display user details

Steps.Step Description: Verify that sensitive fields (e.g., password) are not displayed and that UI shows status and timestamps (created/modified) if available.
Steps.Expected Result: Password is not visible; created/modified timestamps are displayed where applicable.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Operator account exists with permissions to view users. 2) At least one user record exists (e.g., created by TC-001). 3) Backoffice reachable.

test_cases.Expected Result: User details page displays accurate, non-editable information; sensitive data is not exposed.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers read-only viewing of user profile; does not cover bulk export or printing features.

test_cases.Title: EditUser_XXX_UtenteAnagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Modify existing user data

Steps.Expected Result: Administrator is authenticated and the Anagrafica Utente list is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Re-open the user's detail page to verify persisted changes.

test_cases.Expected Result: User data is successfully updated and changes are persisted and visible in both list and details views.

test_cases.Title: DeleteUser_XXX_UtenteAnagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Remove user record safely

Steps.Step Description: Log in as administrator and navigate to 'Anagrafica Utente'.
Steps.Expected Result: Administrator can access the user list.

Steps.Step Description: Search for the user to be deleted (mario.rossi.test+1@example.com) and select the record.
Steps.Expected Result: Target user is found and selectable.

Steps.Step Description: Initiate delete action by clicking 'Delete' or equivalent. Confirm deletion in the confirmation dialog by clicking 'Yes' or 'Confirm'.
Steps.Expected Result: System shows a confirmation dialog requiring user action before deletion.

Steps.Step Description: After confirmation, verify that the system shows a success message and the user no longer appears in the main list when searched.
Steps.Expected Result: User is removed from the active list; search by email returns no results.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to open previously stored direct link to the deleted user's detail page (if applicable) or recreate search by ID.
Steps.Expected Result: System responds with 'User not found' or equivalent; deleted user's details are not accessible. If soft-delete is implemented, UI indicates inactive/deleted status rather than full access.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Admin account with delete permissions. 2) Target user exists and is not linked to irreversible production dependencies. 3) Confirm backup or restore process available for test environment.
test_cases.Dataset: Admin credentials; Target user email: mario.rossi.test+1@example.com
test_cases.Expected Result: User deletion is confirmed and the record is no longer accessible in the UI; appropriate messages displayed. If soft-delete is used, user marked as inactive and cannot be used in active operations.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI delete flow and confirmation; does not cover backend cascades, audit log verification beyond UI messages, or complex dependency constraints.

test_cases.Title: UnauthorizedAccess_XXX_UtenteAnagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Prevent unauthorized user operations

Steps.Step Description: Open Backoffice and attempt to access 'Anagrafica Utente' without logging in (direct URL to user registry).
Steps.Expected Result: System redirects to login page or shows access denied message.

Steps.Step Description: Log in with a low-privilege account (viewer_test / Viewer@123) that has view-only permissions or no permissions at all.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and session established with limited privileges.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to perform restricted actions: Create new user, Edit existing user, Delete user.
Steps.Expected Result: Restricted actions are not available (buttons disabled/hidden) or attempting them results in an authorization error; view-only users can only view permitted fields.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that attempting to call protected API endpoints (if tooling available) returns HTTP 403 Forbidden for the low-privilege account.
Steps.Expected Result: Protected endpoints return 403 Forbidden and no modification occurs.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Low-privilege account exists. 2) Admin account exists for verification. 3) Environment supports role-based access control.
test_cases.Dataset: Viewer credentials; Admin credentials to cross-check; API endpoint URLs if applicable
test_cases.Expected Result: Unauthorized users cannot access or perform create/edit/delete operations; system enforces role-based access control and returns appropriate errors/messages.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Verifies RBAC at UI and API level for common operations; does not cover exhaustive permission matrix or external SSO/OAuth provider behaviors.

test_cases.Title: CreateAnagrafica_XXX_REQ-ANAGRAFICA-001_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_create a new anagrafica record with valid data

Steps.Step Description: Launch the Anagrafica web application and log in with a user having 'anagrafica.create' permission.
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica web application home page is displayed and user is authenticated with access to create functionality.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Nuovo Anagrafica' (New Registry) page or click the 'Create' button.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Create New Anagrafica' form is displayed with all mandatory fields visible.

Steps.Step Description: Fill in the form with valid data: Nome: 'Mario', Cognome: 'Rossi', Codice Fiscale: 'RSSMRA80A01H501U', Data Nascita: '1980-01-01', Indirizzo: 'Via Roma 1', Email: 'mario.rossi@example.com', Telefono: '+39061234567'.
Steps.Expected Result: All input fields accept the provided valid values and no validation errors are shown.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' or 'Submit' to create the anagrafica record.
Steps.Expected Result: The system saves the record, displays a success message (e.g., 'Record creato con successo') and redirects to the newly created record view or list including the new entry.

Steps.Step Description: Search the Anagrafica list for 'Mario Rossi' using search/filter functionality.
Steps.Expected Result: The newly created record appears in the search results with correct details as entered.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Anagrafica application deployed and reachable; 2) Test user account exists with 'create' permission; 3) No duplicate record with same Codice Fiscale exists.
test_cases.Dataset: Nome=Mario; Cognome=Rossi; CF=RSSMRA80A01H501U; DOB=1980-01-01; Email=mario.rossi@example.com; Phone=+39061234567
test_cases.Expected Result: A new anagrafica record is created successfully and is retrievable from the list with the exact entered details.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates successful creation and basic retrieval; does not cover duplicate handling beyond precondition.

test_cases.Title: CreateAnagrafica_MissingMandatory_XXX_REQ-ANAGRAFICA-002_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_attempt create with missing mandatory field

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Anagrafica web application with a user having creation permissions.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and able to access the create form.

Steps.Step Description: Open the 'Create New Anagrafica' form.
Steps.Expected Result: Create form is displayed with mandatory fields (e.g., Nome, Cognome, Codice Fiscale) indicated.

Steps.Step Description: Fill in the form leaving the mandatory 'Codice Fiscale' field blank and provide other valid values (Nome='Anna', Cognome='Bianchi', Email='anna.bianchi@example.com').
Steps.Expected Result: Form shows the mandatory field 'Codice Fiscale' empty; other fields accept values.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' or 'Submit' to attempt to create the record.
Steps.Expected Result: Client-side or server-side validation prevents submission; an inline validation message appears next to 'Codice Fiscale' (e.g., 'Campo obbligatorio') and no record is created.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that no new record for 'Anna Bianchi' exists in the Anagrafica list.
Steps.Expected Result: Search returns no results for the provided data confirming no record was created.

test_cases.Preconditions: Anagrafica application is running; tester logged in; no server validation exceptions are present.
test_cases.Dataset: Nome=Anna; Cognome=Bianchi; CF=; Email=anna.bianchi@example.com
test_cases.Expected Result: System enforces mandatory field validation and prevents record creation when Codice Fiscale is missing.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers mandatory field validation for creation; does not cover all field-specific validation rules (format, uniqueness).

test_cases.Title: UpdateAnagrafica_XXX_REQ-ANAGRAFICA-003_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_update existing anagrafica record

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica application with a user having 'anagrafica.edit' permission.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and edit actions are available.

Steps.Step Description: Locate an existing record with Codice Fiscale 'RSSMRA80A01H501U' via search or list view.

Steps.Expected Result: Edit form accepts new values without immediate validation errors.

Steps.Step Description: Save the changes.
Steps.Expected Result: System saves the updates, shows a confirmation message, and the record view displays the updated Email and Telefono values.

Steps.Step Description: Reload the record or search again to confirm persistence of changes.
Steps.Expected Result: Updated values persist and are returned on subsequent retrievals.

test_cases.Preconditions: A record with CF 'RSSMRA80A01H501U' exists; tester has edit permission.
test_cases.Dataset: TargetRecordCF=RSSMRA80A01H501U; NewEmail=m.rossi@example.com; NewPhone=+39061230000
test_cases.Expected Result: Record updates are accepted and persisted; subsequent retrieval returns updated fields.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates basic update flow; does not cover concurrent modification conflict handling.

test_cases.Title: DeleteAnagrafica_XXX_REQ-ANAGRAFICA-004_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_delete anagrafica record with confirmation

Steps.Step Description: Log in with a user having 'anagrafica.delete' permission.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and delete action is available for records.

Steps.Step Description: Ensure a test record exists (create one if necessary) with Codice Fiscale 'BNCLDO90B01H501X'.
Steps.Expected Result: Test record is present in the list and visible.

Steps.Step Description: Select the test record and click the 'Delete' action.
Steps.Expected Result: A confirmation dialog appears explaining the deletion and asking for confirmation.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm the deletion by clicking 'Confirm' or 'Yes'.
Steps.Expected Result: System deletes the record, displays a success message and removes the record from the list.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the deleted record by direct URL or search using its Codice Fiscale.
Steps.Expected Result: The record is not retrievable; the system returns a 'record not found' message or empty search result.

test_cases.Expected Result: Record is removed from the system after confirmation and cannot be retrieved.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers deletion and confirmation flow; does not cover soft-delete vs hard-delete policy checks.

test_cases.Title: PermissionControl_XXX_REQ-ANAGRAFICA-005_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_verify unauthorized user cannot perform CRUD

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica application with a user account that lacks 'anagrafica.create', 'anagrafica.edit', and 'anagrafica.delete' permissions (read-only role).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and only read-only functions are available in the UI.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the 'Create New Anagrafica' form via UI navigation or direct URL.
Steps.Expected Result: UI should hide or disable the 'Create' control; direct access should be blocked and display an authorization error or redirect (e.g., 'Accesso non autorizzato').

Steps.Step Description: Select an existing record and attempt to click 'Edit'.
Steps.Expected Result: Edit option is disabled or not present; attempts to access edit endpoint return authorization denied (HTTP 403) or equivalent message in UI.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to perform a delete action on a record (via UI or by sending a delete request to the API if tools available).
Steps.Expected Result: Delete action is not permitted; UI prevents action or API returns authorization error (HTTP 403) and no deletion occurs.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that read operations (viewing records) function normally for the read-only user.
Steps.Expected Result: User can view record details and search the list without errors.

test_cases.Preconditions: User account created with read-only role; application enforces role-based access control.
test_cases.Dataset: ReadOnlyUser=username_readonly; Password=incorrectlyShownHereForExample
test_cases.Expected Result: Users without proper permissions cannot create, edit, or delete records; read access remains available.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates role-based access for CRUD operations; does not test audit logging or permission delegation scenarios.

test_cases.Title: NavigateBrandSpain_XXX_Precondizioni_BrandNavigation_TEST_Computer_AccessBrandSpainHome

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application in a supported browser on the Computer device.
Steps.Expected Result: The web application login or home page is displayed successfully.

Steps.Expected Result: Actor is authenticated and application shows user-specific header indicating logged-in state.

Steps.Step Description: From the main navigation, select the Brand selector and choose 'Spain' (Brand Spain).
Steps.Expected Result: The application accepts the Brand Spain selection and initiates navigation to Brand Spain context.

Steps.Step Description: Allow the page to load completely and observe the landing page for Brand Spain.
Steps.Expected Result: Brand Spain landing/home page loads without errors and Spain-specific top-level menus and content are visible.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that no access or permission error messages (e.g., 403, insufficient permissions) are displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: No permission or error messages are shown; user remains on Brand Spain context with full navigation available per role.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. The Actor is correctly logged into the application. B. The Actor is enabled to navigate within Brand Spain.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials with Spain navigation permission; Brand Spain available in configuration.
test_cases.Expected Result: Actor successfully navigates to Brand Spain home page and Spain-specific navigation and content are displayed.

test_cases.Title: BrandSpainLocalization_XXX_Precondizioni_Localization_TEST_Computer_VerifySpanishLocale

Steps.Step Description: Ensure Actor is logged in with Brand Spain navigation permission and Brand Spain is selected (see TC-001 to reach Brand Spain).
Steps.Expected Result: Actor is in Brand Spain context and Brand Spain landing page is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect visible UI text on header, navigation menus, homepage banners and key labels (e.g., welcome message, account menus).
Steps.Expected Result: Primary UI text and labels are displayed in Spanish (e.g., 'Bienvenido', 'Cuenta', 'Promociones').

Steps.Step Description: Verify locale-specific formats: date format, number format and currency displayed on pages relevant to Spain (e.g., prices should display in Euro with appropriate formatting).
Steps.Expected Result: Dates, numbers and currency are displayed in Spain-appropriate formats (EUR symbol for prices, dd/mm/yyyy date format if applicable).

Steps.Step Description: Open a content page (e.g., Terms & Conditions or FAQ) and verify language consistency across that page.
Steps.Expected Result: Content pages in Brand Spain context are delivered in Spanish; no major sections in other languages unless explicitly multi-lingual.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. The Actor is correctly logged into the application. B. The Actor is enabled to navigate within Brand Spain.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user with Spain navigation permission; sample pages/content available for Spain.
test_cases.Expected Result: UI and content in Brand Spain context are displayed in Spanish and locale-specific formats are applied correctly.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates visible UI text and basic locale formats; deep i18n quality checks (translations accuracy) are out of scope.

test_cases.Title: AccessSpainPromotion_XXX_Precondizioni_PromotionAccess_TEST_Computer_VerifySpainPromoVisible

Steps.Step Description: Confirm Actor is logged in and Brand Spain is selected (preconditions A and B).
Steps.Expected Result: Actor session active and Brand Spain context is active.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Promotions/Offers section from the Brand Spain navigation menu.
Steps.Expected Result: Promotions/Offers page for Brand Spain is opened successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Filter or search promotions by 'Spain-only' tag or use known promotion identifier (e.g., PROMO-ESP-001).
Steps.Expected Result: Spain-specific promotions are listed in the results.

Steps.Step Description: Open a Spain-only promotion detail page and attempt to enroll/activate (if applicable for the role).
Steps.Expected Result: Promotion detail page loads; enroll/activate controls are enabled and action completes without permission errors.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that any promotional terms reference Spain and are applicable to the current user region.
Steps.Expected Result: Promotion terms explicitly reference Spain where required and are applicable to the user (no mismatch warnings).

test_cases.Expected Result: Actor can view and access Spain-only promotions without permission errors and promotion details are Spain-specific.

test_cases.Title: DeniedAccessBrandSpain_XXX_Precondizioni_AccessControl_TEST_Computer_VerifyAccessDeniedForUnauthorizedUser

Steps.Step Description: Log into the application using valid credentials for an Actor who is NOT enabled to navigate within Brand Spain (precondition: A true, B false).
Steps.Expected Result: Actor is authenticated and application shows logged-in state for the current brand/region.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to select Brand Spain from the Brand selector or directly navigate to a known Brand Spain URL.
Steps.Expected Result: Navigation attempt is intercepted and user receives an access control response (UI-level message, redirection to allowed brand, or HTTP 403 if direct URL).

Steps.Step Description: Observe any displayed message and verify that the message indicates lack of permission or not authorized to access Brand Spain.
Steps.Expected Result: A clear message is shown explaining that access to Brand Spain is not permitted for this user or the user is redirected to a permitted brand area.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access a deep link/page within Brand Spain (e.g., /es/promotions) using browser address bar.
Steps.Expected Result: Direct deep link access is blocked (HTTP 403 or redirect to login/allowed brand) and the user cannot access Spain-only pages.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. The Actor is correctly logged into the application. B. The Actor is NOT enabled to navigate within Brand Spain (explicitly revoked permission).
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials for a user without Spain navigation permission; known Brand Spain URL.
test_cases.Expected Result: User without Spain permission is prevented from accessing Brand Spain pages; a clear access-denied behavior is observed.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates UI and HTTP-level blocking for unauthorized users; does not validate auditing/logging entries.

test_cases.Title: SessionExpiryDuringBrandSwitch_XXX_Precondizioni_SessionManagement_TEST_Computer_VerifyLoginRequiredOnTimeout

Steps.Step Description: Authenticate Actor with valid credentials and ensure Actor is enabled for Brand Spain navigation (preconditions A and B).
Steps.Expected Result: Actor is logged in and can access application normally.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate session timeout by waiting for the session inactivity period to elapse or by forcing session invalidation via test hook.
Steps.Expected Result: User session is expired on the server and subsequent requests should require re-authentication.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to select Brand Spain or navigate to a Spain page after session expiry.
Steps.Expected Result: Application prevents access and redirects user to the login page or displays a session-expired message requiring re-login.

Steps.Step Description: Re-authenticate with valid credentials and then re-attempt Brand Spain navigation.
Steps.Expected Result: After successful re-login, the Actor can again select Brand Spain and access Spain-specific pages.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. The Actor is correctly logged into the application. B. The Actor is enabled to navigate within Brand Spain. Capability to simulate session timeout is available in test environment.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; session timeout configuration for test environment.
test_cases.Expected Result: When session expires mid-flow, the application requires re-authentication and only after re-login the Actor can navigate to Brand Spain.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers session expiry behavior when switching brands; does not cover token refresh mechanisms or SSO integrations in depth.

test_cases.Title: SortingDescrizione_XXX_REQ_SportSpain_Sorting_TEST_Computer_Verify three-state sorting for Descrizione column

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application and navigate to the Brand Spain > Sport > DGOJ section according to the 'Visualizza lista Sport' base path.
Steps.Expected Result: The Sport DGOJ listing for Brand Spain is displayed with columns 'Descrizione', 'Codice' and 'Type' and the original/default ordering of rows is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Identify the sorting icon (clickable element) in the header of the 'Descrizione' column and click it once.
Steps.Expected Result: Rows are sorted in ascending order (A→Z) by the 'Descrizione' column. The sorting icon indicates ascending state (visual cue like arrow up or active state).

Steps.Step Description: Click the sorting icon in the 'Descrizione' column a second time.
Steps.Expected Result: Rows are sorted in descending order (Z→A) by the 'Descrizione' column. The sorting icon indicates descending state (visual cue like arrow down or active state).

Steps.Step Description: Click the sorting icon in the 'Descrizione' column a third time.
Steps.Expected Result: Rows return to the original/default ordering (the same ordering observed before Step 2). The sorting icon shows neutral/default state (no active ascending/descending indicator).

Steps.Step Description: Verify that records with identical 'Descrizione' values maintain a stable relative order or consistent defined tie-breaker as per UI (if tie-breaker not defined, verify no errors occur).
Steps.Expected Result: Records with identical 'Descrizione' values are displayed consistently when sorting; no UI errors occur and list remains stable.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has access to the Web application. 2) Tester is on Brand Spain > Sport > DGOJ listing. 3) The list contains at least 5 entries with varying 'Descrizione' values including at least two identical values.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample rows: [{Descrizione: 'Atletica', Codice: 'ATH', Type: 'Outdoor'}, {Descrizione: 'Calcio', Codice: 'FUT', Type: 'Team'}, {Descrizione: 'Boxe', Codice: 'BOX', Type: 'Combat'}, {Descrizione: 'Calcio', Codice: 'FUT2', Type: 'Team'}, {Descrizione: 'Nuoto', Codice: 'SWM', Type: 'Individual'}]
test_cases.Expected Result: Clicking the 'Descrizione' column sort icon cycles: first click sorts ascending, second click sorts descending, third click restores original ordering. Sorting UI indicators update accordingly and list remains stable.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI behavior for 'Descrizione' column sorting (ascending/descending/original). Does not cover backend performance or persisted user preferences.

test_cases.Title: SortingCodice_XXX_REQ_SportSpain_Sorting_TEST_Computer_Verify three-state sorting for Codice column

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Brand Spain > Sport > DGOJ listing and confirm visibility of 'Codice' column and data rows.
Steps.Expected Result: Sport list is displayed with visible 'Codice' column and multiple rows with distinct and duplicate 'Codice' values.

Steps.Step Description: Click the sorting icon in the 'Codice' column once.
Steps.Expected Result: Rows are sorted in ascending order by 'Codice' (numeric or lexicographic as appropriate). The UI indicates ascending sort on 'Codice'.

Steps.Step Description: Click the sorting icon in the 'Codice' column a second time.
Steps.Expected Result: Rows are sorted in descending order by 'Codice'. The UI indicates descending sort on 'Codice'.

Steps.Step Description: Click the sorting icon in the 'Codice' column a third time.
Steps.Expected Result: Rows return to the original default ordering. The 'Codice' sort indicator returns to neutral state.

Steps.Step Description: Verify sorting of numeric-like codes (e.g., '01', '2', '10') is consistent and documented (lexicographical vs numeric).
Steps.Expected Result: Sorting behavior follows the application's documented rule (tester confirms expected numeric or lexicographic ordering) and no crash occurs.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User is on the Sport DGOJ list for Brand Spain. 2) The table includes 'Codice' values with numeric-like and alphabetic values to test ordering.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample rows: [{Descrizione:'A', Codice:'01'}, {Descrizione:'B', Codice:'2'}, {Descrizione:'C', Codice:'10'}, {Descrizione:'D', Codice:'A1'}]
test_cases.Expected Result: Clicking 'Codice' cycles through ascending, descending and original orders; UI indicator updates; numeric-like codes sort according to documented rule.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates UI sorting states for 'Codice' column and correct handling of numeric-like codes. Does not verify server-side sort implementation performance.

test_cases.Title: SortingType_XXX_REQ_SportSpain_Sorting_TEST_Computer_Verify three-state sorting for Type column

Steps.Step Description: Open Brand Spain > Sport > DGOJ and ensure 'Type' column and rows are visible.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Type' column visible with multiple row values (e.g., 'Team', 'Individual', 'Outdoor').

Steps.Step Description: Click the sorting icon on the 'Type' column once.
Steps.Expected Result: Rows sorted in ascending order by 'Type' (A→Z). Sorting icon shows ascending state.

Steps.Step Description: Click the sorting icon on the 'Type' column a second time.
Steps.Expected Result: Rows sorted in descending order by 'Type' (Z→A). Sorting icon shows descending state.

Steps.Step Description: Click the sorting icon on the 'Type' column a third time.
Steps.Expected Result: Rows restored to original ordering; sorting icon shows neutral state.

Steps.Step Description: Verify sort visual feedback accessibility (icon has aria-label or accessible state for screen readers) when toggling the 'Type' column sort.
Steps.Expected Result: Sorting controls expose accessible state (e.g., aria-sort or aria-label) corresponding to ascending/descending/none.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester on Sport DGOJ list for Brand Spain. 2) Table contains entries with varying 'Type' values. 3) Accessibility tools available to check ARIA attributes.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample rows: [{Type:'Team'},{Type:'Individual'},{Type:'Outdoor'},{Type:'Team'}]
test_cases.Expected Result: Three-state cycle on 'Type' column functions correctly; accessibility attributes reflect the current sort state.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Focuses on UI sorting and accessibility indicators for 'Type' column; does not cover keyboard-only navigation scenarios in depth.

test_cases.Title: SortingMultipleColumns_XXX_REQ_SportSpain_Sorting_TEST_Computer_Verify interactions when switching between columns and restore original order

Steps.Step Description: Open the Brand Spain > Sport > DGOJ listing and note the original/default order of rows; ensure 'Descrizione', 'Codice', and 'Type' headers are visible with their sort icons.
Steps.Expected Result: Original ordering recorded by tester; all three column headers display sort controls.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Descrizione' column sort icon once (ascending).
Steps.Expected Result: Rows sorted ascending by 'Descrizione'. 'Descrizione' header shows ascending state; other headers show neutral state.

Steps.Step Description: Without restoring 'Descrizione', click the 'Codice' column sort icon once.
Steps.Expected Result: Rows are sorted by 'Codice' ascending. 'Codice' shows ascending state and 'Descrizione' sort state is cleared (only one active sort expected).

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Codice' column sort icon second time to set descending, then click the 'Codice' icon a third time to restore original order for the table.
Steps.Expected Result: After second click, 'Codice' descending order is applied; after third click, the table returns to the original ordering recorded in Step 1 and all sort indicators reset to neutral.

Steps.Step Description: Repeat the process starting with 'Type' column and then returning to 'Descrizione' to confirm original ordering restoration is consistent regardless of column sequence.
Steps.Expected Result: Original ordering restoration works consistently after three clicks on any column; switching columns clears previous sort state and only the active column indicates sorting.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that no residual sorting persists when navigating away from the page and returning (reload page or navigate back to Sport DGOJ section).
Steps.Expected Result: After reload or navigation away/return, the table displays the original/default ordering (no client-side persistent sort unless feature documented).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester is on Sport DGOJ list with multiple records. 2) The application does not have user-saved column sort preferences enabled for this test (unless explicitly required).
test_cases.Dataset: Sample rows: [{Descrizione:'A',Codice:'03',Type:'Team'},{Descrizione:'B',Codice:'01',Type:'Individual'},{Descrizione:'C',Codice:'02',Type:'Outdoor'}]
test_cases.Expected Result: Clicking sort icons on any column cycles ascending→descending→original. Switching columns clears previous active sort. Reloading the page restores original/default ordering.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers interactions between multiple column sorts, state clearing and page reload behavior. Does not cover server-side persistence of user sort preferences if implemented.

test_cases.Title: ClickDettaglioSport_XXX_CasoUso_ClickDettaglioSportDGOJ_TEST_Mobile_SuccessfulNavigationToSportDetail

Steps.Expected Result: Page shows correct sport title, DGOJ badge/logo, list of markets and odds; no UI artifacts or loading spinners remain visible.

Steps.Step Description: Tap on one market to expand its odds and verify odds values are selectable.
Steps.Expected Result: Market expands and individual odds can be selected (selection visual feedback appears).

test_cases.Expected Result: Tapping the sport opens the Sport Detail page showing DGOJ badge, correct title, markets and odds; user can interact with odds.

test_cases.Title: ClickDettaglioSport_XXX_CasoUso_ClickDettaglioSportDGOJ_TEST_Mobile_OfflineBehavior

Steps.Step Description: Ensure device has the BettingApp installed and the app is on the 'Sport' list screen.
Steps.Expected Result: Sport list screen is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Turn off network connectivity (Airplane mode) on the device.
Steps.Expected Result: Device shows no network connectivity.

Steps.Step Description: Select a sport entry with DGOJ badge and tap/click to open the detail.
Steps.Expected Result: App attempts to open the detail; if offline cache exists it displays cached content, otherwise an offline/error message is shown.

Steps.Step Description: If an error message is shown, tap the 'Retry' button; then restore network connectivity and retry opening the detail.
Steps.Expected Result: After restoring network and tapping Retry, the Sport Detail page loads successfully with live data.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Sport with DGOJ badge exists in app. 2) App has known behavior for offline (cache or offline screen).
test_cases.Dataset: Sport ID: DGOJ_TEST_SPORT_01 (if required); device offline scenario
test_cases.Expected Result: When offline, app displays cached sport detail if available; otherwise shows an informative offline message with a retry option. After connectivity is restored and retry executed, sport detail loads.

test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers offline and retry behavior only; does not validate cache freshness or concurrency edge cases.

test_cases.Title: ClickDettaglioSport_XXX_CasoUso_ClickDettaglioSportDGOJ_TEST_Mobile_AccessibilityKeyboardAndScreenReader

test_cases.Title: ClickDettaglioSport_XXX_CasoUso_ClickDettaglioSportDGOJ_TEST_Desktop_BackNavigationAndStatePreserve

test_cases.Title: ClickDettaglioSport_XXX_CasoUso_ClickDettaglioSportDGOJ_TEST_Desktop_AnalyticsEventOnDetailOpen

Steps.Step Description: Open browser developer tools (Network tab) and apply a filter to capture analytics/network events from the Betting Web application.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Sport listing page and click on a sport with DGOJ badge to open its detail page.

Steps.Expected Result: An analytics event is fired when the detail opens; payload contains sport identifier and DGOJ/regulatory metadata.

test_cases.Expected Result: Opening Sport Detail triggers an analytics event with correct event name and payload including the sport id and DGOJ indicator; event delivered successfully (200 OK) and contains no PII.

test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Verifies basic analytics event on detail open; does not assert downstream analytics processing or data warehouse ingestion.

test_cases.Title: ClickUnavailableSport_XXX_Req_SportDGOJ_Web_TEST_Computer_verify disabled row behavior

test_cases.Title: ClickSportRow_NetworkError_XXX_Req_SportDGOJ_Web_TEST_Computer_handle network error when opening detail

Steps.Step Description: Open the Brand Spain Sport DGOJ list on desktop with developer tools available.
Steps.Expected Result: Sport list is displayed normally.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate a network error for the detail API (e.g., throttle network to offline or mock HTTP 500 for detail endpoint).
Steps.Expected Result: Network simulation or mock is active and will affect requests for sport details.

Steps.Step Description: Click on a sport row to request its detail while the network error simulation is in place.
Steps.Expected Result: The application attempts to load detail; an error state is shown such as an inline error message or toast indicating inability to load details.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the application allows the user to retry or return to the list without crashing.
Steps.Expected Result: Retry button is available (if implemented) or user can navigate back; the UI remains responsive and displays a clear error message (e.g., 'Unable to load sport details. Try again').

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application (Chrome with network throttling or API mock)
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester can simulate network errors or mock backend responses. 2) Sport list is loaded before simulation.
test_cases.Dataset: Sport row: 'Fútbol'; network simulation: offline or HTTP 500 for /sport/{id}/detail.
test_cases.Expected Result: On network error the application shows a clear, user-friendly error and allows retry or safe return to the list without losing application stability.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client-side handling of network errors when opening details; backend recovery not covered.

test_cases.Title: BackNavigationPreserveState_XXX_Req_SportDGOJ_Web_TEST_Computer_preserve list state after viewing detail

Steps.Step Description: Open the Backoffice Anagrafica web application and log in with a valid administrator account.

test_cases.Title: Create_MandatoryFieldsValidation_XXX_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Verify mandatory field validation when creating record

test_cases.Title: Create_DuplicateUniqueField_XXX_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Verify unique constraint on TaxId

test_cases.Expected Result: Record is removed from the system and cannot be retrieved by normal search; deletion confirmation is shown.

test_cases.Title: Search_Filter_Anagrafica_XXX_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Verify search and filter functionality

Steps.Step Description: Open Anagrafica list view in the application and ensure multiple sample records exist with varying names, taxIds and cities.
Steps.Expected Result: List view shows multiple records available for search and filtering.

Steps.Step Description: Use the search box to search by exact TaxId (e.g., 'RSSMRA80A01H501U').
Steps.Expected Result: Search results display only the record(s) that match the exact TaxId.

Steps.Step Description: Clear search and apply a text filter on Name with partial value 'Rossi' or city filter 'Milano'.
Steps.Expected Result: Results include all records matching partial name 'Rossi' or city 'Milano'.

Steps.Step Description: Combine multiple filters (e.g., Name contains 'Rossi' AND city equals 'Milano') and apply.
Steps.Expected Result: Results are narrowed to records satisfying all applied filters.

Steps.Step Description: Sort results by Name ascending and verify ordering.
Steps.Expected Result: Records are displayed sorted alphabetically by Name in ascending order.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Several test records exist with varied attributes. 2) User is authenticated with read access.
test_cases.Dataset: Records with Names including 'Rossi', 'Bianchi'; Cities: Milano, Roma; TaxIds: RSSMRA80A01H501U, BNCLGU80A01H501K
test_cases.Expected Result: Search and filter functionality returns correct and expected subsets of records and supports combined filters and sorting.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI search/filter/sort behavior; performance under large datasets not included.

test_cases.Title: FieldLengthBoundary_Anagrafica_XXX_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Verify name field boundary conditions

Steps.Step Description: Open Create form in Anagrafica and locate the 'Name' input field.
Steps.Expected Result: Create form visible and Name field editable.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a name string with length exactly equal to the documented maximum (e.g., 255 characters) and attempt to save.
Steps.Expected Result: System accepts the input and record is created successfully (if other fields valid).

Steps.Step Description: Edit the record and change the Name to a string with length of maximum + 1 (e.g., 256 characters) and attempt to save.
Steps.Expected Result: System rejects the input or trims it and displays a validation message indicating maximum length exceeded.

Steps.Step Description: Try to paste a very long string (e.g., 5000 characters) into the Name field and observe behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: Field enforces maximum length client-side (prevents typing/pasting beyond limit) or server returns validation error; system remains stable and no data corruption occurs.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User with create/edit permissions. 2) Maximum length requirement documented (assumed 255 chars).
test_cases.Dataset: Name values: 255-char string, 256-char string, 5000-char string; Other mandatory fields valid
test_cases.Expected Result: Name field enforces configured maximum length; valid boundary accepted, above-boundary inputs rejected or truncated with clear feedback.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates client and server handling of field length for Name; other fields and international character sets not covered.

test_cases.Title: AccessoBrandSpagna_XXX_Precondizioni_NavigazioneApp_TEST_Computer_verifyAllowedNavigation

Steps.Step Description: Launch the web application using a supported browser and navigate to the application URL.
Steps.Expected Result: The application login page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Log in using credentials for a user who is enabled for Brand Spain (example: user_spain_enabled@example.com / Password123!).
Steps.Expected Result: Login succeeds and the user is redirected to the application home/dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm that the user account shows the Brand Spain authorization (check user profile or authorization badge if available).
Steps.Expected Result: The profile or authorization area indicates that the user is enabled to navigate Brand Spain.

Steps.Step Description: Locate the brand selector or navigation menu and select 'Brand Spain' (or click the menu item leading to Spain content).
Steps.Expected Result: The application navigates to the Brand Spain section/page and the Spain-specific navigation/menu items are shown.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that Spain-specific content (e.g., localized banners, Spain catalog, Spain-language copy) loads and is accessible (click 2 links or open 2 pages inside Brand Spain).
Steps.Expected Result: Spain-specific pages load without errors, links open correctly and localized content is displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions:
A. L'Attore è correttamente loggato all'interno dell'applicativo
B. L'Attore è abilitato alla navigazione all'interno del Brand Spagna
test_cases.Dataset: User: user_spain_enabled@example.com, Password: Password123!; Browser: Chrome latest; Test environment: TEST
test_cases.Expected Result: A user who is logged in and enabled for Brand Spain can access and navigate the Brand Spain section and view Spain-specific content without errors.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI and navigation validation for access to Brand Spain. Does not cover backend audit logs, permission assignment flows or API-level authorization checks.

test_cases.Title: AccessoBrandSpagna_XXX_Precondizioni_NavigazioneApp_TEST_Computer_verifyAccessDeniedForNotEnabled

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application login page in a supported browser.
Steps.Expected Result: The login page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Log in using credentials for a user who is NOT enabled for Brand Spain (example: user_spain_disabled@example.com / Password123!).
Steps.Expected Result: Login succeeds and the user is redirected to the application home/dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to locate or access the Brand Spain section via the brand selector or direct URL to the Spain section.
Steps.Expected Result: Brand Spain is not visible in the brand selector or navigation menu for this user; direct navigation to Spain URL is blocked or redirected.

Steps.Step Description: If a direct URL was used, verify the behavior: note the message or HTTP status returned and any error page content.
Steps.Expected Result: The application returns an access denied message or redirects to an appropriate page (e.g., home) with a clear message indicating insufficient permissions. No Spain-specific content is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Check that other brand areas the user is authorized for remain accessible.
Steps.Expected Result: Other authorized brand areas function normally and are accessible, confirming that the restriction is limited to Brand Spain.

test_cases.Preconditions:
A. L'Attore è correttamente loggato all'interno dell'applicativo
B. L'Attore NON è abilitato alla navigazione all'interno del Brand Spagna
test_cases.Dataset: User: user_spain_disabled@example.com, Password: Password123!; Browser: Firefox latest; Test environment: TEST
test_cases.Expected Result: A logged-in user who is not enabled for Brand Spain cannot view or navigate to Brand Spain; access attempts are blocked and an appropriate message or redirect is presented.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates UI and navigation-level access denial for users without Spain permission. Does not validate admin UI for permission assignment or backend enforcement logs.

test_cases.Title: AccessoBrandSpagna_XXX_Precondizioni_NavigazioneApp_TEST_Computer_verifyPermissionRevocationDuringSession

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application and log in with credentials for a user enabled for Brand Spain (example: user_spain_enabled2@example.com / Password123!).
Steps.Expected Result: Login succeeds and the user is on the application home/dashboard with Brand Spain accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Brand Spain section and confirm Spain-specific content is visible.
Steps.Expected Result: Spain-specific content loads and user can navigate within Brand Spain.

Steps.Step Description: While keeping the session active, simulate revocation of Brand Spain permission for the user (perform via admin console or API call to remove the Spain role).
Steps.Expected Result: Admin/API reports successful revocation of Brand Spain permission for the user.

Steps.Step Description: On the user's browser, attempt to refresh the Brand Spain page and perform a navigation action within Brand Spain (e.g., click a Spain-specific link).
Steps.Expected Result: The application detects the permission change and either logs the user out of Spain area, shows an access denied message, or redirects the user to a non-Spain area. Spain-specific pages are no longer accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt direct navigation to a known Spain-specific URL after revocation and record observed response (UI message or HTTP status).
Steps.Expected Result: Direct access is denied: user receives an access denied message or is redirected; no Spain content is served. Other authorized areas remain accessible.

test_cases.Preconditions:
A. L'Attore è correttamente loggato all'interno dell'applicativo
B. L'Attore è inizialmente abilitato alla navigazione all'interno del Brand Spagna
test_cases.Dataset: User: user_spain_enabled2@example.com, Password: Password123!; Admin user: admin_test@example.com with rights to revoke roles; Test environment: TEST
test_cases.Expected Result: When a user's Brand Spain permission is revoked during an active session, the application should prevent further access to Spain-specific content immediately after refresh or subsequent actions, displaying a clear access denied behavior.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers dynamic enforcement of permission revocation in-session. Does not cover propagation delays in external IAM systems or audit trail persistence.

test_cases.Title: DettaglioSportDGOJ_XXX_REQ01_SportBM_TEST_Computer_VerifyLandingAndListDisplay

Steps.Step Description: Login to Backoffice with a valid backoffice user account having Sport management permissions.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and Home/Dashboard of Backoffice is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: From the main navigation, follow the 'Brand Spain' -> 'Sport' path as defined in the base use case 'Visualizza lista Sport'.
Steps.Expected Result: Navigation succeeds and the Sport section for Brand Spain is requested by the client.

Steps.Step Description: Wait for the Sport DGOJ section to load fully.
Steps.Expected Result: The client displays the Sport DGOJ section for Brand Spain; page header indicates 'Sport DGOJ' and no error messages are shown.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the list/grid area that should present DGOJ sports.
Steps.Expected Result: A list/grid of DGOJ sports is visible with rows representing individual DGOJ sport entries (at least code and description columns visible).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Backoffice server is reachable. 2) Test user exists with Sport management permissions. 3) At least one DGOJ sport exists for Brand Spain.
test_cases.Dataset: User: backoffice_user (valid). Existing DGOJ sports: DGOJ_SP_001 (code), DGOJ_SP_002.
test_cases.Expected Result: Actor lands on Sport DGOJ section for Brand Spain and sees the list of DGOJ sports.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso base – Dettaglio Sport DGOJ associato a Sport BM

test_cases.Title: ListaSportDGOJ_XXX_REQ02_SportBM_TEST_Computer_VerifyListContentsAndAssociationIndicator

Steps.Step Description: Ensure logged in to Backoffice and on the Sport DGOJ section for Brand Spain (precondition: landed on the list).
Steps.Expected Result: Sport DGOJ list is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect the visible list/grid rows for each DGOJ sport to identify association status to Platform (BM) sports (visual marker or column).
Steps.Expected Result: Each DGOJ sport row shows required columns including DGOJ code and description and an indicator or column that shows whether the DGOJ sport is associated to one or more BM sports.

Steps.Step Description: Filter the list if a filter for 'Associated to BM' exists; apply filter to show only associated items.
Steps.Expected Result: The grid filters correctly and displays only those DGOJ sports that have BM associations.

test_cases.Expected Result: List correctly shows association status and filters return the expected subsets.

test_cases.Title: SelezionaSportAssociato_XXX_REQ03_SportBM_TEST_Computer_VerifySelectionRepositionAndDetailRendering

Steps.Step Description: From the Sport DGOJ list, identify a DGOJ sport that is associated to a BM sport (e.g., DGOJ_SP_001 associated to BM_SP_001).
Steps.Expected Result: Row for DGOJ_SP_001 is visible in the list.

Steps.Step Description: Click on the DGOJ sport row (or dedicated action) corresponding to the associated sport.
Steps.Expected Result: The clicked element becomes selected and the client initiates display of the item detail.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the grid area after selection.
Steps.Expected Result: The selected DGOJ sport is repositioned to the top of the grid (first row) preserving the rest of the list and applied filters; no pagination side effects occur incorrectly.

Steps.Step Description: Scroll to / view the detail area located below the grid.
Steps.Expected Result: The detail pane is displayed and populated with the selected DGOJ sport information (header and detailed areas) without errors.

test_cases.Preconditions: User on Sport DGOJ list; at least one associated DGOJ item exists; no client JS errors.

test_cases.Expected Result: Selected associated DGOJ sport is moved to top of grid and full detail is shown beneath the grid.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso base – Dettaglio Sport DGOJ associato a Sport BM
