test_cases.Title: HeaderCTAs_XXX_REQ04_SportBM_TEST_Computer_VerifyHeaderButtonsSaveCloseAssociateAndTimestampBehavior

Steps.Step Description: Select an associated DGOJ sport to open its detail pane (ensure detail loaded).
Steps.Expected Result: Detail pane displayed with header area showing title (code + DGOJ description), CTAs (Salva modifiche, Chiudi, Associa entità) and timestamp.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the initial state of the 'Salva modifiche' CTA before any changes are made.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Salva modifiche' CTA is present and disabled (greyed out) when no changes have been made.

Steps.Step Description: Modify a non-destructive editable field in the detail (e.g., change the short description or a metadata field) but do not save.
Steps.Expected Result: Field value changes in the UI; 'Salva modifiche' CTA becomes enabled; the 'Chiudi' CTA label changes to 'Annulla modifiche' indicating unsaved changes.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Chiudi' (currently labeled 'Annulla modifiche') CTA.
Steps.Expected Result: The system reverts the detail pane to initial values (undoing local changes), the 'Annulla modifiche' label returns to 'Chiudi', and the grid is presented in the same previous state (same filters, same list order, same pagination/position) without any confirmation dialogs.

Steps.Step Description: Modify a field again, then click 'Salva modifiche' CTA.
Steps.Expected Result: The save operation is executed; a success message or silent success is applied; timestamp in header updates to reflect latest modification; 'Salva modifiche' becomes disabled after successful save; 'Chiudi' label remains 'Chiudi'.

Steps.Step Description: Verify 'Associa entità' CTA is visible and enabled in header.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Associa entità' CTA is always enabled and actionable regardless of unsaved changes.

test_cases.Preconditions: User with edit permission; selected DGOJ sport is editable; network connection stable.
test_cases.Functionality: Detail Header Controls / Save & Close behavior
test_cases.Dataset: Editable DGOJ_SP_001; original description 'Original Desc'; changed description 'Temp Change'.
test_cases.Expected Result: Header follows specified behavior: Save disabled until changes, Close acts as Cancel when unsaved changes present (reverting values without confirmation), Associate always enabled, timestamp updates after save.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso base – Dettaglio Sport DGOJ associato a Sport BM
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers header CTA enable/disable and label behavior; does not verify backend persistence logs or multi-user concurrency conflicts.

test_cases.Title: AssociaEntita_XXX_REQ05_SportBM_TEST_Computer_VerifyAssociateEntityFlow

Steps.Step Description: Open the detail of a DGOJ sport (associated or not) and locate the 'Associa entità' CTA in the header.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Associa entità' CTA is visible and enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Associa entità' CTA.
Steps.Expected Result: An association UI (modal or pane) opens that allows selecting one or more platform (BM) sports to associate with the selected DGOJ sport.

Steps.Step Description: In the association UI, select one or more BM sports (e.g., BM_SP_002) and confirm the association action (click 'Confirm' or equivalent).
Steps.Expected Result: The association action is processed; the detail area updates to show the newly associated BM sport(s) (BM code and short description visible in detail).

Steps.Step Description: Verify the grid/list shows the selected DGOJ sport still at the top and now indicates the updated association state.
Steps.Expected Result: Grid displays the DGOJ sport (still selected/repositioned) and association indicator reflects the newly associated BM sport(s).

test_cases.Preconditions: User with association permission; at least one BM sport (BM_SP_002) exists available for association.
test_cases.Dataset: DGOJ_SP_001 (selected). BM candidates: BM_SP_002 (available).
test_cases.Expected Result: User can associate one or more BM sports to the DGOJ sport; detail and list reflect association immediately.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso base – Dettaglio Sport DGOJ associato a Sport BM
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers the happy path of association; does not cover complex validation rules or error handling for failed associations.

test_cases.Title: EliminaAssociazione_XXX_REQ06_SportBM_TEST_Computer_VerifyDeleteAssociatedSportFromDetail

Steps.Step Description: Open the detail view for a DGOJ sport that currently has an associated BM sport (e.g., DGOJ_SP_001 associated to BM_SP_001).
Steps.Expected Result: Detail shows lower section with associated BM code BM_SP_001, short description, and a delete button for the association.

Steps.Step Description: Click the delete button for the associated BM sport in the detail lower area.
Steps.Expected Result: Either a confirmation is requested (if system requires) or the association is removed; the UI updates to remove the BM entry from the detail. (Requirement describes presence of delete button; treat both behaviors below.)

Steps.Step Description: If a confirmation dialog appears, confirm deletion; if no confirmation appears, proceed to check result immediately.
Steps.Expected Result: The BM association is removed server-side and client-side; the detail no longer lists BM_SP_001 as associated; list/grid association indicator updates accordingly.

Steps.Step Description: Reload the list or navigate away and back to the Sport DGOJ list to validate persistence.
Steps.Expected Result: After reload, the DGOJ sport remains without the BM association; no residual indicators of the deleted association are present.

test_cases.Preconditions: User with delete permission; DGOJ_SP_001 has at least one BM association (BM_SP_001).
test_cases.Dataset: DGOJ_SP_001 associated to BM_SP_001.
test_cases.Expected Result: Delete action removes the BM association from the DGOJ sport; UI and persisted data reflect deletion and list state updates.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso base – Dettaglio Sport DGOJ associato a Sport BM
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers deletion flow and persistence check; does not validate role-based access matrix exhaustively or cascading impacts in other systems.

test_cases.Title: SelezioneSportDGOJ_XXX_REQ_DettaglioSport_Backoffice_TEST_Computer_verify selection shows detail and repositions grid

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Backoffice application with a valid operator account and navigate to the Sport management grid.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the header (top part) of the detail pane contains the sport title with code and description, the 'Salva modifiche' CTA (disabled), the 'Chiudi' CTA (enabled), the 'Associa entità' CTA (enabled), and a timestamp of last modification.
Steps.Expected Result: Header shows code and description for DGOJ-EX-001; 'Salva modifiche' is disabled; 'Chiudi' is enabled and labeled 'Chiudi'; 'Associa entità' is enabled; last-modified timestamp is visible and properly formatted.

test_cases.Title: SalvaModificheEnable_XXX_REQ_DettaglioSport_Backoffice_TEST_Computer_verify Save CTA enabled only after modification_and_persist

test_cases.Title: AnnullaModifiche_XXX_REQ_DettaglioSport_Backoffice_TEST_Computer_verify Close behaves as 'Annulla modifiche' when edits present_and_revert

test_cases.Title: ErroreDettaglioSport_XXX_REQ-ALT-ERR_SportBM_SportDGOJ_TEST_Computer_VerificaVisualizzazionePaginaErrore

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application in a browser and navigate to the Sports BM list page.

Steps.Expected Result: API returns HTTP 204 No Content and subsequent GET for that mapping returns HTTP 404 Not Found.

Steps.Expected Result: Association DGOJ_150 -> BM_300 is saved and a confirmation message is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Repeat search and association for a second distinct BM Entity (BM_301 'Tennis BM - Region B') for the same DGOJ Sport DGOJ_150 and save.
Steps.Expected Result: Second association DGOJ_150 -> BM_301 is saved successfully and confirmation displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Open the mapping details for DGOJ_150 and verify the list of associated BM Entities.
Steps.Expected Result: Both BM_300 and BM_301 are listed as associated to DGOJ_150, demonstrating multiple associations are supported.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Backoffice user has mapping permissions. 2) DGOJ_150, BM_300, BM_301 exist in test environment and are distinct BM Entities.
test_cases.Dataset: User: backoffice_user/Password123!; DGOJ: DGOJ_150; BM: BM_300, BM_301
test_cases.Expected Result: A single DGOJ Sport can be associated to multiple distinct BM Entities and all associations are persisted and visible.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers creating multiple associations for a single DGOJ Sport; does not cover deletion or conflict resolution of overlapping associations.

test_cases.Title: BM Entity Search No Results and Unauthorized Access_XXX_REQ-SPORT_ASSOC_SportBMApp_TEST_Desktop_Error handling and auth

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the 'Sport Mapping' page without logging in by opening the Backoffice URL directly in an incognito browser session.
Steps.Expected Result: Access is denied or redirect to login page occurs; user cannot access mapping UI.

Steps.Step Description: Log in with valid credentials (backoffice_user / Password123!) and navigate to 'Sport Mapping'.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and mapping UI is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Select a DGOJ Sport (e.g., DGOJ_180) and in the BM Entity search field enter a random non-existent name (e.g., 'NonExistentBMNameXYZ') then execute search.
Steps.Expected Result: Search returns no results and a clear 'no results' message or an empty results list is displayed without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to associate using the empty search result (try clicking 'Associate' without selecting an entity).
Steps.Expected Result: System prevents association and shows a validation message indicating a BM Entity must be selected before saving.

test_cases.Preconditions: Backoffice is reachable; test user exists for step 2. No state required for non-existent BM name.
test_cases.Dataset: Unauthenticated browser session; User: backoffice_user/Password123!; Non-existent BM search term: 'NonExistentBMNameXYZ'
test_cases.Expected Result: Unauthorized access is blocked; search with no matching BM entities yields a proper 'no results' response; system prevents creating an association without selecting a valid BM entity.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers authentication enforcement and no-results search behavior; does not cover rate limiting or partial-match fuzzy search behavior.

test_cases.Title: VerifyActorPresence_XXX_AttoriCoinvolti_Anagrafica_TEST_Desktop_check actor existence

Steps.Step Description: Open the Backoffice application on the Desktop and navigate to the Administration -> Actors (Attori) management section.
Steps.Expected Result: Administration area is displayed and the Actors management section is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Search the Actors list for the entry with name or identifier 'Utente Anagrafica'.
Steps.Expected Result: The Actors list returns the 'Utente Anagrafica' entry and displays its details (name, identifier, assigned roles).

Steps.Step Description: Open the details of the 'Utente Anagrafica' entry to view properties and metadata.
Steps.Expected Result: Actor details page displays properties including actor name 'Utente Anagrafica', description, status (active/inactive) and assigned roles or permissions.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has administrative credentials with access to Administration -> Actors. 2) Backoffice application is reachable and tester is connected to the network.
test_cases.Dataset: Admin user credentials (username: admin_test, password: Admin@123), expected actor identifier 'Utente Anagrafica'
test_cases.Expected Result: The system lists and shows the 'Utente Anagrafica' actor with correct details in the Actors management section.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates presence and basic details of the actor only; does not validate role permissions or module access.

test_cases.Title: AssignRole_XXX_AttoriCoinvolti_Anagrafica_TEST_Desktop_assign role and verify access

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Backoffice as an administrator (use admin credentials).
Steps.Expected Result: Administrator is authenticated and redirected to the Backoffice dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Administration -> Actors, locate 'Utente Anagrafica' and open its edit page.
Steps.Expected Result: Edit page for 'Utente Anagrafica' is displayed and editable fields are available.

Steps.Step Description: Assign the role/permission set that grants access to the 'Anagrafica' module (e.g., 'Anagrafica_ReadWrite' or equivalent) and save changes.
Steps.Expected Result: Role/permission is saved successfully and the actor now shows the assigned 'Anagrafica' role in its details.

Steps.Step Description: Log out administrator and then log in using the user account associated with the 'Utente Anagrafica' actor.
Steps.Expected Result: User with 'Utente Anagrafica' credentials is authenticated and redirected to their landing page.

Steps.Step Description: From the user's menu, attempt to access the 'Anagrafica' module and open a record for viewing and editing (if role allows write).
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Anagrafica' module is accessible to the user; the user can view records and, if write permission was assigned, edit and save changes successfully.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Admin account available. 2) A user account associated to 'Utente Anagrafica' exists. 3) 'Anagrafica' module is configured in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: Admin credentials (admin_test/Admin@123), Utente Anagrafica user credentials (utente_anagrafica/Test@123), role name 'Anagrafica_ReadWrite'
test_cases.Expected Result: After role assignment, the Utente Anagrafica user can access the Anagrafica module per assigned permissions (view and/or edit) without errors.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers assignment of a single role and verification of direct access; does not cover full matrix of permissions or audit logging.

test_cases.Title: AccessRestriction_XXX_AttoriCoinvolti_Anagrafica_TEST_Desktop_denied access for non-assigned user

Steps.Step Description: Ensure a test user exists without the 'Utente Anagrafica' actor/role assigned (create or use existing non-privileged account).
Steps.Expected Result: A non-privileged test user account is available and its profile shows no 'Anagrafica' related roles.

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Backoffice using the non-privileged test user credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: Non-privileged user is authenticated and reaches their dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to navigate to or open the 'Anagrafica' module directly via the UI menu or by entering the module URL.
Steps.Expected Result: Access is denied: the Anagrafica module is not visible in the menu and direct navigation results in an authorization error or redirection to an access denied page.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to perform API calls or requests (if permitted in test environment) to access Anagrafica endpoints using the non-privileged user's session token.
Steps.Expected Result: API returns 401/403 Forbidden or equivalent error indicating insufficient permissions; no sensitive Anagrafica data is returned.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Non-privileged user account exists and is not assigned any Anagrafica role. 2) Tester has ability to perform API requests if step 4 is executed.
test_cases.Dataset: Non-privileged user credentials (user_no_anagrafica/NoAccess@123), sample Anagrafica endpoint URL
test_cases.Expected Result: Users without the 'Utente Anagrafica' role cannot access the Anagrafica module via UI or API and receive appropriate authorization errors.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates denial of access for non-assigned users; does not test logging/alerting or complex role inheritance scenarios.

test_cases.Title: CreateAnagrafica_XXX_Anagrafica_CreateRecord_TEST_Computer_create a new anagrafica record

Steps.Step Description: Open the Anagrafica application in the Backoffice on the Computer.
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica application login screen or dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Log in with a valid backoffice user account with 'create' permissions (Username: tester.create, Password: Test@1234).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and the Anagrafica main dashboard is displayed with options to create a new record.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to 'Create New Record' (or 'Nuovo') page/section.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Create New Record' form is displayed with fields: First Name, Last Name, Date of Birth, Tax ID, Address, Phone, Email, and Save button.

Steps.Step Description: Populate the form using the test data: First Name='Mario', Last Name='Rossi', Date of Birth='1980-05-15', Tax ID='RSSMRA80E15H501A', Address='Via Roma 1, Milano', Phone='+39021234567', Email='mario.rossi.test@example.com'.
Steps.Expected Result: All fields accept input and show the entered values; no validation errors are shown for valid data.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Save' button to persist the new record.
Steps.Expected Result: System saves the record and displays a confirmation message (e.g., 'Record created successfully') and assigns a unique identifier to the new anagrafica record.

Steps.Step Description: Search for the newly created record using the Tax ID or assigned identifier in the Anagrafica search function.
Steps.Expected Result: The created record appears in search results and all entered details match the stored values.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test environment (TEST) available and reachable. 2) Tester has a valid backoffice account with create permissions (tester.create). 3) No existing record with Tax ID 'RSSMRA80E15H501A' in the TEST dataset. 4) Database and Anagrafica service are online and accessible.
test_cases.Dataset: New person data: {First Name: 'Mario', Last Name: 'Rossi', DOB: '1980-05-15', Tax ID: 'RSSMRA80E15H501A', Address: 'Via Roma 1, Milano', Phone: '+39021234567', Email: 'mario.rossi.test@example.com'}
test_cases.Expected Result: A new anagrafica record is created, confirmation is shown, and record is retrievable via search with correct stored values.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers creation of a standard valid record via Backoffice UI; bulk import, duplicate detection rules, and integration with external systems are not covered.

test_cases.Title: UpdateAnagrafica_XXX_Anagrafica_EditRecord_TEST_Computer_update an existing anagrafica record

Steps.Step Description: Open the Anagrafica application and log in with a user having edit permissions (Username: tester.edit, Password: Edit@123).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and Anagrafica dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Search for an existing test record with Tax ID 'RSSMRA80E15H501A' (ensure the record exists from previous test or test data setup).
Steps.Expected Result: The existing record is displayed in search results and can be opened for editing.

Steps.Step Description: Open the record details and click 'Edit'. Change the Address to 'Corso Italia 10, Milano' and Phone to '+39021654321'.
Steps.Expected Result: Fields are editable and show the new values to be saved.

Steps.Step Description: Save the changes by clicking the 'Save' or 'Update' button.
Steps.Expected Result: System persists changes and displays a success message (e.g., 'Record updated successfully').

Steps.Step Description: Reload or re-open the record and verify the Address and Phone values reflect the updated values.
Steps.Expected Result: Record detail page shows Address='Corso Italia 10, Milano' and Phone='+39021654321'. No unintended changes to other fields.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test record with Tax ID 'RSSMRA80E15H501A' exists. 2) Tester has edit permissions. 3) Anagrafica service is available.
test_cases.Dataset: Existing record identifier / Tax ID 'RSSMRA80E15H501A'; new Address: 'Corso Italia 10, Milano'; new Phone: '+39021654321'.
test_cases.Expected Result: The existing anagrafica record is updated with the new address and phone values and changes persist on subsequent retrieval.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers update via Backoffice UI for typical fields; concurrency/conflict resolution and audit log verification are not included.

test_cases.Title: DeleteAnagrafica_XXX_Anagrafica_DeleteRecord_TEST_Computer_remove an anagrafica record

Steps.Step Description: Open the Anagrafica Backoffice application and log in with a user having delete permissions (Username: tester.delete, Password: Delete@123).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and Anagrafica dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Search for the target record to delete using Tax ID 'RSSMRA80E15H501A' or the unique identifier.
Steps.Expected Result: Target record is listed and available for action (view/edit/delete).

Steps.Step Description: Select the record and initiate the delete action (click 'Delete' or 'Remove'), confirm any confirmation dialog by clicking 'Yes' or 'Confirm'.
Steps.Expected Result: Confirmation dialog is displayed asking for confirmation and upon confirming the system attempts deletion.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the deletion by re-running the search for the same Tax ID or identifier.
Steps.Expected Result: The record is no longer present in search results; system displays 'no records found' or equivalent message.

Steps.Step Description: If soft-delete is implemented, attempt to view 'deleted' items via archive or trash and verify the record appears in archive with deleted status.
Steps.Expected Result: If soft-delete exists, record is present in archive with deletion metadata; otherwise the record is permanently removed.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Target record exists in TEST environment. 2) Tester has delete permissions. 3) Backup or test data refresh is available if record removal must be reverted.
test_cases.Dataset: Target record Tax ID 'RSSMRA80E15H501A' or unique identifier assigned by system.
test_cases.Expected Result: Record is removed (or marked deleted if soft-delete) and is no longer returned by standard searches; deletion confirmation message is shown.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers deletion via UI and basic archive check; recovery processes, cascade deletes, and downstream system propagation not covered.

test_cases.Title: SearchFilterAnagrafica_XXX_Anagrafica_Search_TEST_Computer_search and filter records in anagrafica

Steps.Step Description: Open the Anagrafica Backoffice application and log in with a valid user (tester.search).
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica dashboard and search interface are available.

Steps.Step Description: Enter search criteria: Last Name='Rossi' and City='Milano', then click 'Search'.
Steps.Expected Result: Search executes and results list displays records matching Last Name='Rossi' and City='Milano'.

Steps.Step Description: Apply a date-of-birth range filter: DOB from '1970-01-01' to '1990-12-31' and refresh results.
Steps.Expected Result: Results are filtered to include only records with DOB in the specified range and matching other criteria.

Steps.Step Description: Sort the results by Last Name ascending and then by First Name descending.
Steps.Expected Result: Results list ordering changes according to selected sort criteria.

Steps.Step Description: Open a result detail and verify that the record displayed matches the search criteria used.
Steps.Expected Result: Opened record shows Last Name='Rossi' and City='Milano' and DOB within the selected range.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test dataset contains multiple records with varying Last Names, Cities and DOBs including matches for 'Rossi' in 'Milano'. 2) User has search/view permissions.
test_cases.Dataset: Dataset including records: {Mario Rossi, Milano, DOB 1980-05-15}, {Luigi Rossi, Milano, DOB 1975-03-10}, {Anna Bianchi, Roma, DOB 1990-08-20}
test_cases.Expected Result: Search and filter return only records matching criteria; sorting reflects requested order; selected record details match search criteria.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers basic search, filter ranges and sorting; advanced fuzzy search, performance on large datasets, and saved searches not covered.

test_cases.Title: ValidationAnagrafica_XXX_Anagrafica_FieldValidation_TEST_Computer_mandatory and format validation for create form

Steps.Step Description: Open the Anagrafica Create New Record form after logging in with a user having create permissions.
Steps.Expected Result: The create form is displayed with all expected fields and Save button.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to save the form with all mandatory fields empty and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: The system prevents save and displays validation messages indicating required fields (e.g., 'First Name is required', 'Last Name is required', 'Tax ID is required').

Steps.Step Description: Enter invalid data formats: Email='invalid-email', Phone='abc123', Tax ID='INVALID', Date of Birth='31-02-1980' and attempt to save.
Steps.Expected Result: Field-specific validation errors are shown for invalid formats (e.g., 'Enter a valid email', 'Enter a valid phone number', 'Invalid Tax ID format', 'Invalid date').

Steps.Step Description: Enter a duplicate Tax ID value already present in the system and attempt to save.
Steps.Expected Result: System detects duplicate Tax ID and shows a clear error message preventing creation (e.g., 'A record with this Tax ID already exists').

Steps.Step Description: Correct all validation errors by entering valid values (Email='valido@example.com', Phone='+39021234567', Tax ID unique and valid, DOB='1980-05-15') and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Form saves successfully and no validation errors remain.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester account with create permissions. 2) Validation rules defined in the TEST environment. 3) Test dataset contains at least one record for duplicate check.
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid inputs: {Email:'invalid-email', Phone:'abc123', Tax ID:'INVALID', DOB:'31-02-1980'}; Valid replacement: {Email:'valido@example.com', Phone:'+39021234567', Tax ID:'RSSMRA81E15H501B', DOB:'1981-06-20'}
test_cases.Expected Result: Mandatory and format validations block invalid submissions with clear messages; valid inputs allow successful save.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers mandatory field and basic format validation on UI; server-side validation, internationalization of validation messages and edge case national ID formats not fully covered.

test_cases.Title: RicercaDescrizioneSport_XXX_REQ_BRAND_SPA_SportSection_TEST_Computer_VerifySpanishDescriptionPresent

Steps.Step Description: Launch browser and open Backoffice web application. Login using a user with full Brand Spain navigation and modification permissions (user_spain_editor).
Steps.Expected Result: Backoffice login page loads and user is successfully logged in; dashboard for authorized user is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to 'Configurazione Brand' for 'Brand Spain' and verify language settings.
Steps.Expected Result: Configurazione Brand page for Brand Spain is displayed and shows 'Lingua supportata: Español' and a defined 'Lingua paracadute' (e.g., English).

Steps.Expected Result: The sport entity 'BM_Sport_Entity_001' is found and its details page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: On the sport entity details, inspect the description field and ensure the description is available in Spanish (lingua supportata).
Steps.Expected Result: Description is present and displayed in Spanish. The UI shows the Spanish text and indicates the language as 'Español' or equivalent label.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to view the same sport entity as another user with same permissions to confirm consistency.
Steps.Expected Result: The Spanish description is consistently displayed for other authorized users as well.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. Actor is correctly logged into the application. B. Actor is enabled to navigate and modify within Brand Spain. C. Actor is enabled to modify within Brand Spain. D. In Configurazione Brand the supported language (Spanish) and the parachute language are defined. E. In Brand Master -> Sezione Sport the entity BM_Sport_Entity_001 has a description in Spanish (supported language).
test_cases.Dataset: User: user_spain_editor (editor role), Brand: 'Brand Spain', Sport Entity ID: BM_Sport_Entity_001, Expected language: Español
test_cases.Expected Result: When a sport entity has a description in Spanish and Brand Spain is configured with Spanish as supported language, the Spanish description is displayed in the Brand Master -> Sport section.

test_cases.Title: FallbackDescrizioneSport_XXX_REQ_BRAND_SPA_SportSection_TEST_Computer_VerifyParachuteLanguageFallback

Steps.Step Description: Login to Backoffice as user_spain_editor who has navigation and modification permissions for Brand Spain.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in successfully and has access to Brand Spain sections.

Steps.Step Description: Open 'Configurazione Brand' for Brand Spain and verify that 'Lingua supportata' is Spanish and 'Lingua paracadute' is set (e.g., English).
Steps.Expected Result: Configurazione Brand shows Spanish as supported language and a parachute language is defined.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Brand Master -> Sezione Sport and search for sport entity 'BM_Sport_Entity_002' which has no Spanish description but has description in the parachute language (English).
Steps.Expected Result: Sport entity 'BM_Sport_Entity_002' is found and its details page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect the description field for this entity and verify which language is displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: Since Spanish description is absent, the system displays the description in the configured parachute language (English). The UI indicates that the content is shown in parachute language or labels the language appropriately.

Steps.Step Description: Validate that no Spanish text is shown and that the fallback does not erroneously show machine-translated Spanish (unless feature expected).
Steps.Expected Result: Only the parachute language content (English) is displayed and no incorrect Spanish translation is present.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. Actor is logged in. B. Actor is enabled to navigate and modify within Brand Spain. C. Actor is enabled to modify within Brand Spain. D. Brand configuration defines Spanish as supported language and English as parachute language. E. The BM entity 'BM_Sport_Entity_002' has no Spanish description but has an English description.
test_cases.Dataset: User: user_spain_editor, Brand: Brand Spain, Sport Entity: BM_Sport_Entity_002 (English description only), Parachute language: English

test_cases.Title: MissingDescrizioneSport_XXX_REQ_BRAND_SPA_SportSection_TEST_Computer_VerifyNoDescriptionBehavior

Steps.Step Description: Login to Backoffice as user_spain_editor with navigation/modification rights for Brand Spain.
Steps.Expected Result: Login succeeds and user can access Brand Spain sections.

Steps.Step Description: Verify Brand Spain language configuration lists Spanish as supported and a parachute language is defined.

Steps.Expected Result: Export/publish either proceeds with a documented notice about missing description or blocks action with a clear message, according to product spec. No unhandled errors occur.

Brand configured with Spanish supported and a parachute language. E. BM_Sport_Entity_003 has neither Spanish nor parachute language description.
test_cases.Dataset: User: user_spain_editor, Brand: Brand Spain, Sport Entity: BM_Sport_Entity_003 (no descriptions)

test_cases.Title: PermessiModificaDescrizione_XXX_REQ_BRAND_SPA_SportSection_TEST_Computer_VerifyEditPermissionEnforcement

Steps.Step Description: Login to Backoffice as user_without_edit_rights (a user who is enabled to navigate but NOT enabled to modify within Brand Spain).
Steps.Expected Result: User logs in successfully and can navigate to Brand Spain areas but does not have modification permissions.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Brand Master -> Sezione Sport and open the sport entity 'BM_Sport_Entity_001' that has a Spanish description.
Steps.Expected Result: Entity details are displayed and the description in Spanish is visible (read-only).

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to initiate editing of the description (click Edit or modify description field).
Steps.Expected Result: Edit option is disabled, hidden, or results in a permission denied message. The user is not allowed to enter edit mode.

Steps.Step Description: If the UI erroneously allows editing, attempt to save changes and observe system behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: Save action is blocked with a permission error; no changes persist. If editing is prevented, ensure no UI elements expose editing capabilities for this user role.

Steps.Step Description: Login as user_spain_editor (editor) and confirm that editing is allowed to establish correct permission contrast.
Steps.Expected Result: Editor user can enter edit mode, modify description and save changes successfully, proving permission enforcement is role-based.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. Actor is logged in (user_without_edit_rights). B. Actor is enabled to navigate but NOT enabled to modify within Brand Spain. C. Brand Spain is configured with Spanish and a parachute language. D. BM_Sport_Entity_001 exists with a Spanish description.
test_cases.Dataset: User without edit rights: user_spain_viewer, Editor user: user_spain_editor, Brand: Brand Spain, Sport Entity: BM_Sport_Entity_001
test_cases.Expected Result: Users without modification permissions cannot edit sport descriptions; the system enforces role-based access control and prevents unauthorized modifications.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates UI-level permission enforcement; does not include API-level authorization testing or audit log verification.

test_cases.Title: AssociazioneSport_XXX_REQ_ASSOC_SPORT_TEST_Computer_End-to-end association of a DGOJ Sport with BM Sport

Steps.Step Description: Open the application and navigate to the Brand Spain home page.
Steps.Expected Result: Brand Spain home page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Sport' section following the 'Visualizza lista Sport' base path.
Steps.Expected Result: The Sport listing page for Brand Spain (DGOJ) is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Locate and select the desired DGOJ Sport from the list to open its detail page.
Steps.Expected Result: The DGOJ Sport detail page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Click the CTA 'Associa entità' on the Sport DGOJ detail page.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Associa Sport BM' popup is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the popup contains: filter textbox, 'codice BM' column, 'Icona BM' column, 'Descrizione Sport BM' column, scrollbar, 'Annulla' button (enabled), 'Conferma' button (disabled), and 'X' close icon.
Steps.Expected Result: All listed UI elements are present; 'Conferma' is disabled and 'Annulla' is enabled.

Steps.Step Description: In the popup filter textbox enter the BM Sport name in the Brand supported language (example dataset value: "Football").
Steps.Expected Result: Matching BM Sport items are displayed according to filter logic.

Steps.Step Description: Select the desired BM Sport from the list by clicking the row.
Steps.Expected Result: The selected BM Sport row shows a selection checkmark and the 'Conferma' button becomes enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Click the enabled 'Conferma' button in the popup.
Steps.Expected Result: The popup closes and the selected BM Sport is associated in the DGOJ sport detail view; 'Salva modifiche' button becomes enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Salva modifiche' button to persist the association.
Steps.Expected Result: A temporary toast notification appears confirming changes saved; 'Salva modifiche' becomes disabled after save.

Steps.Step Description: If there are multiple associated BM Sports, verify the ordering of displayed associated sports in DGOJ detail.
Steps.Expected Result: Associated BM Sports are listed in reverse order of association; the most recently associated appears first.

Steps.Step Description: Open the DGOJ sport detail again and confirm the BM Sport association persists.
Steps.Expected Result: The previously associated BM Sport is still shown with its codice BM, icon, and description.

Steps.Step Description: Clean up: if test created an association, remove it or restore previous state according to test environment rules.
Steps.Expected Result: Environment returned to pre-test state or flagged for cleanup.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester is authenticated with a user having permission to view and edit Sports for Brand Spain. 2) The Sport DGOJ to be tested exists and is accessible. 3) Test environment contains BM Sport items including the example 'Football' in dataset. 4) Network connectivity to test environment is available.
test_cases.Dataset: DGOJ Sport ID: DGOJ-12345; BM Sport candidate: { name: 'Football', codiceBM: 'BM-FOOT', description_es: 'Fútbol', description_en: 'Football' }
test_cases.Expected Result: The BM Sport is successfully associated to the DGOJ Sport; UI shows the associated sport with codice, icon and description, 'Salva modifiche' activates then after save a confirmation toast appears and 'Salva modifiche' is disabled.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI flow for associating a single BM Sport and verifying persistence and ordering; backend audit/log verification and multi-user concurrent edits are not covered.

test_cases.Title: FiltroTextbox_XXX_REQ_FILTER_BEHAVIOUR_TEST_Computer_Verify starts-with and contains logic for 1-2 and 3+ characters

Steps.Step Description: Open the application and navigate to Brand Spain 'Sport' section, open a DGOJ Sport detail and click 'Associa entità' to open the association popup.
Steps.Expected Result: The association popup is displayed with the filter textbox.

Steps.Step Description: In the filter textbox enter a single character (example 'F').
Steps.Expected Result: Results are filtered using 'starts-with' logic; only BM Sport entries whose visible name starts with 'F' are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Clear the textbox and enter two characters (example 'Fo').
Steps.Expected Result: Results are filtered using 'starts-with' logic for 'Fo' and show BM Sports starting with 'Fo' (e.g., 'Football').

Steps.Step Description: Extend the input to three characters (example 'For').
Steps.Expected Result: Filter logic switches to 'contains' and results include any BM Sport whose name contains 'For' anywhere in the label (e.g., 'Formula 1', 'Indoor Football' if present).

Steps.Step Description: Enter a 4+ character string (example 'mula') that appears in the middle of some BM Sport names.
Steps.Expected Result: Results continue to use 'contains' and display all BM Sports whose names contain 'mula'.

Steps.Step Description: Clear the textbox and verify that the full list (subject to paging/scroll) is displayed again.
Steps.Expected Result: With empty filter the popup shows the complete BM Sport list (or first page); no unintended filters remain.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester logged in with proper permissions. 2) Association popup contains BM Sport entries with varied names to validate both starts-with and contains behavior.
test_cases.Dataset: BM Sport examples: ['Football','Formula 1','Indoor Football','Handball']
test_cases.Expected Result: Filter textbox applies 'starts-with' for up to 2 characters and 'contains' from 3 characters onward; results match expected examples.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates filter switching behavior only; performance of large result sets and internationalized character normalization not included.

test_cases.Title: ConfermaAbilitazione_XXX_REQ_CONFIRM_BUTTON_TEST_Computer_Confirm button enable/disable and Cancel/X behavior

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to DGOJ Sport detail and open the 'Associa entità' popup.
Steps.Expected Result: Association popup is displayed; 'Conferma' button is visible and disabled; 'Annulla' button is enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Without selecting any BM Sport, verify clicking 'Conferma' does nothing (attempt to click if enabled in UI).
Steps.Expected Result: 'Conferma' is disabled and cannot be activated; no change occurs.

Steps.Step Description: Select a BM Sport row in the popup.
Steps.Expected Result: Selected row shows a checkmark; 'Conferma' button becomes enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Annulla' button while an item is selected.
Steps.Expected Result: Popup closes and no association is made; DGOJ Sport detail remains unchanged and 'Salva modifiche' remains as before opening popup.

Steps.Step Description: Reopen the association popup, select a BM Sport and then click the 'X' (close icon).
Steps.Expected Result: Popup closes and selection is discarded; no association is made.

Steps.Step Description: Reopen the popup, select a BM Sport and click 'Conferma' to proceed, then cancel on any confirmation if present.
Steps.Expected Result: If applicable, a confirmation dialog accepts the action and popup closes; otherwise popup closes and the selection is visible in DGOJ detail UI ready to be saved.

test_cases.Preconditions: User logged in and able to open association popup; BM Sport list available.
test_cases.Dataset: BM Sport candidate: { name: 'Basketball', codiceBM: 'BM-BASK' }
test_cases.Expected Result: The 'Conferma' button remains disabled until a selection is made; 'Annulla' and 'X' close the popup and discard selections; selecting and confirming stages the association for save.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers enablement and cancel behaviors; does not include keyboard accessibility or screen reader behavior.

test_cases.Title: ScrollSelection_XXX_REQ_SCROLL_SELECTION_TEST_Computer_Select BM sport via scrolling beyond initial viewport

Steps.Step Description: Verify the presence and functionality of the scrollbar by scrolling down through the list to reveal items not initially visible.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Conferma' to accept selection.
Steps.Expected Result: Popup closes and selected BM Sport is associated in the DGOJ Sport detail view and 'Salva modifiche' is enabled.

test_cases.Expected Result: Scrollbar allows viewing and selecting items outside the initial viewport; selection persists until confirmed and saved.

test_cases.Title: LocalizzazioneDescrizione_XXX_REQ_LOCALIZATION_TEST_Computer_Verify description language fallback behaviour

Steps.Step Description: Open DGOJ Sport detail and click 'Associa entità' to open the association popup.
Steps.Expected Result: Popup opens and BM Sport rows are visible with description column.

Steps.Step Description: Identify a BM Sport that has a description in the Brand supported language (Spanish) and verify the displayed description.
Steps.Expected Result: If a Spanish description exists it is displayed in the Descrizione Sport BM column.

Steps.Step Description: Identify a BM Sport that does not have a Spanish description but has a parachute language description (e.g., English), and verify the displayed description.
Steps.Expected Result: For the item without Spanish description, the parachute language description is displayed in the column.

Steps.Step Description: Repeat by changing the Brand supported language context if test environment allows (simulate different Brand language) and verify the popup picks the appropriate language or fallback.
Steps.Expected Result: Descriptions are shown in the supported language when available; otherwise the parachute language is displayed consistently.

test_cases.Title: CambioSezioneConModificaNonSalvata_XXX_ALT-CambioSezione_FrontEnd_TEST_Computer_VerifyConfirmNavigatesToSectionHome

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application and log in with valid credentials. Navigate to Section A and open an editable form or area. Make a visible modification to a field but do NOT save the change.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated, Section A is displayed, an editable form is open and contains an unsaved modification (e.g., text in 'Description' field).

Steps.Step Description: From Section A, click the navigation control (menu item or button) to access Section B (another section).
Steps.Expected Result: A modal popup (interruption dialog) is displayed warning about unsaved changes, offering options such as 'Confirm' (leave without saving) and 'Cancel' (stay and keep changes).

Steps.Step Description: In the interruption dialog, click the 'Confirm' button to proceed to the selected section despite unsaved changes.
Steps.Expected Result: The dialog closes and the application navigates to Section B; the Section B homepage is displayed (verify page title/header and URL correspond to Section B).

Steps.Step Description: Validate that the previously unsaved modification is NOT persisted in Section A (return to Section A to verify) and no save confirmation was shown.
Steps.Expected Result: When navigating back to Section A, the editable form does not contain the previously unsaved value (field shows original or blank value). No save action was triggered by the front end; no success save notification is present.

Steps.Step Description: Verify there are no error messages and that the navigation flow ends on the Section B homepage.
Steps.Expected Result: Section B homepage is fully loaded with expected elements (header, main content). The use case ends successfully.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has valid user credentials. 2) Tester is online and can access the application environment (TEST). 3) Section A and Section B are available in the navigation. 4) No autosave is forced by environment. 5) Browser cache cleared or test in incognito to avoid side effects.
test_cases.Dataset: User: testuser@example.com / Password: Password123; Section A form field 'Description' value: 'Temporary edit - do not save'
test_cases.Expected Result: When the user confirms leaving despite unsaved changes, the application navigates to the selected section homepage (Section B) and the unsaved change in Section A is not persisted.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Cambio sezione con modifica non salvata
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client-side interruption dialog confirm path and navigation to the target section. Does not cover server-side autosave mechanisms or backend persistence verification beyond basic UI checks.

test_cases.Title: CambioSezioneConModificaNonSalvata_XXX_ALT-CambioSezione_FrontEnd_TEST_Computer_VerifyCancelKeepsUserOnSameSection

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application and log in with valid credentials. Navigate to Section A and open an editable form or area. Make a visible modification to a field but DO NOT save the change.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated, Section A is displayed, an editable form is open and contains an unsaved modification (e.g., text in 'Title' field).

Steps.Step Description: From Section A, click the navigation control (menu item or button) to access Section B (another section).
Steps.Expected Result: A modal popup (interruption dialog) is displayed warning about unsaved changes, offering options such as 'Confirm' (leave without saving) and 'Cancel' (stay and keep changes).

Steps.Step Description: In the interruption dialog, click the 'Cancel' button to abort navigation and remain on the current section.
Steps.Expected Result: The dialog closes and the application remains on Section A; no navigation to Section B occurs.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the unsaved modification is still present in the editable form and no data loss has occurred.
Steps.Expected Result: The form field retains the unsaved value entered in Step 1 (e.g., 'Title' field still shows the temporary edit). No automatic save or discard has occurred.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt navigation again and re-open the interruption dialog to confirm consistent behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: Interruption dialog is shown again upon navigation attempt; choosing 'Cancel' again keeps the user on Section A with unsaved modifications intact.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has valid user credentials. 2) Tester is online and can access the application environment (TEST). 3) Section A has an editable form. 4) No external auto-save process active.
test_cases.Dataset: User: testuser@example.com / Password: Password123; Section A form field 'Title' value: 'Draft title - keep'
test_cases.Expected Result: When the user cancels the interruption dialog, navigation is aborted, the user remains in the current section, and unsaved changes are preserved.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Cambio sezione con modifica non salvata
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers cancel path of interruption dialog and client-side preservation of unsaved changes. Does not cover session timeout scenarios or backend persistence.

test_cases.Title: AnnullaCambioSezione_XXX_PERCORSO_ALTERNATIVO_CambioSezione_TEST_Computer_PressAnnullaWithUnsavedChanges_returnsToStep9

Steps.Step Description: Launch the web application and navigate to the login page.
Steps.Expected Result: Login page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Authenticate with a valid user account that has permission to edit the target section (use test account 'test.user@example.com' / 'Password123').
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and home/dashboard page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the section referenced in the base path (the one from which the alternative path originates).
Steps.Expected Result: Target section page/form is displayed and editable fields are visible.

Steps.Step Description: Make one or more modifications in the section without saving (e.g., change a text field value and modify a select/dropdown).
Steps.Expected Result: Changes are reflected in the UI but not saved to the server (no save action performed).

Steps.Step Description: Press the 'Annulla' button.
Steps.Expected Result: The application cancels the current operation and navigates back to the UI/state corresponding to step 9 of the base path.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the application displays the screen/state defined by step 9 of the base path and that previously made changes are not persisted.
Steps.Expected Result: The UI corresponds exactly to the state described in base path step 9; the unsaved modifications are discarded and not present in the section; no save confirmation is shown and no changes are persisted on backend.

Steps.Step Description: Refresh the page or reopen the section to ensure changes were not saved on the server.
Steps.Expected Result: After refresh/reopen the section shows the original data prior to the unsaved edits; server data remains unchanged.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user account exists with edit permissions. 2) The section referenced by base path step 9 is available and contains known baseline data. 3) Network connectivity to test environment is available. 4) Tester is logged in before executing step actions.
test_cases.Dataset: User: test.user@example.com / Password123; baseline record ID: SECTION-100 (contains known values to validate discard).
test_cases.Expected Result: When 'Annulla' is pressed while there are unsaved changes, the operation is cancelled, the application returns to the UI/state defined in base path step 9, and all unsaved modifications are discarded (not persisted).
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Cambio sezione con modifica non salvata – annullamento dell'operazione
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only the cancel action behavior when unsaved edits exist and the navigation back to base path step 9. Does not cover confirmation dialogs if introduced by UX nor backend error handling.

test_cases.Title: AnnullaCambioSezione_XXX_PERCORSO_ALTERNATIVO_CambioSezione_TEST_Computer_PressAnnullaWithoutChanges_returnsToStep9_noDataLoss

Steps.Step Description: Launch the web application and log in with a valid test user account (test.user@example.com / Password123).
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and the dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the target section (same section as base path step 9) but do not make any changes to the fields.
Steps.Expected Result: Target section is displayed with baseline data and no edit operations performed.

Steps.Step Description: Press the 'Annulla' button.
Steps.Expected Result: The application cancels the operation and navigates to the UI/state corresponding to step 9 of the base path without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that no changes were attempted/saved and that navigation occurred smoothly.
Steps.Expected Result: No save was triggered, the application state matches base path step 9, and there are no error messages or unexpected prompts.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user account exists. 2) Target section accessible and contains baseline data. 3) No unsaved edits present prior to pressing 'Annulla'.
test_cases.Dataset: User: test.user@example.com / Password123; baseline record ID: SECTION-100.
test_cases.Expected Result: Pressing 'Annulla' with no unsaved changes returns the user to the state defined in base path step 9 without any data loss, prompts, or errors.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Cambio sezione con modifica non salvata – annullamento dell'operazione

test_cases.Title: DGOJDetailError_XXX_REQ-DGOJ_DETAIL_DGOJApp_TEST_Computer_Error page displayed when detail not returned

Steps.Step Description: Ensure tester is logged into the application with a user account that has permissions to view and associate DGOJ Sports.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and on the application main page with access to Sport DGOJ functionality.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the DGOJ Sports listing page (menu or path: Admin > Sports > DGOJ Sports).
Steps.Expected Result: DGOJ Sports listing is displayed with a list of available DGOJ Sport entries.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the UI response after the failed detail request.
Steps.Expected Result: The application displays the error page (error UI) for DGOJ Sport detail access instead of the detail view.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the error page is shown within 5 seconds and that no partial or corrupted detail fields are shown.
Steps.Expected Result: Error page is rendered within 5 seconds; no partial sport detail is visible.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has valid credentials and appropriate permissions. 2) Test environment has an API simulator or mechanism to force the DGOJ detail endpoint to fail or return empty. 3) Network connectivity to test environment.

test_cases.Title: DGOJAssociationBlocked_XXX_REQ-DGOJ_ASSOC_DGOJApp_TEST_Computer_User cannot proceed with association when detail unavailable

Steps.Step Description: Login and navigate to DGOJ Sports listing where association to BM Sport is normally initiated.
Steps.Expected Result: User is on DGOJ Sports listing page and can select an item for association under normal conditions.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate DGOJ detail retrieval failure for the selected Sport (same test setup as TC-001) and open the error page.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to proceed with the association workflow from the error page (e.g., click 'Associate', 'Map to BM Sport' or follow any link that would start association).
Steps.Expected Result: The application must not allow starting or proceeding with the association of the DGOJ Sport to a BM Sport. Buttons/links are disabled or the operation is blocked with an explanatory message.

Steps.Step Description: From an administrative perspective, attempt to invoke the association endpoint directly (if permitted in test) using the SportID while the detail service is down.
Steps.Expected Result: The backend/service rejects association requests for a DGOJ Sport that has no validated detail; no association record is created.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that no association record exists for the attempted SportID in the application (database or audit UI) after the blocked attempt.
Steps.Expected Result: No association entry with the specified SportID is present; audit logs (if accessible) indicate the association was not performed due to missing detail.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application / Test DB access for verification
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has admin permissions to view association and audit logs. 2) Test environment can simulate DGOJ detail failure. 3) Access to DB or backoffice audit UI to confirm absence of association.
test_cases.Dataset: Admin user: admin_test@example.com / SportID: DGOJ-SPORT-TEST-003 / DB connection for verification.
test_cases.Expected Result: When the DGOJ detail is unavailable, the system prevents the association workflow from starting or completing and no association is created.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Errore nell'accesso al dettaglio dello Sport DGOJ

test_cases.Title: DGOJAlternatePathTermination_XXX_REQ-DGOJ_FLOW_DGOJApp_TEST_Computer_Use case ends after error

Steps.Step Description: Prepare environment to reproduce DGOJ detail failure and navigate to the DGOJ Sport detail (triggering the error).
Steps.Expected Result: Error page is shown after attempting to open the DGOJ Sport detail.

Steps.Step Description: From the error page, attempt navigations available to the actor (e.g., 'Back to list', 'Home', any suggested next steps). Execute each available navigation option sequentially.
Steps.Expected Result: Each navigation option behaves as expected: 'Back to list' returns to DGOJ listing, 'Home' returns to main dashboard. No continuation of the association flow occurs from these actions.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the use case ends and that there is no residual state that would allow the user to later continue the association for that same item without re-initiating the flow (refresh the listing, re-open item after service recovery required).
Steps.Expected Result: The use case terminates at the error; to retry association the user must re-initiate the flow once the DGOJ detail is available. No partial workflow state is left that would auto-complete when service is restored.

Steps.Step Description: If possible, restore the DGOJ detail service and re-attempt to open the same Sport entry to confirm that successful detail retrieval is required to re-initiate association.
Steps.Expected Result: After service restoration, opening the Sport entry returns the proper detail view and the association workflow can be started anew. The prior failed attempt did not produce an association.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester can toggle the DGOJ detail service off and on in the test environment. 2) Tester has an account with required permissions.
test_cases.Dataset: User: test_user@example.com / SportID: DGOJ-SPORT-TEST-004 / Service toggle access.
test_cases.Expected Result: The alternate error path ends the use case; the user cannot proceed with association and must re-initiate the workflow after the detail service is back to proceed.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Errore nell'accesso al dettaglio dello Sport DGOJ
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates flow termination and recovery re-initiation only; does not validate long-term state persistence or monitoring alerts.

test_cases.Title: SaveErrorToast_XXX_modifiche_non_salvate_SalvaModifiche_TEST_Computer_validate_modal_toast_display

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application and authenticate with a valid user account.
Steps.Expected Result: Application home page is displayed and user is logged in.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the grid/listing page where records can be edited.
Steps.Expected Result: The grid page is displayed with records loaded.

Steps.Step Description: Select a record and change one or more editable fields, then click the 'Salva modifiche' (Save changes) button.
Steps.Expected Result: The client sends the save request and the UI indicates a save attempt (e.g., spinner or disabled button).

Steps.Step Description: Simulate or wait for the server-side failure condition that prevents changes from being saved (e.g., force API to return 500 or network error).
Steps.Expected Result: The client receives an error response from the server or times out.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the UI after the failed save attempt.
Steps.Expected Result: A modal toast error is displayed to the user indicating that the modifications were not saved correctly. The message text must be clear (e.g., 'Modifiche non salvate. Riprovare più tardi.') and the modal toast must be dismissible or present appropriate action options.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has valid user credentials. 2) Test environment configured to allow forcing a server error or network failure for save operation. 3) At least one editable record exists in the grid. 4) Tester has access to developer tools or test hooks to simulate server error if needed.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials: test_user/password; Record ID: 1001; Original field value: 'A'; New field value: 'B'.
test_cases.Expected Result: When the save operation fails, the client displays a clear modal toast error informing the user that the modifications were not saved.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – modifiche non salvate correttamente
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates client-side error reporting (modal toast) only. Does not validate server logs or backend rollback mechanisms.

test_cases.Title: GridUnchanged_XXX_modifiche_non_salvate_Grid_TEST_Computer_validate_grid_no_change_after_failed_save

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application and log in with valid test credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: Home page loads and user session is active.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the grid/listing page and record the current values of the target record fields (take screenshots or note values).
Steps.Expected Result: Original values for the selected record are recorded (e.g., Field1='Alpha', Field2='10').

Steps.Step Description: Edit the record fields to new values and click 'Salva modifiche'.
Steps.Expected Result: Save request is initiated by the client.

Steps.Step Description: Force or wait for the save operation to fail (server error, validation error, or network issue).
Steps.Expected Result: Client receives an error and displays an error indicator (toast/modal).

Steps.Step Description: Refresh the grid view (or navigate away and return) to ensure the displayed data is reloaded from the server.
Steps.Expected Result: The grid reloads and the previously edited record shows the original values (no changes were persisted).

Steps.Step Description: Verify that there is no indication in the grid that the changes were saved (no success marker, no timestamp of edit, etc.).
Steps.Expected Result: Grid shows no saved changes; visual cues indicate the record remains unchanged.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Valid user account. 2) Test record exists and original values documented. 3) Mechanism to simulate save failure is available.
test_cases.Dataset: User: test_user; Record ID: 1002; Original values: FieldA='100', FieldB='X'; Edited values: FieldA='200', FieldB='Y'.
test_cases.Expected Result: After a failed save, the grid displays the original (pre-edit) values and no changes are persisted.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – modifiche non salvate correttamente
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI-level verification that unsaved changes are not persisted; does not verify backend database state beyond UI reload.

test_cases.Title: MultipleEditsRevert_XXX_modifiche_non_salvate_SalvaModifiche_TEST_Computer_validate_all_edits_not_saved_and_user_can_retry

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the web application with a valid account and open the target grid.
Steps.Expected Result: Grid with editable rows is displayed and user is authenticated.

Steps.Step Description: Make edits to multiple rows or multiple fields across a record (e.g., change Field1 and Field2).
Steps.Expected Result: UI shows the edited values in-place and indicates unsaved state where applicable (e.g., an asterisk or unsaved marker).

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Salva modifiche' to attempt to save all edits in a single operation.
Steps.Expected Result: Client initiates a bulk save request for all changes.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate a partial or complete failure of the bulk save operation (server returns error or times out).
Steps.Expected Result: Client receives error response and shows a modal toast error indicating modifications were not saved correctly.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the state of the grid after the failure: check all edited rows/fields and confirm whether any of the edits were applied.
Steps.Expected Result: No edits are applied; the grid shows pre-edit values for all affected rows/fields (i.e., all modifications were not saved).

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to re-apply edits: edit one record again, click 'Salva modifiche' after ensuring the server is responding, and verify save success.
Steps.Expected Result: When server is available, the save operation succeeds and changes are persisted. This confirms the application allows retry after failure.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has valid credentials. 2) Multiple editable records present. 3) Ability to simulate bulk save failure and then restore normal server responses.
test_cases.Dataset: User: test_user; Record IDs: 2001,2002; Original values documented; Edited values: various fields changed.
test_cases.Expected Result: On failed bulk save, none of the edits are persisted and the client shows an error toast. After resolving the failure, the user can retry and successfully save changes.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – modifiche non salvate correttamente
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates behavior for bulk edits and retry flow at UI level; does not validate backend transaction atomicity beyond observed UI outcomes.

test_cases.Title: DeleteAssociation_XXX_REQ-EliminaAssociazione_SportDGOJtoSportBM_Backoffice_TEST_Desktop_concurrent deletion

Steps.Step Description: Open two Backoffice sessions (Session A and Session B) with two admin users (admin_A and admin_B). Ensure association DGOJ_1005 ↔ BM_2005 exists.
Steps.Expected Result: Both sessions display the Sport Mapping list and show association DGOJ_1005 ↔ BM_2005.

Steps.Step Description: In Session A, click 'Delete' for the association and confirm deletion.
Steps.Expected Result: Session A receives success notification and the association is removed from its list.

Steps.Step Description: Immediately in Session B (before refreshing), click 'Delete' for the same association and confirm.
Steps.Expected Result: Session B receives a graceful error or notification indicating the association no longer exists or the operation failed; no duplicate or inconsistent state occurs.

Steps.Step Description: Refresh Session B and verify the association is absent. Check audit logs for both users to ensure single deletion entry and appropriate error/log for second attempt.
Steps.Expected Result: Only one successful deletion recorded (admin_A) and admin_B has a logged failed attempt or 'Not Found'; system remains consistent.

test_cases.Preconditions: Two admin accounts exist; assoc-5005 (DGOJ_1005 ↔ BM_2005) exists; sessions operate concurrently.
test_cases.Dataset: admin_A/admin_B credentials; assoc-5005; two browser sessions.
test_cases.Expected Result: Concurrent deletion attempts are handled safely: single successful deletion, subsequent attempts fail gracefully, and audit reflects correct sequence.

test_cases.Title: DeleteAssociation_XXX_REQ-EliminaAssociazione_SportDGOJtoSportBM_Backoffice_TEST_Desktop_db failure handling

test_cases.Expected Result: System handles DB failures gracefully: user is informed, no inconsistent data introduced, and proper error logs are generated.
test_cases._polarion: Caso d'uso: Elimina associazione Sport DGOJ a Sport BM

test_cases.Title: EliminaAssociazioneSport_XXX_REQ-DEL-SPORT_AdminConsole_TEST_Desktop_Delete existing DGOJ-BM association

Steps.Step Description: Open the Web Admin Console and log in with an actor account that has permission to manage sport mappings (username: admin_mapper, password: Admin@123).
Steps.Expected Result: Admin Console login page is displayed and actor is successfully logged in, landing on the Dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Sport Mapping' management section (e.g., Main Menu > Configuration > Sport Mapping).
Steps.Expected Result: Sport Mapping list page is displayed with existing DGOJ-to-BM associations.

Steps.Step Description: Identify an existing association row between DGOJ Sport with ID 'DGOJ_SP_100' and BM Sport with ID 'BM_SP_250'.
Steps.Expected Result: The association row for DGOJ_SP_100 -> BM_SP_250 is present and selectable.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Delete' action/button associated with the DGOJ_SP_100 -> BM_SP_250 mapping.
Steps.Expected Result: A confirmation dialog is displayed asking the user to confirm deletion with clear message (e.g., 'Are you sure you want to delete this mapping? This action cannot be undone.') and options 'Confirm' and 'Cancel'.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Confirm' to proceed with deletion.
Steps.Expected Result: The system performs the deletion, displays a success notification (e.g., 'Mapping deleted successfully'), and the mapping row is removed from the UI list.

Steps.Step Description: Refresh the Sport Mapping list page.
Steps.Expected Result: The mapping DGOJ_SP_100 -> BM_SP_250 remains absent after refresh.

Steps.Step Description: Verify via backend/API or database that there is no persistent association record for DGOJ_SP_100 to BM_SP_250 (use API GET /mappings or database query).
Steps.Expected Result: Backend/API/database confirms the association record has been deleted (no record returned for DGOJ_SP_100 -> BM_SP_250).

Steps.Step Description: Verify audit/logging that records the deletion event by navigating to Audit Logs or querying audit API (filter by actor 'admin_mapper' and action 'delete_mapping').
Steps.Expected Result: An audit entry exists with actor 'admin_mapper', action 'delete_mapping', target DGOJ_SP_100 -> BM_SP_250, timestamp within the test execution time, and status 'success'.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Admin account 'admin_mapper' exists with mapping-management permission. 2) Mapping DGOJ_SP_100 -> BM_SP_250 exists in the system. 3) Tester has access to backend/API or DB for verification. 4) Network connectivity to UAT environment is available.
test_cases.Dataset: User: admin_mapper/Admin@123; Existing mapping: DGOJ_SP_100 -> BM_SP_250; APIs: GET /mappings, GET /audit-logs
test_cases.Expected Result: The specified DGOJ to BM sport association is deleted successfully; UI reflects removal; backend/database shows record removed; audit log entry created.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers deletion happy path and verification via UI and backend; does not cover load/concurrency or cascading business effects on related objects (e.g., bets referencing the sport).

test_cases.Title: EliminaAssociazioneSport_XXX_REQ-DEL-SPORT_AdminConsole_TEST_Desktop_Delete non-existent association

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Admin Console / Admin API

test_cases.Expected Result: System returns a clear 'not found' error and does not delete any other mappings.

test_cases.Title: EliminaAssociazioneSport_XXX_REQ-DEL-SPORT_AdminConsole_TEST_Desktop_UserWithoutPermission_BLOCK deletion attempt

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Web Admin Console with a user account that does NOT have mapping deletion permission (username: viewer_user, password: Viewer@123).

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Sport Mapping management and locate an existing mapping DGOJ_SP_102 -> BM_SP_261.
Steps.Expected Result: Mapping list is visible, but action buttons for deletion are either not present or disabled for the current user role.

Steps.Expected Result: The UI either prevents the action (button disabled) or, if attempted, the system returns an authorization error (e.g., HTTP 403 Forbidden) and displays an appropriate message 'You do not have permission to perform this action'. No deletion occurs.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the mapping still exists in the UI and backend.
Steps.Expected Result: Mapping DGOJ_SP_102 -> BM_SP_261 remains intact in both UI and backend; no audit entry for deletion by viewer_user is recorded.

test_cases.Expected Result: Users without deletion permission cannot delete mappings; system returns authorization error and mapping remains unchanged.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates RBAC enforcement for delete operation; does not validate role assignment workflows.

test_cases.Title: EliminaAssociazioneSport_XXX_REQ-DEL-SPORT_AdminConsole_TEST_Desktop_Delete with server error_ROLLBACK expected

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Web Admin Console as 'admin_mapper' and navigate to Sport Mapping management where mapping DGOJ_SP_103 -> BM_SP_262 exists.
Steps.Expected Result: User authenticated and mapping visible.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate a transient server error during deletion (coordinate with test environment to inject failure or use network throttling to cause timeout) and initiate deletion of DGOJ_SP_103 -> BM_SP_262 by clicking 'Delete' and confirming.
Steps.Expected Result: The UI shows an error state (e.g., spinner then error message) indicating deletion failed (e.g., 'Deletion failed due to server error. Please try again.').

Steps.Step Description: After error message, refresh the Sport Mapping list and check backend/API for the mapping DGOJ_SP_103 -> BM_SP_262.
Steps.Expected Result: Mapping still exists (system performed rollback or did not delete); data integrity is preserved; no partial or inconsistent state is present.

Steps.Step Description: Verify audit logs to ensure that deletion attempt is recorded with status 'failed' and includes error details.
Steps.Expected Result: Audit entry exists indicating deletion attempt by 'admin_mapper' and a failure status with error message/reason.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Admin Console / UAT Backend with fault injection
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Mapping DGOJ_SP_103 -> BM_SP_262 exists. 2) Test environment supports fault injection or network simulation. 3) Tester coordinates with environment admin to simulate the server error.
test_cases.Dataset: User: admin_mapper/Admin@123; Mapping: DGOJ_SP_103 -> BM_SP_262; Fault injection configuration details
test_cases.Expected Result: On server/network failure during deletion the system reports an error, preserves the mapping (rollback), and logs the failed attempt in audit logs.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers transactional rollback on failure; does not test long-term retry or queueing mechanisms.

test_cases.Title: EliminaAssociazioneSport_XXX_REQ-DEL-SPORT_AdminConsole_TEST_Desktop_ConfirmationDialog_UI and accessibility

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Web Admin Console with 'admin_mapper' and navigate to Sport Mapping management.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and mapping list is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Delete' for any existing mapping (e.g., DGOJ_SP_104 -> BM_SP_263) to open the confirmation dialog.

Steps.Expected Result: Dialog text correctly identifies the mapping and the buttons show localized labels. No ambiguous wording is present.

Steps.Step Description: Check keyboard accessibility: press Tab to navigate to 'Confirm' and 'Cancel' buttons and press Enter to activate them; also test Esc key to close dialog.
Steps.Expected Result: Tab order reaches the buttons, Enter triggers the focused button action, and Esc closes the dialog equivalent to 'Cancel'.

Steps.Step Description: Check screen-reader accessibility by enabling screen-reader and re-opening the confirmation dialog; ensure dialog elements are announced correctly (title, message, buttons).
Steps.Expected Result: Screen reader announces dialog title, message, and each button with role and label. Focus is trapped in dialog until closed.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Mapping DGOJ_SP_104 -> BM_SP_263 exists. 2) Accessibility tools are available (screen reader). 3) Application is set to test language/localization.

test_cases.Expected Result: Confirmation dialog UI is correct, localized, and accessible via keyboard and screen readers; focus is managed properly.

test_cases.Title: View_Anagrafica_XXX_AttoriUtenteAnagrafica_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_Verify_user_can_view_own_profile

test_cases.Title: Edit_Anagrafica_XXX_AttoriUtenteAnagrafica_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_Edit_personal_details
