test_cases.Title: Edit_AnagraficaInvalid_XXX_AttoriUtenteAnagrafica_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_Validate_input_error_handling

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application and log in as 'Utente Anagrafica' (user_anagrafica).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and lands on the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to 'Anagrafica' and open the edit form for the user's profile.
Steps.Expected Result: Edit form shows current data with editable fields and validation hints where applicable.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to set Email to an invalid format 'invalid-email-format' and leave Full Name empty (mandatory field), then click Save.
Steps.Expected Result: Client-side and/or server-side validation prevents saving and displays clear validation messages next to the Email and Full Name fields.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to set Full Name to a very long string (e.g., 500 characters) and click Save.
Steps.Expected Result: System enforces maximum length: either truncates input with warning or rejects with validation error; no crash occurs.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to set Phone number using non-numeric characters and click Save.
Steps.Expected Result: Validation error is shown for Phone field and changes are not saved.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that after failed validation attempts, the original valid data remains unchanged in the profile when canceling or navigating away.
Steps.Expected Result: Original profile data is still present and unchanged; no partial or invalid data has been persisted.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Valid 'Utente Anagrafica' account exists. 2) Validation rules and constraints are defined (mandatory fields, max lengths, formats).
test_cases.Dataset: Username: user_anagrafica; Password: Password123!; Invalid Email: invalid-email-format; Overlength Name: 'A' * 500; Invalid Phone: '+39ABC1234'
test_cases.Expected Result: System displays appropriate validation errors for invalid inputs and prevents persistence of invalid data; original data remains unchanged.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client and server validation for common invalid inputs. Does not cover every international format or all possible edge cases.

test_cases.Title: Permission_Anagrafica_XXX_AttoriUtenteAnagrafica_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_prevent_edit_other_profiles

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application and log in as 'Utente Anagrafica' with account A (username: userA, password: PasswordA!).
Steps.Expected Result: User A is authenticated and can access the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access another user's (userB) Anagrafica profile by searching for userB in the application or by direct URL manipulation to userB's profile ID.
Steps.Expected Result: Access is restricted: either userB does not appear in search results, the profile is not accessible, or an 'Access Denied' or 'Not Authorized' message is shown.

Steps.Step Description: If the profile view is accessible in read-only mode, attempt to click 'Edit' and then save changes to userB's profile.
Steps.Expected Result: The Edit action is disabled or the Save action is blocked and an error message is shown; changes are not persisted.

Steps.Step Description: Observe any error messages or UI behavior, and verify server response codes via developer tools (if available) when attempting unauthorized access (expected 403 Forbidden or similar).
Steps.Expected Result: Server responds with appropriate HTTP status for unauthorized operations (403/401) and the UI shows a clear authorization error message without exposing sensitive data.

Steps.Step Description: Log out and log in as an administrative user (if available) to confirm that administrative accounts can access/edit userB's Anagrafica.
Steps.Expected Result: Admin user with appropriate permissions can access and edit userB's profile (confirming permission model works).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Two regular user accounts exist (userA, userB). 2) Permission model documented: regular users can only access/edit their own Anagrafica. 3) Admin account exists for control test.
test_cases.Dataset: User A: userA / PasswordA!; User B: userB / PasswordB!; Admin: admin / AdminPass!
test_cases.Expected Result: Regular user cannot view or edit other users' Anagrafica; unauthorized access attempts are blocked and logged. Admins with proper rights can manage other users.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers basic authorization checks for same-tenant users. Does not exercise complex RBAC hierarchies or external SSO authorization flows.

test_cases.Title: SearchFilter_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Desktop_Search and filter registry records

Steps.Expected Result: List shows only records matching surname 'Rossi' (case-insensitive) and highlights search term where applicable.

test_cases.Title: EliminaAssociazioneSport_XXX_REQ_DeleteAssociation_SportMapping_TEST_Computer_Verify successful deletion and save

Steps.Step Description: Login to the Backoffice web application with a user account that has permission to manage Sport DGOJ associations (use provided credentials).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and the Backoffice home page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate through the menu to the Brand Spain section and then to the Sport list following the standard 'Visualizza lista Sport' path.
Steps.Expected Result: The Brand Spain Sport list is displayed and the user lands on the Sport DGOJ section for Brand Spain.

Steps.Step Description: From the Sport DGOJ list, select a Sport DGOJ entry that has at least one associated Sport BM (identify using 'Ass. BM' flag).
Steps.Expected Result: The selected Sport DGOJ detail page is opened and shows at least one associated Sport BM row with the trash/delete icon present (as in Figura 13).

Steps.Step Description: Click the trash/delete icon corresponding to the Sport BM association you want to remove.
Steps.Expected Result: The association row is marked for deletion in the UI (association row visually shows deletion state) and the 'Salva modifiche' button becomes enabled (as shown in Figura 15).

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Salva modifiche' button.
Steps.Expected Result: A confirmation popup is displayed requesting confirmation to remove the association (popup matches Figura 14) and the Save action is pending confirmation.

Steps.Step Description: In the confirmation popup click the 'Conferma' button to confirm deletion.
Steps.Expected Result: Popup is dismissed and the client shows a temporary toast notification indicating that changes were saved successfully; the deleted Sport BM row disappears from the Sport DGOJ detail and the 'Ass. BM' flag is removed from the table (as in Figura 16).

Steps.Step Description: Verify in the Sport DGOJ detail that the association row is removed and the 'Salva modifiche' button returns to disabled state (if no other unsaved changes).
Steps.Expected Result: The deleted association is no longer present in the UI, the Ass. BM column no longer shows the flag for that Sport DGOJ, and Save is disabled when no further changes exist.

Steps.Step Description: Optionally, refresh the Sport DGOJ detail page and verify persistence of deletion.
Steps.Expected Result: After refresh the previously deleted Sport BM association remains removed and the 'Ass. BM' flag remains absent.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user exists with manage-association permissions. 2) The selected Brand is Spain and has at least one Sport DGOJ entry associated to a Sport BM. 3) Network connection available. 4) Tester has credentials: test_user_spain / Password1!
test_cases.Dataset: User: test_user_spain; Sport DGOJ ID: DGOJ-123 (has associated Sport BM ID: BM-456)
test_cases.Expected Result: The Sport BM association is removed from the Sport DGOJ detail, changes are saved successfully, the UI displays a success toast, and the 'Ass. BM' flag is removed and persisted after refresh.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI flow for deletion and persistence verification; backend audit logs and DB-level verification not included.

test_cases.Title: EliminaAssociazioneSport_XXX_REQ_DeleteAssociation_CancelFlow_TEST_Computer_Verify cancellation does not remove association

Steps.Step Description: Login to the Backoffice web application with a user account that has permission to manage Sport DGOJ associations.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and the Backoffice home page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Brand Spain -> Sport list and open the detail page of a Sport DGOJ entry that has at least one Sport BM association.
Steps.Expected Result: Sport DGOJ detail page is shown with at least one Sport BM association and the trash icon visible.

Steps.Step Description: Click the trash/delete icon next to an associated Sport BM to mark it for deletion.
Steps.Expected Result: UI marks the row for deletion and 'Salva modifiche' becomes enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Salva modifiche' and when the confirmation popup appears, click the 'Annulla' or close the popup (do NOT confirm).
Steps.Expected Result: The popup is dismissed without confirming; no server-side deletion occurs and the UI still shows the original association row (or the mark-for-deletion is reverted).

Steps.Step Description: If the UI still shows the row marked for deletion, perform an explicit 'Cancel changes' action or refresh the page to discard unsaved changes.
Steps.Expected Result: The association row is present again and the 'Ass. BM' flag remains set; 'Salva modifiche' returns to disabled.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user with proper permissions. 2) Sport DGOJ entry has at least one Sport BM associated. 3) Browser cache cleared or known state.
test_cases.Dataset: User: test_user_spain; Sport DGOJ ID: DGOJ-123 (associated BM-456)
test_cases.Expected Result: Cancelling the confirmation retains the original Sport BM association; no changes are saved and the 'Ass. BM' flag remains.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers cancel/abort flow at confirmation popup; does not include concurrent modification scenarios.

test_cases.Title: EliminaAssociazioneSport_XXX_REQ_DeleteAssociation_NoAssociationPresent_TEST_Computer_Verify delete button absent or disabled

test_cases.Title: EliminaAssociazioneSport_XXX_REQ_DeleteAssociation_NetworkFailure_TEST_Computer_Verify error handling on save failure

Steps.Step Description: Login to Backoffice with a user that can manage Sport associations.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and Backoffice home is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Brand Spain -> Sport list and open a Sport DGOJ detail that has at least one Sport BM association.
Steps.Expected Result: Sport DGOJ detail page shows an associated Sport BM row and trash icon is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Click the trash icon to mark the association for deletion so that 'Salva modifiche' becomes enabled.
Steps.Expected Result: Row is marked for deletion and 'Salva modifiche' becomes enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate network failure or server error before clicking 'Salva modifiche' (e.g., disable network in browser dev tools or point API to return 500).
Steps.Expected Result: Network calls to save will fail or return error when attempted.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Salva modifiche' and confirm the deletion in the confirmation popup while the simulated failure is active.
Steps.Expected Result: Client attempts to save, save request fails, and the client displays a clear error message/toast indicating the save failed. The UI should keep the association row visible or indicate that the deletion was not completed.

Steps.Step Description: Restore network connectivity or remove server error simulation and retry saving the same change.
Steps.Expected Result: Save retry succeeds: success toast is shown and the association row is removed; the 'Ass. BM' flag is cleared and persisted after refresh.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user with permissions. 2) Sport DGOJ with association exists (DGOJ-123). 3) Ability to simulate network failure (developer tools or proxy).
test_cases.Dataset: User: test_user_spain; Sport DGOJ ID: DGOJ-123; BM association: BM-456; network simulation tool
test_cases.Expected Result: On save failure the system surfaces a clear error and does not remove the association; after connectivity restoration the save can be retried and will succeed, removing the association and clearing the flag.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client-side error handling for save failures and recovery; does not cover detailed backend retry/backoff mechanisms.

test_cases.Title: SelezionaSportDGOJ_NoBM_XXX_REQ-ALT_AssociazioneBM_Backoffice_TEST_Computer_VerifyDeleteNotAvailable

test_cases.Title: SelezionaSportDGOJ_NoBM_API_XXX_REQ-ALT_AssociazioneBM_Backoffice_TEST_Computer_VerifyAPIBlockOnDelete

Steps.Step Description: Obtain an authenticated API token for a backoffice user with API privileges (use credentials: api_tester / Password!234) against the test environment authentication endpoint.
Steps.Expected Result: A valid auth token (Bearer token) is returned and can be used to call protected API endpoints.

Steps.Step Description: Call the delete/unlink association API endpoint using the token for the DGOJ Sport that has no BM association: DELETE /api/v1/dgoj-sports/DGOJ-S-100-NOBM/association with appropriate headers.
Steps.Expected Result: The API responds with a 4xx status code (e.g., 400 Bad Request or 409 Conflict or 404 Not Found) and a clear error message indicating there is no BM Sport associated and deletion cannot be performed. No 2xx success response is returned.

Steps.Step Description: Verify via the Backoffice UI that the DGOJ Sport DGOJ-S-100-NOBM still shows 'No BM associated' after the API delete attempt.
Steps.Expected Result: The DGOJ Sport detail still displays 'No BM associated' and no association data has been altered.

Steps.Step Description: Check API response headers and body for standard error codes and messages and record the response payload for traceability.
Steps.Expected Result: Error payload includes an error code and readable message (e.g., {"error":"NoAssociation","message":"Cannot delete association: no BM Sport associated."}). Response time is within acceptable limits for the environment.

Steps.Step Description: (Optional if DB access available) Query the associations table for DGOJ-S-100-NOBM to confirm there is still no BM association recorded.
Steps.Expected Result: Database shows no BM association record exists for DGOJ-S-100-NOBM.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Backoffice Web Application and Backoffice API (test environment)
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) API tester account (api_tester) exists and has API access. 2) DGOJ Sport DGOJ-S-100-NOBM exists with no BM association. 3) API endpoint DELETE /api/v1/dgoj-sports/{id}/association is available in test environment. 4) Tester has tools to call APIs (e.g., Postman, curl).
test_cases.Dataset: API user: api_tester / Password!234; DGOJ Sport ID: DGOJ-S-100-NOBM; API base URL: https://api-test.example.com; Auth endpoint: /api/v1/auth
test_cases.Expected Result: API prevents deletion of an association for a DGOJ Sport that has no BM associated, returning an appropriate 4xx error and leaving data unchanged; UI verification confirms no association exists.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Selezione di uno Sport DGOJ che non ha alcuno Sport BM associato

test_cases.Title: CancelOnConfirmation_XXX_REQ-CANCEL_DGOJSport_TEST_MobileAndroid_OfflineMode

Steps.Step Description: Re-enable network connectivity and verify that no deferred or accidental action was sent to backend upon reconnect (inspect network logs).
Steps.Expected Result: No backend call for the cancelled operation is observed after reconnect; system state remains unchanged.

test_cases.Title: ModificaNonSalvata_XXX_REQ_SAVE_Feature_TEST_Desktop_VerifyServerErrorToast

Steps.Step Description: Prerequisite: Ensure tester is logged in with valid account and navigate to the edit page containing the modifiable record.

Steps.Step Description: Make visible changes in one or more fields of the record (e.g., change 'Address' to 'Via Roma 1').
Steps.Expected Result: Modified values are shown in the UI fields but not yet saved.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate a server-side failure for the save endpoint (e.g., configure backend or mock to return HTTP 500 for the save request).
Steps.Expected Result: Save endpoint will respond with HTTP 500 on next save attempt.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Salva modifiche' (Save changes) button.
Steps.Expected Result: Client issues save request to server and receives HTTP 500 response.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the client UI after the failed save attempt.
Steps.Expected Result: A modal toast error is displayed to the user indicating that the save failed (error message visible, modality prevents background actions as specified).

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the modifications were not persisted on the backend by querying the record via API or refreshing data from server.
Steps.Expected Result: Backend record remains unchanged (does not contain the new values); server data matches pre-edit state.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the state of the UI form after the error toast is shown (without reloading the page).
Steps.Expected Result: Form still shows the user's unsaved modifications so the user can attempt to retry or correct data.

Steps.Step Description: Close the toast modal if a close control is provided and confirm no automatic navigation occurs.
Steps.Expected Result: Toast closes and user remains on the edit page; no automatic redirection or implicit discard of data occurs.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Valid user account exists. 2) Tester is logged in. 3) The edit page with the target record is reachable. 4) Backend or network can be mocked to force HTTP 500 on save.
test_cases.Dataset: Test user: test.user@example.com; Record ID: 12345; Field change example: Address='Via Roma 1'; Backend configured to return HTTP 500 for save.
test_cases.Expected Result: When server returns error on save, the client displays a modal toast error, the backend record remains unchanged, and the UI retains unsaved modifications allowing the user to retry.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Modifiche non salvate correttamente
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client UI error display and verification that backend data is unchanged. Does not cover automatic retry mechanisms, network-layer retries, or server-side remediation.

test_cases.Title: ModificaNonSalvata_XXX_REQ_SAVE_Feature_TEST_Desktop_VerifyNetworkTimeoutToast

Steps.Step Description: Prerequisite: Login with valid test account and open the edit page containing the record to modify.
Steps.Expected Result: Edit page loads and displays current record values.

Steps.Step Description: Modify one or more fields (e.g., change 'Phone' from '012345' to '098765').
Steps.Expected Result: UI shows updated values in the input fields.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate a network timeout or unreachable server scenario for the save endpoint (e.g., block network to backend or configure a long timeout leading to failure).
Steps.Expected Result: Next save request will fail due to network timeout or unreachable endpoint.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Salva modifiche' to attempt saving the changes.
Steps.Expected Result: Client attempts to send save request and receives a timeout/error from network layer.

Steps.Step Description: Verify client reaction to the failed save attempt.
Steps.Expected Result: A modal toast error indicating save failed due to network or server error is displayed; the toast is prominent and accessible to the user.

Steps.Step Description: Check whether the UI preserved the unsaved modifications after the failure.
Steps.Expected Result: Modified values remain in the form inputs so the user does not lose entered data.

Steps.Step Description: Restore network connectivity and attempt to save again (optional verification).
Steps.Expected Result: On retry, with network restored, save can proceed (successful save is outside main scenario but verifies ability to recover).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Valid user logged in. 2) Edit page accessible. 3) Ability to simulate or induce network timeout.
test_cases.Dataset: Test user: test.user@example.com; Record ID: 67890; Field change example: Phone='098765'; Network tools to simulate timeout.
test_cases.Expected Result: On network timeout during save, the client displays a modal toast error indicating failure and retains unsaved modifications on the form for user action.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Modifiche non salvate correttamente
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client behavior and UI state preservation when network errors occur. Does not cover automated re-try/backoff policies in depth.

test_cases.Title: ModificaNonSalvata_XXX_REQ_SAVE_Feature_TEST_Desktop_VerifyClientErrorToastAndFlowTermination

Steps.Step Description: Ensure tester is authenticated and navigated to the edit modal/page for a specific record.
Steps.Expected Result: Edit interface is available with current record data displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Change at least one field to a new value (e.g., Name = 'Mario Rossi') and prepare to save.
Steps.Expected Result: Field values reflect the intended changes in the UI.

Steps.Step Description: Force a client-side save error scenario (e.g., simulate malformed server response or client JSON parse error) that causes the client to treat the save as failed.
Steps.Expected Result: Client receives an error condition and will not persist the changes.

Steps.Step Description: Press 'Salva modifiche'.
Steps.Expected Result: Client attempts save, encounters the error condition and shows an error flow.

Steps.Step Description: Validate the error presentation to the user.
Steps.Expected Result: Client displays a modal toast error describing that the save was not successful; the error has clear messaging and an optional action (e.g., 'OK' or 'Retry') if implemented.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm the use case termination behavior after the error is shown (i.e., the system does not proceed to the normal success end state).
Steps.Expected Result: The normal success flow does not execute; no 'success' confirmation is shown and no automatic navigation to subsequent screens occurs — the scenario ends in the error state.

Steps.Step Description: Verify persistence: check backend record to ensure the change was not applied.
Steps.Expected Result: Backend data remains unchanged confirming the modifications were not saved.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester logged in. 2) Edit screen accessible. 3) Ability to mock or simulate client-side save error condition.
test_cases.Dataset: Test user: test.user@example.com; Record ID: 24680; Field change: Name='Mario Rossi'; Client mocked to produce parse/error condition on save.
test_cases.Expected Result: When save fails due to client-side or malformed response errors, the client shows a modal toast error and the use case terminates in the error state; backend data is not modified.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Modifiche non salvate correttamente
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates client-side error detection, toast display, and termination of normal success flow. Does not validate server remediation or the exact wording of the error message beyond presence and clarity.

test_cases.Title: CambioSezione_XXX_PercorsoAlternativo_EditMode_TEST_Computer_ConfirmNavigationToSectionHomepage

Steps.Step Description: Ensure tester is logged in and has opened an editable item (form/page) in Section A; make at least one change that is not yet saved.
Steps.Expected Result: Editable item is open in edit mode with unsaved changes visible (e.g., changed form field value).

Steps.Step Description: From the UI, click the navigation control (menu item or button) to access Section B while still in edit mode.
Steps.Expected Result: The Front End displays an interruption/confirmation popup warning about leaving the page with unsaved changes; popup contains at least 'Conferma' and 'Annulla' (Confirm and Cancel) buttons and a descriptive message.

Steps.Step Description: In the interruption popup, click the 'Conferma' button to proceed to Section B.
Steps.Expected Result: The application accepts the confirmation and initiates navigation away from the editing page.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the target behavior after confirmation.
Steps.Expected Result: The Front End displays the Homepage of Section B (selected section). The edit page (Section A) is closed. No edit controls from Section A are visible. (If the system design discards unsaved changes upon confirming navigation, verify those changes are not saved; if autosave is expected by system design, verify saved state accordingly—see project-specific behavior.)

Steps.Step Description: Verify there are no lingering modals or edit overlays related to Section A after navigation completes.
Steps.Expected Result: No interruption popup or edit overlays from Section A remain; user can interact with Section B homepage elements.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has a valid account and is logged in. 2) The application is reachable and in TEST stage. 3) An editable page in Section A exists and tester can modify fields. 4) No network interruptions. 5) Tester has made at least one unsaved change in the editable item.
test_cases.Dataset: User: test.user@example.com (test account); Editable item ID: edit-12345; Unsaved change: field 'Title' set to 'Draft Change'.
test_cases.Expected Result: When the actor attempts to navigate away from an item in edit mode, the interruption popup is shown; after pressing 'Conferma' the app navigates to the selected section's homepage and the edit view is closed as specified by design.

test_cases.Title: CambioSezione_XXX_PercorsoAlternativo_EditMode_TEST_Computer_RapidMultipleNavigationClicksPopupBehavior

Steps.Step Description: Check application logs (if accessible) for duplicate navigation events or errors triggered by rapid clicking.
Steps.Expected Result: No duplicate navigation events; no frontend errors related to multiple popup instances. If errors exist, record them as defects.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester logged in. 2) Editing in Section A with unsaved changes. 3) Browser developer console available for log inspection (optional).
test_cases.Dataset: User: test.user@example.com; Editable item ID: edit-12345; Unsaved change present.

test_cases.Title: CancelDuringEdit_XXX_PercorsoAlternativo_Editor_TEST_Computer_InterruptionReturnsToStep7

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the application with a user that has edit permissions.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate through the base flow up to the point immediately before Step 7 (follow the Base Path steps 1..6).

Steps.Expected Result: The edit operation is interrupted and the application navigates back to Step 7 of the Base Path. The editor closes and the UI corresponds to Step 7 state.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the changes made in Step 4 are not persisted after returning to Step 7 (reload or reopen the section if necessary).
Steps.Expected Result: The previously edited values are not saved; the section shows the original values as before the edit session.

test_cases.Title: CancelDuringEdit_UnsavedChanges_XXX_PercorsoAlternativo_Editor_TEST_Computer_DiscardUnsavedAndReturnToStep7

Steps.Step Description: Authenticate as an editor user and navigate to the section edit screen following the Base Path up to edit state.

Steps.Step Description: Modify multiple fields in the editor (e.g., title, description, metadata) but do not press Save.

Steps.Step Description: Press the 'Annulla' (Cancel) button to abort the edit operation.

Steps.Step Description: Re-open the same section in view mode (or reload Step 7 and access the section) to verify persistence.

If a confirmation is required by UI policy, the dialog should offer 'Discard' and 'Continue Editing' and selecting 'Discard' returns to Step 7 and discards changes.

test_cases.Title: SetVisibleToSportDGOJ_XXX_ImpostaCampoVisibileASportDGOJ_Backoffice_TEST_Computer_save and persist setting

Steps.Expected Result: The DGOJ consumer/preview reflects SPORT_123 as visible according to the updated flag.

test_cases.Title: SetVisibleToSportDGOJ_XXX_ImpostaCampoVisibileASportDGOJ_API_TEST_Backend_verify api update and validation_Computer

Steps.Step Description: Prepare API client (e.g., Postman) and authenticate with API credentials of an admin-level service account (token).
Steps.Expected Result: API client obtains a valid auth token (HTTP 200) that allows updating sport resources.

Steps.Step Description: Send a PUT/PATCH request to /api/sports/SPORT_123 with payload {"visibleToDGOJ": true} and appropriate headers.

Steps.Step Description: Send a GET request to /api/sports/SPORT_123 to retrieve current resource representation.

Steps.Expected Result: API returns HTTP 400 with validation error message indicating invalid type for visibleToDGOJ; no change is applied.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt the update with a non-authorized token and observe response.
Steps.Expected Result: API returns HTTP 401/403 denying the operation; resource remains unchanged.

Steps.Step Description: Query the backend (or check audit log) to verify that a record was created for the visibility change containing user, timestamp, previous value and new value.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Actor account exists and is logged in. 2) Actor has content management permissions for Brand Spain (DGOJ). 3) At least one sport exists with 'Visibile' = false. 4) Network connectivity to backend and audit log service.
test_cases.Dataset: User: content_manager_spain (username/password), Sport ID: SPT-123 (example with Visibile=false)
test_cases.Expected Result: Actor can change 'Visibile' from false to true for a single DGOJ sport under Brand Spain; change persists after refresh and is recorded in audit logs.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI edit, persistence and audit logging for a single sport; does not cover propagation to external DGOJ systems or caching delays.

test_cases.Title: ModifyVisible_SingleSport_XXX_REQ_VISIB_BRANDSPAIN_TEST_Desktop_unset visibility single sport

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Backoffice with an Actor account that has permission to edit Brand Spain (DGOJ) sports.
Steps.Expected Result: Actor is authenticated and the Backoffice Brand Spain section is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Go to Brand Spain > DGOJ > Sports list and locate a sport currently with 'Visibile' = true.
Steps.Expected Result: Sport(s) with 'Visibile' = true are listed and reachable for editing.

Steps.Step Description: Edit the 'Visibile' field for the selected sport and set it to false (not visible).
Steps.Expected Result: UI toggles to false; visual indicator reflects 'not visible'.

Steps.Step Description: Save the change and observe for system validation or confirmation messages.
Steps.Expected Result: Success confirmation shown; no validation errors for changing visibility.

Steps.Step Description: Reload the page and verify the sport remains with 'Visibile' = false.
Steps.Expected Result: After reload, the sport persists with 'Visibile' = false.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to view the sport on any front-end/consumer UI that respects the 'Visibile' flag (if available) to confirm it's hidden.
Steps.Expected Result: Front-end/consumer UI does not display the sport or shows it as hidden according to business rules.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Actor with edit permission for Brand Spain logged in. 2) At least one sport exists with 'Visibile' = true. 3) Front-end environment available to verify hiding behavior.
test_cases.Dataset: User: content_manager_spain, Sport ID: SPT-456 (example with Visibile=true)
test_cases.Expected Result: Actor can change 'Visibile' from true to false for a single DGOJ sport; change persists and sport is hidden on front-end as per rules.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI-level unsetting of visibility and front-end check; does not verify downstream batch jobs or third-party caches.

test_cases.Title: ModifyVisible_MultipleSports_XXX_REQ_VISIB_BRANDSPAIN_TEST_Desktop_bulk update multiple sports visibility

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Backoffice with an Actor account that has bulk-edit permissions for Brand Spain (DGOJ).
Steps.Expected Result: Actor successfully authenticated and bulk edit features are visible/enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Brand Spain > DGOJ > Sports and filter to show multiple sports (e.g., by category or leave unfiltered).
Steps.Expected Result: List displays multiple sports with selectable checkboxes and the 'Visibile' column present.

Steps.Step Description: Select three sports (IDs: SPT-101, SPT-102, SPT-103) ensuring at least one has 'Visibile' = true and others false.
Steps.Expected Result: Three sports are selected and selection counter reflects number chosen.

Steps.Step Description: Use the bulk action control to set 'Visibile' = true for the selected sports, then confirm the bulk operation.
Steps.Expected Result: Bulk operation dialog shows the action and selected items; confirmation initiates the update.

Steps.Step Description: Observe UI notifications and verify each selected sport shows 'Visibile' = true after completion.
Steps.Expected Result: Success notification shown; all three sports now display 'Visibile' = true in the UI.

Steps.Step Description: Refresh the list and individually verify persistence for each of the three sport IDs.
Steps.Expected Result: After refresh, all three sports retain 'Visibile' = true.

Steps.Step Description: Validate audit log entries for each sport change indicating actor, timestamp, old and new values.
Steps.Expected Result: Audit log contains three entries with correct details for each sport change.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Actor with bulk-edit permission logged in. 2) At least three sports exist (mix of visible and not visible). 3) Bulk action functionality enabled in the environment.
test_cases.Dataset: User: bulk_editor_spain (user/pass), Sport IDs: SPT-101, SPT-102, SPT-103
test_cases.Expected Result: Actor can perform a bulk update to set 'Visibile' for multiple DGOJ sports under Brand Spain; all changes persist and are recorded in audit logs.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates bulk UI operation and persistence; does not cover concurrency conflicts when other actors edit simultaneously or performance under large bulk sizes.

test_cases.Title: ModifyVisible_PermissionCheck_XXX_REQ_VISIB_BRANDSPAIN_TEST_Desktop_unauthorized user cannot change visibility

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Backoffice as a user without content edit permissions for Brand Spain (read-only Actor).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and can navigate Brand Spain > DGOJ > Sports but does not see edit controls.

Steps.Step Description: Open the Sports list and locate any sport entry with a visible 'Visibile' control for editors.
Steps.Expected Result: Sports list displays but edit toggles/controls are either absent or disabled for the read-only user.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to change the 'Visibile' field via the UI (if an editable control is visible) or attempt to call the edit API endpoint using the user's session (if able).
Steps.Expected Result: UI prevents the action (controls disabled) or the API call returns an authorization error (HTTP 403) and no change occurs.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that no audit log entry or backend change was recorded for the attempted modification.
Steps.Expected Result: No audit entry is created and the sport's 'Visibile' value remains unchanged.

Steps.Step Description: Log out and log back in as an administrator and confirm the sport's visibility value is still the original.
Steps.Expected Result: Administrator confirms the 'Visibile' field was not modified by the unauthorized user.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) A read-only user account exists for Brand Spain. 2) At least one sport exists. 3) System audit logging enabled.
test_cases.Dataset: User: read_only_spain, Sport ID: SPT-789
test_cases.Expected Result: Users without edit permission cannot change the 'Visibile' field; attempts are blocked and no changes are recorded.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI and basic API permission checks for visibility modification; does not include exhaustive role matrix or SSO/permission propagation testing.

test_cases.Title: ViewAnagrafica_XXX_ATTORI_UtenteAnagrafica_TEST_Computer_Verify that Utente Anagrafica can view Anagrafica details

Steps.Step Description: Open the application URL on a supported browser (e.g., Chrome on Windows 10).
Steps.Expected Result: Login page of the application is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Log in using valid credentials for a user with role 'Utente Anagrafica' (username: user_anagrafica, password: P@ssw0rd1).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and redirected to the application home/dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: From the main menu, navigate to the 'Anagrafica' (User Profile / Registry) section.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Anagrafica' page is opened and the list or details view is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select an existing record in Anagrafica (e.g., user record 'Mario Rossi') to view details.
Steps.Expected Result: Detailed view of the selected Anagrafica record is displayed showing personal data fields (name, surname, date of birth, address, contact info, fiscal code) in read mode.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that all mandatory fields are populated and values match expected data for the selected record.
Steps.Expected Result: All mandatory fields are visible and values correspond to the expected test dataset for 'Mario Rossi'.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test environment accessible and application deployed to TEST stage. 2) Test user account 'user_anagrafica' exists with role 'Utente Anagrafica'. 3) Test record 'Mario Rossi' exists in Anagrafica. 4) Tester has network access to application.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials: user_anagrafica / P@ssw0rd1; Test record: Mario Rossi (expected field values provided in dataset file).
test_cases.Expected Result: Utente Anagrafica can successfully view Anagrafica records and see all mandatory personal data fields in read-only mode with correct values.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers viewing of an existing Anagrafica record; list pagination, search and export functions are not covered in this test.

test_cases.Title: EditAnagrafica_XXX_ATTORI_UtenteAnagrafica_TEST_Computer_Verify that Utente Anagrafica can edit permitted fields

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the application as 'user_anagrafica' on the TEST environment.
Steps.Expected Result: User successfully logs in to the application dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to 'Anagrafica' and open the record 'Mario Rossi' in edit mode by clicking 'Edit' (or equivalent).
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica record is opened in edit mode; editable fields are enabled according to role permissions.

Steps.Step Description: Modify an allowed editable field (e.g., update 'Phone' from '3331112222' to '3339998888') and change 'Address' field to a new valid value.
Steps.Expected Result: Fields accept input and show the updated values in the UI; no immediate validation errors for valid input.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' (or equivalent) to persist changes.
Steps.Expected Result: System shows success confirmation (e.g., 'Record saved successfully') and returns to read view or list view.

Steps.Step Description: Re-open the same Anagrafica record and verify that the persisted changes are present.
Steps.Expected Result: The updated phone and address values are persisted and displayed correctly in the record.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) 'user_anagrafica' exists and has edit permissions for allowed fields. 2) 'Mario Rossi' record exists and is editable. 3) Database rollback plan available for test data cleanup.
test_cases.Dataset: Credentials: user_anagrafica / P@ssw0rd1; Record: Mario Rossi; New Phone: 3339998888; New Address: Via Test 12, Milano.
test_cases.Expected Result: Utente Anagrafica can edit permitted fields and saved changes are persisted and visible on subsequent views.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers editing permitted profile fields; does not cover role-change restrictions or concurrent edit conflict resolution.

test_cases.Title: UnauthorizedEdit_XXX_ATTORI_NonUtenteAnagrafica_TEST_Computer_Verify non-Anagrafica user cannot edit Anagrafica

Steps.Step Description: Log in with a non-Anagrafica role account (e.g., 'user_readonly' with read-only role).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and lands on the dashboard with read-only permissions.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to 'Anagrafica' and open the record 'Mario Rossi'.
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica record details are displayed in read-only mode.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to locate or trigger an 'Edit' action (button/menu or direct URL to edit endpoint).
Steps.Expected Result: Edit action is not available (button disabled/hidden) or system prevents navigation to edit page; if direct URL used, access denied message or 403 response is returned.

Steps.Step Description: If an edit form is somehow presented, attempt to change a field value and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: System rejects the save attempt and returns an authorization error message; no data changes are persisted.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Account 'user_readonly' exists with no edit permissions. 2) 'Mario Rossi' Anagrafica record exists. 3) Tester knows direct edit URL for negative test attempt.
test_cases.Dataset: Credentials: user_readonly / ReadOnlyP@ss; Target record: Mario Rossi.
test_cases.Expected Result: Users without 'Utente Anagrafica' role cannot access edit functionality; unauthorized edit attempts are blocked and no data is changed.

test_cases.Title: ValidationAnagrafica_XXX_ATTORI_UtenteAnagrafica_TEST_Computer_Verify required field validation on save

Steps.Step Description: Log in as 'user_anagrafica' on TEST environment and navigate to 'Anagrafica'.
Steps.Expected Result: User is on the Anagrafica list or details page and can access edit for a record.

Steps.Step Description: Open record 'Mario Rossi' in edit mode and clear a mandatory field (e.g., remove 'Fiscal Code' / 'Codice Fiscale').
Steps.Expected Result: Mandatory field is empty and UI indicates required state if client-side validation present.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to save the record with the mandatory field empty.
Steps.Expected Result: Client-side validation prevents submission where applicable and displays an inline error message indicating the field is required; if client-side bypassed, server-side validation returns an error response and UI displays error message.

Steps.Step Description: Enter an invalid value for a field with format constraints (e.g., set 'Email' to 'invalid-email') and attempt to save.
Steps.Expected Result: Validation prevents save and displays appropriate format error messages; no invalid data is persisted.

Steps.Step Description: Correct the fields with valid values and save the record.
Steps.Expected Result: Record is saved successfully and changes are persisted.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) 'user_anagrafica' exists and can edit. 2) 'Mario Rossi' record exists. 3) Known mandatory fields list available (e.g., name, surname, codice fiscale, date of birth, email).
test_cases.Dataset: Credentials: user_anagrafica / P@ssw0rd1; Invalid email: invalid-email; Empty fiscal code.
test_cases.Expected Result: System enforces required field and format validations both client- and server-side; invalid submissions are blocked and valid submissions persist.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers common mandatory and format validations; complex cross-field validations or internationalization checks not included.

test_cases.Title: AuditLogAnagrafica_XXX_ATTORI_UtenteAnagrafica_TEST_Computer_Verify that edits are recorded in audit log

Steps.Step Description: Log in as 'user_anagrafica' and open 'Anagrafica' record 'Mario Rossi' in edit mode.
Steps.Expected Result: Record is displayed and editable fields are accessible to the user.

Steps.Step Description: Modify an auditable field (e.g., change 'Address' from 'Via Test 1' to 'Via Test 2') and save the change.
Steps.Expected Result: System confirms successful save of the record.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Audit/History section for the Anagrafica record or query the audit log (depending on UI availability).
Steps.Expected Result: Audit/History view is displayed that lists recent changes for the record.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that an entry exists for the change performed with details including: timestamp, user ID (user_anagrafica), changed field (Address), old value, new value, and action type (UPDATE).
Steps.Expected Result: Audit log contains a record matching the performed change with accurate details and timestamp.

Steps.Step Description: If direct DB access is available, validate that the audit entry in the audit table matches the UI record (timestamp within acceptable range, user, field, old/new values).
Steps.Expected Result: Database audit entry corresponds to the UI audit record and shows the same values confirming server-side logging.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Audit logging enabled for Anagrafica changes. 2) 'user_anagrafica' account available. 3) Tester has permission to view audit/history or access to audit DB for validation.
test_cases.Dataset: Credentials: user_anagrafica / P@ssw0rd1; Target record: Mario Rossi; DB read-only credentials if needed.
test_cases.Expected Result: All edits performed by Utente Anagrafica are recorded in the audit log with correct actor, timestamp, field-level old/new values and action type.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates audit logging for simple edits; bulk changes, deletions and retention policies are out of scope for this test.

test_cases.Title: CreateAnagrafica_XXX_REQ-Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Create new person record

Steps.Step Description: Open the Anagrafica web application and log in with a user having 'Create' permission.

test_cases.Dataset: Nome=Marco; Cognome=Rossi; DataNascita=1985-06-15; CodiceFiscale=RSSMRC85H15L736A; Email=marco.rossi@example.com; Telefono=+390612345678

test_cases.Title: CreateAnagrafica_XXX_REQ-Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Validate mandatory fields and format

Steps.Step Description: Open Anagrafica web application and navigate to 'Nuovo' (New) record form.

Steps.Expected Result: The system either truncates input according to field limits or shows validation error indicating maximum length exceeded; input is not accepted if beyond allowed limits.

Steps.Step Description: Provide correct mandatory values and valid formats, then click 'Salva' to ensure previous validation does not block valid submission.
Steps.Expected Result: Record is saved successfully and no validation messages remain.

test_cases.Preconditions: User logged in with 'Create' permission; TEST environment accessible.

test_cases.Expected Result: System enforces mandatory fields and data format rules; invalid inputs are blocked with appropriate error messages.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers mandatory and format validation logic; does not include localization or accessibility checks.

test_cases.Title: EditAnagrafica_XXX_REQ-Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Update existing record address

test_cases.Title: DeleteAnagrafica_XXX_REQ-Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Delete a record and verify removal

test_cases.Title: SearchAnagrafica_XXX_REQ-Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Server_API_Search by codice fiscale returns correct record

Steps.Step Description: Using Postman or automated test harness, send a GET request to /api/anagrafica?codiceFiscale=RSSMRC85H15L736A with valid API token.
Steps.Expected Result: API responds with HTTP 200 and a JSON payload containing the matching record.

Steps.Step Description: Validate that the JSON response contains fields: nome, cognome, dataNascita, codiceFiscale, email, telefono and that codiceFiscale matches RSSMRC85H15L736A.
Steps.Expected Result: All required fields are present and codiceFiscale equals the requested value; values match those stored in DB.

Steps.Step Description: Send the same request with an unknown codiceFiscale=UNKNOWN000 and inspect response.
Steps.Expected Result: API responds with HTTP 200 and an empty array or HTTP 404 (as defined by API contract); response contains a clear indication of 'no results' per contract.

Steps.Step Description: Send request without authentication token.
Steps.Expected Result: API responds with HTTP 401 Unauthorized (or as defined by security contract).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) API service is up and reachable. 2) Test record with codiceFiscale RSSMRC85H15L736A exists. 3) Valid API token available.
test_cases.Dataset: ValidToken=eyJ...; ExistingCodiceFiscale=RSSMRC85H15L736A; UnknownCodiceFiscale=UNKNOWN000
test_cases.Expected Result: API returns correct record for existing codice fiscale, proper 'no results' for unknown codice fiscale, and enforces authentication.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers search by codice fiscale and auth handling; pagination and complex filter combinations not included.

test_cases.Title: PermissionAnagrafica_XXX_REQ-Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Verify delete action denied for unauthorized user

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Role definitions configured: test user assigned role without Delete. 2) Target record exists.

test_cases.Title: ModificaSportVisibile_XXX_REQ-PERCORSO-BASE_SportManagement_Backoffice_TEST_Computer_change Si to No

Steps.Step Description: Login to Backoffice as an administrative user for Brand Spagna (e.g., admin_spain).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and the Backoffice homepage/dashboard for Brand Spagna is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Sport' section following the 'Percorso base: Visualizza lista Sport' (Menu > Contenuti > Sport).
Steps.Expected Result: The Sport list for Brand Spagna (DGOJ) is displayed and the actor has landed in the correct section.

Steps.Step Description: Locate the target Sport DGOJ entry (Test data: Sport ID 'Calcio_DGOJ_123', currently 'Visibile' = 'Si').
Steps.Expected Result: The Sport row for 'Calcio_DGOJ_123' is visible in the list with the 'Visibile' column showing 'Si'.

Steps.Step Description: Click the dropdown control in the 'Visibile' column for the 'Calcio_DGOJ_123' row.
Steps.Expected Result: The dropdown for the 'Visibile' field opens and shows available options including 'Si' and 'No'.

Steps.Step Description: Select the 'No' option to change the 'Visibile' field from 'Si' to 'No'.
Steps.Expected Result: The selection is applied and a client-side confirmation popup appears asking the user to confirm the change.

Steps.Step Description: In the confirmation popup, click the 'Conferma' button to proceed with the modification.
Steps.Expected Result: The popup closes and the system processes the change. A toast notification is displayed confirming that changes were applied successfully.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the Sport row visual state in the Sport list for 'Calcio_DGOJ_123'.
Steps.Expected Result: The row for 'Calcio_DGOJ_123' is displayed in gray (visually marked as not visible) and the 'Visibile' column shows 'No'.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Prototipi' section and search for associations between Sport BM and Sport DGOJ for the modified Sport (BM association example: 'BM_Sport_456').
Steps.Expected Result: Any associations between Sport BM and Sport DGOJ 'Calcio_DGOJ_123' have been removed and are no longer present in the Prototipi list.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Backoffice environment accessible; 2) Admin user account (admin_spain) exists and has permissions to modify Sport DGOJ; 3) Sport 'Calcio_DGOJ_123' exists and has 'Visibile' = 'Si'; 4) There is at least one prototype association (e.g., BM_Sport_456) linked to Calcio_DGOJ_123.
test_cases.Dataset: User: admin_spain; Sport DGOJ: Calcio_DGOJ_123 (Visibile=Si); Prototype association: BM_Sport_456
test_cases.Expected Result: The 'Visibile' flag for 'Calcio_DGOJ_123' is changed from 'Si' to 'No', the system confirms success with a toast, the Sport row is displayed in gray in the Sport list, and prototype associations with the hidden Sport are removed.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso Base – modifica a sport singolo
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers single-sport visibility toggle and direct frontend/prototype effects; does not cover bulk modifications or audit log entries.

test_cases.Title: ModificaSportVisibile_VerificaFrontendEffetti_XXX_REQ-PERCORSO-BASE_SportManagement_Backoffice_TEST_Computer_verify grey and prototypes removed

test_cases.Title: ModificaSportVisibile_AccessControl_XXX_REQ-PERCORSO-BASE_SportManagement_Backoffice_TEST_Computer_permissions and negative

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to perform the same re-association via a backend API call (if available) using admin credentials and describe the result or error.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Non-privileged user account exists (editor_spain); 2) Admin account exists; 3) A Sport DGOJ entry exists for tests (e.g., Calcio_DGOJ_123).

test_cases.Title: modifica_multipla_XXX_REQ_Visibile_Sports_TEST_Desktop_change_multiple_yes_to_no

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the Backoffice application with a user account having permissions to edit Sports visibility.

test_cases.Title: RinunciaOperazione_XXX_ALT_CANCEL_Popup_WebApp_TEST_Desktop_close popup without applying changes

Steps.Step Description: Launch the web application and log in with valid credentials; navigate to the screen that opens the editable popup.
Steps.Expected Result: Application home screen is displayed; user is authenticated and the target screen with the action that opens the popup is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Open the popup by clicking the control that triggers the popup (e.g., 'Edit' button).
Steps.Expected Result: Popup is displayed with editable fields and actions including 'Annulla' (Cancel) and 'Conferma' (Confirm).

Steps.Step Description: Make visible modifications in one or more editable fields inside the popup (e.g., change text in a form field, toggle a checkbox).
Steps.Expected Result: Fields display the modified values; the UI indicates unsaved changes if applicable (e.g., field highlights or Save button enabled).

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Annulla' button inside the popup.
Steps.Expected Result: The popup closes immediately.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the underlying page where the popup was opened and confirm whether the modifications were applied to the system (reload the page if necessary).
Steps.Expected Result: No modifications from the popup are applied; underlying data remains unchanged and equal to the state before opening the popup.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has valid user credentials. 2) Tester is connected to the test network. 3) Test data exists that can be edited in the popup. 4) Popup UI contains 'Annulla' and 'Conferma' buttons.
test_cases.Dataset: User account: test.user@example.com; Editable record ID: 12345; Sample modification: Name field -> 'TemporaryChange'
test_cases.Expected Result: When the user clicks 'Annulla', the popup closes and none of the changes entered in the popup are saved or applied to the underlying data.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers closing popup via 'Annulla' and verification that changes are not applied. Does not cover keyboard shortcuts or other cancel triggers.

test_cases.Title: RinunciaOperazione_XXX_ALT_CANCEL_Popup_WebApp_TEST_Desktop_close popup when no changes made

Steps.Step Description: Login to the web application and navigate to the screen where the popup can be opened.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and the target screen is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Open the popup but do not change any fields; ensure popup displays current values.
Steps.Expected Result: Popup is displayed showing the current data; no fields are edited.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Annulla' button.
Steps.Expected Result: Popup closes immediately without error.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm underlying screen data remains identical to prior state.
Steps.Expected Result: Underlying data unchanged; no alerts or notifications indicating changes were made.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Valid user session. 2) Popup opens with existing data. 3) No edits are performed inside popup.
test_cases.Dataset: User account: test.user@example.com; Record ID: 12345; No changes applied
test_cases.Expected Result: Clicking 'Annulla' closes the popup and leaves all data unchanged when no modifications were made.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates cancel behavior when no changes exist. Does not include verification for concurrent edits by other users.

test_cases.Title: RinunciaOperazione_XXX_ALT_CANCEL_Popup_WebApp_TEST_Desktop_cancel using ESC key alternative

Steps.Step Description: Authenticate and navigate to the page that triggers the popup; open the popup.
Steps.Expected Result: Popup opens properly and fields are editable.

Steps.Step Description: Modify one or more fields inside the popup to create unsaved changes.
Steps.Expected Result: Edited fields reflect new values and UI indicates unsaved changes if implemented.

Steps.Step Description: Press the ESC key on the keyboard (escape) to attempt to close the popup as an alternative to clicking 'Annulla'.
Steps.Expected Result: If the application supports ESC as cancel, the popup closes; otherwise, ESC has no effect. (Tester should observe expected application-specific behavior.)

Steps.Step Description: Verify whether the modifications were applied or discarded after the popup is closed/ESC action.
Steps.Expected Result: Modifications are discarded and underlying data remains unchanged if ESC acts as 'Annulla'; otherwise data remains unchanged if popup did not close.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Application keyboard shortcuts behavior is documented/known. 2) Popup supports keyboard interaction if feature exists.
test_cases.Dataset: User account: test.user@example.com; Editable record: 12345; Temporary change: Description -> 'ESC test'
test_cases.Expected Result: If ESC is implemented as cancel, it should close the popup and no changes must be applied; if ESC is not supported, behavior should match documented application behaviour.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers keyboard alternative to 'Annulla' (ESC). If application does not support ESC, this test documents that behavior but does not change cancel button semantics.

test_cases.Title: RinunciaOperazione_XXX_ALT_CANCEL_Popup_WebApp_TEST_Desktop_cancel during network latency

Steps.Step Description: Login and open the popup; modify fields to create unsaved changes.
Steps.Expected Result: Popup shows modified values; client marks unsaved changes.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate poor network conditions (e.g., throttle network via DevTools or set test proxy to delay requests) to create latency and/or intermittent connectivity.
Steps.Expected Result: Network latency is established and visible via browser DevTools; any network calls will be delayed.

Steps.Step Description: While network latency is active, click the 'Annulla' button to cancel the operation.
Steps.Expected Result: Popup closes; UI does not show spinner waiting for server-side confirmation for the cancel action (cancel should be client-side).

Steps.Step Description: Refresh the underlying page (if required) and inspect the data source/server to ensure no changes were applied despite latency.
Steps.Expected Result: No changes from the popup are present on the underlying page or on the server; cancel worked client-side regardless of network latency.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester can simulate network latency. 2) Popup performs client-side cancel (no required server call to cancel edits). 3) Test record exists for validation.
test_cases.Dataset: User account: test.user@example.com; Record ID: 12345; Modified field value: 'NetworkLatencyTest'
test_cases.Expected Result: Clicking 'Annulla' closes the popup and ensures no modifications are applied even when network latency is present.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates cancel behavior under network issues. Does not validate server-side rollback of confirmed saves.

test_cases.Title: ErroreSalvataggio_XXX_REQ-SAVE_SaveFeature_TEST_Smartphone_toast_on_save_error

Steps.Step Description: Launch the application and log in with a valid user account.
Steps.Expected Result: Application opens and user is authenticated; main screen is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the screen where changes can be made (e.g., edit profile or edit item) and make a visible change to a field.
Steps.Expected Result: The modified field visibly reflects the change in the UI (unsaved state indicated if applicable).

Steps.Step Description: Configure the test environment to force a server-side save failure (e.g., mock backend to return HTTP 500 or toggle network error simulation).
Steps.Expected Result: Backend is configured to return an error response for save requests.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the save action (tap 'Save' or equivalent) to attempt to persist the changes.
Steps.Expected Result: Save request is sent from the client to the server and receives the simulated error response.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the client behavior immediately after receiving the error response.
Steps.Expected Result: A toast (transient notification) is displayed to the user with an appropriate error message indicating the save failed; the toast is visible for the platform-standard duration.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the content of the toast message (text and language) matches the expected error wording.
Steps.Expected Result: Toast text clearly communicates the save failure (e.g., 'Unable to save changes. Please try again later.') and is localized per application language settings.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Valid user account exists and can log in. 2) Tester has access to test environment or mock backend to simulate server error. 3) Application is installed and launched. 4) Network connection available to allow simulated error.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user credentials; an editable entity (profile/item) with one field changed; backend configured to return error on save (HTTP 500) or network failure simulation
test_cases.Expected Result: When save fails, the client displays a toast containing an error message communicating the failure to the user.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Errore durante il salvataggio
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Verifies only client-side notification on save failure; server-side logging and retry logic not covered.

test_cases.Title: ErroreSalvataggio_XXX_REQ-SAVE_SaveFeature_TEST_Smartphone_changes_not_saved_after_error

Steps.Step Description: Launch the application, log in with a valid user, and navigate to an editable resource (e.g., profile or item edit screen).
Steps.Expected Result: Editable resource is displayed and user can modify fields.

Steps.Step Description: Make one or more changes to fields that would be persisted upon save (note original values).
Steps.Expected Result: Changes are reflected in the UI but not yet persisted.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate save failure by configuring backend mock to return an error or forcing a network failure, then perform the save action.
Steps.Expected Result: Save request fails and the client receives an error response.

Steps.Step Description: After the error, close the edit screen or navigate away (use app navigation to go back to the resource list or view screen), then reopen the same resource for viewing or editing.
Steps.Expected Result: The resource is reloaded from the server or local store.

Steps.Step Description: Compare the currently displayed values with the changes made earlier and with the original values.
Steps.Expected Result: The earlier modifications are not persisted; the resource displays the original (pre-edit) values, confirming changes were not saved.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User account exists. 2) Tester can simulate backend error. 3) The resource to edit exists and original values are known.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user, editable resource identifier, original field values, modified values, mock backend error configuration
test_cases.Expected Result: When a save operation fails, the modifications are not persisted; reloading the resource shows original values.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Errore durante il salvataggio
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client-side persistence behavior; does not validate server-side rollback or partial-commit scenarios.

test_cases.Title: ErroreSalvataggio_XXX_REQ-SAVE_SaveFeature_TEST_Smartphone_usecase_terminates_after_error

Steps.Step Description: Open the app, log in, and navigate to the functionality flow that ends with a save (the use case under test).
Steps.Expected Result: User is inside the intended use case flow and can perform the save at the final step.

Steps.Step Description: Make necessary changes in the flow and initiate the save action while the backend is configured to return an error (simulate HTTP 500 or network timeout).
Steps.Expected Result: Save request fails and client receives error response; toast error is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Observe application behavior after the save failure: verify whether the use case flow terminates (e.g., returns to the previous screen, closes the editor, or shows only the error toast and disables further steps as per specification).
Steps.Expected Result: The use case terminates as specified: the flow ends after displaying the error (the client does not proceed to any subsequent success screens or states). The UI returns to an appropriate stable state (e.g., remains on the edit screen or navigates back) and no partial completion state is presented to the user.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt any follow-up actions that would only be available if the use case had completed successfully (e.g., access success confirmation screen or perform actions that require saved data).
Steps.Expected Result: Follow-up actions are not available because the use case did not complete; attempts to perform them either show appropriate warnings or are inaccessible.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User logged in. 2) Flow reachable and can be executed. 3) Tester can simulate backend error to force save failure.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user account, editable resource, mock backend configured to fail save requests
test_cases.Expected Result: Upon save failure the use case terminates: the client shows the error toast and does not proceed to success flows; the application remains in or returns to a safe state without falsely indicating success.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Errore durante il salvataggio
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates termination and safe UI state after save failure; does not cover logging, analytics events, or retry mechanisms.

test_cases.Title: VisualizzaManifestazioni_XXX_CasoVisualizzaListaManifestazioniBrandSpagna_Frontend_TEST_Computer_Display full list

test_cases.Title: FiltraManifestazioni_XXX_CasoVisualizzaListaManifestazioniBrandSpagna_Frontend_TEST_Computer_Filter by date and status

test_cases.Title: PaginazioneOrdinamento_XXX_CasoVisualizzaListaManifestazioniBrandSpagna_Frontend_TEST_Computer_Pagination and sorting

test_cases.Title: ViewBrandManifestations_XXX_REQ_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Verify Brand Spain displays Brand Master manifestations for DGOJ-BM associated sports

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application and navigate to the login page.
Steps.Expected Result: Login page is displayed with username and password fields.

Steps.Step Description: Log in using valid user credentials with Anagrafica view permissions (e.g., user: ana.spain.viewer, role: Anagrafica_Viewer).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and redirected to the application main dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: From the main menu, navigate to Anagrafica -> Brand and select Brand 'Spagna' (Spain).
Steps.Expected Result: Brand 'Spagna' detail page is shown and the navigation panel displays the 'Manifestazioni' section.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Manifestazioni' section for Brand Spagna.
Steps.Expected Result: The Manifestazioni list view opens and loads records related to Brand Spagna.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the list shows only Brand Master (BM Master) manifestazioni and that each displayed manifestazione corresponds to a DGOJ sport that has an association with one or more BM sports.
Steps.Expected Result: All visible manifestazioni are labelled as 'Brand Master' and each entry's Sport source indicates DGOJ with an association to BM; no non-associated DGOJ sports or non-BM manifestazioni are shown.

Steps.Step Description: Open one manifestazione record from the list to view details.
Steps.Expected Result: Manifestazione detail view opens showing fields including 'Nome Manifestazione', 'Tipo' (Brand Master), 'Sport Source' (DGOJ), and 'Associazioni Sport BM' containing at least one associated BM sport.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test environment with Brand 'Spagna' data loaded. 2) At least one DGOJ sport has association(s) with BM sport(s) and corresponding Brand Master manifestazione(s) exist. 3) Tester has valid Anagrafica_Viewer credentials. 4) Network connectivity to test environment.
test_cases.Dataset: User: ana.spain.viewer / Password: <valid>; Brand: Spagna; Manifestazione sample: 'Championship X' (Tipo: Brand Master, Sport Source: DGOJ linked to BM 'Football_BM')
test_cases.Expected Result: Logged-in user with proper permissions can view the Manifestazioni list for Brand Spagna and see only Brand Master manifestazioni where DGOJ sports have associations with BM sports; detail view shows association information.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers viewing/listing and detail display for Brand Master manifestazioni only. Does not cover editing, creating, deleting, or bulk operations; performance and large dataset pagination behavior not covered.

test_cases.Title: ViewBrandManifestations_XXX_REQ_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Verify empty state when no DGOJ-BM associations exist for Brand Spain

test_cases.Expected Result: When no DGOJ-BM associations exist, the Manifestazioni section for Brand Spagna shows an empty state message and no Brand Master manifestazioni entries.

test_cases.Title: ViewBrandManifestations_XXX_REQ_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Verify access control prevents unauthenticated or unauthorized users from viewing Manifestazioni

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the user is not authenticated (log out if currently logged in) and attempt to directly open the URL for Brand Spagna -> Manifestazioni.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Existence of two test accounts: one without Anagrafica permissions (basic_user) and one with permissions (ana.spain.viewer). 2) Tester can log out and switch accounts.

test_cases.Title: FilterManifestations_XXX_REQ_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Verify filters show only DGOJ sports associated with BM for Brand Spain
