test_cases.Title: CreateUserMissingFields_XXX_AttorePrincipale_UtenteAnagrafica_TEST_Computer_Attempt to create a user with missing mandatory fields

Steps.Step Description: Open 'Anagrafica Utenti' and click 'Nuovo' to open the creation form.
Steps.Expected Result: User creation form/modal is displayed with mandatory and optional fields.

Steps.Step Description: Leave mandatory fields empty (Name and Codice Fiscale) and fill Email with 'invalid.email@example.com' (or leave email empty depending on scenario).
Steps.Expected Result: The fields are left empty or populated as instructed; client-side validators may mark empty mandatory fields.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Salva' to submit the form.
Steps.Expected Result: The system prevents submission and displays inline validation messages indicating which mandatory fields are missing (e.g., 'Campo obbligatorio: Nome', 'Campo obbligatorio: Codice Fiscale'). No user is created.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to submit again after entering invalid Codice Fiscale format (e.g., 'INVALIDCF') to trigger format validation.
Steps.Expected Result: The system displays a validation error indicating invalid Codice Fiscale format; submission is blocked until a valid format is provided.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester account has create permission. 2) Test environment available.
test_cases.Dataset: Name= ; Surname=Verdi; CodiceFiscale= ; Email=invalid.email@example.com
test_cases.Expected Result: The system enforces mandatory field checks and format validation; no user record is created and clear validation messages are shown.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers mandatory and basic format validations; does not cover internationalization of validation messages or exhaustive format rules.

test_cases.Title: EditUser_XXX_AttorePrincipale_UtenteAnagrafica_TEST_Computer_Edit existing user details and save

Steps.Step Description: Ensure an existing user is available (pre-created) with Email 'anna.bianchi@example.com'. Navigate to 'Anagrafica Utenti' and search for this user.
Steps.Expected Result: The user 'Anna Bianchi' appears in the list and can be selected to view details.

Steps.Step Description: Open the user details and click 'Modifica' (Edit) to enable editing of fields.
Steps.Expected Result: The user details fields become editable and an option to save/cancel appears.

Steps.Step Description: Change Email to 'anna.bianchi+test@example.com' and Telephone to '+390987654321', then click 'Salva'.
Steps.Expected Result: The system validates the new values; upon success, displays a confirmation 'Modifiche salvate' and updates the record in the UI.

Steps.Step Description: Reload the user details page (or re-query the list) and verify the persisted values.
Steps.Expected Result: The Email and Telephone values reflect the updated inputs in both UI and backend data (if backend access is available).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has edit permission. 2) A user 'Anna Bianchi' exists with email anna.bianchi@example.com. 3) Test DB is writable.
test_cases.Dataset: ExistingUserEmail=anna.bianchi@example.com; NewEmail=anna.bianchi+test@example.com; NewPhone=+390987654321
test_cases.Expected Result: User details are updated successfully; changes persist in the system and are displayed in the UI without data loss.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers basic edit flow and persistence; does not cover concurrent edits, audit log verification, or rollback scenarios.

test_cases.Title: DeleteUser_XXX_AttorePrincipale_UtenteAnagrafica_TEST_Computer_Delete an unlinked user and confirm cancellation path

Steps.Step Description: Identify an unlinked user record (no external relations) with Email 'test.to.delete@example.com' in 'Anagrafica Utenti'.
Steps.Expected Result: The specified user is present in the list and is eligible for deletion (no warning about linked entities).

Steps.Step Description: Select the user and click 'Elimina' (Delete). When the confirmation dialog appears, click 'Annulla' (Cancel).
Steps.Expected Result: The confirmation dialog closes and the user record remains unchanged in the list.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Elimina' again and confirm deletion by clicking 'Conferma' (Confirm).
Steps.Expected Result: The system deletes the user record, shows a success message 'Utente eliminato', and the user no longer appears in the list.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the deleted user's details URL directly or search by email.
Steps.Expected Result: The system returns 'User not found' or empty search; the deleted user details are not accessible.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has delete permission. 2) A user 'test.to.delete@example.com' exists and has no linked transactions or constraints preventing deletion.
test_cases.Dataset: Email=test.to.delete@example.com; UserState=unlinked
test_cases.Expected Result: Unlinked user can be deleted after confirmation; cancellation preserves the user. Deleted user records are no longer accessible.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers delete and cancel flows for unlinked users; does not cover soft-delete vs hard-delete behavior or retention policies.

test_cases.Title: DeleteUserLinked_XXX_AttorePrincipale_UtenteAnagrafica_TEST_Computer_Attempt to delete a linked user and expect error

Steps.Step Description: Ensure a user exists that is linked to other system entities (e.g., transactions) with Email 'linked.user@example.com'. Navigate to their record.
Steps.Expected Result: The linked user record is found in the Anagrafica list and selection displays details, including an indicator of linked relations if provided by the UI.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Elimina' (Delete) to attempt removal of the linked user and confirm deletion.
Steps.Expected Result: The system blocks deletion and displays an informative error or warning explaining why deletion is not allowed (e.g., 'Impossibile eliminare: utente collegato a transazioni').

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to force deletion via API (if test scope includes backend access) using user identifier.
Steps.Expected Result: API returns a 4xx response with an error message describing the constraint; no deletion occurs. Backend logs contain the constraint rejection (if accessible).

Steps.Step Description: Verify the user still exists in the UI and their linked relations are intact.
Steps.Expected Result: User remains present; linked relations are unchanged and accessible.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application (Anagrafica Module) and API endpoints
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has delete permission. 2) A user 'linked.user@example.com' exists and is linked to transactions or other entities. 3) API access credentials available if API step executed.
test_cases.Dataset: Email=linked.user@example.com; LinkedEntities=transactions
test_cases.Expected Result: System prevents deletion of users that are linked to other entities and provides a clear explanatory message; no data is removed.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers prevention of deletion for linked users; does not cover unlinking flow or administrator override scenarios.

test_cases.Title: CreateRecord_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_create a new anagrafica record

Steps.Step Description: Launch the Backoffice web application and log in with a user having 'Anagrafica Create' permissions.
Steps.Expected Result: Backoffice home page is displayed and user is authenticated with appropriate permissions.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Anagrafica' module via the main menu.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Anagrafica' module page is displayed with options for creating and managing records.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Create New' (or equivalent) to open the new record form.
Steps.Expected Result: New Anagrafica form is displayed with all required input fields (e.g., Name, Surname, Tax ID, Date of Birth, Contact Info).

Steps.Step Description: Fill in all mandatory fields with valid data: Name='Mario', Surname='Rossi', TaxID='RSSMRA80A01H501U', DOB='1980-01-01', Email='m.rossi@example.it', Phone='+39011222333'.
Steps.Expected Result: Fields accept input and show no validation errors.

Steps.Step Description: Optional: add address and notes, then click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Save action is accepted and system shows a success confirmation (e.g., 'Record created successfully').

Steps.Step Description: Search for the created record using Tax ID or Name to confirm persistence.
Steps.Expected Result: The new record appears in search results with all entered details matching the input.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester account exists with 'Anagrafica Create' permission. 2) Backoffice application reachable (URL). 3) No existing record with the same TaxID used in test data.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid user details: Name='Mario', Surname='Rossi', TaxID='RSSMRA80A01H501U', DOB='1980-01-01', Email='m.rossi@example.it', Phone='+39011222333', Address='Via Roma 1, Torino'
test_cases.Expected Result: A new Anagrafica record is created and persisted; search returns the record with correct details.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers creation of a standard person record; bulk import and special character edge cases not included.

test_cases.Title: MandatoryFieldsValidation_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_validate mandatory fields on create

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Backoffice with a user who can access the Anagrafica module.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and Anagrafica module is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Open the 'Create New' Anagrafica form.
Steps.Expected Result: New record form is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Leave mandatory fields empty (e.g., Name, Surname, Tax ID) and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Form is not saved; validation messages are shown next to each mandatory field indicating they are required.

Steps.Step Description: Enter an invalid Tax ID value (e.g., 'INVALID123') while other mandatory fields are valid and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Save is rejected; a validation error specific to Tax ID format is displayed and no record is created.

Steps.Step Description: Enter an invalid email format (e.g., 'mario.at.example') and attempt to save.
Steps.Expected Result: Form shows an email format validation message and prevents save.

test_cases.Preconditions: Backoffice application available; tester has access to Anagrafica create form.
test_cases.Dataset: Empty mandatory fields; invalid TaxID: 'INVALID123'; invalid email: 'mario.at.example'
test_cases.Expected Result: System enforces mandatory field presence and field-format validation; invalid inputs are rejected with clear messages.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client-side and server-side mandatory and format validations for common fields; locale-specific validations (e.g., international Tax IDs) not covered.

test_cases.Title: UpdateRecord_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_modify an existing anagrafica record

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Backoffice with an account having 'Anagrafica Edit' permission.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and can access edit functionality in Anagrafica.

Steps.Step Description: Search and open an existing Anagrafica record (use TaxID 'RSSMRA80A01H501U' created in TC-AN-001 or an existing test record).
Steps.Expected Result: Record details page/form is displayed with current values.

Steps.Step Description: Modify editable fields: change Phone to '+39011999888' and Address to 'Corso Italia 5, Torino'.
Steps.Expected Result: Fields accept the new values without immediate validation errors.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' or 'Update' to persist changes.
Steps.Expected Result: System confirms update (e.g., 'Record updated successfully') and no validation errors are returned.

Steps.Step Description: Reload or re-open the same record and verify that the updated values are persisted.
Steps.Expected Result: The record shows the new Phone and Address values matching the modifications.

test_cases.Preconditions: A target Anagrafica record exists and tester has 'Edit' permission.
test_cases.Dataset: Existing record TaxID='RSSMRA80A01H501U'; new Phone='+39011999888'; new Address='Corso Italia 5, Torino'
test_cases.Expected Result: Record changes are accepted, persisted, and visible upon retrieval.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Verifies simple field updates; complex business rules or linked entity updates not included.

test_cases.Title: DeleteRecord_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_delete an anagrafica record

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Backoffice with a user having 'Anagrafica Delete' permission.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and Delete functionality is available if permitted.

Steps.Step Description: Search for an existing test Anagrafica record (e.g., TaxID created in TC-AN-001).
Steps.Expected Result: Record is found and accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Delete' (or equivalent) on the record and confirm the deletion in any confirmation dialog.
Steps.Expected Result: System asks for confirmation and, after confirm, shows success message indicating deletion.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to search for the deleted record by TaxID.
Steps.Expected Result: Record is not returned in search results; system either shows 'no results' or indicates record is inactive/archived depending on business rule.

Steps.Step Description: If system supports soft-delete/archiving, verify that record is flagged as deleted/inactive in audit or history log.
Steps.Expected Result: Audit/history shows delete action with user and timestamp; record status reflects deletion as per system design.

test_cases.Preconditions: A deletable Anagrafica record exists; tester has delete permissions.
test_cases.Dataset: Existing record TaxID='RSSMRA80A01H501U' or dedicated deletable test record
test_cases.Expected Result: Record is deleted or marked as inactive per system rules; record is no longer returned by normal searches and deletion is logged.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers delete flow and audit verification; restore/undelete and cascading deletes not covered.

test_cases.Title: SearchFilter_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_search and filter records in anagrafica

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Backoffice and open the Anagrafica module.
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica list/search interface is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Perform a search by full TaxID (e.g., 'RSSMRA80A01H501U').
Steps.Expected Result: Search returns the exact matching record if it exists.

Steps.Step Description: Perform a partial search by surname (e.g., 'Ross') and apply filter for 'Active' status.
Steps.Expected Result: Search returns records whose surname contains 'Ross' and only those with 'Active' status.

Steps.Step Description: Combine filters (e.g., City = 'Torino' AND DOB before '1990-01-01') and execute search.
Steps.Expected Result: Results list only records satisfying all combined filter criteria.

Steps.Step Description: Sort results by Surname ascending and verify ordering.
Steps.Expected Result: Results are ordered by surname alphabetically ascending.

test_cases.Preconditions: Several test Anagrafica records exist covering different surnames, cities, dates of birth and statuses.
test_cases.Dataset: Multiple records with variations: Surnames 'Rossi','Rossini','Bianchi'; Cities 'Torino','Milano'; DOBs spanning decades; statuses Active/Inactive.
test_cases.Expected Result: Search and filter operations return correct and expected subsets; sorting orders as specified.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers common search/filter/sort scenarios; performance limits for very large datasets not covered.

test_cases.Title: AccessControl_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_verify role based access controls

Steps.Step Description: Log in with a user account that has only 'Anagrafica Read' permission (no create/edit/delete).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and can access Anagrafica module in read-only mode.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access 'Create New' or 'Edit' UI elements and verify availability.
Steps.Expected Result: Create/Edit/Delete actions are not available or are disabled; attempting direct URL to edit/create returns 'Access Denied' or redirects to an error/forbidden page.

Steps.Step Description: Try to perform a create or update API call (if API available) using the read-only user's credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: API returns 403 Forbidden (or appropriate access control error) and no data modifications occur.

Steps.Step Description: Log in with an admin user having full Anagrafica permissions and verify that create/edit/delete operations succeed.
Steps.Expected Result: Admin can perform create/edit/delete operations successfully; audit logs show admin actions.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Anagrafica Web Application and API
test_cases.Preconditions: User accounts with distinct roles exist: read-only user and admin user; API access available for role tests.
test_cases.Dataset: Read-only user credentials; admin user credentials; sample record TaxID='RSSMRA80A01H501U'
test_cases.Expected Result: Role-based access controls enforced both at UI and API layers; unauthorized modifications are blocked and authorized actions are logged.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates basic RBAC enforcement; integration with central auth server or SSO flows not covered.

test_cases.Title: AccessoBrandSpagna_XXX_PRECOND_BrandNavigation_TEST_Mobile_Verify successful navigation within Brand Spain

Steps.Step Description: Launch the mobile application and ensure network connectivity.
Steps.Expected Result: The application opens to the splash/login screen and network is available.

Steps.Step Description: Log in using valid credentials for a user enabled to navigate Brand Spain (e.g., user_spain@example.com / Password123!).
Steps.Expected Result: Login is successful and the user is taken to the application home/dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: From the home/dashboard, open the Brand selector or menu and select 'Spagna' (Spain) brand.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Spagna' brand is selected and the UI updates context to Brand Spain.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to key Brand Spain sections (e.g., Offers, Events, Account Settings) and open each section.
Steps.Expected Result: Each selected section loads successfully and displays content localized/pertinent to Brand Spain (language, currency, offers).

Steps.Step Description: Perform an action that requires brand-specific authorization (e.g., view a Spain-only promotion detail).
Steps.Expected Result: The promotion detail is displayed without errors and indicates Spain-specific information where applicable.

Steps.Step Description: Log out from the application.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged out and returned to the login screen.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. The actor is correctly logged into the application. B. The actor is enabled to navigate within Brand Spagna (Spain). Network connectivity is available.
test_cases.Dataset: User enabled for Brand Spain (user_spain@example.com / Password123!), mobile device with Android 11, App v2.3.1
test_cases.Expected Result: A logged-in user enabled for Brand Spain can select 'Spagna' and successfully navigate to all Spain-specific sections and view Spain-localized content without errors.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers selection of Brand Spain and navigation to main sections; does not include deep functional validation of each feature (e.g., purchase flow, payment integrations).

test_cases.Title: AccessDeniedIfNotEnabled_XXX_PRECOND_BrandNavigation_TEST_Desktop_Verify access denied for users not enabled to Brand Spain

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application on a desktop and ensure network connectivity.
Steps.Expected Result: Web application is reachable and displays the login page.

Steps.Step Description: Log in with valid credentials for a user NOT enabled to navigate Brand Spain (e.g., user_nonspain@example.com / Password123!).
Steps.Expected Result: Login is successful and the user is taken to the home/dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to select or navigate to 'Spagna' (Spain) brand via Brand selector/menu or direct URL to a Spain-specific page.
Steps.Expected Result: The system prevents selection/navigation to Brand Spain and either hides the 'Spagna' option or shows an access denied/insufficient privileges message.

Steps.Step Description: If an access denied page or message is shown, verify the content of the message and any offered next steps (e.g., request access link, contact support).
Steps.Expected Result: The message clearly indicates lack of permission to access Brand Spain and provides appropriate guidance (no sensitive information exposed).

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access a Spain-specific resource via direct link (if possible) while logged in as the not-enabled user.
Steps.Expected Result: Access is denied; the resource page is not displayed and a 403 or friendly access denied notification is presented.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. The actor is correctly logged into the application. B. The actor is NOT enabled to navigate within Brand Spagna (negative precondition).
test_cases.Dataset: User without Brand Spain permissions (user_nonspain@example.com / Password123!), desktop with Windows 10
test_cases.Expected Result: Users not enabled for Brand Spain cannot access or navigate to Spain-specific brand areas; system shows access denied and does not expose Spain-only content.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates access control behavior only; does not check administrative permission assignment flows.

test_cases.Title: SessionExpiry_XXX_PRECOND_BrandNavigation_TEST_Tablet_Verify session expiry redirects to login before Brand Spain navigation

Steps.Step Description: Launch the application on a tablet and log in with valid Brand Spain-enabled credentials (user_spain@example.com / Password123!).
Steps.Expected Result: Login completes and the user reaches the home/dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Remain idle in the application for a period longer than the configured session timeout (e.g., wait 31 minutes if timeout is 30 minutes) or force session invalidation from backend (if available).
Steps.Expected Result: The session becomes expired or invalidated.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to select 'Spagna' (Spain) brand or navigate to a Spain-specific page after session expiry.
Steps.Expected Result: The application detects expired session and redirects to the login screen or prompts for re-authentication before allowing access to Brand Spain.

Steps.Step Description: Re-authenticate using the same valid credentials and attempt again to access Brand Spain.
Steps.Expected Result: After successful re-login, the user can select Brand Spain and navigate to Spain-specific sections as expected.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. The actor is correctly logged into the application. B. The actor is enabled to navigate within Brand Spagna. Ability to simulate session timeout or backend session invalidation.
test_cases.Dataset: User enabled for Brand Spain (user_spain@example.com / Password123!), tablet with iOS 16
test_cases.Expected Result: When session expires, attempts to access Brand Spain require re-authentication; after re-login, Brand Spain access is restored for the authorized user.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers session expiry handling related to Brand Spain navigation; does not cover session timeout configuration or token refresh mechanics in depth.

test_cases.Title: NavigateToManifestazioni_XXX_REQ-MANIFESTAZIONI_Manifestazioni_APP_WebTEST_Desktop_verify navigation from homepage

Steps.Step Description: Precondition: Ensure tester is logged in (if required) and on the Brand Spain homepage (Homepage Brand Spagna). Verify page fully loaded.
Steps.Expected Result: Brand Spain homepage is displayed and fully loaded.

Steps.Step Description: From the central area of the homepage, click the 'Manifestazioni' section (red rectangle in Figure 17).
Steps.Expected Result: User is navigated to the Manifestazioni page and the Manifestazioni page header is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Go back to homepage and open the left menu. From the left-side menu click the 'Manifestazioni' entry (orange rectangle in Figure 17).
Steps.Expected Result: User is navigated to the Manifestazioni page and the Manifestazioni page header is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that both navigation methods (central section and left menu) lead to the same Manifestazioni page URL and same page content.
Steps.Expected Result: Both navigation methods land on the same Manifestazioni page (same URL and same visible content).

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Google Chrome 120, Web Application Brand Spagna
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has network access. 2) Tester is authenticated if the site requires login. 3) Tester is on Brand Spain homepage.

test_cases.Expected Result: User can access the Manifestazioni page from both the homepage central area and the left navigation menu; both paths lead to the same page.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers navigation to Manifestazioni only; does not validate content of the table or filters in depth.

test_cases.Title: DefaultState_XXX_REQ-MANIFESTAZIONI_Manifestazioni_APP_WebTEST_Desktop_verify default empty state and buttons disabled

Steps.Step Description: Precondition: Navigate to the Manifestazioni page (use TC-001 to reach the page).
Steps.Expected Result: Manifestazioni page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the Manifestazioni table area immediately after landing on the page without performing any search or filter actions.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the state of the action buttons on initial load.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Google Chrome 120, Web Application Brand Spagna
test_cases.Preconditions: User is on Manifestazioni page with no filters applied.

test_cases.Expected Result: On initial page load the Manifestazioni table is in empty state; filter controls show default values and 'Avvia ricerca' and 'Reset' are disabled.

test_cases.Title: TableColumnsSorting_XXX_REQ-MANIFESTAZIONI_Manifestazioni_APP_WebTEST_Desktop_verify columns and sorting behavior

Steps.Step Description: Precondition: Execute a search that returns multiple Manifestazioni rows (use known dataset or back-end test data to ensure results contain many rows). Navigate to Manifestazioni page and apply a search to populate the table.
Steps.Expected Result: Table shows multiple Manifestazioni rows with values in all columns.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that table contains the following columns: Codice, Descrizione, Sport DGOJ, Genere, Categoria, Internazionale, Sigla ISO.
Steps.Expected Result: All listed columns are present in the table header in the expected order or layout.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to sort by clicking on the column header 'Codice'.
Steps.Expected Result: Table is sorted by Codice in ascending order on first click and toggles to descending on second click; UI shows sort indicator.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to sort by clicking on the column header 'Descrizione'.
Steps.Expected Result: Table sorts by Descrizione (toggle asc/desc) and shows sort indicator.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to sort by clicking on the column header 'Genere' and 'Categoria'.
Steps.Expected Result: Both columns support sorting (toggle asc/desc) and show correct sorted results and UI indicator.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Google Chrome 120, Web Application Brand Spagna
test_cases.Preconditions: Test dataset exists with multiple Manifestazioni covering diverse values for sortable columns.

test_cases.Expected Result: All columns except 'Sport DGOJ' and 'Sigla ISO' are sortable with correct ordering; 'Sport DGOJ' and 'Sigla ISO' are not sortable.

test_cases.Title: TextFilterPuntale_XXX_REQ-MANIFESTAZIONI_Manifestazioni_APP_WebTEST_Desktop_verify exact search disables other filters

Steps.Step Description: Precondition: On Manifestazioni page; ensure filter fields are in default state and store any pre-filled values for later verification.
Steps.Expected Result: Filters show default values: text empty, Sport DGOJ empty, Genere='Tutti', Categoria='Tutti', Sigla ISO empty.

Steps.Step Description: Enter an exact code (puntale) known to match a single manifestazione into 'Descrizione o codice' input (e.g., exact code 'BM12345') and press Enter or move focus out.
Steps.Expected Result: Because the search input is a 'puntale' entry (exact code), the UI should recognize that an exact/puntale search is requested.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the state of the fields 'Genere', 'Categoria' and 'Sigla ISO' after entering the exact code.
Steps.Expected Result: Fields 'Genere', 'Categoria' and 'Sigla ISO' become grayed out and disabled (not editable). Their current values are not cleared and remain visible.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to change values in the disabled fields while the text field contains the exact code.
Steps.Expected Result: Disabled fields cannot be changed; selection controls are inactive and do not accept input.

Steps.Step Description: Switch the text filter mode from 'puntale' to a non-exact mode ('contiene') by editing the Descrizione input (e.g. remove trailing characters to make it a partial search) or selecting an interface option to change search type.
Steps.Expected Result: The disabled fields become enabled again and retain their previous values (the values they had before becoming disabled).

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Avvia ricerca' (if enabled) to perform the search with the exact code.
Steps.Expected Result: Search executes and the table displays only the manifestazione(s) matching the exact code; if only one match exists, only that row is shown.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Reset' button after the search to clear filters (if Reset becomes enabled after search).
Steps.Expected Result: All filters return to their default states: 'Descrizione o codice' cleared, Sport DGOJ cleared, Genere='Tutti', Categoria='Tutti', Sigla ISO cleared; table returns to empty state or default result set.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Google Chrome 120, Web Application Brand Spagna
test_cases.Preconditions: Known manifestazione code (e.g., BM12345) exists in the dataset; tester on Manifestazioni page.
test_cases.Dataset: Exact manifestazione code 'BM12345' and related dataset entries; default filter values
test_cases.Expected Result: Entering an exact code triggers 'puntale' logic: 'Genere','Categoria','Sigla ISO' become disabled and keep their values; switching back to non-exact restores enabled state and previous values; search returns correct exact-match row(s).

test_cases.Title: AutocompleteAndISODropdown_XXX_REQ-MANIFESTAZIONI_Manifestazioni_APP_WebTEST_Desktop_verify autocomplete and iso dropdown

test_cases.Title: EditAnagrafica_XXX_AttorePrincipale_UtenteAnagrafica_TEST_Computer_edit existing anagrafica record

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application with a valid Utente Anagrafica account that has edit permissions.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and can access the Anagrafica module.

Steps.Step Description: Locate an existing Anagrafica record (use record with Codice Fiscale='RSSMRA80A01H501U' created previously) in the listing and open it.
Steps.Expected Result: The selected record detail page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Edit' to enable editing of the record fields.
Steps.Expected Result: Fields become editable and 'Save' and 'Cancel' controls are available.

Steps.Step Description: Change Email to 'm.rossi+update@example.test' and Phone to '+39019999888', then click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: System validates inputs and accepts changes; a success message is shown and the listing reflects updated data.

Steps.Step Description: Re-open the edited record and verify that Email and Phone fields show the updated values.
Steps.Expected Result: Record details display Email='m.rossi+update@example.test' and Phone='+39019999888'.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) An existing Anagrafica record is present. 2) Tester account has edit permission.
test_cases.Dataset: Existing record identifier (Codice Fiscale) and new values for Email and Phone
test_cases.Expected Result: Changes to the Anagrafica record are saved and persisted; UI displays updated values.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers basic edit flow and UI persistence; does not verify audit trail or concurrency edits.

test_cases.Title: DeleteAnagrafica_XXX_AttorePrincipale_UtenteAnagrafica_TEST_Computer_delete anagrafica record gracefully

Steps.Step Description: Login as Utente Anagrafica with delete permission.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and can access Anagrafica module.

Steps.Step Description: Select an existing Anagrafica record from the listing (use a test record created for deletion).
Steps.Expected Result: Record is highlighted and details can be accessed.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Delete' (or 'Remove') for the selected record and confirm the deletion in any confirmation dialog.
Steps.Expected Result: A confirmation dialog is displayed asking to confirm deletion; upon confirmation the record is deleted and a success message appears.

Steps.Step Description: Search the listing for the deleted record using its Codice Fiscale.
Steps.Expected Result: Record is no longer present in the listing; search returns no results.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to open the deleted record by direct URL if known.
Steps.Expected Result: System returns a not-found message or redirects to listing; the deleted record cannot be accessed.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test record available for deletion. 2) Tester has delete permissions. 3) Backup copy of test data exists if needed.
test_cases.Dataset: Identifier of record to delete (Codice Fiscale or internal ID)
test_cases.Expected Result: Record is removed from the system and cannot be retrieved via UI; delete action prompts confirmation to avoid accidental deletion.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI deletion and search; does not validate physical DB deletion or retention policy.

test_cases.Title: AccessControlAnagrafica_XXX_AttorePrincipale_UtenteAnagrafica_TEST_Computer_validate access rights and negative scenarios

Steps.Step Description: Login with an Utente Anagrafica account that has read-only permission (no create/edit/delete).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and lands on the application home page.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Anagrafica module and verify available actions.
Steps.Expected Result: Listing and record view are accessible; Create/Edit/Delete buttons are not visible or disabled.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the 'Create New' form by URL manipulation or direct API call (if tester has tools) while logged in as read-only user.
Steps.Expected Result: System denies access and shows an authorization error or redirects to a permitted page; no new form is presented.

Steps.Step Description: Login with an account that has no Anagrafica module permission and attempt to access the module URL.
Steps.Expected Result: Access is denied and an appropriate authorization/403 message is shown; Anagrafica module link is not visible in the menu.

Steps.Step Description: Try to perform a delete operation via direct POST/DELETE API call with read-only user credentials (if API accessible in test env).
Steps.Expected Result: API responds with authorization error (e.g., 403) and no delete is performed.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test users with different permission levels are provisioned (read-only, no-access). 2) Tester knows module URLs and has tools for API calls if needed.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials for read-only and no-access accounts
test_cases.Expected Result: Only users with proper roles can create/edit/delete Anagrafica; unauthorized attempts are blocked and logged.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI and API-level authorization checks for basic roles; does not include exhaustive role matrix for all possible roles.

test_cases.Title: CreateRecord_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Create new registry record with valid data

Steps.Step Description: Open the Anagrafica Backoffice web application and log in with a valid admin user account.
Steps.Expected Result: Backoffice login page is loaded and admin user is successfully authenticated; Anagrafica dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Anagrafica' module and click the 'Create New Record' (or 'Nuovo') button.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Create New Record' form is displayed with all mandatory and optional fields visible.

Steps.Step Description: Fill in mandatory fields with valid data: First Name = 'Mario', Last Name = 'Rossi', Date of Birth = '1985-05-20', Fiscal Code = 'RSSMRA85E20H501X', Address = 'Via Roma 1, Roma', Contact Email = 'mario.rossi@example.com'.
Steps.Expected Result: All entered values are accepted by the UI (no inline validation errors displayed).

Steps.Step Description: Fill optional fields as needed and click 'Save' (or 'Salva').
Steps.Expected Result: Form submission is accepted and processing indicator (if any) is shown.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the new record appears in the Anagrafica list and open the record details.
Steps.Expected Result: New record is present in the list with correct summary information; details page shows all saved values exactly as entered.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has a valid admin account with create permissions on Anagrafica. 2) Test environment database is available and reachable. 3) No existing record with Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA85E20H501X' exists.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid admin credentials; example record data (Mario Rossi, RSSMRA85E20H501X, mario.rossi@example.com)
test_cases.Expected Result: A new Anagrafica record is successfully created and persisted; all entered fields are stored and viewable in details.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers creation happy path and UI-level validation; does not cover performance under load or external system integrations.

test_cases.Title: CreateRecordMissingMandatory_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Verify mandatory field validation on create

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica Backoffice with a valid user who has create permissions.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and Anagrafica module is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Open 'Create New Record' form and leave mandatory field 'Last Name' empty. Fill other mandatory fields with valid data (First Name, Fiscal Code, Date of Birth).
Steps.Expected Result: Form shows 'Last Name' as empty; other fields are populated correctly.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to save the record by clicking 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Save action is blocked; inline validation message appears near the 'Last Name' field indicating it is required; no record is created.

Steps.Step Description: Repeat by entering an invalid email format 'mario.rossi@invalid' in Contact Email and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Inline validation prevents submission and displays an appropriate error message for email format; no record is created.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user exists with create permission. 2) Anagrafica form validation rules are deployed in TEST environment.
test_cases.Dataset: Sample inputs with missing and invalid values (empty Last Name, invalid email).
test_cases.Expected Result: System enforces mandatory and format validations on create; prevents record creation when validations fail and displays appropriate error messages.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client-side and server-side basic validations; does not include exhaustive validation rules for all optional fields.

test_cases.Title: EditRecord_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Update existing registry record contact information

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica Backoffice with a user who has edit/update permissions.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and Anagrafica module is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Search for an existing record by Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA85E20H501X' and open the record details page.
Steps.Expected Result: Record is found and details page loads with current information.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Edit' (or 'Modifica'), change Email to 'mario.rossi.new@example.com' and Phone to '+39 06 1234567', then click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Update request is submitted; success confirmation is shown.

Steps.Step Description: Refresh or reopen the record details and verify updated fields.
Steps.Expected Result: Email and Phone fields reflect the new values and are persisted in the system.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Record with Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA85E20H501X' exists. 2) Tester has update permissions.

test_cases.Expected Result: Record updates are accepted and persisted; changes visible in details and list views.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers typical edit flow and persistence; does not cover audit trail or rollback scenarios.

test_cases.Title: DeleteRecord_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Soft delete anagrafica record and verify removal from active list

Steps.Step Description: Log in as a user with delete permissions in Anagrafica Backoffice.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully authenticated and the Anagrafica module is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Locate a non-production test record (e.g., Fiscal Code 'DELTEST1234567') in the Anagrafica list.
Steps.Expected Result: The test record is displayed in the list.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Delete' (or 'Elimina') action for the record and confirm the deletion in the confirmation dialog.
Steps.Expected Result: Confirmation dialog appears and, after confirmation, system displays success message; record is removed from active list.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to search for the deleted record by Fiscal Code and also check 'Show deleted/inactive' filter if available.
Steps.Expected Result: Record is not present in active results; if 'show deleted' is enabled, record appears but marked as deleted/inactive (soft delete).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test record exists and is safe to delete (test data). 2) Tester has delete permissions. 3) Deletion behavior (soft vs hard) is defined in requirements.
test_cases.Dataset: Test record identifier 'DELTEST1234567'.
test_cases.Expected Result: Record deletion workflow works as specified; record removed from active lists and, if soft-delete, available only via deleted/inactive filter.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers user-initiated deletion confirmation flow; does not validate downstream processes that consume deleted records.

test_cases.Title: SearchFilter_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Verify search and filter by multiple criteria

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica Backoffice with a user account that can view records.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and can access the Anagrafica list view.

Steps.Step Description: Use the search box to perform a free-text search for 'Rossi' and press Enter.
Steps.Expected Result: List refreshes showing only records that match 'Rossi' in searchable fields (name, surname).

Steps.Step Description: Apply filters: Date of Birth between '1980-01-01' and '1990-12-31', and Location = 'Roma', then apply filters.
Steps.Expected Result: List displays only records that satisfy all applied filters; counts and pagination adjust accordingly.

Steps.Step Description: Clear filters and perform an advanced search by Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA85E20H501X'.
Steps.Expected Result: Search returns exactly the matching record when a precise identifier is used.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt a search using special characters and SQL-like input (e.g., "' OR 1=1 --").
Steps.Expected Result: Input is treated as text and sanitized; search returns no unintended results and no error or injection occurs.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Several sample records with varied attributes exist in TEST environment. 2) Search/indexing service is running.
test_cases.Dataset: Multiple test records covering name, DOB ranges, locations, fiscal codes; malicious-like input for injection check.
test_cases.Expected Result: Search and filters return correct, consistent results; inputs are properly sanitized and no injection is possible.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI search and filter functionality; does not include full-text indexing performance evaluation.

test_cases.Title: DuplicatePrevention_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Verify duplicate detection on import and create

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica Backoffice with import and create permissions.
Steps.Expected Result: User authenticated and import/create features accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to create a new record with a Fiscal Code that already exists in the system (e.g., 'RSSMRA85E20H501X').
Steps.Expected Result: System rejects creation and displays a clear duplicate error message indicating the existing record identifier.

Steps.Step Description: Prepare a CSV import file containing two rows: one with a new Fiscal Code and one with the existing Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA85E20H501X'. Upload the file via the Anagrafica import function and run validation step.
Steps.Expected Result: Import validation flags the duplicate row and provides a report of errors/warnings without importing invalid duplicate row(s).

Steps.Step Description: Resolve duplicates by selecting the option to skip duplicates and re-run import, or choose to merge if supported.
Steps.Expected Result: Import completes for non-duplicate rows; duplicate rows are skipped or merged according to chosen option; import summary accurately reflects processed/skipped/merged counts.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Anagrafica Backoffice Web Application, Import Service
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Existing record with Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA85E20H501X' present. 2) Import service enabled in TEST environment. 3) Tester has import permissions.
test_cases.Dataset: CSV with one duplicate row and one new row; existing fiscal code in system.
test_cases.Expected Result: System detects duplicates both on create and on import, prevents duplicate creation, and provides actionable feedback in import reports.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers duplicate detection for Fiscal Code during create/import; does not include complex merge conflict resolution scenarios.

test_cases.Title: EventSearch_XXX_Precondizioni_SportsApp_TEST_Computer_VerifyBMassociationDisplayed

test_cases.Title: AccessDenied_NotLogged_XXX_Precondizioni_SportsApp_TEST_Computer_VerifyAccessBlockedWhenNotLoggedIn

test_cases.Title: RicercaContiene_XXX_REQ_MANIFESTAZIONI_SearchApp_TEST_Computer_contains search returns matching items

Steps.Step Description: Open the Backoffice application and navigate to Brand Spain > Manifestazioni section following the base path 'Visualizza lista Manifestazioni Brand Spagna'.
Steps.Expected Result: The Manifestazioni section for Brand Spain is displayed and ready for interaction.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the search filter field labeled 'Descrizione o codice BM' is visible and empty.

Ensure search mode is set to 'contiene' (contains) or default supports contains.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the 'Avvia ricerca' button state after entering the search text.

Steps.Expected Result: The search request is executed and the results list is refreshed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the search results contain all manifestazioni where the description contains 'Feria'. Check each result row columns.
Steps.Expected Result: Only entries whose Codice or Descrizione contain 'Feria' are shown. Result list displays columns: Codice, Descrizione, Sport DGOJ, Genere, Categoria, Internazionale, Sigla ISO. Values correspond to the matching records.

Steps.Expected Result: Detail view (if supported) corresponds to the selected row; details match displayed row values.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has valid Backoffice credentials with access to Brand Spain Manifestazioni. 2) Test data exists: at least two manifestazioni with descriptions containing the term 'Feria' (e.g., 'Feria de Madrid', 'Feria Internacional') and corresponding BM codes. 3) Network connectivity to TEST environment.
test_cases.Dataset: Existing manifestazioni: {BM001:'Feria de Madrid', BM002:'Feria Internacional', BM123:'Exposicion'}, search input: 'Feria'.
test_cases.Expected Result: Search using 'contains' returns only manifestazioni whose description or BM code contains the search term, and the results list shows columns Codice, Descrizione, Sport DGOJ, Genere, Categoria, Internazionale, Sigla ISO.

test_cases.Title: ErroreAccessoManifestazioni_XXX_REQ-MANIFESTAZIONI_BrandSpagna_TEST_Smartphone_verify_error_page_display

Steps.Step Description: Install and launch the Brand App on the smartphone and ensure the application is updated to the test version.
Steps.Expected Result: Application launches successfully and home screen is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Ensure active session: log in with a valid user account (test_user_spain@example.com / Password123) or confirm guest access as per app policy.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in (or guest session active) and profile/brand selector is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Set the application Brand/context to 'Spain' (Brand Spagna) using the brand switcher or confirm the app is already set to Brand Spagna.
Steps.Expected Result: Brand displayed in the app is 'Spain' and Brand-specific menus (including 'Manifestazioni') are visible.

Steps.Step Description: From the main menu, select the 'Manifestazioni' (Events) section.
Steps.Expected Result: The client displays the standard error page used for other Brands in production when access fails (error title, description/message consistent with production 'as is').

Steps.Step Description: Inspect the error page UI for expected elements: error message, possible retry/back navigation option and no event listing.
Steps.Expected Result: Error page shows the expected message and presentation consistent with production for other brands; no events are listed.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to proceed to search for a Manifestazione via any visible search field or search icon on the error page.
Steps.Expected Result: Search operation is not available: search field is disabled/absent or attempting search returns the same error state; user cannot perform search.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) App installed and updated to test version; 2) Network connectivity available; 3) Valid test account credentials available (test_user_spain@example.com / Password123) or guest allowed; 4) Brand context set to Spain; 5) Tester has access to Manifestazioni menu item
test_cases.Dataset: User: test_user_spain@example.com; Password: Password123; App version: 1.2.3-test; Device: Android 12 smartphone
test_cases.Expected Result: When accessing Manifestazioni under Brand Spagna, the client displays the standard error page (as per production for other brands) and the user cannot proceed to search for events; use case ends.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Errore nell'accesso alla sezione Manifestazioni del Brand Spagna
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI presentation and blocking of search on error page; does not validate backend logs or telemetry.

test_cases.Title: RicercaBloccataManifestazioni_XXX_REQ-MANIFESTAZIONI_BrandSpagna_TEST_Smartphone_verify_search_disabled_on_error

Steps.Step Description: Launch the Brand App and confirm Brand is set to Spain and user is authenticated as in preconditions.
Steps.Expected Result: App is running, Brand is Spain, user session active.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Manifestazioni section via menu or direct navigation link.
Steps.Expected Result: The Manifestazioni section loads the error page as per the application's error design for other Brands.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to tap into any search input field, type a search query (e.g., 'concerto Madrid'), and press the search/enter action.
Steps.Expected Result: Input is either not present or disabled; if input accepts characters, pressing search returns or remains on the error page with no search results; no search results are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt alternative search triggers: use app-wide quick-search (if present) or deep-link to a Manifestazione search URL (if supported in the app).
Steps.Expected Result: Any attempt to perform a search for Manifestazioni under Brand Spagna is blocked or results in the same error state; no search or event listing is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Use back navigation or the provided retry/navigation option to exit the Manifestazioni error page and try to access another non-Manifestazioni section.
Steps.Expected Result: Back navigation works and other sections are reachable; the Manifestazioni search remains inaccessible until the error condition is resolved.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) App installed and updated; 2) User logged in (test_user_spain@example.com) or guest access allowed; 3) Brand context set to Spain; 4) Tester has permission to perform searches in normal operations
test_cases.Dataset: Search query examples: 'concerto Madrid', 'teatro Barcelona'; User credentials as above; App version: 1.2.3-test
test_cases.Expected Result: Search functionality for Manifestazioni is not available when the Manifestazioni section returns the error; the user cannot perform searches and receives the error state instead.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Errore nell'accesso alla sezione Manifestazioni del Brand Spagna
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates that UI blocks search operations; does not cover network-level redirections or system-wide search indexing.

test_cases.Title: ErroreAccessoManifestazioniLogging_XXX_REQ-MANIFESTAZIONI_BrandSpagna_TEST_Smartphone_verify_error_reporting_and_ui_consistency

Steps.Step Description: Ensure test environment (TEST or PRE-PROD) with backend logging enabled; launch the Brand App on an iOS device and set Brand to Spain.
Steps.Expected Result: App launches on iOS device, Brand Spain selected, backend logging active for test environment.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Manifestazioni section to reproduce the access error condition.
Steps.Expected Result: Client shows the standard error page for Manifestazioni as per production 'as is' behavior.

Steps.Step Description: Capture the client-side error identifier or code displayed (if present) and note timestamp. Observe whether the UI offers retry/back actions.
Steps.Expected Result: An error message and/or error code is visible on the UI; retry/back options present as per production design.

Steps.Step Description: On the backend/test logging console, search logs for the time window and for error events related to Manifestazioni access for Brand Spain; confirm an appropriate error event is registered (error type, timestamp, device ID, user ID).
Steps.Expected Result: A corresponding error log entry is recorded in the backend with details matching the client event (error code/type, timestamp, user or device identifier).

Steps.Step Description: Verify that no event listings are retrievable via API for the Manifestazioni endpoint for Brand Spain (call the API endpoint used by the app for Manifestazioni and note response).
Steps.Expected Result: API returns an error response consistent with the client error (e.g., HTTP 4xx/5xx or controlled error payload); no event data returned.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to perform a Manifestazioni search via API with a sample query and validate response.
Steps.Expected Result: Search API returns error or empty response and does not return event data; client remains on error page and cannot proceed with search.

test_cases.Reference System: iOS 16, Brand App (Spain) connected to TEST/PRE-PROD backend with logging enabled
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test backend with logging accessible; 2) App built with test instrumentation; 3) Tester has access to backend logs and API endpoints; 4) Device has network connectivity and Brand set to Spain
test_cases.Dataset: User: test_user_spain@example.com; App build: iOS 1.2.3-test; Backend endpoint: /api/manifestazioni; Sample query: 'concerto Madrid'
test_cases.Expected Result: Accessing Manifestazioni under Brand Spagna results in the standard client error page; backend logs an error event corresponding to the client-side error; APIs return error/empty responses and searches cannot retrieve event data.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Errore nell'accesso alla sezione Manifestazioni del Brand Spagna
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI error display and backend logging/API response validation in test environment; does not cover production logging verification or analytics propagation.

test_cases.Title: NoResultsMessage_XXX_REQ_NoResultsSearch_CLIENT_TEST_Computer_display no results message

Steps.Step Description: Open the client search screen where filters and the search textbox are available.
Steps.Expected Result: Search screen loads with textbox, filter panel and 'Avvia ricerca' button visible.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a search query in the textbox that is non-numeric (for example 'abcdefg') and ensure the search mode is set to a non-'numerica puntuale' option (e.g., 'contiene').
Steps.Expected Result: Textbox contains 'abcdefg' and search mode displays 'contiene' (not 'numerica puntuale').

Steps.Step Description: If any filters are set, leave them as-is (do not clear). Click the 'Avvia ricerca' button.
Steps.Expected Result: Client executes the search request.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the client response when the search returns no results.
Steps.Expected Result: Client displays a clear 'no results' message indicating that no items were found for the performed search. The message includes or is accompanied by available next actions (e.g., a button to clear filters, the ability to edit the textbox, and an option to stop the search).

Steps.Step Description: Verify the wording and visibility of actionable elements in the 'no results' state: 'Clear Filters' button (labelled as per UI, referenced as button (2) Figure 18), textbox editable, and a 'Stop' or 'Cancel' option.
Steps.Expected Result: All three actions (clear filters button, editable textbox, and stop/close action) are visible and accessible from the 'no results' state.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester is logged into the client application. 2) Network connection available. 3) There exists no matching data for the chosen non-numeric search term in the current dataset (or test dataset configured to return zero matches). 4) Search mode is selectable and set to a non-'numerica puntuale' option.
test_cases.Dataset: Search term: 'abcdefg' (non-numeric), search mode: 'contiene', optional active filters: Category=A (does not match dataset).
test_cases.Expected Result: When a non-'numerica puntuale' search returns no results the client shows a 'no results' message and provides actions allowing the user to either clear all filters, edit/clear the textbox and retry a textual search, or stop the search/use case.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo - Nessun risultato dalla ricerca diversa da 'numerica puntuale'
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Verifies only the client behaviour and UI elements presented when a non-numeric-exact search yields no results; backend logging and analytics not covered.

test_cases.Title: ClearFiltersAndRetry_XXX_REQ_NoResultsSearch_CLIENT_TEST_Computer_clear filters and search

Steps.Step Description: Begin from the 'no results' state after conducting a non-'numerica puntuale' search (as validated in TC-ALT-001).
Steps.Expected Result: The 'no results' message and the 'Clear Filters' control (button (2) Figure 18) are visible.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Clear Filters' button (explicit control referenced as (2)).
Steps.Expected Result: All filter controls are reset to default (no filter selected) and the UI reflects cleared filters.

Steps.Step Description: Select any filter (for example, Filter 'Category' -> 'B') or leave filters cleared and choose a different filter option, then click 'Avvia ricerca' to perform a new search.
Steps.Expected Result: Client executes a new search using the selected (or newly chosen) filter(s).

Steps.Step Description: Observe the results returned by the new search and the UI response.
Steps.Expected Result: If data matching the new filter exists, results are displayed. If still no results, the 'no results' message is shown again and actions remain available. Filters remain in the state set prior to the search (i.e., newly selected filters persist).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test starts in 'no results' state from a non-'numerica puntuale' search. 2) Tester can interact with filter controls and the 'Clear Filters' button is enabled.
test_cases.Dataset: Initial search term: 'abcdefg' (no matches). Filter options: Category values {A,B,C}. Use Category=B for the retry search (assume B returns matches in test dataset).
test_cases.Expected Result: Clicking 'Clear Filters' removes all applied filters allowing the tester to select new filters or search with none. A subsequent search with a chosen filter performs correctly and returns results if matching data exists; otherwise the 'no results' state is presented again.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo - Nessun risultato dalla ricerca diversa da 'numerica puntuale'
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers clearing filters and performing a retry search; does not cover deep validation of each filter type or backend filter logic.

test_cases.Title: ClearTextboxAndTextSearch_XXX_REQ_NoResultsSearch_CLIENT_TEST_Computer_clear textbox and retry textual search

Steps.Step Description: From the search screen, confirm you are in the 'no results' state after a previous non-'numerica puntuale' search.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'no results' message is displayed and the textbox remains editable.

Steps.Step Description: Clear the text in the search textbox using the UI clear control or by deleting characters, leaving textbox empty.
Steps.Expected Result: Textbox is empty.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a new textual search term that is known to match existing records (for example 'validName') and set the search mode to either 'contiene' or 'puntuale' as required by the test scenario.
Steps.Expected Result: Textbox contains 'validName' and search mode is set to the selected textual option.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Avvia ricerca' to perform the textual search.
Steps.Expected Result: Client executes the textual search and returns matching results if present.

Steps.Step Description: If results are returned, verify that results match the search term according to chosen search mode ('contiene' returns items containing 'validName'; 'puntuale' returns exact matches).
Steps.Expected Result: Results list displays entries consistent with the selected search mode; if no results, the 'no results' message is shown again.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester is logged into client and on the search screen. 2) Test dataset contains at least one record matching 'validName'. 3) Initial state can be 'no results' or any state where textbox is editable.
test_cases.Dataset: Initial term: 'abcdefg' (no matches). New term: 'validName' (expected matches). Search mode: 'contiene' or 'puntuale' per scenario.
test_cases.Expected Result: Clearing the textbox and entering a valid textual search term should allow the user to successfully search; results are displayed consistent with the chosen textual search mode. If still no matches, the 'no results' message appears and user actions remain available.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo - Nessun risultato dalla ricerca diversa da 'numerica puntuale'
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates clearing textbox and performing textual searches for both 'contains' and 'exact' modes; does not verify full search relevance ranking or paging.

test_cases.Title: StopSearch_XXX_REQ_NoResultsSearch_CLIENT_TEST_Computer_stop search and terminate use case

Steps.Step Description: Reproduce the 'no results' state after performing a non-'numerica puntuale' search.
Steps.Expected Result: Client displays the 'no results' message with available actions including a 'Stop' or 'Cancel' option.

Steps.Step Description: Activate the 'Stop' or 'Cancel' action to interrupt the search/use case (by tapping the stop icon or pressing the labelled control).
Steps.Expected Result: Client cancels the current search flow and navigates away from the search results/no-results UI according to the product design (for example, return to previous screen or close the search panel).

Steps.Step Description: Verify that no additional search operations are running in the background and that the UI is in the expected terminal state (for example initial search screen or previous page).
Steps.Expected Result: No background search activity is present; the use case is terminated and user is returned to the prior application state. The textbox and filters are in the state defined by the design when stopping (e.g., preserved or reset).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester at 'no results' state. 2) 'Stop'/'Cancel' control is present and enabled.
test_cases.Dataset: Initial search term: 'abcdefg' (no matches).
test_cases.Expected Result: Selecting the 'Stop' option interrupts the search and ends the use case; the client returns to the expected prior state with no residual search processes.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo - Nessun risultato dalla ricerca diversa da 'numerica puntuale'
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI flow for stopping search and termination of the use case; does not inspect backend job cancellation logs or asynchronous cleanup beyond UI confirmation.

test_cases.Title: ClearTextboxAndTextSearch_XXX_PercorsoAlternativo_Ricerca_TEST_Computer_verify textual 'contains' and 'puntuale' searches after clearing textbox

Steps.Step Description: Perform an initial numeric exact search that yields no results to reach the alternative path message.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'no results' message is presented.

Steps.Step Description: Clear the text in the search textbox (use UI action to empty the textbox).
Steps.Expected Result: Textbox is empty; any numeric value previously entered is removed.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a textual search term that should match existing items using 'contains' mode (e.g., 'rossi' when items include 'Mario Rossi'). Set search mode to 'contiene' and click 'Avvia ricerca'.
Steps.Expected Result: Search returns items that contain 'rossi' (case-insensitive) and results list displays matching items.

Steps.Step Description: Repeat by clearing textbox, entering a textual search term that should match exactly (puntuale) an existing item (e.g., 'Mario Rossi'), set mode to 'puntuale' and click 'Avvia ricerca'.
Steps.Expected Result: Search returns only exact matches (e.g., 'Mario Rossi') and displays them; partial matches are excluded.

Steps.Step Description: If no results are returned for either mode, verify the 'no results' message appears and that the user remains able to change mode or input and retry.
Steps.Expected Result: Appropriate 'no results' message appears and UI allows further actions (change search mode, modify text, clear filters, cancel).

test_cases.Expected Result: After clearing textbox, textual searches in 'contiene' mode return partial matches while 'puntuale' mode returns exact matches; UI shows results or 'no results' message appropriately.

test_cases.Title: CancelSearch_XXX_PercorsoAlternativo_Ricerca_TEST_Computer_verify canceling search terminates the use case

Steps.Step Description: From the search screen, execute a numeric exact search that returns no results and confirm the 'no results' message is displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: User is presented with 'no results' message and UI actions (clear filters, clear textbox, cancel) are visible.

test_cases.Title: AutocompleteDebounce_XXX_SportDGOJ_Search_AUT_APP_TEST_Desktop_Debounce and rapid typing behavior

Steps.Step Description: Log into the application and focus on the search input field.

Steps.Step Description: Type characters rapidly: type 'S', then quickly add 'p', 'o', 'r', 't' within 200ms intervals between keystrokes to simulate fast typing.
Steps.Expected Result: Autocomplete should not flood backend with requests on every keystroke; suggestions should appear after the configured debounce/throttle interval (e.g., ~300ms) presenting relevant matches including 'Sport DGOJ'.

Steps.Step Description: Pause after typing and observe whether only a single suggestion fetch occurs and suggestions are displayed correctly.
Steps.Expected Result: Only one request is triggered after the typing pause (observable via dev tools or mock network), suggestions are displayed and application remains responsive.

test_cases.Preconditions: User logged in; developer tools/network monitoring available if verifying request count.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials, Rapid typing sequence: 'S' -> 'p' -> 'o' -> 'r' -> 't' within 200ms intervals
test_cases.Expected Result: Autocomplete implements debounce: network requests are limited and suggestions render after the debounce delay; 'Sport DGOJ' suggestion appears if applicable.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Checks debounce behavior and request throttling but does not measure exact timing SLA or server-side processing time.
