test_cases.Expected Result: Deletion operation requires confirmation; cancel prevents deletion; confirm removes the record and it is no longer accessible.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Does not cover deletion audit trail retention, soft-delete vs hard-delete behavior across integrations, or role-based visibility of audit logs.

test_cases.Title: CreateRecord_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Desktop_Create a new anagrafica record

Steps.Step Description: Open the Anagrafica application in the Backoffice environment and log in with a user having 'Create' permissions.
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica home page is displayed and user is authenticated with correct role.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to 'Nuovo Record' (New Record) section.
Steps.Expected Result: New Record form is displayed with all mandatory fields visible (Name, Surname, Date of Birth, Fiscal Code).

Steps.Step Description: Populate the mandatory fields with valid test data: Name='Mario', Surname='Rossi', DOB='1985-05-10', Fiscal Code='RSSMRA85E10H501U', Address='Via Roma 1, Milano'. Fill optional fields as needed (Phone='+391234567890').
Steps.Expected Result: Form fields accept input and display the entered values correctly.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' (Salva) to create the record.
Steps.Expected Result: System shows a confirmation message 'Record created successfully' and assigns a unique Anagrafica ID to the new record.

Steps.Step Description: Search for the created record using the Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA85E10H501U'.
Steps.Expected Result: The newly created record appears in the search results with all entered details and the correct Anagrafica ID.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test environment deployed in TEST stage. 2) Tester has a Backoffice user account with Create permissions. 3) No existing record with Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA85E10H501U'. 4) Database test schema is reachable.
test_cases.Dataset: Name=Mario; Surname=Rossi; DOB=1985-05-10; FiscalCode=RSSMRA85E10H501U; Address=Via Roma 1, Milano; Phone=+391234567890
test_cases.Expected Result: A new Anagrafica record is created, a unique ID is assigned, and the record is retrievable by search with all entered details persisted.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI creation flow and basic persistence; does not cover backend asynchronous processing or downstream integrations.

test_cases.Title: CreateRecordMissingMandatory_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Desktop_Attempt create record without mandatory fields

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica backoffice with a user having Create permissions.
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica home page is displayed and user is authenticated.

Steps.Step Description: Open 'New Record' form.
Steps.Expected Result: New Record form is displayed with mandatory field indicators.

Steps.Step Description: Fill only Name='Luca' and Surname='Bianchi' leaving Fiscal Code and Date of Birth empty.
Steps.Expected Result: Form displays the entered Name and Surname; mandatory fields remain empty.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Client-side or server-side validation prevents save and displays error messages indicating mandatory fields (e.g., 'Fiscal Code is required', 'Date of Birth is required').

Steps.Step Description: Verify that no new record is created by searching for Name='Luca' and Surname='Bianchi'.
Steps.Expected Result: No matching active record is returned (or created record is not persisted).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has a Backoffice account with Create permission. 2) Test environment in TEST stage.
test_cases.Dataset: Name=Luca; Surname=Bianchi; FiscalCode=; DOB=; Address=Via Test 2
test_cases.Expected Result: System blocks creation, shows clear validation messages for mandatory fields, and no record is stored.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers mandatory field validation on the UI and server-side; does not test internationalized error messages or all possible validation rules.

test_cases.Title: UpdateRecord_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Desktop_Edit existing anagrafica record

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica as a user with Edit permissions.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and Anagrafica home is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Search for an existing record by Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA85E10H501U' (record must exist - can be created by TC-001).
Steps.Expected Result: Record is found and displayed in the search results.

Steps.Step Description: Open the record details and click 'Edit'.
Steps.Expected Result: Edit form opens showing current values.

Steps.Step Description: Change Phone to '+391112223334' and Address to 'Via Milano 10, Milano' then click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: System confirms 'Record updated successfully' and new values are persisted.

Steps.Step Description: Re-open the record details and verify Phone and Address fields reflect the updated values.
Steps.Expected Result: Phone='+391112223334' and Address='Via Milano 10, Milano' are shown in the record details.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Existing Anagrafica record with Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA85E10H501U' is present. 2) Tester has Edit permissions.
test_cases.Dataset: FiscalCode=RSSMRA85E10H501U; Phone=+391112223334; Address=Via Milano 10, Milano
test_cases.Expected Result: Record updates are accepted, persisted, and reflected in subsequent searches and record view.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates basic edit and persistence; does not validate audit trail entries or concurrent editing conflict resolution.

test_cases.Title: DeleteRecord_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Desktop_Delete anagrafica record

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica with a user having Delete permissions.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and can access records.

Steps.Step Description: Search for the target record by Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA85E10H501U'.
Steps.Expected Result: Target record is displayed in search results.

Steps.Step Description: Open the record and click 'Delete'. Confirm the deletion when prompted.
Steps.Expected Result: System displays a confirmation dialog and, after confirmation, shows success message 'Record deleted' or marks record inactive.

Steps.Step Description: Search again for the same Fiscal Code in the default active records view.
Steps.Expected Result: Record no longer appears in active results (either removed or flagged inactive).

Steps.Step Description: If the application has a 'Show Inactive' or 'Recycle Bin' view, enable it and search for the Fiscal Code again.
Steps.Expected Result: If soft-deleted, record appears in Inactive/Recycled view with deletion metadata; if hard-deleted, record is not found anywhere.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Record with Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA85E10H501U' exists. 2) Tester has Delete permission. 3) Backup or test DB rollback available for post-test restoration.
test_cases.Dataset: FiscalCode=RSSMRA85E10H501U
test_cases.Expected Result: Record is deleted or marked inactive; it is not visible in active searches and appears in inactive/recycle view if soft-delete is implemented.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers delete action and visibility; does not cover retention policy enforcement or irreversible hard-delete recovery.

test_cases.Title: SearchFilter_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Desktop_Search and filter anagrafica records

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica Backoffice with a user having Search permissions.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and search interface is available.

Steps.Step Description: Perform a partial name search using 'Mar' in Name field and click search.
Steps.Expected Result: Records with Name containing 'Mar' (e.g., Mario, Marco) are returned.

Steps.Step Description: Perform an exact Fiscal Code search using 'RSSMRA85E10H501U'.
Steps.Expected Result: Only the record with that Fiscal Code is returned.

Steps.Step Description: Apply a Date of Birth range filter (from '1980-01-01' to '1990-12-31') and search.
Steps.Expected Result: Only records with DOB within the specified range are returned.

Steps.Step Description: Search using criteria that yield no results (e.g., Fiscal Code='ZZZZZZZZZZ').
Steps.Expected Result: System displays 'No records found' and does not crash.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Multiple test records exist covering various names, DOBs and fiscal codes. 2) Tester has Search permission.
test_cases.Dataset: PartialName=Mar; FiscalCodeExact=RSSMRA85E10H501U; DOBFrom=1980-01-01; DOBTo=1990-12-31; NoResultFiscal=ZZZZZZZZZZ
test_cases.Expected Result: Filters and search return correct, consistent results for partial, exact, range and zero-result scenarios without errors.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates common search/filter combinations; does not cover performance under large dataset loads or advanced full-text search ranking.

test_cases.Title: Permissions_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Desktop_Verify role-based access control for Anagrafica

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to log in to Anagrafica as a user with 'Read-Only' role.
Steps.Expected Result: User authenticates successfully and views the Anagrafica UI with read-only permissions.

Steps.Step Description: Search for a known record (e.g., Fiscal Code 'RSSMRA85E10H501U') and open its details.
Steps.Expected Result: Record details are visible in view mode; no Edit or Delete buttons are available or they are disabled.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to invoke Edit by URL manipulation or direct API call to update a field (e.g., change Phone) while authenticated as read-only user.
Steps.Expected Result: Server rejects the update with HTTP 403 or an access denied message; no changes are applied.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the 'New Record' form and perform a save operation.
Steps.Expected Result: Access is denied or operation blocked; system displays appropriate authorization error and no record is created.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) A read-only user account exists. 2) A test record exists to attempt view/edit. 3) API endpoint protection is configured.
test_cases.Dataset: ReadOnlyUser=ro_user; ReadOnlyPwd=Password123; TargetFiscalCode=RSSMRA85E10H501U
test_cases.Expected Result: Role-based access control enforces read-only restrictions in UI and backend; unauthorized edit/create/delete attempts are blocked.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers common RBAC scenarios for read-only role; does not validate every role variant or complex delegation workflows.

test_cases.Title: VerificaEvento_SportDGOJ_XXX_REQ-SD-001_FilterApp_TEST_Computer_EventDisplayedWhenMappingExists

Steps.Step Description: Open the application web URL and navigate to the Brand Spain area.
Steps.Expected Result: Application loads and Brand Spain landing page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Log in with a valid user account that is enabled for Brand Spain (use credentials from Test Data).
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully authenticated and sees Brand Spain navigation options.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the 'Sport DGOJ' filter is present and enabled in the filters panel.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Sport DGOJ' filter is visible and its state is enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Enter the known Manifestation/Event name or ID (from Test Data) in the search field and apply the 'Sport DGOJ' filter set to the DGOJ sport associated with the event.
Steps.Expected Result: Search is executed and the system applies the 'Sport DGOJ' filter.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect the search results list for the expected event entry that has at least one associated Sport BM entity.
Steps.Expected Result: The expected event appears in the results and shows its association to at least one Sport BM entity.

Steps.Step Description: Open the event details page and confirm the DGOJ sport mapping and listed Sport BM associations.
Steps.Expected Result: Event details display the DGOJ sport and the associated Sport BM entity/entities.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. User is logged into the application. B. User is enabled to navigate Brand Spain. C. The searched event's DGOJ Sport is associated with at least one Sport BM entity. D. The 'Sport DGOJ' filter is enabled.
test_cases.Functionality: Sport DGOJ Filter and Event Search
test_cases.Dataset: User: spain_user_test / Password: Test1234!; Event Name: 'Copa Test Evento 2025' (ID: EVT-1001); DGOJ Sport: 'Futbol' mapped to Sport BM: 'Football_BM_01'.
test_cases.Expected Result: When 'Sport DGOJ' filter is enabled and the DGOJ sport is mapped to at least one Sport BM, the searched event is returned in results and details show the mapping.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers positive search and details display for events with existing DGOJ->Sport BM mapping; does not cover bulk/list performance or mobile clients.

test_cases.Title: VerificaEvento_SportDGOJ_XXX_REQ-SD-002_FilterApp_TEST_Computer_NoResultsWhenNoBMMapping

Steps.Step Description: Open the application and navigate to Brand Spain area.
Steps.Expected Result: Brand Spain area is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Log in with a valid Brand Spain enabled user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and authorized for Brand Spain.

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the 'Sport DGOJ' filter is visible and enabled.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Sport DGOJ' filter is visible and enabled.

Steps.Expected Result: Search executes with the selected DGOJ sport filter.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the search results and system messages.
Steps.Expected Result: No events are returned; the UI displays an appropriate 'no results' message and no event details are shown.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. User logged in. B. User enabled for Brand Spain. C. The selected DGOJ sport for the searched event has NO associated Sport BM entities. D. 'Sport DGOJ' filter enabled.

test_cases.Expected Result: When DGOJ sport has no Sport BM mapping, applying the 'Sport DGOJ' filter yields no results and an appropriate informational message.

test_cases.Title: VerificaEvento_SportDGOJ_XXX_REQ-SD-003_FilterApp_TEST_Computer_FilterDisabledBehavior

Steps.Step Description: Open the application and navigate to Brand Spain area.
Steps.Expected Result: Brand Spain area is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Log in as a valid Brand Spain user.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and Brand Spain navigation is available.

Steps.Step Description: Programmatically or via admin settings, disable the 'Sport DGOJ' filter (or ensure the filter state is disabled for this session).
Steps.Expected Result: 'Sport DGOJ' filter control shows disabled state and cannot be applied by the user.

Steps.Step Description: Search for an event that would normally be returned when the DGOJ sport mapping exists (use Test Data event) without the 'Sport DGOJ' filter.
Steps.Expected Result: Search returns results according to default filters; the 'Sport DGOJ' filter has no effect while disabled.

Steps.Step Description: Verify whether the expected event appears or additional unrelated events appear due to filter being disabled.
Steps.Expected Result: Event listing behavior reflects absence of 'Sport DGOJ' filter; expected event may appear if other filters match; no errors reported related to disabled filter.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. User logged in. B. User enabled for Brand Spain. C. Event DGOJ sport is mapped to Sport BM. D. 'Sport DGOJ' filter is disabled for the session.

test_cases.Expected Result: With 'Sport DGOJ' filter disabled, the filter cannot be applied; search results follow other active filters and no application error occurs.

test_cases.Title: VerificaAccesso_SportDGOJ_XXX_REQ-SD-004_FilterApp_TEST_Computer_AccessBlockedIfNotLogged

test_cases.Title: VerificaAutorizzazione_SportDGOJ_XXX_REQ-SD-005_FilterApp_TEST_Computer_AccessDeniedIfNoSpainPermission

test_cases.Title: Manifestazioni_SportDGOJ_001_BrandSpagna_Manifestazioni_TEST_Computer_positive autocomplete selection and search

Steps.Step Description: Open the web browser and navigate to the application home page. Access the Brand Spagna section and then the 'Manifestazioni' section following the base navigation path.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Manifestazioni' section of Brand Spagna is displayed and ready for interaction.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the 'Sport DGOJ' filter control (textbox) is present and enabled on the page.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Sport DGOJ' textbox filter is visible and enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Sport DGOJ' textbox and type the first three characters of a known sport name (example: type 'Cal').
Steps.Expected Result: An autocomplete suggestion list begins to appear and shows suggestions relevant to the characters typed (e.g., 'Calcio') once the third character is entered.

Steps.Step Description: From the autocomplete suggestions, select the correct sport entry (example: select 'Calcio').
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Sport DGOJ' textbox is populated with the selected suggestion and the suggestion list closes.

Steps.Step Description: Click the search/submit button to trigger the search for Manifestazioni associated with the selected Sport DGOJ.
Steps.Expected Result: The search is executed and the system requests the list of Manifestazioni filtered by the chosen Sport DGOJ.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the results list and verify that Manifestazioni displayed are associated with the selected Sport DGOJ.
Steps.Expected Result: An enumerable list of Manifestazioni related to the selected Sport DGOJ (e.g., Calcio) is displayed with appropriate details (title, date, location or summary) and no unrelated items are present.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application (latest stable supported browser)
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has network access and valid access to the application. 2) The Brand Spagna content is available in the environment. 3) There are known Manifestazioni linked to the sport 'Calcio'. 4) Tester is on the Manifestazioni page.
test_cases.Dataset: Known Sport DGOJ term: 'Calcio' (will produce results). Example input sequence: 'C','a','l'.
test_cases.Expected Result: Autocomplete provides suggestions starting at 3rd character, selection populates textbox, search returns list of Manifestazioni associated to selected Sport DGOJ.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers positive autocomplete and search flow; does not validate deep content of each Manifestazione or backend logs.

test_cases.Title: Manifestazioni_SportDGOJ_002_BrandSpagna_Manifestazioni_TEST_Computer_autocomplete threshold behavior

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Brand Spagna -> Manifestazioni section and locate the 'Sport DGOJ' textbox.
Steps.Expected Result: The Manifestazioni page is displayed and 'Sport DGOJ' textbox is visible and enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Type a single character into the 'Sport DGOJ' textbox (example: 'C').
Steps.Expected Result: No autocomplete suggestions are shown while only the first character is present.

Steps.Step Description: Type the second character to form two characters total (example: type 'a' to make 'Ca').
Steps.Expected Result: No autocomplete suggestions are shown while only two characters are present.

Steps.Step Description: Type the third character to form three characters total (example: type 'l' to make 'Cal').
Steps.Expected Result: Autocomplete suggestions are displayed (trigger threshold of three characters) and relevant items appear.

Steps.Step Description: Clear the textbox back to two characters and then to one character and verify suggestions disappear accordingly.
Steps.Expected Result: When the textbox contains fewer than three characters, the suggestion list is hidden or not shown.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Application reachable and Manifestazioni page loaded. 2) Autocomplete service enabled for Sport DGOJ filter.
test_cases.Dataset: Partial inputs: 'C', 'Ca', 'Cal'; expected suggestions appear only after 'Cal'.
test_cases.Expected Result: Autocomplete suggestions should not appear for 1-2 characters and must appear when 3 or more characters are entered.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates only the client-side autocomplete trigger threshold; does not validate network latency or backend suggestion ranking.

test_cases.Title: Manifestazioni_SportDGOJ_003_BrandSpagna_Manifestazioni_TEST_Computer_no results scenario

Steps.Step Description: Open the Manifestazioni section for Brand Spagna and ensure the 'Sport DGOJ' textbox is visible.
Steps.Expected Result: Manifestazioni page is open and 'Sport DGOJ' filter textbox is available.

Steps.Step Description: Type three characters into the 'Sport DGOJ' textbox that do not correspond to any known sport (example: 'XyZ').
Steps.Expected Result: Autocomplete should either show 'no suggestions' or return an empty suggestion list.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to select a suggestion (none available) and press the search button to execute the search with the typed value.
Steps.Expected Result: No suggestion can be selected. The search request is sent with the entered term.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the UI response after search executes when no matching Manifestazioni exist.
Steps.Expected Result: The results area shows an appropriate 'no results' message (e.g., 'Nessuna manifestazione trovata') or an empty list; no unrelated Manifestazioni are shown and the UI remains stable.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester on Manifestazioni page. 2) No known sport matches for the test term 'XyZ'.
test_cases.Dataset: Non-existent sport sample: 'XyZ'
test_cases.Expected Result: When no matches exist, autocomplete shows no suggestions and search returns a clear 'no results' state/message.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client behavior and UI messaging for no-result searches; does not validate server logs or analytics events.

test_cases.Title: Manifestazioni_SportDGOJ_004_BrandSpagna_Manifestazioni_TEST_Computer_special characters and input validation

Steps.Step Description: Access the Brand Spagna -> Manifestazioni page and identify the 'Sport DGOJ' textbox.
Steps.Expected Result: Page displays correctly and textbox is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Enter three characters containing special characters and numbers (examples: 'B@5', 'Fo#') into the textbox, one value at a time.
Steps.Expected Result: The textbox accepts input but the autocomplete either ignores invalid characters or returns no suggestions; no client-side errors are thrown.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to select a suggestion (if any) and perform the search for each invalid input.
Steps.Expected Result: If no suggestions present, search executes and returns either no results message or handles input safely. If suggestions present, selection behaves normally and search returns consistent results.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the application does not crash, does not render malformed UI, and sanitizes/encodes the input safely (no raw HTML injection displayed).
Steps.Expected Result: Application remains stable; no XSS or unencoded HTML is displayed; input is handled/escaped by the client and server.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Manifestazioni page is reachable. 2) Tester has rights to perform searches.
test_cases.Dataset: Inputs: 'B@5', 'Fo#', '<script>', '123'
test_cases.Expected Result: Invalid characters do not break autocomplete; no security issues or application crashes; search handles such inputs gracefully with no results or sanitized matches.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates client-side handling of special characters; does not include backend penetration testing.

test_cases.Title: Manifestazioni_SportDGOJ_005_BrandSpagna_Manifestazioni_TEST_Computer_filter enabled presence and accessibility

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Brand Spagna -> Manifestazioni page on the target environment.
Steps.Expected Result: Manifestazioni page for Brand Spagna is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect the filters area and verify that the 'Sport DGOJ' filter is present, enabled, keyboard accessible and labeled appropriately.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Sport DGOJ' filter appears in the filters list, is enabled (not disabled/grayed out), has an accessible label (for screen readers), and can receive keyboard focus.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to focus the textbox using keyboard (Tab) and type three characters to ensure keyboard-based autocomplete interaction is supported.
Steps.Expected Result: Textbox receives focus via keyboard; autocomplete suggestions appear after three characters and can be navigated/selected using arrow keys and Enter.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the filter state persists if expected (e.g., after performing a search, the selected Sport DGOJ remains visible) according to product behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: After performing a search the selected Sport DGOJ remains visible in the textbox if persistence is required; otherwise behavior follows documented UX rules (explicitly check expected behavior).

test_cases.Preconditions: Manifestazioni page loaded; accessibility tools optional but recommended.
test_cases.Dataset: No specific dataset; verify focus and keyboard navigation with sample input 'Bas' -> 'Basket'.
test_cases.Expected Result: Sport DGOJ filter is present, enabled and accessible; keyboard autocomplete interaction works and filter state behaves as per UX requirements.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI presence and accessibility; does not verify cross-browser rendering differences or screen reader output in all assistive tech.

test_cases.Title: RicercaManifestazione_XXX_PercorsoAlternativo_SportDGOJ_TEST_Computer_SearchWithFilterEnabledAfterPreviousSearch

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application and navigate to the 'Manifestazioni' search page.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Manifestazioni' search page is displayed with the 'Sport DGOJ' textbox visible.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that a previous search has been performed (precondition) and that the filter is currently enabled.
Steps.Expected Result: System shows evidence of previous search (search history or last search term) and the relevant filter toggle or indicator for 'Sport DGOJ' is enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Sport DGOJ' textbox, enter a valid search term (e.g., 'calcio'), and press the 'Search' button.
Steps.Expected Result: The system accepts the input and starts the search operation.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the search results and select a manifestazione from the displayed list to continue the flow.
Steps.Expected Result: The results list contains manifestazioni relevant to 'calcio'; selecting an item navigates the user to the next screen as defined in Step 4 of the Base Path (e.g., manifestazione details or selection confirmation).

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the 'Sport DGOJ' filter remains enabled after the new search and that results reflect the new search term (not the previous one).
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Sport DGOJ' filter remains enabled and results correspond to the new search term 'calcio', replacing prior search results.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) The user has performed at least one prior search on the 'Manifestazioni' page (e.g., previous term 'tennis'). 2) The 'Sport DGOJ' filter is enabled. 3) The tester is on the 'Manifestazioni' search page.
test_cases.Dataset: Previous search term: 'tennis'; New search term: 'calcio'; User session: active
test_cases.Expected Result: A new text search in 'Sport DGOJ' is executed successfully after a previous search; the filter remains enabled and results correspond to the new search. The flow continues from Step 4 of the Base Path (selection/navigation possible).
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Ricerca manifestazione dopo averne effettuata una in precedenza
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only the text search in 'Sport DGOJ' after a previous search and verifies filter persistence; does not validate downstream business rules beyond Step 4 of the Base Path.

test_cases.Title: RicercaManifestazione_XXX_PercorsoAlternativo_SportDGOJ_TEST_Computer_SearchWithEmptyTextboxValidation

Steps.Step Description: Open the 'Manifestazioni' search page where a prior search has already been performed and confirm the 'Sport DGOJ' filter is enabled.
Steps.Expected Result: Page loads showing previous search evidence and 'Sport DGOJ' filter is enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Leave the 'Sport DGOJ' textbox empty and click the 'Search' button.
Steps.Expected Result: The system does not execute a search and displays a validation message indicating that the search term is required (or highlights the textbox).

test_cases.Title: NoResults_ClearAndRetry_XXX_PercorsoAlternativo_SportDGOJ_TEST_Computer_VerifyClearAndRetry

Steps.Step Description: Launch the web application and navigate to the Search screen containing the 'Sport DGOJ' textbox.
Steps.Expected Result: Search screen is displayed and the 'Sport DGOJ' textbox is visible and enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a sport name that is known not to exist in the DGOJ dataset (example: "NonExistingSportXYZ") into the 'Sport DGOJ' textbox and trigger the search (click search button or press Enter).
Steps.Expected Result: The client issues the search request and no matching results are returned by the client/server; the UI displays a clear 'No results found' state/message and the entered text remains in the textbox. A clear (X) icon to clear the textbox is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Click the clear (X) icon in the 'Sport DGOJ' textbox to remove the current input.
Steps.Expected Result: The textbox is cleared (empty), the 'No results found' message is removed or replaced by the default empty-search state, and the clear icon is no longer visible.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a valid sport name that is known to exist in the DGOJ dataset (example: "Calcio" or another valid sport) into the 'Sport DGOJ' textbox and trigger the search as described in the base path (this should correspond to returning to step 4 of the base path flow).
Steps.Expected Result: The application performs the search and displays matching results for the valid sport, confirming that clearing and retrying returns the user to the base search flow.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has access to the web application. 2) Tester is on the Search screen with the 'Sport DGOJ' textbox visible. 3) Network connectivity to backend is available. 4) Known existing and non-existing sport names are available for test data.
test_cases.Dataset: Non-existing sport: "NonExistingSportXYZ"; Existing sport: "Calcio" (or other valid sport in dataset).
test_cases.Expected Result: When a search returns no results, the UI displays a 'No results found' message; the user can clear the textbox and re-enter a valid term to resume the base search flow and obtain results.

test_cases.Title: NoResults_InputEdgeCases_XXX_PercorsoAlternativo_SportDGOJ_TEST_Computer_VerifyEdgeInputsProduceNoResults

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application and go to the Search screen with the 'Sport DGOJ' textbox.
Steps.Expected Result: Search screen and 'Sport DGOJ' textbox are present and ready for input.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a whitespace-only string (example: "   ") into the 'Sport DGOJ' textbox and trigger search (press Enter or click search).
Steps.Expected Result: System handles whitespace-only input gracefully: either displays a validation message prompting the user to enter a search term or shows the 'No results found' state. No errors or crashes occur.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a string composed only of special characters (example: "@@@###$$$") into the 'Sport DGOJ' textbox and trigger search.
Steps.Expected Result: No matching results are returned and the UI displays the 'No results found' state; system does not crash or behave unexpectedly and provides a way to clear the input.

Steps.Step Description: Enter an excessively long input that exceeds typical limits (example: a 300-character string) into the 'Sport DGOJ' textbox and trigger search.
Steps.Expected Result: The application either enforces a maximum length (truncates or disallows further typing) and/or performs the search returning no results; in any case, the UI remains responsive and displays either a validation message or the 'No results found' state without errors.

Steps.Step Description: For each of the above inputs that produce no results, use the clear icon (if present) or manually delete the input, then enter a valid sport name and trigger search to confirm normal behavior resumes.
Steps.Expected Result: After clearing and entering a valid sport, the application performs a normal search and displays expected results, confirming recovery from edge-case inputs.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has access to the Search screen. 2) Application accepts keyboard input into the 'Sport DGOJ' textbox.
test_cases.Functionality: Search - Input validation and no-result handling
test_cases.Dataset: Whitespace: "   "; Special chars: "@@@###$$$"; Very long string: 300-character random string; Valid sport example: "Calcio".
test_cases.Expected Result: Edge-case inputs that do not correspond to any Sport DGOJ entries result in a safe 'no results' or validation UI state; the user can clear the input and resume normal search behavior.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Nessun risultato dalla ricerca attraverso la textbox 'Sport DGOJ'
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers handling of edge-case inputs producing no results and recovery by clearing; does not cover every possible character encoding or internationalization scenario.

test_cases.Expected Result: Selecting multiple genres returns results that belong to any of the selected genres and the UI reflects combined filter selection.

test_cases.Title: SearchByGenre_NoResults_XXX_REQ-GEN-SEARCH_Filter_Genere_TEST_Computer_No matching results shown

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Brand Spain 'Manifestazioni' and log in as a valid user.
Steps.Expected Result: Manifestazioni page and filter controls accessible after login.

Steps.Step Description: Open 'Genere' filter and select a genre known to have no manifestazioni in test dataset (e.g., 'Opera' if dataset contains none).
Steps.Expected Result: Filter selection is registered (checkbox or radio shows selection).

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Apply' or 'Search' to execute the filter.
Steps.Expected Result: Search executes and returns zero results; a 'No results found' message is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the content of the no-results message and available actions (e.g., 'Clear filters' or suggestions).
Steps.Expected Result: No-results message is user-friendly, suggests clearing filters or trying another genre, and 'Clear filters' action is available.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Valid user logged in. 2) Test dataset contains no manifestazioni for the selected genre.
test_cases.Dataset: User: user_spain@example.com; Genre: Opera (no data)
test_cases.Expected Result: Applying a genre with no matching manifestazioni displays a clear 'No results found' message and presents an option to clear filters or refine the search.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI behavior when no results are returned; does not cover backend search logs or analytics.

test_cases.Title: ClearGenreFilter_XXX_REQ-GEN-SEARCH_Filter_Genere_TEST_Computer_Clear filter resets results

Steps.Step Description: Log in and navigate to Brand Spain 'Manifestazioni' page; note the unfiltered total result count.
Steps.Expected Result: Unfiltered listing displays and total count is recorded (e.g., 120 items).

Steps.Step Description: Apply a 'Genere' filter (e.g., 'Dance') and wait for results to update.
Steps.Expected Result: Results show only 'Dance' manifestazioni and filtered count is lower than unfiltered count.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Clear filters' control or unselect the 'Genere' selection and reapply search.
Steps.Expected Result: Filter selection is cleared and results refresh.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the listing returns to the original unfiltered state and that the total count matches the pre-filter count.
Steps.Expected Result: Listing displays all manifestazioni as before and the total result count equals the initial unfiltered count; no residual filter labels remain.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away to another page and return to verify filter persistence behavior (should be cleared in this test case).
Steps.Expected Result: Upon return, no 'Genere' filter is selected and unfiltered results are shown (unless requirement specifies persistence).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Valid user logged in. 2) Known unfiltered total count available.
test_cases.Dataset: User: user_spain@example.com; Genre: Dance
test_cases.Expected Result: Clearing the 'Genere' filter restores the unfiltered manifestazioni listing and count; no filters remain active after clearing.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates clearing of genre filter and UI state; does not verify persistence across user sessions or storage mechanisms.

test_cases.Title: FilterRequiresLogin_XXX_REQ-GEN-SEARCH_Filter_Genere_TEST_Computer_Unauthenticated user cannot apply genre filter

Steps.Step Description: Open the Brand Spain 'Manifestazioni' page without logging in (incognito mode or logged out).
Steps.Expected Result: Page loads in unauthenticated state; filter controls may be visible but login prompt expected per requirement.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to expand or interact with the 'Genere' filter control and select a genre.
Steps.Expected Result: The system either blocks selection, greys out the control, or prompts the user to log in to use filtering functionality.

Steps.Step Description: If prompted, click the 'Log in' prompt and perform login with valid credentials; otherwise attempt applying the filter and observe behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: Unauthenticated attempt triggers a login flow or displays an appropriate message indicating that login is required to apply filters. After login, filter becomes usable.

Steps.Step Description: After successful login, re-attempt selection of 'Genere' and apply the filter.
Steps.Expected Result: Filter is applied successfully and results are filtered by the selected genre, confirming that login is required before using the feature.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester is logged out or in private browsing. 2) Valid user credentials available for subsequent login.
test_cases.Dataset: Unauthenticated session; User: user_spain@example.com / P@ssw0rd for login step
test_cases.Expected Result: The 'Genere' filter requires the user to be logged in to apply; unauthenticated users are prompted to log in or blocked from filtering. After login, filter works as expected.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Checks that filter usage requires authentication and that login enables filter; does not cover SSO or external auth providers.

test_cases.Title: VisualizzaAnagrafica_XXX_AttorePrincipale_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Display user profile details

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application URL and navigate to the login page.
Steps.Expected Result: Login page is displayed with username and password fields.

Steps.Step Description: Login using valid credentials for the 'Utente Anagrafica' account (username: anagrafica_user, password: Test@1234).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and redirected to the application home/dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: From the dashboard, click the 'Anagrafica' or 'Profile' menu item to view the user's personal data.
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica/User Profile page is displayed showing personal data sections (name, surname, date of birth, address, contact details).

Steps.Step Description: Verify that all mandatory profile fields are populated and displayed in read-only mode by default.
Steps.Expected Result: Mandatory fields (e.g., Name, Surname, Tax Code/ID, Email) are visible and show the correct values for the logged-in user.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test environment is up and accessible. 2) 'Utente Anagrafica' test user (anagrafica_user) exists. 3) Tester has network access and browser supported by application.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials: username=anagrafica_user, password=Test@1234; Expected profile values: Name=Mario, Surname=Rossi, Email=mario.rossi@example.com
test_cases.Expected Result: The 'Utente Anagrafica' can view their complete profile (Anagrafica) and all mandatory fields are correctly displayed.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers viewing profile data only; editing or updating profile fields not included.

test_cases.Title: CreaAnagrafica_XXX_AttorePrincipale_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Create new user record successfully

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application and login as an administrator or user with permissions to create 'Anagrafica' records (username: admin_user, password: Admin@123).
Steps.Expected Result: Admin is authenticated and dashboard is displayed with access to 'Create Anagrafica' function.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to 'Anagrafica' -> 'Create New' or similar option to open the new user creation form.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Create New Anagrafica' form is displayed with all required input fields.

Steps.Step Description: Fill in all mandatory fields with valid data: Name='Luca', Surname='Bianchi', TaxCode='BNCLCU85A01H501X', DOB='1985-01-01', Email='luca.bianchi@example.com', Phone='+39011222333'.
Steps.Expected Result: Fields accept the input and show no inline validation errors.

Steps.Step Description: Submit the form by clicking 'Save' or 'Create'.
Steps.Expected Result: A success message is displayed (e.g., 'Anagrafica created successfully'), and the new user appears in the Anagrafica list or detail view.

Steps.Step Description: Search for the created user in the Anagrafica list using TaxCode or Email and open the detail view.
Steps.Expected Result: The created record is found and all entered values are persisted and displayed correctly.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has admin/create permission. 2) No existing record with the same TaxCode or Email. 3) Test data source cleared for uniqueness.
test_cases.Dataset: Admin credentials: admin_user/Admin@123; New user payload: {Name: 'Luca', Surname: 'Bianchi', TaxCode: 'BNCLCU85A01H501X', DOB: '1985-01-01', Email: 'luca.bianchi@example.com', Phone: '+39011222333'}
test_cases.Expected Result: New Anagrafica record is created successfully and data is persisted; success confirmation shown.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers positive creation flow and persistence; does not verify downstream integrations or notification emails.

test_cases.Title: CreaAnagraficaNegative_XXX_AttorePrincipale_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Create user missing mandatory fields validation

Steps.Step Description: Login as admin or user with create permission (admin_user/Admin@123) and open the 'Create New Anagrafica' form.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Create New Anagrafica' form is shown with mandatory field indicators for required fields.

Steps.Step Description: Leave mandatory fields empty (e.g., Name empty, Surname empty, TaxCode empty) and fill only optional fields if present.
Steps.Expected Result: Mandatory fields show as empty; no automatic submission happens yet.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' or 'Create' to submit the incomplete form.
Steps.Expected Result: Form submission is blocked and inline validation messages are displayed for each missing mandatory field (e.g., 'Name is required').

Steps.Step Description: Fill one mandatory field but leave another mandatory field empty and attempt to submit again.
Steps.Expected Result: Only validation messages for still-empty mandatory fields remain; submission is prevented until all mandatory fields are provided.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User has create permission. 2) Form validation rules configured in environment.
test_cases.Dataset: Admin credentials: admin_user/Admin@123; Partial input: {Name: '', Surname: '', TaxCode: '', Email: 'invalid@example.com'}
test_cases.Expected Result: System prevents creation of Anagrafica when mandatory fields are missing and displays clear validation error messages.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only client-side and server-side validation for mandatory fields; does not test format validations beyond presence.

test_cases.Title: ModificaAnagrafica_XXX_AttorePrincipale_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Edit user email validation

Steps.Step Description: Login as 'Utente Anagrafica' owner of an existing profile (username: anagrafica_user, password: Test@1234) and navigate to the Anagrafica detail page.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and profile detail page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Edit' or 'Modify' to enable editing of profile fields.
Steps.Expected Result: Profile fields become editable and 'Save'/'Cancel' buttons are available.

Steps.Step Description: Change the Email field to an invalid format (e.g., 'not-an-email' or 'user@domain') and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: The system rejects the input and displays an inline validation error indicating invalid email format.

Steps.Step Description: Correct the Email field to a valid unique email 'updated.email@example.com' and save changes.
Steps.Expected Result: Changes are accepted, a success message is shown, and the updated email is persisted in the profile detail view.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) An existing user profile for testing exists. 2) The new email is not already used by another profile.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials: anagrafica_user/Test@1234; Existing email: mario.rossi@example.com; New valid email: updated.email@example.com
test_cases.Expected Result: System enforces email format validation and persists valid email updates; invalid formats rejected with clear message.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers email format validation and persistence; does not cover uniqueness race conditions or downstream notifications.

test_cases.Title: EliminaAnagrafica_XXX_AttorePrincipale_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Delete user record and confirm removal

Steps.Step Description: Login as an admin or a user with delete permissions (admin_user/Admin@123) and navigate to the Anagrafica list.
Steps.Expected Result: Admin is authenticated and the Anagrafica list is displayed with delete actions available for records.

Steps.Step Description: Select an existing (non-production critical) test user record (e.g., TaxCode='BNCLCU85A01H501X') and click the 'Delete' action.
Steps.Expected Result: A confirmation dialog appears asking to confirm deletion of the selected Anagrafica record.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm deletion by clicking 'Yes'/'Confirm' in the dialog.
Steps.Expected Result: The system deletes the record, shows a success notification (e.g., 'Record deleted successfully') and removes the record from the list.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to search for the deleted record by TaxCode or Email.
Steps.Expected Result: No results are returned; the deleted record cannot be found. If soft-delete is implemented, the record should be marked as deleted and inaccessible from the UI list.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Admin/delete permission available. 2) A dedicated test user record exists and is safe to delete. 3) Backups or restore steps available if necessary.
test_cases.Dataset: Admin credentials: admin_user/Admin@123; Target record TaxCode=BNCLCU85A01H501X, Email=luca.bianchi@example.com
test_cases.Expected Result: Anagrafica record is deleted and cannot be accessed via the UI; a confirmation message is shown.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI deletion flow; does not verify cascading deletes, audit logs, or backend retention policies.

test_cases.Title: Anagrafica_CreateEntry_XXX_REQ_ANAGRAFICA_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_create a new registry entry

Steps.Step Description: Open the Anagrafica application in the browser and log in with valid backoffice credentials (user: backoffice.user, pwd: Back0ff!ce).
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica application home/dashboard is displayed and user is authenticated.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to 'Crea Anagrafica' (Create Registry) section.
Steps.Expected Result: Create Registry form/page is displayed with fields: Name, Surname, TaxCode, Date of Birth, Address, Email, Phone, Save button.

Steps.Step Description: Fill mandatory fields with valid test data: Name='Mario', Surname='Rossi', TaxCode='RSSMRA80A01H501U', DateOfBirth='1980-01-01', Email='mario.rossi.test@example.com', Phone='3471234567', Address='Via Test 1, Milano'.
Steps.Expected Result: All entered values appear in the corresponding form fields without validation errors.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Save' button.
Steps.Expected Result: System performs save operation and displays success confirmation message (e.g., 'Anagrafica salvata con successo') and the new entry is assigned a unique identifier.

Steps.Step Description: Search for the newly created entry using the assigned identifier or by TaxCode 'RSSMRA80A01H501U'.
Steps.Expected Result: The search returns the newly created record with all fields matching the input data.

Steps.Step Description: Open the created record details view.
Steps.Expected Result: Details view shows the full record correctly saved and timestamps (created/modified) and the current user as creator.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has valid backoffice credentials. 2) Test environment is up and Anagrafica service is reachable. 3) No existing record with TaxCode 'RSSMRA80A01H501U'.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials: backoffice.user/Back0ff!ce; Create payload: Name=Mario,Surname=Rossi,TaxCode=RSSMRA80A01H501U,DoB=1980-01-01,Email=mario.rossi.test@example.com,Phone=3471234567,Address='Via Test 1, Milano'.
test_cases.Expected Result: A new Anagrafica entry is created successfully and retrievable via search with matching data.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers creation and basic retrieval of an Anagrafica entry; does not cover bulk import, attachments, or downstream system propagation.

test_cases.Title: Anagrafica_SearchEntry_XXX_REQ_ANAGRAFICA_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_search and filter registry entries

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica with valid backoffice credentials and navigate to 'Ricerca Anagrafica' (Search Registry).
Steps.Expected Result: Search page loads and search controls are available (free text, TaxCode, Name, Surname, filters for Status, Date range).

Steps.Step Description: Enter search criteria: TaxCode='RSSMRA80A01H501U' and click 'Search'.
Steps.Expected Result: Search results show entries matching the TaxCode. Result list includes correct columns (ID, Name, Surname, TaxCode, Status).

Steps.Step Description: Clear previous criteria, perform a name+surname search: Name='Mario', Surname='Rossi' and apply filter Status='Active'.
Steps.Expected Result: Results display only active records matching the Name and Surname; pagination works if results > page size.

Steps.Step Description: Sort results by 'Date Created' descending and export the result list to CSV using 'Export' action.
Steps.Expected Result: Results are sorted correctly; exported CSV downloads and contains the same rows and columns as displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt a search with an invalid TaxCode format 'INVALIDCODE' and click 'Search'.
Steps.Expected Result: System either returns zero results or shows a validation/warning message about invalid format per business rules; no server error occurs.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) At least one Anagrafica entry exists with TaxCode 'RSSMRA80A01H501U'. 2) Tester is authenticated.
test_cases.Dataset: Existing entries; search values: TaxCode=RSSMRA80A01H501U, Name=Mario,Surname=Rossi; invalid TaxCode=INVALIDCODE.
test_cases.Expected Result: Search, filter, sort, and export functionalities work as expected and handle invalid inputs gracefully.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers basic search, filter, sort and export flows; does not cover advanced saved searches or performance under large datasets.

test_cases.Title: Anagrafica_UpdateEntry_XXX_REQ_ANAGRAFICA_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_modify an existing registry entry

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica and locate an existing entry (e.g., TaxCode 'RSSMRA80A01H501U') using search.
Steps.Expected Result: Search returns the target record and the record is visible in the results list.

Steps.Step Description: Open the record details and click 'Edit' to modify fields.
Steps.Expected Result: Edit form opens with current values pre-populated and editable fields enabled per role permissions.

Steps.Step Description: Change mutable fields: Address='Via Nuova 2, Milano', Phone='3477654321', Email='m.rossi.updated@example.com'.
Steps.Expected Result: Values are updated in the form without client-side validation errors.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' to persist changes.
Steps.Expected Result: System saves changes, displays success message, updates 'Last Modified' timestamp, and shows the modifier user identity.

Steps.Step Description: Re-open the record or search again to verify persisted changes.
Steps.Expected Result: Record displays updated Address, Phone, and Email values as saved.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to change an immutable field (e.g., TaxCode) and save.
Steps.Expected Result: System prevents modification of immutable fields (either field disabled or validation error) and does not allow save with changed TaxCode.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Target Anagrafica record exists. 2) Tester has edit permissions. 3) Audit/logging enabled to verify modifier info.
test_cases.Dataset: Existing record TaxCode=RSSMRA80A01H501U; new values: Address='Via Nuova 2, Milano', Phone=3477654321, Email=m.rossi.updated@example.com.
test_cases.Expected Result: Mutable fields are updated and persisted; immutable fields cannot be modified; audit information reflects the change.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates single-record update and immutability of TaxCode; does not cover bulk edits or external system synchronization.

test_cases.Title: Anagrafica_DeleteEntry_XXX_REQ_ANAGRAFICA_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_delete a registry entry with confirmation and audit

Steps.Step Description: Log in as a user with delete permissions and search for the test record to delete (TaxCode='RSSMRA80A01H501U').
Steps.Expected Result: Target record is located and visible in the results list.

Steps.Step Description: Select the record and click 'Delete' (or 'Annulla' depending on UI) action.
Steps.Expected Result: System displays a deletion confirmation dialog including record summary and asking for confirmation (Yes/No).

Steps.Step Description: Confirm deletion by clicking 'Yes' and provide any required justification if prompted.
Steps.Expected Result: System performs deletion (soft or hard per business rule), displays success message and records deletion audit (who, when, reason).

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to search the same TaxCode after deletion.
Steps.Expected Result: Deleted record is not present in active search results; if soft-delete used, record should appear only when filter 'Show Deleted' is enabled or in audit logs.

Steps.Step Description: Log into the audit/log viewer or check audit trail for the deleted record entry.
Steps.Expected Result: Audit log contains an entry for the deletion action with user identity, timestamp, and justification text.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to delete a non-existent record by inputting a random TaxCode and pressing Delete.
Steps.Expected Result: System shows appropriate error or zero-results state; no server exception occurs.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has delete permissions. 2) Target record exists and is not linked to mandatory external constraints preventing deletion.
test_cases.Dataset: Record to delete: TaxCode=RSSMRA80A01H501U; user credentials with delete role.
test_cases.Expected Result: Record deletion works with confirmation, audit entries are recorded, and deleted records are excluded from active searches.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers deletion flow and audit verification; does not cover cascading deletes or external system impacts.

test_cases.Title: Anagrafica_FieldValidation_XXX_REQ_ANAGRAFICA_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_mandatory and format validations on create

Steps.Step Description: Open Create Registry form while logged in with valid credentials.
Steps.Expected Result: Create form is displayed with mandatory and optional fields clearly indicated.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to save the form with all mandatory fields empty and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Client-side validation prevents save and displays required field errors for each mandatory field (Name, Surname, TaxCode, DateOfBirth).

Steps.Step Description: Enter invalid formats: TaxCode='ABC123', Email='not-an-email', Phone='phone123' and fill other mandatory fields with valid values, then click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Form shows specific validation messages for TaxCode format, Email format, and Phone number format; record is not saved.

Steps.Step Description: Enter boundary values: Name length=1 character, Surname length=255 characters, DateOfBirth in the future (e.g., tomorrow), then attempt to save.
Steps.Expected Result: System enforces min/max length constraints and prevents future DateOfBirth values with appropriate error messages for invalid boundaries.

Steps.Step Description: Provide a TaxCode that already exists in the system and attempt to save.
Steps.Expected Result: System rejects duplicate TaxCode per uniqueness rule and displays a clear error indicating the duplicate.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester is authenticated. 2) System validation rules configured (format, uniqueness).
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid inputs: TaxCode=ABC123, Email=not-an-email, Phone=phone123; Duplicate TaxCode=RSSMRA80A01H501U.
test_cases.Expected Result: All mandatory and format validations are enforced; invalid or duplicate data is rejected with clear messages.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates mandatory, format and uniqueness checks on creation; does not include locale-specific formats beyond Italian TaxCode/email/phone.

test_cases.Title: Anagrafica_AccessControl_XXX_REQ_ANAGRAFICA_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_role based access restrictions

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Anagrafica using a read-only role account (user: viewer.user, pwd: Viewer!2025).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and the UI reflects read-only permissions (no Create/Edit/Delete actions visible or enabled).

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the Create Registry page directly by URL while logged in as read-only user.
Steps.Expected Result: System denies access (403 or redirect to unauthorized page) or shows disabled UI with proper message; no editable form is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Log out and log in with a user who should not have any Anagrafica privileges (user: noaccess.user, pwd: NoAcc!2025).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated but Anagrafica menu is not present or access is blocked with clear message indicating insufficient privileges.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to call backend API endpoints for create/update/delete using the no-privilege user token (via API client).
Steps.Expected Result: API responds with 403 Forbidden or appropriate access control error; no data modification occurs.

Steps.Step Description: Log in with admin user and verify that admin can perform Create, Edit and Delete actions successfully.
Steps.Expected Result: Admin user can perform full CRUD; audit entries record the admin actions. This verifies role-based separation between admin and restricted roles.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Anagrafica Web Application and backend APIs
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user accounts exist for viewer.user, noaccess.user, and admin.user with appropriate role assignments. 2) API client available for direct calls.
test_cases.Dataset: Credentials: viewer.user/Viewer!2025 (read-only), noaccess.user/NoAcc!2025 (no access), admin.user/Admin!2025 (admin). API endpoints: /anagrafica/create, /anagrafica/update, /anagrafica/delete.
test_cases.Expected Result: Role-based access control enforces permissions: read-only and no-access users are restricted; admin has full access. Backend enforces same rules.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers role-based UI and API access enforcement for common roles; does not cover fine-grained attribute-level permissions or integration with external IAM systems.

test_cases.Title: GenereFilter_XXX_Precondizioni_FilterFeature_TEST_Desktop_verify_visibility_and_selectability

Steps.Step Description: Launch the web application and navigate to the home page.
Steps.Expected Result: Web application home page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Log in using a valid user account that is enabled for Brand Spain (credentials: user_sp_enabled / Password1!).
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard/home area.

Steps.Step Description: Select the Brand selector and choose 'Spain' (Brand: Spain).
Steps.Expected Result: Brand Spain context is activated and content for Spain is loaded.

Steps.Step Description: Open the filters panel or filters area on the Spain-branded content page.
Steps.Expected Result: Filters panel is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the 'Genere' filter is present and its UI control is enabled (not greyed out).
Steps.Expected Result: 'Genere' filter is visible in the filters panel and control is enabled (selectable).

Steps.Step Description: Select a specific genre value from the 'Genere' filter (e.g., 'Comedia') and apply the filter.
Steps.Expected Result: Filter is applied and content results are updated to reflect only items matching 'Comedia'.

Steps.Step Description: Inspect several returned items and check their metadata or detail pages to confirm genre.
Steps.Expected Result: All inspected items belong to the selected genre 'Comedia'. No items of other genres are present in results.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. User is already logged into the application. B. User account is enabled for navigation within Brand Spain. C. 'Genere' filter feature flag is enabled.
test_cases.Dataset: User: user_sp_enabled (authorized for Spain), Password: Password1!; Genre option to select: Comedia
test_cases.Expected Result: When a logged-in user authorized for Spain opens filters the 'Genere' filter is visible, enabled and selecting a genre correctly filters results to that genre.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers visibility and basic selection/application of 'Genere' filter; does not cover multi-select, pagination or persistence across sessions.

test_cases.Title: GenereFilter_XXX_Precondizioni_AccessControl_TEST_Desktop_verify_access_denied_when_not_enabled_for_Spain

Steps.Step Description: Launch the web application and navigate to the home page.
Steps.Expected Result: Web application home page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Log in using a valid user account that is NOT enabled for Brand Spain (credentials: user_sp_disabled / Password1!).
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully authenticated and redirected to their default dashboard/home area.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to select 'Spain' from the Brand selector or navigate to a Spain-branded content area.
Steps.Expected Result: Either 'Spain' is not available in the Brand selector for this user or an access denied/insufficient permissions message is shown.

Steps.Step Description: If the Spain brand is selectable, open the filters panel and try to locate the 'Genere' filter.
Steps.Expected Result: If brand access is prevented, no Spain content or filters are displayed. If brand is selectable but restricted, 'Genere' filter is either not present or disabled and an appropriate message is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to apply any filters or access Spain-specific content when access is denied.
Steps.Expected Result: The system prevents access to Spain-specific filtering and content; operations are blocked and a clear informational message is shown to the user.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. User is logged in. B. User is NOT enabled for Brand Spain (account configured without Spain permission). C. 'Genere' filter may be available in general but should not apply to this user's brand scope.
test_cases.Dataset: User: user_sp_disabled (not authorized for Spain), Password: Password1!
test_cases.Expected Result: Users not enabled for Brand Spain cannot access Spain-specific content or the 'Genere' filter for Spain; the system must clearly prevent actions and show an informative message.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates access control for Spain and presence/availability of 'Genere' filter for unauthorized users; does not test role assignment flows.

test_cases.Title: GenereFilter_XXX_Precondizioni_AuthRequired_TEST_Desktop_verify_login_redirect_and_filter_unavailable

Steps.Step Description: Open the application URL in an incognito/private browser window (no active session).
Steps.Expected Result: Application landing/login page is displayed since no user is authenticated.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to navigate directly to the Spain-branded content URL or select Spain from the Brand selector without logging in.
Steps.Expected Result: System redirects to the login page or shows a login required message/modal before allowing access to brand-specific content.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the filters panel area while not logged in or before successful authentication.
Steps.Expected Result: Filters panel (including 'Genere') is not accessible; 'Genere' filter is not visible or interaction prompts login.

Steps.Step Description: Now perform login with a valid Spain-enabled user (user_sp_enabled / Password1!) from the redirected login page.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and redirected to the requested Spain content or default page; filters including 'Genere' become available assuming authorization.

test_cases.Title: GenereFilter_XXX_Precondizioni_FilterDisabled_TEST_Desktop_verify_filter_absent_or_disabled_when_feature_flag_off

test_cases.Title: ImpostazioneFiltroGenere_XXX_REQ_GENRE_Manifestazioni_TEST_Computer_apply filter after prior search

test_cases.Title: GenereFilter_ClearTextbox_XXX_REQ_ALT_GenereFilter_WebApp_TEST_Computer_enable filter by clearing textbox

test_cases.Title: GenereFilter_Disabled_Accessibility_XXX_REQ_ALT_GenereFilter_WebApp_TEST_Computer_verify disabled attributes

test_cases.Title: SearchError_SRV500_XXX_REQ_SEARCH_SearchFeature_TEST_Computer_DisplayErrorAfterSearch

Steps.Step Description: Ensure test environment is prepared: web application deployed on TEST environment, test harness/stub configured to force search API to return HTTP 500 (Internal Server Error) for the test search query.
Steps.Expected Result: Test harness/stub is active and will return HTTP 500 for the configured search query.

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application in a browser on the test computer and navigate to the Search page.
Steps.Expected Result: Search page is displayed with search input and search button.

Steps.Step Description: Enter the test search query from the dataset (e.g., "test-product-123") into the search input and trigger the search (click Search or press Enter).
Steps.Expected Result: Search request is sent from the client to the backend; network call is made and backend responds with HTTP 500 as configured by the stub.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the UI behavior after the search request receives the HTTP 500 response.
Steps.Expected Result: The application displays a clear, user-friendly error message informing the user that an error occurred during the search (example: "An error occurred while performing the search. Please try again later."). No stack traces or technical details are shown to the user.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the use case terminates gracefully: search results section remains empty or unchanged and user can choose to retry or navigate away.
Steps.Expected Result: Search results are not populated; the error message is visible; application allows user to retry or return to previous page. No unhandled exceptions or crashes occur.

Steps.Step Description: Check application logs (server or client as applicable) to confirm that the HTTP 500 response and the error handling event were logged for diagnostics.
Steps.Expected Result: Relevant error event is present in logs with appropriate severity and correlation id if applicable (no sensitive data logged).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has access to TEST environment. 2) Test harness/stub available to simulate backend responses. 3) Browser cleared cache or using incognito. 4) Tester has network access to application.
test_cases.Dataset: Search query: "test-product-123"; Stub: search API -> HTTP 500 response
test_cases.Expected Result: When the backend returns an HTTP 500 for the search, the user sees a friendly error message and the use case terminates gracefully without application crash; error is logged.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Errore di risposta a seguito di esecuzione della ricerca
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI display of error message for HTTP 500 and graceful termination; retry flow behavior and localized message variations not covered.

test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client-side timeout handling and message; backend recovery and automatic retries are not covered.

test_cases.Title: CreateAnagrafica_XXX_ANAGRAFICA_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_missing required fields validation

Steps.Step Description: Verify application behavior after cancellation: ensure no search is executed and no changes are applied to the data.
Steps.Expected Result: No search is performed, application returns to previous state or dashboard, and the use case terminates without applying filters.

test_cases.Title: NoResultsMessage_XXX_REQ-SEARCH-NoResults_SearchApp_TEST_Computer_display_no_results_message

Steps.Step Description: Enter a search term guaranteed to return no results (e.g., 'nonexistent-unique-string-xyz') and leave current 'Categoria' filter value as-is. Click the Search button.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the UI after search completes.

Steps.Step Description: Verify presence of suggested actions described by the alternative path: (a) category selector values, (b) reset to default button labeled corresponding to button (2) in Figure 18, and (c) a cancel/close option.

test_cases.Title: ChangeCategory_XXX_REQ-SEARCH-NoResults_SearchApp_TEST_Computer_change_category_and_continue

Steps.Step Description: Using the 'Categoria' filter control, change the value from the current one to 'Professional'.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Categoria' control reflects the selected value 'Professional'.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the search action again (press Search button or equivalent) to continue with the base path step (re-execute the search with the new category filter).
Steps.Expected Result: A new search request is initiated with filter 'Categoria=Professional' and the original search term.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the search results area and any returned items or messages.
Steps.Expected Result: If matching results exist for the chosen category, results are displayed according to base path step 4 behavior; if still no results, the 'no results' message persists and the alternative options remain available.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Application is reachable. 2) Initial search term yields no results. 3) 'Categoria' filter contains values: 'Tutti','Professional','Amateur','University','Youth','Friendly'.

test_cases.Title: ResetCategory_XXX_REQ-SEARCH-NoResults_SearchApp_TEST_Computer_reset_category_then_change_and_continue

Steps.Step Description: Perform a search that returns no results so that the 'no results' message and the reset button (button (2) in Figure 18) are visible.
Steps.Expected Result: 'No results' message is displayed and reset-to-default button (2) is visible and enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Click the reset-to-default button (button (2)) to restore the 'Categoria' filter to its default value.

Steps.Step Description: Re-run the search to continue with the base path step 4 using the reset-then-changed filter.
Steps.Expected Result: A new search is executed with the selected 'Categoria' (University). Results are displayed if available; otherwise the 'no results' message remains and options persist.

test_cases.Title: AbandonSearch_XXX_REQ-SEARCH-NoResults_SearchApp_TEST_Computer_cancel_search_and_terminate
