test_cases.Title: ErroreRisposta_XXX_REQ-ALT-ERR_SEARCH_WebApp_TEST_Computer_display server 500 error

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application and navigate to the Search page.
Steps.Expected Result: Search page loads and search input is visible and enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a valid search query into the search input (e.g., 'test item') and submit the search.
Steps.Expected Result: Search request is sent from the client to the server.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate server returning HTTP 500 Internal Server Error for the search request (use test harness, proxy or dev tools to mock response).
Steps.Expected Result: Client receives HTTP 500 response.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the UI after the error response is received.
Steps.Expected Result: An error message is displayed to the Actor indicating the search failed (message text should be user-friendly and localized if applicable). No search results are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to dismiss the error message (e.g., click close or OK) and verify application state.
Steps.Expected Result: Error message can be dismissed; application returns to idle Search page state (search input remains visible and ready for a new query).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has access to the web application in TEST environment. 2) Test harness or proxy available to mock server responses. 3) User is on Search page and able to perform searches.
test_cases.Dataset: Search query: 'test item'; Mocked server response: HTTP 500, body: server error
test_cases.Expected Result: When the server returns an error after executing a search, the user sees a clear error message, no results are shown, and the use case ends returning the UI to the idle search state.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Errore di risposta a seguito di esecuzione della ricerca
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI behavior for server-side 500 errors; does not validate server-side logging or retry mechanisms.

test_cases.Title: ErroreRisposta_XXX_REQ-ALT-ERR_SEARCH_WebApp_TEST_Computer_network timeout error

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application and navigate to the Search page.
Steps.Expected Result: Search page loads and search input is visible and enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a valid search query (e.g., 'network test') and submit the search.
Steps.Expected Result: Search request is initiated by the client.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate a network timeout or lost connectivity while the search request is in progress (use network throttling or disable network in dev tools).
Steps.Expected Result: Client fails to receive a response; request times out or fails with network error.

Steps.Step Description: Observe how the application handles the network failure and what message is shown to the user.
Steps.Expected Result: A network error message is displayed to the Actor indicating the search could not be completed due to connectivity issues. The message suggests retrying or checking network connection.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to perform another search after restoring network connectivity and verify behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: After connectivity is restored, a new search can be executed successfully (if server responds normally); prior error message is cleared or dismissible.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has access to the web application. 2) Ability to simulate network loss or timeout via dev tools or test network environment.
test_cases.Dataset: Search query: 'network test'; Network condition: disconnected or request timeout
test_cases.Expected Result: On network failure during search, a clear connectivity error message is shown and the use case terminates; user can retry after connectivity is restored.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Errore di risposta a seguito di esecuzione della ricerca
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates client-side handling of network timeouts; does not test different network speed degradations beyond timeout scenario.

test_cases.Title: ErroreRisposta_XXX_REQ-ALT-ERR_SEARCH_WebApp_TEST_Computer_malformed response handling

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application and navigate to the Search page.
Steps.Expected Result: Search page is displayed with search input available.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a search query (e.g., 'malformed') and submit the search.
Steps.Expected Result: Client sends search request to server.

Steps.Step Description: Mock the server to return an HTTP 200 status but with a malformed or unexpected response body (e.g., invalid JSON or missing expected fields).
Steps.Expected Result: Client receives the malformed response body.

Steps.Step Description: Observe how the client application processes the malformed response and what is shown to the user.
Steps.Expected Result: The application detects the invalid response and displays an error message to the Actor indicating that the search could not be completed (generic error). No partial or incorrect results are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the system does not crash and the UI remains responsive after the error message is presented.
Steps.Expected Result: Application remains responsive; search input is available for a new query and the use case terminates after showing the error.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester able to mock server responses. 2) Application is at Search page.
test_cases.Dataset: Search query: 'malformed'; Mocked server response: HTTP 200 with invalid JSON body
test_cases.Expected Result: On malformed server response, the user sees a clear error message, no erroneous results are rendered, and the use case terminates safely returning UI to idle.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Errore di risposta a seguito di esecuzione della ricerca
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client handling of malformed successful responses; does not validate server-side content generation.

test_cases.Title: ErroreRisposta_XXX_REQ-ALT-ERR_SEARCH_WebApp_TEST_Computer_ensure use case termination after error

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application and navigate to the Search page.
Steps.Expected Result: Search page is loaded and search input is ready.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger a search that will produce an error response (choose either server error, timeout, or malformed response as in previous tests).
Steps.Expected Result: An error response is simulated and returned to the client.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm that the application displays the appropriate error message to the Actor.
Steps.Expected Result: A clear error message is shown; no partial results are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to continue the original use case workflow beyond the error (e.g., navigate to next step that normally follows a successful search).
Steps.Expected Result: The use case does not proceed to subsequent successful-search steps; workflow terminates at the error condition and user remains on or is returned to the Search page or previous safe state.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the user can start a new independent search or that the application provides a clear recovery path (e.g., retry button or guidance).
Steps.Expected Result: User is able to retry the search or perform another action; recovery options are visible and the application state is consistent.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester on Search page. 2) Ability to simulate an error response. 3) Knowledge of normal post-search workflow for verification.
test_cases.Dataset: Search query: 'terminate test'; Error simulated: server error / timeout / malformed response
test_cases.Expected Result: After an error response to a search, the application displays an error message and the use case terminates without proceeding to subsequent successful-search steps; the user is presented with a recovery option.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Errore di risposta a seguito di esecuzione della ricerca
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates termination behavior of the use case on error; does not cover automated retries or backend recovery.

test_cases.Title: ImpostaFiltroSiglaISO_XXX_SIGLA_ISO_BackofficeFilter_TEST_Computer_apply valid ISO filter

Steps.Step Description: Login to the Backoffice web application with an account that has permission to view the dataset.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and the Backoffice home/dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the module/page that contains the list/grid where the 'Sigla ISO' filter is available.
Steps.Expected Result: The list/grid page is displayed and the filter panel (or toolbar) containing 'Sigla ISO' is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Locate the 'Sigla ISO' filter control (dropdown, input, or autocomplete) and enter/select the valid ISO code 'IT'.
Steps.Expected Result: 'IT' is accepted in the filter control (appears selected or as the filter value).

Steps.Step Description: Apply the filter by clicking the 'Apply' button or confirming the selection according to the UI (if filter applies automatically, wait for results to refresh).
Steps.Expected Result: The list/grid refreshes and only items with Sigla ISO = 'IT' are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the UI indicates the filter is active (filter badge, highlighted filter, or filter summary) and that each displayed row/item shows Sigla ISO = 'IT'.
Steps.Expected Result: A visual indicator shows the 'Sigla ISO: IT' filter is active and every displayed record's Sigla ISO column equals 'IT'.

Steps.Step Description: Clear the filter using the UI (clear button or remove badge) and verify the full dataset is restored.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Sigla ISO' filter is cleared and the list/grid shows the unfiltered dataset (items with multiple ISO codes).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has valid Backoffice credentials (admin/tester) with view permissions. 2) Dataset contains multiple records with Sigla ISO values including 'IT', 'DE', 'FR'. 3) Network connectivity available.
test_cases.Dataset: User: admin@example.com / Password: Test123!; Records: [{id:1,iso:'IT'},{id:2,iso:'DE'},{id:3,iso:'FR'}]
test_cases.Expected Result: Applying Sigla ISO = 'IT' shows only records with ISO 'IT', UI indicates filter active; clearing filter restores full dataset.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI filtering behaviour; does not validate backend API logs, pagination across large datasets, or export functionality.

test_cases.Title: ImpostaFiltroSiglaISO_XXX_SIGLA_ISO_BackofficeFilter_TEST_Computer_invalid ISO code

Steps.Step Description: Login and navigate to the list/grid page containing the 'Sigla ISO' filter (same preconditions as TC-001).
Steps.Expected Result: List/grid page and 'Sigla ISO' filter control are accessible.

Steps.Step Description: In the 'Sigla ISO' filter control, enter an invalid ISO code value 'XYZ' (3 letters) and attempt to apply the filter.
Steps.Expected Result: The system either rejects the input with a validation message OR accepts it and applies the filter resulting in zero matched records.

Steps.Step Description: If a validation message is shown, verify the exact message content. If the filter is applied with no matches, verify a 'No results found' or equivalent message is displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: Appropriate feedback is provided: either 'Formato Sigla ISO non valido' (validation) OR 'Nessun elemento trovato' when applied with no matching records.

Steps.Step Description: Clear the filter and confirm normal data is visible again.
Steps.Expected Result: Filter cleared and full dataset is visible; no residual errors remain.

test_cases.Preconditions: Backoffice account with view permissions; dataset contains only standard 2-letter ISO codes.
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid input example: 'XYZ'; valid dataset: 'IT','DE','FR'
test_cases.Expected Result: System prevents invalid ISO format or shows no results with clear messaging; clearing filter restores dataset.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client-side validation and zero-result state; does not cover server-side sanitization or security validation.

test_cases.Title: ImpostaFiltroSiglaISO_XXX_SIGLA_ISO_BackofficeFilter_TEST_Computer_case insensitivity

Steps.Step Description: Login and navigate to the page with the 'Sigla ISO' filter.
Steps.Expected Result: Page and filter control are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Enter lowercase 'it' into the 'Sigla ISO' filter and apply the filter.
Steps.Expected Result: The filter accepts 'it' and applies the filter (no input rejection).

Steps.Step Description: Verify the results displayed after applying lowercase 'it' are identical to those when applying uppercase 'IT' (compare record IDs or count).
Steps.Expected Result: Records returned for 'it' match those returned for 'IT' (case-insensitive behavior).

Steps.Step Description: Repeat with mixed-case input 'It' to confirm consistent behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: Mixed-case input returns the same set of records as 'IT' and 'it'.

test_cases.Preconditions: Dataset contains records with Sigla ISO 'IT' (uppercase) to compare results.
test_cases.Dataset: Inputs to test: 'IT', 'it', 'It' ; Records with iso='IT' present
test_cases.Expected Result: Filter behaves case-insensitively: 'IT', 'it', and 'It' return identical result sets.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers case sensitivity on UI; does not validate case handling in backend APIs or database collation settings.

test_cases.Title: ImpostaFiltroSiglaISO_XXX_SIGLA_ISO_BackofficeFilter_TEST_Computer_autocomplete and partial match

Steps.Step Description: Login and open the page with the 'Sigla ISO' filter control which supports autocomplete or suggestion.
Steps.Expected Result: Filter control with autocomplete is visible and ready for input.

Steps.Step Description: Type the first letter 'I' into the 'Sigla ISO' filter input slowly to trigger suggestions.
Steps.Expected Result: Autocomplete suggestions appear and include entries starting with 'I' (e.g., 'IT', 'IS', 'IE' where applicable).

Steps.Expected Result: Selected suggestion populates the filter and the grid refreshes showing only records matching the selected ISO.

Steps.Step Description: Type a partial two-letter sequence that matches multiple codes (if supported) and verify suggestions are filtered accordingly.
Steps.Expected Result: Suggestions narrow down based on partial input; selecting any suggestion applies the correct filter and results.

test_cases.Expected Result: Autocomplete suggestions appear and selecting one applies the filter correctly showing matching records.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI autocomplete and selection; does not cover performance of suggestion loading under heavy load.

test_cases.Title: ImpostaFiltroSiglaISO_XXX_SIGLA_ISO_BackofficeFilter_TEST_Computer_filter persistence after navigation

Steps.Step Description: Login and navigate to the list/grid page; set the 'Sigla ISO' filter to 'DE' and apply it.
Steps.Expected Result: Filter is applied and list shows only records with Sigla ISO = 'DE'.

Steps.Step Description: Click to open details of one of the filtered records (navigate to record detail view) and wait for the detail page to load.
Steps.Expected Result: Record detail page opens and displays correct record data.

Steps.Step Description: Use the Back or Close action to return to the list/grid page (or click the list/menu to return) without manually clearing the filter.
Steps.Expected Result: User returns to the list/grid page.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the 'Sigla ISO' filter is still set to 'DE' and the list remains filtered accordingly.
Steps.Expected Result: The filter value 'DE' persists after navigation and the list shows only 'DE' records.

Steps.Step Description: Log out and log back in, then navigate again to the same list to verify if filter persistence is session-based or persisted across sessions (if requirement states persistence across sessions).
Steps.Expected Result: If design specifies session persistence: filter cleared after logout; if design specifies user preference persistence: 'DE' remains selected. Tester must compare observed behaviour against product specification.

test_cases.Preconditions: User logged in; dataset contains records with 'DE' ISO; specification available indicating expected persistence behavior.
test_cases.Dataset: Filter value to test persistence: 'DE'; user account sample: user1@example.com
test_cases.Expected Result: Filter persists while navigating within the application; session vs persistent behavior must match specification and is documented in result.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates UI persistence only; does not cover long-term preference storage or multi-device sync.

test_cases.Title: Filtra Sigla ISO_XXX_REQ_SIGLAISO_ApplicativoWeb_TEST_Computer_Filter by single ISO in Brand Spain

Steps.Expected Result: All returned manifestations belong to Brand 'Spain'. Manifestations from other brands with the same ISO are not present in the results.

Steps.Step Description: Change Brand selector to a different Brand (e.g., 'Italy') and repeat the same ISO search.
Steps.Expected Result: Results change accordingly and now show manifestations for the selected Brand (if any); previously shown Spain-specific items are not displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester logged in. 2) Multiple Brands present in the dataset including Spain and Italy. 3) ISO 'ES' has manifestations in at least two brands in the system.
test_cases.Functionality: Filter/Search by Sigla ISO with Brand scoping
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials; Sigla ISO: 'ES'; Manifestations: MNT-ES-SPAIN-001 (Brand Spain), MNT-ES-ITALY-002 (Brand Italy)
test_cases.Expected Result: When Brand 'Spain' is selected and Sigla ISO 'ES' applied, only Spain manifestations are returned; switching Brand updates results to the selected Brand only.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates that ISO filtering is correctly scoped to the selected Brand; does not test combined filters with other attributes (dates, status) in depth.

test_cases.Title: CreateUser_XXX_REQ-ANAG_UtenteAnagrafica_TEST_Computer_Create a new anagrafica user

Steps.Step Description: Fill in mandatory fields: First Name = 'Mario', Last Name = 'Rossi', Email = 'mario.rossi.test@example.com', Role = 'Operator', Tax Code = 'RSSMRA80A01H501U'. Fill optional fields as needed.
Steps.Expected Result: All entered values remain in the form and validation does not show errors for valid formats.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' (Salva) to submit the new user.
Steps.Expected Result: A success message is displayed (e.g., 'User created successfully') and the new user appears in the User Registry list.

Steps.Step Description: Search the User Registry for 'mario.rossi.test@example.com' and open the user details.
Steps.Expected Result: User details page displays the information entered during creation and the user status is 'Active' (or equivalent).

test_cases.Expected Result: A new anagrafica user is created successfully, visible in the User Registry with correct details and active status.

test_cases.Title: ViewUserDetails_XXX_REQ-ANAG_UtenteAnagrafica_TEST_Computer_View an anagrafica user details

test_cases.Title: CreateAnagrafica_XXX_REQ-ANAGRAFICA_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Create new registry entry

Steps.Expected Result: Create Anagrafica form is displayed with all mandatory and optional fields (e.g., First Name, Last Name, Fiscal Code/ID, Date of Birth, Contact Info).

test_cases.Title: SearchAnagrafica_XXX_REQ-ANAGRAFICA_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Search and filter registry entries

test_cases.Expected Result: Search and filter return correct subset of Anagrafica records, filters combine using logical AND, and detail view matches list data.

test_cases.Title: UpdateAnagrafica_XXX_REQ-ANAGRAFICA_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Edit existing registry entry

test_cases.Title: DeleteAnagrafica_XXX_REQ-ANAGRAFICA_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Delete registry entry with confirmation

Steps.Step Description: Login to Backoffice as a user with delete permissions on Anagrafica.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and delete actions are available in the Anagrafica module.

Steps.Step Description: Identify a non-critical test Anagrafica record (created for testing) and click 'Delete' or 'Remove' from the list or detail view.
Steps.Expected Result: A confirmation dialog appears warning about deletion and asking to confirm or cancel (including record identifier information).

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Cancel' in the confirmation dialog.
Steps.Expected Result: Deletion is aborted, the record remains in the system and no data is removed.

Steps.Step Description: Repeat delete action and this time click 'Confirm' to proceed with deletion.
Steps.Expected Result: System deletes the record, shows a success message (e.g., 'Record deleted'), and removed record no longer appears in search or list.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the deleted record's detail URL directly (if possible).
Steps.Expected Result: System returns a not found message or redirects to list view; deleted record cannot be accessed.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has delete permissions. 2) A test record exists and is safe to delete (not linked to production-critical data).
test_cases.Dataset: Test record Fiscal Code=DELTEST001; created specifically for deletion tests.
test_cases.Expected Result: Delete confirmation works correctly (cancel/confirm), record is permanently removed on confirm, and cannot be retrieved via UI or direct link.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI delete flow and confirmation; backend soft-delete vs hard-delete behavior and audit log verification not included.

test_cases.Title: ValidateAnagrafica_XXX_REQ-ANAGRAFICA_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Input validation and duplicate detection

Steps.Step Description: Login to Backoffice with create/edit permissions and open the Anagrafica create form.
Steps.Expected Result: Create form is displayed and ready for input.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to save a new record leaving mandatory fields blank (e.g., remove Last Name and Fiscal Code) and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Client-side validation prevents submission and displays required-field errors next to each mandatory field.

Steps.Step Description: Enter invalid formats: set Email = 'not-an-email', Date of Birth = '31-02-2000', Fiscal Code = 'INVALID123', then click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Field-specific validation errors are displayed indicating invalid email format, invalid date, and invalid fiscal code format; save is blocked.

Steps.Step Description: Enter data matching an existing record's unique identifier (e.g., Fiscal Code = existing value) and attempt to save.
Steps.Expected Result: System detects duplicate (server-side or client-side) and displays a clear duplicate warning; user is prevented from creating duplicate unless merge/override workflow is followed.

Steps.Step Description: Try inputting maximum length values for text fields (boundary test) and save.
Steps.Expected Result: System accepts inputs up to defined maximum lengths; if input exceeds max length, an appropriate error is displayed and save is blocked.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) At least one existing Anagrafica record present for duplicate checks. 2) Validation rules documented and available.
test_cases.Dataset: Existing Fiscal Code=RSSMRA80A01H501U; invalid inputs and boundary strings for length testing.
test_cases.Expected Result: All client and server validations enforce mandatory fields, correct formats, duplicate detection and maximum lengths; appropriate error messages are shown and data is not saved when invalid.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers standard field validation and duplicate detection; localization of error messages and international identifier validation not included.

test_cases.Title: Manifestazioni_SiglaISO_XXX_REQ-MANIFEST-BRAND-SPAIN_TEST_Computer_Verify_default_and_search_by_ISO

test_cases.Title: Manifestazioni_SiglaISO_XXX_REQ-MANIFEST-BRAND-SPAIN_TEST_Computer_InvalidISO_input_validation

Steps.Step Description: Open the Brand Spain 'Manifestazioni' section and locate the 'Sigla ISO' dropdown autocomplete filter.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Sigla ISO' filter is visible and defaulted to 'Tutti'.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to type an arbitrary value that is not present in the Brand Master (e.g., 'ZZZ-Invalid') into the autocomplete field and press Enter or attempt to select it.
Steps.Expected Result: The autocomplete should not allow an invalid selection: either no suggestion is available or the control refuses to accept the invalid value.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to press the 'Avvia ricerca' button while the autocomplete contains the invalid text (if the control allows typing but not selection).
Steps.Expected Result: The system prevents the search with an invalid ISO selection by either: a) showing a validation message prompting to select a valid ISO, or b) ignoring the invalid text and keeping the filter at 'Tutti'. No unintended search with invalid value should be performed.

Steps.Step Description: Clear the invalid input and select a valid ISO or leave as default and press 'Avvia ricerca' to continue normal use.
Steps.Expected Result: After clearing invalid input, a valid ISO can be selected or the default 'Tutti' remains; search proceeds normally and results are displayed accordingly.

test_cases.Title: NoResultsChangeISO_XXX_AltPath_NessunRisultato_Ricerca_TEST_Computer_change ISO to another registered country

Steps.Step Description: Precondition: Ensure user is logged into Backoffice web application and has performed a search that returned no results (the 'no results' message is displayed). Verify the 'Sigla ISO' filter is visible.

test_cases.Title: NoResultsAbortSearch_XXX_AltPath_NessunRisultato_Ricerca_TEST_Computer_abort search and terminate use case

test_cases.Title: ErroreRispostaRicerca_XXX_REQ-ERR-SEARCH_SearchApp_TEST_Computer_display_error_on_500

Steps.Step Description: Ensure the backend search endpoint is configured to return an HTTP 500 response for the test query (precondition setup by test environment or API mock).
Steps.Expected Result: Backend will return HTTP 500 for the configured test query.

Steps.Step Description: Launch the web application on the Computer and navigate to the Search page.
Steps.Expected Result: Search page is loaded and search input controls are visible and enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Enter a valid search term defined in Test Data (e.g., "test-product-500") into the search input and initiate the search (click Search button or press Enter).
Steps.Expected Result: Search request is sent to backend; UI shows an in-progress indicator (spinner) while awaiting response.

Steps.Step Description: Observe behavior after backend returns HTTP 500 error.
Steps.Expected Result: The application displays a clear, user-friendly error message indicating a search error (e.g., "An error occurred while processing your search. Please try again later.") and hides or removes the loading indicator.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that no search results are displayed and that the use case terminates without navigating away or performing additional automatic retries (unless specified by application design).
Steps.Expected Result: No results are shown, no unexpected navigation occurs, and the search flow ends with the displayed error message. The user can retry the search manually.

Steps.Step Description: Check accessibility and localization: confirm error message is readable, uses appropriate ARIA role (alert or status) and is displayed in the expected language for the test locale.
Steps.Expected Result: Error message is accessible (screen reader announces it) and localized correctly for the test locale.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has access to a test environment where backend responses can be mocked or configured. 2) The backend search endpoint is configured to return HTTP 500 for the test query. 3) Tester is logged in if required by the application. 4) Network connectivity from client to test environment is available.
test_cases.Dataset: Search term: "test-product-500"; Backend mocked to return HTTP 500 for this term; User account (if required): test.user@example.com / password
test_cases.Expected Result: When the backend returns an HTTP 500 response after executing a search, the user sees a clear, localized error message, no results are displayed and the use case terminates gracefully allowing the user to retry.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Errore di risposta a seguito di esecuzione della ricerca
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates UI behavior and messaging for server error (HTTP 500) after search. Does not cover retry logic beyond manual retry, nor detailed backend error logging.

test_cases.Title: ErroreRispostaRicerca_XXX_REQ-ERR-SEARCH_SearchApp_TEST_Mobile_display_error_on_network_offline

Steps.Step Description: Set the mobile device network to offline mode (airplane mode) or block network access to the application (precondition).
Steps.Expected Result: Device has no network connectivity to the application backend.

Steps.Step Description: Open the mobile application and navigate to the Search screen.
Steps.Expected Result: Search screen is displayed with input field and Search action available (but network calls will fail).

Steps.Step Description: Enter the search term defined in Test Data (e.g., "network-offline-test") and initiate the search.
Steps.Expected Result: Application attempts to perform the search and then detects lack of network connectivity or fails to receive response.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the error handling displayed to the user when the search cannot complete due to network unavailability.
Steps.Expected Result: Application shows an explicit offline/network error message (e.g., "No internet connection. Please check your network and try again."), removes any loading indicator, and does not display search results.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the use case terminates after displaying the error and that user can restore connectivity and retry the search manually.
Steps.Expected Result: Flow terminates with the error message; no automatic retry is performed (unless designed); once connectivity is restored a manual retry performs a fresh search.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Mobile test device available and configured for testing. 2) Test application version installed. 3) Device can be switched to offline mode. 4) Tester logged in if required.
test_cases.Dataset: Search term: "network-offline-test"; Mobile device with network turned off
test_cases.Expected Result: If a search is executed while device/network is offline, the app displays a clear offline/network error message and the use case ends without showing results.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Errore di risposta a seguito di esecuzione della ricerca
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers offline/network error display on mobile. Does not cover network recovery or background retry mechanisms.

test_cases.Title: ErroreRispostaRicerca_XXX_REQ-ERR-SEARCH_SearchAPI_TEST_Automated_verify_timeout_error_message

Steps.Step Description: Configure the test environment or API mock to simulate a backend timeout for the search endpoint (response delay exceeding client timeout threshold).
Steps.Expected Result: Backend will delay response long enough to trigger client-side timeout or explicit timeout error.

Steps.Step Description: Execute an automated test script or API-driven search request from the client configured for the test (use the test harness or automation tool).
Steps.Expected Result: Client sends search request and waits up to its configured timeout period.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the client's behavior when the request times out: capture UI or API error response handling.
Steps.Expected Result: Client presents a timeout-related error message to the user (or returns a timeout error code in API), e.g., "Search request timed out. Please try again." The loading indicator is dismissed.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm that the use case terminates after the timeout error and that no stale or partial results are displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: No results are displayed; state is consistent and the user is able to perform another search attempt manually.

Steps.Step Description: Log and assert the exact error message text and any error code returned to ensure it matches the expected localization and format for timeout errors.
Steps.Expected Result: Error message and/or error code matches the expected test data values and format; logs contain the timeout event for traceability.

test_cases.Reference System: Test Environment with API Mocking, Web Application
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test automation framework available and configured. 2) API mock capable of simulating delayed responses. 3) Client timeout thresholds known and configured for test.
test_cases.Dataset: Search term: "timeout-test"; Mocked backend configured to delay response beyond client timeout
test_cases.Expected Result: When the backend response times out during a search, the system displays (or returns) a clear timeout error message, no results are shown, and the use case ends gracefully.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Errore di risposta a seguito di esecuzione della ricerca
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Automated validation of client timeout handling and error messaging. Does not cover recovery or retry policies beyond a single manual retry.

test_cases.Title: SelectMaxItems_XXX_Manifestazioni_BrandSpagna_TEST_Computer_Verify_boundary_max_option_100

test_cases.Title: SelectMaxItems_XXX_Manifestazioni_BrandSpagna_TEST_Computer_Verify_persistence_across_sessions_and_language

test_cases.Title: SelectMaxItems_XXX_REQ-SPAIN-001_Manifestazioni_TEST_Computer_verify selectable page size options and displayed rows

Steps.Step Description: Open the web browser and navigate to the Brand Spain application login page.
Steps.Expected Result: Brand Spain login page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Log in with valid credentials (user with access to 'Manifestazioni').
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and redirected to the application home page.

Steps.Step Description: From the main menu, navigate to the 'Manifestazioni' section of Brand Spain.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Manifestazioni' page is loaded and the table of manifestazioni is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Locate the 'items per page' / page size control (dropdown or selector) above or below the table.
Steps.Expected Result: Page size control is visible with available options (e.g., 10, 25, 50, 100).

Steps.Step Description: Select the page size option '10'.
Steps.Expected Result: The table refreshes and displays up to 10 rows. If fewer than 10 items exist, all items are shown. Pagination controls reflect the selected page size.

Steps.Step Description: Select the page size option '25'.
Steps.Expected Result: The table refreshes and displays up to 25 rows. If fewer than 25 items exist, all items are shown. Pagination controls update accordingly.

Steps.Step Description: Select the page size option '50'.
Steps.Expected Result: The table refreshes and displays up to 50 rows. If fewer than 50 items exist, all items are shown. Pagination controls update accordingly.

Steps.Step Description: Select the page size option '100'.
Steps.Expected Result: The table refreshes and displays up to 100 rows. If fewer than 100 items exist, all items are shown. Pagination controls update accordingly.

Steps.Step Description: For each selection above, verify the visible row count matches the expected count and that row content corresponds to manifestazioni entries (no truncated rows).
Steps.Expected Result: Visible row count equals selected page size or equals total items if less than selected value; rows display valid manifestazione data without truncation.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user exists with access to Brand Spain and Manifestazioni section. 2) The application database contains >100 manifestazioni items for exhaustive verification. 3) Network connection available.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials: test.spain@domain, password. Page size options: [10,25,50,100]. DB contains >100 manifestazioni entries.
test_cases.Expected Result: Selecting any available page size option updates the table to show up to the selected number of rows; pagination updates accordingly and content is correct.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI selection and display of rows for provided page sizes. Does not cover backend logging or API payload validation.

test_cases.Title: SelectMaxItems_XXX_REQ-SPAIN-002_Manifestazioni_TEST_Computer_verify selecting maximum shows all items and pagination behavior

Steps.Step Description: Login to Brand Spain with valid test credentials and navigate to 'Manifestazioni'.
Steps.Expected Result: User is on the 'Manifestazioni' page and table is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Note the total items count shown in the UI (e.g., label 'Mostrando 1-72 di 72').
Steps.Expected Result: Total items count is visible and recorded for comparison.

Steps.Step Description: From the page size control, select the maximum option (100).
Steps.Expected Result: The table refreshes showing up to 100 rows.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that if total items < selected page size (e.g., 72 < 100), the table displays all items on a single page and pagination controls are disabled or indicate single page.
Steps.Expected Result: All items are displayed on the page (72 rows). Pagination controls are disabled or show single page; no empty rows are present.

Steps.Step Description: Validate that the displayed number of rows equals the total items count previously noted.
Steps.Expected Result: Displayed row count equals total items count (e.g., 72).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user has access. 2) Application shows total items count. 3) Database has fewer than the maximum page size (example: 72 items).
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials, total items in DB = 72, page size options include 100 as maximum.
test_cases.Expected Result: Selecting the maximum page size displays all items on one page when total < maximum and pagination updates to single-page state.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Does not validate server-side performance impact when loading maximum rows.

test_cases.Title: SelectMaxItems_XXX_REQ-SPAIN-003_Manifestazioni_TEST_Computer_verify page size persistence after navigation and reload

Steps.Step Description: Login to Brand Spain and navigate to 'Manifestazioni'.
Steps.Expected Result: Manifestazioni page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: From the page size control, select '50'.
Steps.Expected Result: Table refreshes and displays up to 50 rows; page size control shows '50' selected.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to a different section of the application (for example 'Dashboard') and wait until that page fully loads.
Steps.Expected Result: Dashboard page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Return to 'Manifestazioni' via the menu.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Manifestazioni' page loads and the page size control still shows '50' selected and the table displays up to 50 rows.

Steps.Step Description: Reload the browser page (F5) while on 'Manifestazioni'.
Steps.Expected Result: After reload the page size selection remains '50' and the table displays up to 50 rows.

Steps.Step Description: Sign out and sign back in, then navigate to 'Manifestazioni'.
Steps.Expected Result: If persistence is expected across sessions, the page size remains '50'; otherwise default is applied (document expected behavior).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User can navigate between pages. 2) Application supports client-side storage or server-side preference for page size if specified by requirements.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials; page size value: 50.
test_cases.Expected Result: Page size selection persists for navigation and reload as per application specification (either session-only persistence or persistent across sessions).
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates UI persistence and basic session persistence. Does not verify storage mechanism (cookie vs server) in depth.

test_cases.Title: SelectMaxItems_XXX_REQ-SPAIN-004_Manifestazioni_TEST_Computer_verify invalid pageSize URL parameter is sanitized and clamped

Steps.Step Description: Login to Brand Spain and navigate to 'Manifestazioni'.
Steps.Expected Result: Manifestazioni page and table are visible.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the current URL pattern used for pagination and page size (e.g., contains query param pageSize=25).
Steps.Expected Result: URL contains page-related parameters or the application uses route params to control page size.

Steps.Step Description: Manually modify the URL query parameter pageSize to an invalid value (examples: pageSize=9999, pageSize=0, pageSize=-10, pageSize=abc) and press Enter to load.
Steps.Expected Result: Application reloads and sanitizes/clamps the provided value to a valid page size option or falls back to default (e.g., uses max allowed 100 for 9999; uses default 25 for invalid strings; uses minimum 10 for 0 or negative).

Steps.Step Description: Verify the table displays a number of rows consistent with the sanitized/clamped value and that no UI error or crash occurs.
Steps.Expected Result: Table shows a valid number of rows (clamped or default). No unhandled error messages are shown and pagination behaves normally.

Steps.Step Description: Check that the page size control selection reflects the sanitized value (e.g., shows '100' if clamped to maximum or default value).
Steps.Expected Result: Page size control displays the sanitized/clamped/default selection.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User access to Manifestazioni. 2) Application indicates page size via URL parameter or supports query parameter for testing.
test_cases.Functionality: Manifestazioni - Page size input validation and sanitization
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials; URL template for Manifestazioni (e.g., /manifestazioni?page=1&pageSize=25). Test values: 9999, 0, -10, abc.
test_cases.Expected Result: Invalid or out-of-range pageSize values are handled gracefully: application clamps to allowed maximum or falls back to default without errors and UI reflects the effective page size.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client-side and URL parameter handling; does not perform deep backend API fuzzing.

test_cases.Title: ModificaAnagraficaInvalidi_XXX_Attore_UtenteAnagrafica_TEST_Computer_verify validation on invalid input

Steps.Step Description: Enter an overly long value exceeding field limits in Address (e.g., 5,000 characters) and click 'Save'.

test_cases.Expected Result: Application enforces validation rules: invalid formats or missing mandatory fields produce clear error messages and prevent saving; oversized input is rejected or handled per specification.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to modify an existing record's Codice Fiscale to another existing Codice Fiscale and save.
Steps.Expected Result: System blocks the update and shows duplicate identifier validation error; original record remains unchanged.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) A person with the target Codice Fiscale exists in the system. 2) Unique constraint on Codice Fiscale is expected to be enforced by application or DB.
test_cases.Dataset: Existing Codice Fiscale value to attempt duplication.
test_cases.Expected Result: System prevents creation or update that would result in duplicate Codice Fiscale and displays an explanatory error message.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates duplicate detection for Codice Fiscale; does not cover other unique identifiers or race conditions during concurrent creation.

test_cases.Title: ScrollPages_XXX_ScorrerePagine_TabellaManifestazioniBrandSpagna_TEST_Computer_NextPrevButtons

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application and navigate to the 'Tabella delle Manifestazioni' for Brand 'Spagna'.
Steps.Expected Result: The page with the table of manifestations for Brand Spagna is displayed and table is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Verify pagination controls (Next, Previous) are visible and enabled when more than one page of results exists.
Steps.Expected Result: Pagination controls 'Next' and 'Previous' are displayed; 'Next' is enabled if not on last page; 'Previous' is disabled on first page.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Next' pagination button once.
Steps.Expected Result: Table refreshes and displays the next page of results; the page indicator updates to page 2; the focus remains on the table or pagination control.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Previous' pagination button once.
Steps.Expected Result: Table refreshes and displays the previous page of results; the page indicator updates back to page 1.

Steps.Step Description: Repeatedly click 'Next' until the 'Next' button becomes disabled (last page).
Steps.Expected Result: Each click advances to the next page; on reaching the last page 'Next' becomes disabled and 'Previous' is enabled.

Steps.Step Description: On the last page click 'Previous' to return to an earlier page and check data consistency.
Steps.Expected Result: Clicking 'Previous' returns to prior pages and displayed rows correspond to expected dataset slice; no duplicate or missing rows across page transitions.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester is logged in with a user that can view Brand Spagna manifestations. 2) The dataset contains more records than the page size (e.g., >= 25 items when page size = 10). 3) Network is stable.
test_cases.Dataset: Brand=Spagna, TotalRecords=45, PageSize=10
test_cases.Expected Result: Pagination Next/Previous buttons navigate between pages correctly, page indicator updates accurately, and table rows correspond to correct slice of dataset without duplicates or omissions.
test_cases._polarion: Caso d'uso: Scorre pagine della Tabella delle Manifestazioni del Brand Spagna
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers Next/Previous pagination controls; does not cover direct page input, sorting or filtering interactions.

test_cases.Title: ScrollPages_XXX_ScorrerePagine_TabellaManifestazioniBrandSpagna_TEST_Computer_LargeDatasetPerformance

Steps.Step Description: Return to first page using 'First' and observe stability.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Performance testing environment available with dataset ~10,000 records. 2) Monitoring tools available to measure response times.
test_cases.Dataset: Brand=Spagna, TotalRecords=10000, PageSize=20
test_cases.Expected Result: Pagination remains performant under large dataset; page loads and jumps complete within defined thresholds and UI remains stable.
test_cases._polarion: Caso d'uso: Scorre pagine della Tabella delle Manifestazioni del Brand Spagna
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers performance aspects of pagination with large datasets; does not validate data correctness beyond sample checks.

Steps.Expected Result: All mandatory fields are displayed and show the correct information corresponding to the user account.

Steps.Step Description: Verify read-only controls and that no edit controls are present if the user's role is view-only.
Steps.Expected Result: Edit controls are not visible; fields are read-only for a view-only Utente Anagrafica.

Steps.Step Description: Log out from the application.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged out and redirected to the login page.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test environment available and stable (TEST). 2) Test account 'utente_anagrafica_01' exists with view-only role. 3) Tester has network access and browser supported by app. 4) Test dataset loaded with user profile data.

test_cases.Expected Result: Utente Anagrafica can successfully view their profile; mandatory fields are shown correctly and are read-only if role is view-only.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers profile view behavior for a view-only Utente Anagrafica. Does not cover edit or audit log verification.

test_cases.Title: UpdateUser_XXX_Attore_Principale_UtenteAnagrafica_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_Edit_existing_user_record

test_cases.Title: DeleteUser_Permissions_XXX_Attore_Principale_UtenteAnagrafica_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_Verify_delete_and_permission_restrictions

Steps.Step Description: Log in as a user without delete permissions (editor_anagrafica / Editor@123).
Steps.Expected Result: Editor dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Search for a test user record intended for deletion and check available actions for the editor user.
Steps.Expected Result: Delete action/button is not visible or is disabled for the editor user.

Steps.Step Description: Log out and log in as an admin user with delete permissions (admin_anagrafica / Admin@123).
Steps.Expected Result: Admin dashboard is displayed with delete capabilities.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that a delete entry is recorded in audit logs indicating which admin performed the delete and timestamp.

test_cases.Expected Result: Only users with delete permission can delete records; deletion removes the record from active dataset and is recorded in audit logs.

test_cases.Title: CreatePerson_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Create a new person record successfully

Steps.Step Description: Open browser and navigate to the Backoffice Anagrafica application. Log in with a user that has create rights (username: backoffice_user, password: Passw0rd!).
Steps.Expected Result: Backoffice Anagrafica landing page is displayed and user is authenticated with access to 'Create New Person' functionality.

Steps.Step Description: Click on 'Anagrafica' module, then click 'New' or 'Create' to open the 'Create Person' form.
Steps.Expected Result: Create Person form is displayed with fields: First Name, Last Name, Date of Birth, Tax Code/SSN, Address, Email, Phone, Gender, Save and Cancel buttons.

Steps.Step Description: Fill all mandatory fields with valid data: First Name: 'Mario', Last Name: 'Rossi', DOB: '1985-05-12', Tax Code: 'RSSMRA85E12H501U', Email: 'm.rossi@example.com', Phone: '+39061234567'.
Steps.Expected Result: All entered values are accepted by the UI without validation errors (fields show entered values).

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' to persist the new person record.
Steps.Expected Result: System shows a success confirmation message (e.g., 'Record created successfully'), the new person appears in the Anagrafica list, and a unique Person ID is assigned.

Steps.Step Description: Open the created record from the list to view details and verify stored values match input values.
Steps.Expected Result: All details displayed for the record match the data entered in Step 3 (including Tax Code and Email).

test_cases.Dataset: User credentials: backoffice_user / Passw0rd!; Person data: {FirstName: Mario, LastName: Rossi, DOB: 1985-05-12, TaxCode: RSSMRA85E12H501U, Email: m.rossi@example.com, Phone: +39061234567}
test_cases.Expected Result: New person record is created successfully, confirmation message displayed, record present in list with correct persisted values.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only the nominal create flow and basic field storage; does not cover integration with external identity validation services, audit log verification, or performance under load.

test_cases.Title: CreatePerson_MandatoryMissing_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Attempt create with missing mandatory fields

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Backoffice Anagrafica with a user that has create rights.

Steps.Step Description: Open the 'Create Person' form.

Steps.Step Description: Repeat by leaving mandatory field 'Tax Code' empty and fill others. Click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Form submission is blocked; a validation error message is shown near 'Tax Code' (e.g., 'Tax Code is required') and no record is created.

test_cases.Expected Result: System prevents saving when mandatory fields are missing and shows clear validation messages for each missing mandatory field.

test_cases.Title: UpdatePerson_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Edit and persist updates to an existing person record

test_cases.Title: DeletePerson_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Delete a person record and verify removal

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Backoffice Anagrafica as a user with delete permissions. Ensure a disposable test person record exists (create one if necessary with Tax Code 'DELTEST90A01H501Z').

test_cases.Title: SearchFilter_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Verify search and filter capabilities including partial and case-insensitive matches

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Backoffice Anagrafica and ensure several test records exist with varied attributes (e.g., 'Anna Bianchi', 'Antonio Bianchi', 'Annalisa Verdi').
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica list shows multiple records available for searching and filtering.

Steps.Step Description: Use the search box to search by partial last name 'Bian' and execute search.
Steps.Expected Result: Records with last name containing 'Bian' (e.g., Anna Bianchi, Antonio Bianchi) are returned. Results are not case-sensitive.

Steps.Step Description: Apply a filter for 'Date of Birth' range (e.g., 1980-01-01 to 1995-12-31) and execute filter.
Steps.Expected Result: Only records with DOB within the specified range are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Search using a non-matching string (e.g., 'ZZZZ') and verify system behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: No results returned and a friendly message is displayed (e.g., 'No matching records found').

Steps.Step Description: Clear filters and search to return to full list.
Steps.Expected Result: Full list of records is restored and pagination (if present) behaves normally.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Multiple records exist to validate filters. 2) User has search access.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials; Test records: {Anna Bianchi, Antonio Bianchi, Annalisa Verdi} with varied DOBs and other attributes
test_cases.Expected Result: Search and filter operations return correct and consistent results for partial, case-insensitive, range filters and no-match scenarios.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers basic search and filtering; does not include performance testing for large datasets or advanced fuzzy matching algorithms.

test_cases.Title: DuplicateDetection_XXX_Anagrafica_Anagrafica_TEST_Computer_Prevent creation of duplicate person based on Tax Code

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Backoffice Anagrafica with a user that can create records. Ensure an existing record with Tax Code 'DUPTST90A01H501X' exists.
Steps.Expected Result: Existing person with Tax Code 'DUPTST90A01H501X' is present in the system.

Steps.Step Description: Open 'Create Person' form and fill all mandatory fields using the same Tax Code 'DUPTST90A01H501X' but different name values (e.g., First Name: 'Paolo', Last Name: 'Bianchi').
Steps.Expected Result: Form accepts input but on Save the system runs duplicate detection.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' to attempt creation of duplicate record.
Steps.Expected Result: System detects duplicate Tax Code and prevents creation, showing a clear message (e.g., 'Duplicate Tax Code: a record with this Tax Code already exists') and offers to open existing record or cancel.

Steps.Step Description: Verify no new record with the duplicate Tax Code appears in the Anagrafica list and existing record remains unchanged.
Steps.Expected Result: No duplicate record is created; the original record remains intact and searchable.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) An existing record with Tax Code DUPTST90A01H501X exists. 2) Duplicate detection logic is enabled in test environment.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials; Existing Tax Code: DUPTST90A01H501X; New record attempt using same Tax Code.
test_cases.Expected Result: System identifies duplicate based on Tax Code and prevents creation, displaying an informative message and options.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates duplicate detection on Tax Code only; does not test fuzzy/partial duplicate matches across multiple fields or multi-source reconciliation.

test_cases.Title: VerificaPulsanteManifestazioni_XXX_PRECONDIZIONI_ManifestazioniApp_TEST_Desktop_Verify button enabled when preconditions met

Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and redirected to the application home page.

Steps.Step Description: Select 'Brand Spagna' from the Brand selector.

Steps.Step Description: Perform a search using the search field in Manifestazioni (e.g., search term 'Concerto') and submit.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the target action button that depends on list population (e.g., 'Proceed', 'Book', or similar).
Steps.Expected Result: The target button is enabled (clickable) because the list is populated.

test_cases.Title: VerificaPulsanteManifestazioni_NoLogin_XXX_PRECONDIZIONI_ManifestazioniApp_TEST_Desktop_Verify button disabled when user not logged in

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application and ensure the user is not logged in (clear session/cookies or open incognito).
Steps.Expected Result: Application displays login screen or anonymous state; no user session present.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to navigate to Brand Spagna and the Manifestazioni section without logging in.

Steps.Expected Result: Even if the list is populated, the target action button remains disabled or the application blocks action requiring authentication; a login prompt or error is shown when attempting the action.

Steps.Step Description: Try to click the target button if enabled; otherwise, attempt the action to confirm access is denied.
Steps.Expected Result: Action is not allowed; user is prompted to login or shown an authorization error.

test_cases.Preconditions: A. User is NOT logged in. B. (Optional) User is or is not enabled for Brand Spagna but login requirement takes precedence. C. A search may or may not have been performed.

test_cases.Title: VerificaPulsanteManifestazioni_NoBrandPermission_XXX_PRECONDIZIONI_ManifestazioniApp_TEST_MobileAndroid_Verify button disabled when user not enabled for Brand Spagna

test_cases.Title: VerificaPulsanteManifestazioni_NoSearch_XXX_PRECONDIZIONI_ManifestazioniApp_TEST_Tablet_Verify button disabled when no search performed

test_cases.Title: Pagination_DefaultFirstPage_XXX_REQ_Manifestazioni_TEST_Computer_verify default first page

Steps.Step Description: Verify preconditions: the Actor is on the 'Sezione Manifestazioni' for Brand 'Spain' and has executed a search resulting in a populated list (multiple items and more than one page).
Steps.Expected Result: Preconditions satisfied: list is populated and pagination controls are visible; total pages > 1 (e.g., 5).

Steps.Step Description: Observe the initially displayed page and the pagination controls (page numbers, 'Next' and 'Previous' buttons / arrows shown in the UI area indicated by the red rectangle in Figure 21).
Steps.Expected Result: The list is displayed showing page 1 content. The page indicator highlights '1' (or URL contains page=1). 'Previous' control is disabled/inactive; 'Next' control is enabled if total pages > 1.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the number of items shown on the page and that these correspond to the expected page size (e.g., 10 items per page).
Steps.Expected Result: The number of items displayed matches the configured page size (example: 10). Items correspond to the first page dataset (no items from page 2+ are visible).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User is authenticated (if required). 2) Navigate to Brand 'Spain' -> Sezione Manifestazioni. 3) Execute a search returning a populated list with total pages > 1 (example dataset: 45 results, page size 10 -> 5 pages).
test_cases.Dataset: Brand: Spain; Search term: 'concerti'; Total results: 45; Page size: 10; Expected total pages: 5.
test_cases.Expected Result: On opening the Manifestazioni section after a search, the list defaults to page 1: page indicator shows '1', 'Previous' disabled, 'Next' enabled, and only items of page 1 are displayed.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only UI behavior for default page load; does not cover backend pagination API response validation or network error handling.

test_cases.Title: Pagination_NextButton_XXX_REQ_Manifestazioni_TEST_Computer_navigate to next page using next button

Steps.Step Description: Ensure preconditions: user is on Manifestazioni Brand Spain, search executed, currently on page 1 and total pages >= 2 (example: 5 pages).
Steps.Expected Result: User is on page 1 with 'Next' control enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Next' pagination button/arrow located in the pagination control (as shown in the red rectangle of Figure 21).
Steps.Expected Result: The application navigates to the next page.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm that the content list updates to display items of page 2 and that the page indicator highlights '2' (and if applicable the URL or API call indicates page=2).
Steps.Expected Result: Page 2 content is displayed; page indicator shows '2'; 'Previous' control becomes enabled; 'Next' remains enabled if more pages available.

Steps.Step Description: Repeat clicking 'Next' until page 3 to verify multiple sequential navigations are supported.
Steps.Expected Result: Sequential navigation works: after second click the UI displays page 3 and the indicator updates accordingly.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User on Sezione Manifestazioni (Brand Spain). 2) Search returned results with at least 3 pages (e.g., 25+ results, page size 10).
test_cases.Dataset: Brand: Spain; Search term: 'teatro'; Total results: 25; Page size: 10; Pages: 3.
test_cases.Expected Result: Clicking 'Next' moves the user one page forward: the list updates to the next page's items and the page indicator/URL/API reflect the new page index.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI action of 'Next' navigation and client-side update; does not validate backend performance or race conditions with rapid clicks.

test_cases.Title: Pagination_PreviousButton_XXX_REQ_Manifestazioni_TEST_Computer_navigate to previous page using previous button

Steps.Step Description: Precondition: user is on Manifestazioni Brand Spain and currently on page 3 (or any page > 1); search results populated (example total pages: 5).
Steps.Expected Result: UI displays page 3 and both 'Previous' and 'Next' controls are visible and enabled as appropriate.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Previous' pagination button/arrow located in the pagination control.
Steps.Expected Result: The application navigates to the previous page (page 2).

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the content list updates to show items for page 2 and the page indicator updates to '2' (and URL/API reflects page=2).
Steps.Expected Result: Page 2 content is displayed; page indicator shows '2'; 'Previous' remains enabled if page > 1; 'Next' is enabled.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Previous' again to navigate to page 1 and verify 'Previous' becomes disabled after reaching page 1.
Steps.Expected Result: Page 1 displayed and 'Previous' control is disabled/inactive; page indicator shows '1'.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User on Sezione Manifestazioni (Brand Spain). 2) Search returned results and user navigated to page >= 2 (example current page 3).
test_cases.Dataset: Brand: Spain; Search term: 'fiere'; Total results: 30; Page size: 10; Current page: 3.
test_cases.Expected Result: Clicking 'Previous' moves the user one page backward; the displayed items and UI indicators update accordingly until reaching page 1 where 'Previous' is disabled.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates backward navigation UI flow; does not cover accessibility keyboard-only navigation or screen-reader announcements.

test_cases.Title: Pagination_JumpToPage_XXX_REQ_Manifestazioni_TEST_Computer_jump to specific page using page selector

Steps.Step Description: Precondition: user is on Sezione Manifestazioni (Brand Spain) and search results are populated with multiple pages (example total pages = 5).
Steps.Expected Result: Pagination control shows available page numbers (1..5) or a page input control.

Steps.Step Description: Click directly on page number '4' in the pagination control or enter '4' in the page selector and confirm (if input exists).
Steps.Expected Result: The application navigates directly to page 4.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the list displays page 4 items, the page indicator highlights '4', and URL/API parameters reflect page=4.
Steps.Expected Result: Page 4 content is shown; page indicator and URL/API indicate page 4; 'Previous' and 'Next' controls are enabled according to position.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to enter an out-of-range page number (e.g., '99') in the page selector if available.
Steps.Expected Result: System prevents navigation beyond last page: either clamps to last page (page 5) or shows validation message; no client error or crash occurs.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User on Sezione Manifestazioni (Brand Spain). 2) Search returned results with total pages = 5. Pagination UI exposes page numbers or an input-based page selector.
test_cases.Dataset: Brand: Spain; Search 'mostre'; Total results: 47; Page size: 10; Pages: 5. Page to jump: 4; Invalid page: 99.
test_cases.Expected Result: Clicking a page number or entering a valid page navigates to that page. Entering an out-of-range page is handled gracefully and does not break UI; appropriate feedback or clamping to last page occurs.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers direct navigation and invalid input handling on client side; server-side validation/error payloads not validated here.

test_cases.Title: Pagination_LastPageAndSinglePage_XXX_REQ_Manifestazioni_TEST_Computer_verify last page and single-page behaviors

Steps.Step Description: Precondition A (last page): user is on Manifestazioni Brand Spain, search results populated with total pages = 5 and currently navigated to page 5 (last page).
Steps.Expected Result: UI shows page 5 content and page indicator '5'.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the state of pagination controls when on the last page: check 'Next' button/arrow state and behavior when clicked.
Steps.Expected Result: 'Next' control is disabled/inactive on last page. If clicked, no navigation occurs and no error is raised.

Steps.Step Description: Precondition B (single page): change dataset or filter so total results <= page size (e.g., 8 results, page size 10) resulting in only 1 page.
Steps.Expected Result: UI shows the list with only one page available and pagination controls may be hidden or both 'Previous' and 'Next' are disabled/inactive.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to use any pagination controls ('Next', 'Previous', page numbers) when only one page exists.
Steps.Expected Result: No navigation occurs; controls are disabled or absent; UI remains stable with page 1 displayed. No client errors should be produced.

test_cases.Preconditions: Two datasets: A) Brand: Spain; Search: 'festival' -> Total results 50; Page size 10 -> 5 pages. B) Brand: Spain; Search: 'evento raro' -> Total results 8; Page size 10 -> 1 page.
test_cases.Dataset: Dataset A: 50 results (5 pages). Dataset B: 8 results (1 page).
test_cases.Expected Result: On the last page, 'Next' is disabled and clicking it has no effect. When only a single page exists, pagination controls are either hidden or disabled and no navigation is possible; UI remains stable.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates boundary behaviors for last-page and single-page scenarios at the UI level; does not test backend paging API error scenarios or concurrency.

test_cases.Dataset: User credentials: user_readonly / ReadOnlyPass; Target profile id: profile_100
test_cases.Expected Result: Users without edit permissions cannot modify profile data; UI clearly indicates read-only state or an authorization error.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates permission enforcement for edit actions only. Does not verify permission management interfaces.

test_cases.Title: ConcurrentUpdateAnagrafica_XXX_REQ-ANAG-005_AnagraficaWeb_TEST_Computer_concurrent modification conflict handling

Steps.Step Description: Open two browser sessions (A and B) and log in with the same Anagrafica user 'user_anag_04' in both sessions.
Steps.Expected Result: Both sessions authenticate successfully and display the home page.

Steps.Step Description: In session A, navigate to Anagrafica, click Edit, change Address to 'Via A, 1' but do not save yet.
Steps.Expected Result: Editable form in session A shows the modified Address but changes are not yet saved.

Steps.Step Description: In session B, navigate to Anagrafica, click Edit and change Address to 'Via B, 2' and click Save.
Steps.Expected Result: Session B successfully saves changes and system confirms update.

Steps.Step Description: Return to session A and attempt to save the previously modified form (which is now stale).
Steps.Expected Result: System detects concurrent modification and either prevents overwrite with a conflict warning, prompts to reload latest data, or merges changes per spec; no silent overwrite occurs.

Steps.Step Description: Follow the conflict resolution path as prompted (e.g., reload data and reapply changes) and save.
Steps.Expected Result: After resolving conflict per application behavior, the final persisted data reflects the intended resolution and no data is lost silently.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) user_anag_04 exists and can edit. 2) Two independent browser sessions available. 3) Application supports detection of concurrent edits (optimistic locking or similar).
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials: user_anag_04 / ValidPass123; Initial Address='Old Address 5'; Session A new value='Via A, 1'; Session B new value='Via B, 2'
test_cases.Expected Result: Application detects concurrent modifications and prompts appropriate conflict resolution; no silent data overwrite occurs and final data is consistent with chosen resolution.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers basic optimistic concurrency handling when same user edits from multiple sessions. Does not cover multi-user cross-account conflicts or automated merge policies.

test_cases.Title: CreatePerson_XXX_Anagrafica_Registration_TEST_Computer_create new person record

Steps.Step Description: Open the Anagrafica application in the Backoffice on the Computer.
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica application main page is displayed and user is authenticated to a user with 'anagrafica_create' permission.

Steps.Step Description: Click on 'New Person' or 'Nuovo' button to open the create person form.
Steps.Expected Result: Create person form is displayed with all mandatory fields (Name, Surname, Date of Birth, Tax Code) and optional fields.

Steps.Step Description: Populate the form with valid data: Name='Mario', Surname='Rossi', DOB='1985-07-15', TaxCode='RSSMRA85L15H501U', Address='Via Roma 1, Milano', Email='mario.rossi@example.it', Phone='+393331234567'.
Steps.Expected Result: All entered values are accepted by the UI and no inline validation errors are shown.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' or 'Salva' to submit the new person record.
Steps.Expected Result: Application displays a success message (e.g., 'Record salvato con successo') and redirects to the person details page or list view showing the new record.

Steps.Step Description: Search for the created record using Tax Code 'RSSMRA85L15H501U' in the Anagrafica search box.
Steps.Expected Result: Search returns the newly created person. Details match the entered data (Name, Surname, DOB, TaxCode, Address, Email, Phone).

Steps.Step Description: Verify backend persistence by querying the database or API (if authorized) for Tax Code 'RSSMRA85L15H501U'.
Steps.Expected Result: A single record exists in the database with the provided Tax Code and fields match the UI values.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has valid backoffice credentials with 'anagrafica_create' permission. 2) Anagrafica application is deployed in TEST environment. 3) Tax Code 'RSSMRA85L15H501U' does not exist in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: User: backoffice_creator@test.local / Password: Test@1234; Person data as per Step 3
test_cases.Expected Result: New person record is successfully created, displayed in UI, and persisted in the backend with correct field values.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers single-record creation via UI and persistence verification; bulk import, duplicate detection policies and downstream integrations not covered.

test_cases.Title: CreatePersonValidation_XXX_Anagrafica_Registration_TEST_Computer_mandatory field and format validation

Steps.Step Description: Open the Anagrafica create person form as a user with create permission.
Steps.Expected Result: Create form is displayed with mandatory field indicators.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to save the form with empty mandatory fields (leave Name and Tax Code blank) and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Client-side and/or server-side validation prevents submission and shows clear error messages near mandatory fields (e.g., 'Nome obbligatorio', 'Codice fiscale obbligatorio').

Steps.Step Description: Enter invalid Tax Code format 'INVALID123' and valid values for other mandatory fields, then click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Validation prevents save and displays an error indicating invalid tax code format (e.g., 'Formato codice fiscale non valido').

Steps.Step Description: Enter an invalid email 'email@invalid' and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Validation flags the email field with an error message or tooltip indicating invalid email format.

Steps.Step Description: Fix all validation errors by entering valid data and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: The record is accepted and success message is displayed.

test_cases.Preconditions: Anagrafica create form is accessible; tester has create permission.
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid TaxCode: 'INVALID123', Invalid Email: 'email@invalid', Valid fallback data: Name='Luca', Surname='Bianchi', TaxCode='BNC LCU85L15H501Y' (when fixing)
test_cases.Expected Result: Form enforces mandatory and format validations; prevents invalid data save and accepts valid corrected data.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client and server-side validation for common fields; complex international tax code rules and locale-specific validations not covered.

test_cases.Title: UpdatePerson_XXX_Anagrafica_Edit_TEST_Computer_update existing person address

Steps.Step Description: Search for an existing person by Tax Code 'RSSMRA85L15H501U' and open the person details page.

Steps.Step Description: Refresh the page and verify the address field still shows 'Via Milano 2, Milano'.
Steps.Expected Result: Updated address persists after refresh, confirming backend update.

Steps.Step Description: Verify an audit trail or last modified metadata shows the update (user and timestamp) if the system provides audit information.
Steps.Expected Result: Audit information reflects the edit operation by the current user and a recent timestamp.

test_cases.Preconditions: Person with Tax Code 'RSSMRA85L15H501U' exists; tester has 'anagrafica_edit' permission.
