test_cases.Title: DeletePerson_XXX_Anagrafica_Delete_TEST_Computer_remove person record with confirmation

Steps.Step Description: Locate the person record with Tax Code 'RSSMRA85L15H501U' in the Anagrafica list.
Steps.Expected Result: Person record is visible in the list with action options (View/Edit/Delete) per user permissions.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Delete' or 'Elimina' action for the selected person.
Steps.Expected Result: A confirmation modal/pop-up is displayed asking to confirm deletion with clear wording about consequences.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm deletion by clicking 'Confirm' in the modal.
Steps.Expected Result: Application displays a success message and the person is removed from the list view.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to search for the deleted Tax Code 'RSSMRA85L15H501U'.
Steps.Expected Result: Search returns no active results. If soft-delete is implemented, record may be marked as inactive; verify according to system design.

Steps.Step Description: Verify backend: check database flag or API response for deletion (soft delete vs hard delete) according to system policy.
Steps.Expected Result: Backend reflects deletion state consistent with application design (e.g., 'deleted' flag set or record removed) and deletion timestamp recorded.

test_cases.Preconditions: Person exists and tester has 'anagrafica_delete' permission; backup or test data reset available to restore deleted record if needed.
test_cases.Dataset: Person TaxCode to delete: 'RSSMRA85L15H501U'; User: backoffice_admin@test.local
test_cases.Expected Result: Person is deleted (soft or hard per design), UI and backend reflect deletion, and confirmation prevents accidental deletes.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI-driven delete and backend state verification; scheduled purge processes and cascading deletes to other systems not covered.

test_cases.Title: SearchFilter_XXX_Anagrafica_Search_TEST_Computer_search and filter persons by criteria

Steps.Step Description: Open the Anagrafica list page and ensure several test records exist with various surnames and tax codes.
Steps.Expected Result: List page displays existing records and search/filter UI components are available.

Steps.Step Description: Enter Tax Code 'BNC LCU85L15H501Y' in the Tax Code search field and execute search.
Steps.Expected Result: List shows only the record(s) matching the exact Tax Code.

Steps.Step Description: Clear the search, enter Surname 'Rossi' in the surname filter and set result page size to 50, then apply filter.
Steps.Expected Result: All records with Surname 'Rossi' are displayed; pagination and page size respect the selected value.

Steps.Step Description: Combine filters: Surname 'Rossi' and Address contains 'Milano', then apply combined filters.
Steps.Expected Result: Only persons matching both criteria are returned; filters are combinational (AND) per requirements.

Steps.Step Description: Sort results by Date of Birth descending and verify top record has the latest DOB among filtered results.
Steps.Expected Result: Sorting is applied and results order changes accordingly; DOB for first row is the latest date.

test_cases.Preconditions: Test dataset containing multiple persons exists with varied surnames, addresses and tax codes; tester has read/search permissions.
test_cases.Dataset: Multiple test persons loaded in TEST DB; Examples: TaxCode='BNCLCU85L15H501Y', Surname='Rossi', Address includes 'Milano'.
test_cases.Expected Result: Search and filter functionalities return correct and paginated results; sorting works as expected.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers standard search and filter combinations and sorting; advanced fuzzy search and performance under large datasets not covered.

test_cases.Title: Authorization_XXX_Anagrafica_Security_TEST_Computer_verify access control for Anagrafica

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the Anagrafica application URL with a user account that has no Anagrafica roles (e.g., 'guest_user@test.local').
Steps.Expected Result: Access is denied or redirected to an authorization error page; user sees a message indicating insufficient permissions.

Steps.Step Description: Login with a read-only role (e.g., 'anagrafica_reader') and attempt to click 'New Person' or 'Delete' actions.
Steps.Expected Result: 'New Person' and 'Delete' actions are either disabled/hidden or, if attempted, return an authorization error; read-only user can view but not perform write operations.

Steps.Step Description: Login with a write role (e.g., 'anagrafica_editor') and verify access to create and edit functionalities.
Steps.Expected Result: Write user can access create and edit screens and perform operations successfully according to permissions.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that unauthorized direct API calls to person-create endpoint using the guest user's token are rejected with HTTP 403.
Steps.Expected Result: API responds with HTTP 403 Forbidden and a suitable error message; no record is created.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Anagrafica Web Application (Backoffice) and Anagrafica API
test_cases.Preconditions: Test users with defined roles exist (guest_user, anagrafica_reader, anagrafica_editor); API access available for testing.
test_cases.Dataset: guest_user:testpwd, reader_user:testpwd, editor_user:testpwd; API tokens for each user
test_cases.Expected Result: System enforces role-based access: unauthorized users cannot access or modify records; authorized roles have appropriate access.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers role-based access checks for UI and API; detailed privilege escalation and SSO integration tests not covered.

test_cases.Title: SetGenre_XXX_REQ-SET-GENRE-SPA_Genere_Backoffice_TEST_Computer_successful_update

The Manifestazione EV-ES-1001 is correctly profiled in Brand Spain. E. Actor has performed a search so the list of Manifestazioni is populated.

test_cases.Title: SetGenre_XXX_REQ-SET-GENRE-SPA_Genere_Backoffice_TEST_Computer_forbidden_when_modification_not_allowed

test_cases.Title: SetGenre_XXX_REQ-SET-GENRE-SPA_Genere_Backoffice_TEST_Computer_cannot_set_when_manifestazione_not_profiled

test_cases.Title: SetGenre_XXX_REQ-SET-GENRE-SPA_Genere_Backoffice_TEST_Computer_search_list_not_populated_behavior

test_cases.Title: SetGenre_XXX_REQ-SET-GENRE-SPA_Genere_Backoffice_TEST_Computer_invalid_genre_validation

test_cases.Title: NoResultsMessage_XXX_Manifestazione_SearchApp_TEST_Computer_Verify no results message and options displayed

test_cases.Title: AbandonOption_XXX_Manifestazione_SearchApp_TEST_Computer_Verify abandon ends the operation

test_cases.Title: GenereBlank_XXX_REQ_Genere_Manifestazione_TEST_Computer_verify flow continues to step5

Steps.Step Description: Return to the manifestazione summary or review page and inspect the 'Genere' value for the created/edited record.

test_cases.Title: CancelAssignGenere_XXX_InterruzioneAssegnazioneGenere_WebApp_TEST_Computer_VerificaAnnullaRipristinoPrecedente

test_cases.Title: ErroreSalvataggio_XXX_REQ_SAVE_SaveFeature_TEST_Computer_Verify_toast_modal_on_save_error

Steps.Step Description: Login to the application with valid credentials and navigate to the editable resource/form where save operation is available.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and the editable form/resource is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Modify one or more fields in the form to produce unsaved changes.
Steps.Expected Result: Form shows unsaved changes (e.g., changed fields reflect new values).

Steps.Step Description: Simulate a save failure (e.g., configure backend to return HTTP 500, or disable network if applicable) and click the 'Save' button.
Steps.Expected Result: Client attempts to save and receives a failure response from the server (or network error occurs).

Steps.Step Description: Observe the client UI after the failed save attempt.
Steps.Expected Result: A modal toast (or modal dialog) is displayed informing the user that the save failed and that changes were NOT applied. The message text explicitly indicates failure and that modifications will not be applied. The modal contains at least the options to 'Retry' and 'Cancel' (or equivalent actions).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has a valid user account (testuser@example.com). 2) Tester is able to login. 3) Test environment where backend error can be simulated (stub/mock or ability to cut network). 4) The form/resource to edit exists and is accessible.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials: testuser@example.com / P@ssw0rd; Form data: Name='Test User', Address='123 Test St'; Backend stub configured to return HTTP 500 on save.
test_cases.Expected Result: When the save fails the client displays a modal toast indicating the save error and that changes were not applied, and presents actionable choices to the user (Retry and Cancel).
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates client-side user notification UI for save failures and presence of action buttons; does not validate server-side logs or downstream persistence beyond the error response.

test_cases.Title: RetryAfterErroreSalvataggio_XXX_REQ_SAVE_SaveFeature_TEST_Computer_Verify_retry_reinitiates_save_flow

Steps.Step Description: Ensure preconditions: user logged in, editable form open, changes made, and backend currently configured to cause a save failure on first attempt.
Steps.Expected Result: Form with unsaved changes is ready and backend is set to fail the initial save attempt.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' to trigger the save; confirm the failure toast/modal appears with 'Retry' option available.
Steps.Expected Result: Save fails and the modal toast appears showing the failure message and a 'Retry' action.

Steps.Step Description: Select the 'Retry' action in the modal toast. Before retrying, reconfigure backend to allow a successful save (or restore network connectivity) to simulate user retry after transient error.
Steps.Expected Result: The application re-initiates the save operation (returns to the save step of the workflow).

Steps.Step Description: Observe the behavior and result of the retry attempt.
Steps.Expected Result: The retry triggers a new save request. If backend now accepts the save, a success confirmation is shown and changes are persisted; the flow continues from Step 5 of the base path (i.e., the save step is re-executed). If backend still fails, the same failure modal is shown again.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Valid user account and login. 2) Editable resource with unsaved changes. 3) Ability to toggle backend response (fail then succeed) or toggle network connectivity.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials: testuser@example.com / P@ssw0rd; Form draft to be saved; Backend stub toggled from 500 to 200 to simulate transient failure then success.
test_cases.Expected Result: Selecting 'Retry' re-initiates the save flow (returns to the save step). If transient conditions are resolved the save succeeds and the user receives success confirmation; if not, the failure modal is shown again.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers retry behavior from client perspective; does not cover backend persistence verification beyond success acknowledgement.

test_cases.Title: CancelAfterErroreSalvataggio_XXX_REQ_SAVE_SaveFeature_TEST_Computer_Verify_cancel_discards_changes_and_terminates

Steps.Step Description: Login and open the editable form/resource; make one or more changes to create unsaved modifications.
Steps.Expected Result: Editable form with unsaved changes is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate save failure (backend error or network outage) and click 'Save' to trigger the failure modal/toast.
Steps.Expected Result: Save fails and the failure modal/toast is shown indicating changes were not applied and providing 'Retry' and 'Cancel' options.

Steps.Step Description: Select the 'Cancel' (Interrupt Operation) option on the failure modal/toast.
Steps.Expected Result: The application terminates the use case: the failure modal closes and the application navigates as defined by the use case termination (e.g., returns to the previous screen or main listing). Unsaved changes are not applied and are discarded.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that no changes were persisted and that the user is on the expected screen after termination.
Steps.Expected Result: The resource shows stored data unchanged (no persisted modifications). The user is on the expected post-termination screen (for example, the previous listing or dashboard) and the use case is considered terminated.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Valid user account. 2) Editable resource accessible. 3) Backend stub or network control to simulate save failure.
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials: testuser@example.com / P@ssw0rd; Form draft values; Backend returns 500 to simulate failure.
test_cases.Expected Result: Selecting 'Cancel' closes the error modal and terminates the use case; unsaved changes are not persisted and the user is returned to the expected screen.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates cancel/terminate branch of the save-failure alternate path from client perspective; does not validate server-side cleanup or audit logs.

test_cases.Title: ErroreSalvataggio_UIValidation_XXX_REQ_SAVE_SaveFeature_TEST_Computer_Verify_modal_text_and_buttons_enabled

Steps.Step Description: Open the editable form with unsaved changes and configure the environment so that a save attempt will fail.
Steps.Expected Result: Form is ready with unsaved changes and save attempt will fail on submission.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' to produce the failure modal/toast.
Steps.Expected Result: Failure modal/toast is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Validate the failure modal content: confirm exact message wording, presence of Retry and Cancel actions, and that both actions are enabled and accessible via keyboard and mouse (accessibility).
Steps.Expected Result: Modal text clearly states 'save not completed' and that modifications were not applied; both 'Retry' and 'Cancel' actions are visible, enabled, and reachable via keyboard (tab focus) and mouse click. The modal has appropriate ARIA roles if applicable.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to interact with both action controls and verify focus management and that no unexpected navigation occurs before action is chosen.
Steps.Expected Result: Selecting 'Retry' or 'Cancel' triggers their respective behaviors; focus returns to a sensible element after the modal closes. No unexpected navigation or errors occur when interacting with the modal controls.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Valid user account. 2) Editable form with unsaved changes. 3) Accessibility hooks enabled for verification (e.g., screen reader support optional).
test_cases.Dataset: User credentials: testuser@example.com / P@ssw0rd; Form draft values; Backend set to return failure on save.
test_cases.Expected Result: Failure modal text and controls meet UI and accessibility expectations: clear failure message, both action buttons present and enabled, keyboard focusable, and each action invokes the correct behavior.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI text correctness and accessibility of the error modal; does not cover backend error injection mechanism beyond causing the modal to appear.

test_cases.Title: AssegnazioneGenereMulti_XXX_PercorsoAlternativo_Backoffice_TEST_Computer_assign multiple genres via multi-selection

Steps.Step Description: Login to Backoffice with a valid user account that has permission to edit catalogue items.
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and Backoffice dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the catalogue list/grid containing the column 'Genere'.
Steps.Expected Result: Catalogue list/grid is displayed and the 'Genere' column is visible for items.

Steps.Step Description: Select a single catalogue row (item) to edit the 'Genere' cell or use the multi-edit control to open the 'Genere' selection modal for that row, following the same approach as 'assegnazione multipla categoria' but targeting the 'Genere' column.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Genere' multi-selection control/modal is opened for the selected item.

Steps.Step Description: In the 'Genere' multi-selection modal, choose multiple distinct genres (e.g., 'Azione', 'Drammatico', 'Commedia') from the available list and confirm the selection with the modal 'Save/OK' action.
Steps.Expected Result: The selected genres are shown as selected in the modal; on confirm the modal closes and the 'Genere' cell shows all selected genres (e.g., 'Azione; Drammatico; Commedia').

Steps.Step Description: Save changes for the item (if separate save action exists) or ensure inline changes are committed according to the UI workflow.
Steps.Expected Result: Changes are accepted by the system; a success notification is shown if applicable and no error is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Refresh the catalogue list or re-open the item edit view to verify persistence of the assigned genres.
Steps.Expected Result: All previously selected genres remain assigned to the item and are displayed correctly in the 'Genere' column/cell.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has valid Backoffice credentials with edit permissions. 2) At least one catalogue item exists with the 'Genere' column visible. 3) There are multiple genre values available in the system (e.g., Azione, Drammatico, Commedia).
test_cases.Dataset: User: backoffice_editor@example.com; ItemID: ITEM-1001; Available genres: ['Azione','Drammatico','Commedia','Romantico']
test_cases.Expected Result: The system allows selecting multiple genres for an item via the 'Genere' multi-selection control; selections persist after saving and are correctly displayed in the 'Genere' column.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – assegnazione campo 'Genere' tramite selezione multipla
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers successful assignment and persistence of multiple genres via the multi-selection control; does not cover bulk assignment across multiple items or API-level validation.

test_cases.Title: AssegnazioneGenereMultiDuplicates_XXX_PercorsoAlternativo_Backoffice_TEST_Computer_prevent duplicate genre assignments

Steps.Step Description: Login to Backoffice with valid edit permissions and open the catalogue item edit view for a specific item.
Steps.Expected Result: Item edit view is displayed and the 'Genere' multi-selection control is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Open the 'Genere' multi-selection modal/control and select a genre (e.g., 'Azione').
Steps.Expected Result: The genre 'Azione' is selected in the control/modal.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to select the same genre again (e.g., click 'Azione' a second time) or add it via any available duplicate-adding mechanism.
Steps.Expected Result: The UI either prevents selecting the same genre twice (no second selection toggle) or ignores duplicate selection; only one instance of 'Azione' is shown as selected.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm/save the selection and save the item changes.
Steps.Expected Result: The system accepts the selection and the 'Genere' field for the item shows 'Azione' only once (no duplicated entries).

Steps.Step Description: Refresh the item view or catalogue grid to verify that no duplicate genre entries are persisted.
Steps.Expected Result: The persisted 'Genere' value shows each assigned genre only once; no duplicate tokens or repeated values are present.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has valid Backoffice credentials with edit permissions. 2) At least one genre exists to select. 3) Target item exists in catalogue.
test_cases.Dataset: User: backoffice_editor@example.com; ItemID: ITEM-1002; Genre to test duplicates: 'Azione'
test_cases.Expected Result: System prevents or ignores duplicate genre selections so that each genre appears only once in the 'Genere' field after save and refresh.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – assegnazione campo 'Genere' tramite selezione multipla
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates duplicate selection handling for the 'Genere' multi-select control; does not validate backend DB deduplication beyond UI-visible behaviour.

test_cases.Title: AssegnazioneGenereMultiCancel_XXX_PercorsoAlternativo_Backoffice_TEST_Computer_cancel preserves original genres and returns to step6

Steps.Step Description: Login to Backoffice and open an item that already has one or more genres assigned.
Steps.Expected Result: Item edit view displays current 'Genere' values (baseline state).

Steps.Step Description: Open the 'Genere' multi-selection modal/control and change selections (add or remove genres) but do not confirm; instead click 'Cancel' or close the modal using the provided cancel/close action.
Steps.Expected Result: The modal closes and no changes are committed; the UI returns to the previous state for the item edit view.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the 'Genere' field shows the original genres unchanged and that no save action was triggered.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Genere' field content remains identical to the baseline state; no success notification about changes is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Follow the procedure to 'return to step 6 of the Percorso Base' as referenced by the requirement (i.e., navigate back to the screen/state specified as step 6 in the base path).
Steps.Expected Result: The application navigates back to the expected step 6 state of the base flow without applying the unconfirmed selections; the UI state matches what is expected for step 6.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has valid Backoffice credentials. 2) An item with pre-existing genres is available. 3) Tester knows how to reach 'step 6' of the base flow (as per documented base path).
test_cases.Dataset: User: backoffice_editor@example.com; ItemID: ITEM-1003; Baseline genres: ['Drammatico','Romantico']
test_cases.Expected Result: Canceling the multi-selection leaves the original 'Genere' assignments unchanged and the application correctly returns to the state corresponding to step 6 of the base path.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – assegnazione campo 'Genere' tramite selezione multipla
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers cancel behavior and navigation back to the referenced base path step; does not cover the content of step 6 beyond verifying navigation and state preservation.

test_cases.Title: ImpostaCategoria_XXX_Categoria_Form_Web_TEST_Computer_Select_valid_category

Steps.Step Description: Login to the web application with valid user credentials that have permission to edit the form containing the 'Categoria' field.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the form page containing the 'Categoria' field.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Categoria' dropdown control and select a valid category option from the list (e.g., 'Finanza').

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' (or equivalent) to persist the form.
Steps.Expected Result: System returns success indication (toast, message), and the form is saved without errors.

Steps.Step Description: Refresh the page and reopen the same form.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Categoria' field still displays the previously selected category 'Finanza', confirming persistence.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user account exists and has edit/save permissions. 2) Test data: available category options include 'Finanza'. 3) Network connectivity to TEST environment.

test_cases.Expected Result: A valid category can be selected and saved; the selected category is persisted after refresh.

test_cases.Title: ImpostaCategoria_XXX_Categoria_Form_Web_TEST_Computer_Save_without_selection_validation

Steps.Step Description: Login to the web application with valid user credentials and navigate to the form containing the 'Categoria' field.
Steps.Expected Result: Form is displayed; 'Categoria' field is visible and is either empty or set to default.

Steps.Step Description: Ensure no selection is made in the 'Categoria' field (leave blank or default).
Steps.Expected Result: 'Categoria' field remains unselected or blank.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to save the form by clicking 'Save' (or equivalent).
Steps.Expected Result: If the 'Categoria' field is required, validation prevents save and displays an inline validation message (e.g., 'Campo Categoria obbligatorio'); if optional, form saves successfully.

Steps.Step Description: If a validation error was shown, verify the message text and that the 'Categoria' field is highlighted.
Steps.Expected Result: Validation message is shown and field is highlighted according to UI spec; no server error occurs.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User account with form edit permission. 2) Knowledge whether 'Categoria' is required by business rule.
test_cases.Dataset: User: test.user@example.com; Business rule: Categoria required = TRUE (for validation scenario)
test_cases.Expected Result: System enforces required validation for 'Categoria' when applicable; shows proper validation message and prevents save.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI validation when no category selected; does not cover backend validation logs or optional-field variant in same test.

test_cases.Title: ImpostaCategoria_XXX_Categoria_Form_Web_TEST_Computer_Attempt_set_invalid_value

Steps.Step Description: Login and open the form containing the 'Categoria' field.
Steps.Expected Result: Form loads and 'Categoria' control is visible.

Steps.Step Description: If 'Categoria' control is a free-text input, enter an invalid/unexpected value containing special characters or a too-long string (e.g., 500 chars or '!!!@@@###'). If 'Categoria' is a dropdown, attempt to submit a modified request via browser dev tools/API to set an invalid category id (e.g., 'invalid-cat-id').
Steps.Expected Result: UI either prevents entry of invalid characters/length or accepts input; server-side rejects invalid category id with a clear error response (400/validation) and does not persist invalid value.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to save the form and observe client-side and server-side responses.
Steps.Expected Result: If client-side validation exists it blocks save with message; otherwise server returns validation error and the invalid value is not saved.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application + Browser Dev Tools
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User has edit permission. 2) Tester has access to browser dev tools or test API endpoints for manipulation.
test_cases.Dataset: Invalid inputs: '!!!@@@###', 500-char string, API payload with categoryId='invalid-cat-id'
test_cases.Expected Result: System prevents storing invalid/unauthorized category values; appropriate validation messages or server errors are returned.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client and server validation for invalid category values; does not include mass-injection or performance of validation under load.

test_cases.Title: ImpostaCategoria_XXX_Categoria_Form_Web_TEST_Computer_Change_category_and_audit

Steps.Step Description: Login with a user that can edit forms and has audit logging enabled for changes.
Steps.Expected Result: User can access form and auditing feature is active on server side.

Steps.Step Description: Open an existing saved form with an initial category 'Marketing'.

Steps.Step Description: Change the 'Categoria' selection to 'Operations' and save the form.
Steps.Expected Result: Form saves successfully and shows confirmation.

Steps.Step Description: Verify in the UI that the category now shows 'Operations', then query the audit/log area or backend (if permitted) to check that a record of category change exists including previous value, new value, user and timestamp.
Steps.Expected Result: UI displays 'Operations'; audit log shows an entry: previous='Marketing', new='Operations', changedBy=test.user, timestamp present.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Audit logging feature enabled in TEST environment. 2) Tester has read access to audit logs. 3) Existing form with category 'Marketing'.
test_cases.Dataset: Form ID: FORM-12345; User: auditor.user@example.com
test_cases.Expected Result: Category change persists and corresponding audit log entry is created with correct details.

test_cases.Title: ImpostaCategoria_XXX_Categoria_Form_Web_TEST_Smartphone_Mobile_responsive_selection

Steps.Step Description: Open the application web page on a smartphone device (or emulator) and login with valid credentials.

test_cases.Title: ImpostaCategoria_XXX_Categoria_Form_Web_TEST_Computer_Permission_denied_no_edit

test_cases.Title: ImpostaCategoria_XXX_Categoria_Form_Web_TEST_Computer_Keyboard_accessibility_and_tab_flow

test_cases.Title: SetCategoriaSingleManifestazione_XXX_REQ-SET-CATEGORIA_CategoriaManifestazioni/Backoffice_TEST_Computer_Set single manifestation category

Steps.Step Description: Open the Backoffice application and log in with a user account that has permission to edit Manifestazioni.
Steps.Expected Result: Backoffice home/dashboard is displayed and user is logged in.

Steps.Step Description: From the brand selector, choose the Brand 'Spain' (Spagna).
Steps.Expected Result: The context switches to Brand Spain and the list of Manifestazioni for Spain is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Locate a single Manifestazione in the list (e.g., Manifestazione ID: M-SP-001) and click the 'Edit' action for that Manifestazione.
Steps.Expected Result: Edit form for the selected Manifestazione is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: In the Edit form, find the 'Categoria' field (dropdown) and select a valid category value (e.g., 'Concert').
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Categoria' dropdown accepts the selection and displays 'Concert' as selected.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' or 'Update' to persist the change.
Steps.Expected Result: A success message is shown (e.g., 'Changes saved successfully') and the edit form closes or refreshes.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the Manifestazione list shows the updated Categoria for the Manifestazione M-SP-001 and, if possible, open the Manifestazione detail view to confirm.
Steps.Expected Result: The Manifestazione shows Categoria = 'Concert' in list and detail view.

Steps.Step Description: Optionally, verify back-end persistence by querying the API or database for Manifestazione M-SP-001 and checking the 'categoria' field.
Steps.Expected Result: The API/database returns categoria = 'Concert' for Manifestazione M-SP-001.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester has valid backoffice credentials with edit permissions. 2) At least one Manifestazione exists under Brand 'Spain' (example M-SP-001). 3) Network access to application and backend services is available.

test_cases.Title: SetCategoriaMultipleManifestazioni_XXX_REQ-SET-CATEGORIA_CategoriaManifestazioni/Backoffice_TEST_Computer_Set multiple manifestations category (bulk edit)

Steps.Step Description: Select Brand 'Spain' from brand selector to filter Manifestazioni for Spain.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm the bulk update and wait for the operation to complete.
Steps.Expected Result: Success message is displayed indicating number of updated Manifestazioni (e.g., '3 Manifestazioni updated').

Steps.Step Description: Verify the Manifestazioni list and individual detail views show Categoria = 'Theatre' for M-SP-002, M-SP-003, M-SP-004 and that backend records reflect the change.
Steps.Expected Result: All selected Manifestazioni show the updated Categoria and backend queries confirm persistence.

test_cases.Expected Result: User can update the Categoria for multiple Manifestazioni in Brand Spain in a single bulk operation and changes are persisted.

test_cases.Title: SetCategoriaInvalidValue_XXX_REQ-SET-CATEGORIA_CategoriaManifestazioni/Backoffice_TEST_Computer_Attempt to set invalid category value

test_cases.Title: SetCategoriaPermissionDenied_XXX_REQ-SET-CATEGORIA_CategoriaManifestazioni/Backoffice_TEST_Computer_User without permission cannot set category

test_cases.Title: SetCategoriaPersistenceAndAudit_XXX_REQ-SET-CATEGORIA_CategoriaManifestazioni/Backoffice_TEST_Computer_Verify persistence and audit log on category change

Steps.Step Description: Log in to Backoffice as an editor user and select Brand 'Spain'.

Steps.Expected Result: Audit entry exists showing the edit performed by the editor user with timestamp and changed field details.

test_cases.Title: DeleteAnagrafica_XXX_AttorePrincipale_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_Remove user record

Steps.Step Description: Log in with an account that has delete privileges (e.g., admin.user / Admin@123).
Steps.Expected Result: Admin user authenticated and dashboard displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Anagrafica, locate the target user record intended for deletion (ensure this is a safe test record), and initiate the delete action (click 'Delete' or trash icon).
Steps.Expected Result: A delete confirmation prompt/modal appears describing the deletion action.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm the delete action on the prompt by selecting 'Confirm' or 'Yes'.
Steps.Expected Result: System proceeds with deletion and displays a success notification (e.g., 'User deleted successfully').

Steps.Step Description: Search the Anagrafica list for the deleted user's Fiscal Code or email to confirm removal from list.
Steps.Expected Result: Deleted user no longer appears in the Anagrafica list; search returns no results.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the deleted user's details URL/ID directly (if accessible) to verify proper handling.
Steps.Expected Result: System returns 'Not Found' or displays an appropriate error/message indicating the resource does not exist.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Admin account with delete rights. 2) A dedicated test user record exists and is marked safe to delete. 3) Backup/process to restore deleted records if needed for subsequent tests.
test_cases.Dataset: Admin credentials: admin.user / Admin@123; Target test user fiscal code for deletion.
test_cases.Expected Result: Target user record is removed from the system and cannot be retrieved; deletion confirmation displayed and direct access returns appropriate not-found response.

test_cases.Title: PermissionsAnagrafica_XXX_AttorePrincipale_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_Access control enforcement

Steps.Step Description: Log in with a limited user account that should not have create/edit/delete permissions (e.g., limited.user / Limited@123).
Steps.Expected Result: Limited user is authenticated and dashboard is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the Anagrafica module.
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica list is displayed but UI controls for create/edit/delete are not visible or are disabled.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to access the create user page URL directly by entering its path in the browser or attempt to invoke create via API call with the limited user's session token.
Steps.Expected Result: Access is denied (HTTP 403 or application-level access denied message) and create action is not allowed.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to open an existing record and click 'Edit' or 'Delete'.
Steps.Expected Result: Edit/Delete actions are disabled or if invoked, result in access denied error; no changes are allowed.

Steps.Step Description: Log out and log back in as an admin to ensure the operations were not applied by the limited user.
Steps.Expected Result: No unauthorized changes were made to the Anagrafica data; audit/logs show attempted denied access entries for the limited user.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Limited user account exists with restricted permissions. 2) Admin user available to verify absence of unauthorized changes. 3) Security/audit logging enabled in the environment.
test_cases.Dataset: Limited credentials: limited.user / Limited@123; Admin credentials: admin.user / Admin@123.
test_cases.Expected Result: Users without appropriate privileges cannot perform restricted operations; UI hides/disables controls and backend prevents unauthorized requests, logging denied attempts.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates front-end and basic back-end enforcement; does not perform exhaustive role-matrix coverage for all roles.

test_cases.Title: CreatePerson_XXX_Anagrafica_AddRecord_TEST_Computer_Create a new person record in Anagrafica

Steps.Step Description: Open the Anagrafica application and log in with a valid user (role with create permissions).
Steps.Expected Result: Anagrafica application main dashboard is displayed and user is authenticated.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'New Person' (Nuovo) form in the Anagrafica module.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'New Person' entry form is displayed with fields for Nome, Cognome, Data di nascita, Codice Fiscale, Email and Telefono.

Steps.Step Description: Enter valid data in all mandatory fields: Nome='Mario', Cognome='Rossi', Data di nascita='1985-05-10', Codice Fiscale='RSSMRA85E10H501U', Email='mario.rossi@example.com', Telefono='0123456789'.
Steps.Expected Result: All entered values are shown correctly in the form and no inline validation error messages are displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Save' (Salva) button.
Steps.Expected Result: The system saves the record, displays a success message (e.g., 'Anagrafica salvata con successo') and returns to the person list or shows the created person details.

Steps.Step Description: Search for the created person by Codice Fiscale in the Anagrafica search bar.
Steps.Expected Result: The recently created person 'Mario Rossi' is found and the details match the saved values.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user account exists with create permissions. 2) Anagrafica application is accessible and database is reachable. 3) No existing record with Codice Fiscale 'RSSMRA85E10H501U'.
test_cases.Dataset: Nome=Mario; Cognome=Rossi; DataNascita=1985-05-10; CodiceFiscale=RSSMRA85E10H501U; Email=mario.rossi@example.com; Telefono=0123456789
test_cases.Expected Result: New person record is persisted in Anagrafica and retrievable via search, with displayed fields matching the input data.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers successful creation flow; file attachments and advanced attributes not included.

test_cases.Title: MandatoryFieldsValidation_XXX_Anagrafica_FieldValidation_TEST_Computer_Verify required fields validation on new record

Steps.Step Description: Enter an invalid email format 'mario[at]example' and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Email validation prevents save and an inline error is shown (e.g., 'Email non valida').

test_cases.Expected Result: Mandatory field validation prevents saving incomplete or incorrectly formatted data; appropriate error messages are displayed.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client-side and server-side validation for main fields; locale-specific edge-cases not included.

test_cases.Title: DuplicatePrevention_XXX_Anagrafica_DuplicateCheck_TEST_Computer_Verify duplicate Codice Fiscale handling

Steps.Step Description: Ensure there is an existing person record with Codice Fiscale 'RSSMRA85E10H501U' in Anagrafica.
Steps.Expected Result: Existing record is present in the system.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to create a new person with the same Codice Fiscale 'RSSMRA85E10H501U' and other arbitrary valid data.
Steps.Expected Result: The system detects the duplicate Codice Fiscale and prevents creation by showing a clear error (e.g., 'Record con lo stesso codice fiscale già presente').

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to edit a different existing person and change their Codice Fiscale to 'RSSMRA85E10H501U' and save.
Steps.Expected Result: The system prevents the update and displays an error indicating duplicate Codice Fiscale.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the original record remains unchanged after failed create/update attempts.
Steps.Expected Result: Original record is intact and no duplicate record was created or modified.

test_cases.Preconditions: At least one person exists with the target Codice Fiscale; user has create/edit permissions.
test_cases.Dataset: Existing CodiceFiscale=RSSMRA85E10H501U; New attempt uses same CodiceFiscale
test_cases.Expected Result: System blocks creation or update leading to duplicate Codice Fiscale and shows explanatory error; data integrity preserved.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers Codice Fiscale uniqueness check; checks for duplicates across merged datasets not covered.

test_cases.Title: SearchFilter_XXX_Anagrafica_SearchAndFilter_TEST_Computer_Verify search and filter functionality

Steps.Step Description: Open the Anagrafica list view where search and filters are available.

Steps.Expected Result: Results list shows all records with Cognome containing 'Ros' (case-insensitive), and no unrelated records are returned.

test_cases.Title: ImpostaManifestazione_XXX_Precondizioni_BrandSpagnaApp_TEST_Desktop_set Manifestazione successfully

Steps.Step Description: Select a Manifestazione that is correctly profiled in Brand Spain (precondition D) from the results list and click 'Edit' or 'Modify'.

Steps.Step Description: Change the 'Manifestazione' field to a new valid value (e.g., 'Manifestazione Primavera 2026') and click 'Save'.

Steps.Step Description: Refresh the Manifestazione details or re-open the Manifestazione from the results list to verify persistence.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Manifestazione' field shows the updated value 'Manifestazione Primavera 2026' and the change is persisted.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application - Brand Spain Backoffice
test_cases.Preconditions:
A. Actor is logged into the application.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application - Brand Spain Backoffice

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application - Brand Spain Backoffice

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application - Brand Spain Backoffice

test_cases.Title: ImpostaManifestazione_XXX_Precondizioni_InputValidation_BrandSpagna_TEST_Desktop_invalid input validation

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application - Brand Spain Backoffice
test_cases.Preconditions:
A. Actor is logged into the application.

C. Actor is enabled to modify within Brand Spain.

test_cases.Title: NoResultsMessage_XXX_ManifestazioneNonTrovata_Search_TEST_Computer_Verify no-results message and options displayed
