Steps.Expected Result: Search is executed and results area shows no entries.

Steps.Step Description: Observe the message area and available actions on the no-results view.
Steps.Expected Result: A clear message is displayed indicating no results were found (for example: 'Nessuna manifestazione trovata' or equivalent). UI shows actionable options to either 'Esegui una nuova ricerca' (New Search) and 'Abbandona' (Abandon) or similar controls.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that no result items are shown in the results list and that the results count is zero or absent.
Steps.Expected Result: Results list is empty and any results count indicator shows 0 or is not present; only the no-results message and the two actions are visible.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Application is accessible. 2) Tester has access to the Search page (base path step 1). 3) No backend errors; search index/state is stable. 4) Test query does not exist in the dataset.
test_cases.Dataset: Search query: 'manifestazione_non_esistente_12345' (a query known to return zero results)
test_cases.Expected Result: When the search returns no matches the application shows a 'no results found' message and provides the user with options to start a new search or abandon the operation.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only the alternate path where no search results are found and the UI presentation of options; does not validate backend search algorithms or indexing.

test_cases.Title: NewSearchAction_XXX_ManifestazioneNonTrovata_Search_TEST_Computer_Verify new search returns to base step

Steps.Step Description: Start from the no-results view (precondition: a search has been executed and no results are displayed).
Steps.Expected Result: No-results view is displayed with message and actionable controls 'Esegui una nuova ricerca' and 'Abbandona'.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Esegui una nuova ricerca' (New Search) action/button/link.
Steps.Expected Result: The application navigates to the search input state corresponding to base path step 1 (search input is focused or displayed and ready for new input).

Steps.Step Description: Verify the search input is cleared or reset to the expected initial state and that any previous filters or results are not active.
Steps.Expected Result: Search field is empty or reset to default, filters cleared as per base step 1 behavior, and no previous results are displayed. User can enter a new query to perform another search.

Steps.Step Description: Perform a different valid search to confirm the application allows continuing from the returned-to-base state.
Steps.Expected Result: New search executes normally and shows results (if any) or the no-results view again, confirming navigation returned to the base search state.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Application is accessible. 2) Tester has reached the no-results view by executing a search that returned zero matches.
test_cases.Dataset: Initial no-result query: 'manifestazione_non_esistente_12345'; follow-up valid query: 'manifestazione_valida_example'.
test_cases.Expected Result: Clicking 'Esegui una nuova ricerca' returns the user to the initial search state (base step 1) with inputs reset and ready for a new search.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates only the navigation from no-results view to base search state; does not cover persistence of prior filters beyond this transition.

test_cases.Title: AbandonAction_XXX_ManifestazioneNonTrovata_Search_TEST_Computer_Verify abandon terminates operation

Steps.Step Description: Start from the no-results view (a search has been executed and no results are displayed).
Steps.Expected Result: No-results view is displayed with message and actionable controls 'Esegui una nuova ricerca' and 'Abbandona'.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Abbandona' (Abandon) action/button/link.
Steps.Expected Result: The application performs the abandon operation which terminates the use case: the user is returned to the expected destination (e.g., previous page, home/dashboard) or the search dialog is closed, consistent with the product behavior specification.

Steps.Step Description: Verify there are no lingering search states (no open modals, no active search in progress) and that the application context corresponds to the abandonment outcome defined by the product.
Steps.Expected Result: Search dialog or screen is closed and the user is placed on the expected page (previous page or home). No background search activity remains and UI is stable.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to use the UI to continue the previous search without explicitly re-entering the search flow (e.g., verify search did not automatically continue).
Steps.Expected Result: There is no automatic continuation of the previous search; the operation is considered terminated per the use case.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Application is accessible. 2) Tester has reached the no-results view by executing a search that returned zero matches.
test_cases.Dataset: Initial no-result query: 'manifestazione_non_esistente_12345'.
test_cases.Expected Result: Clicking 'Abbandona' terminates the use case and returns the user to the designated page/context; no residual search state remains.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only the abandon action behavior from the no-results alternate path; does not validate downstream navigation destinations beyond confirming the operation terminates.

test_cases.Title: CategoriaPrefill_XXX_PercorsoAlternativo_Categoria_TEST_Computer_Verify prefilled category proceeds to step5

Steps.Step Description: Ensure tester is authenticated with a user account that has permission to view/edit the entity form.
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and lands on the application main dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the entity (e.g., practice/workflow) creation/modification form where the 'Categoria' field is present for the specific entity ID 'ENT-12345'.
Steps.Expected Result: The form for entity 'ENT-12345' is displayed and the section containing the 'Categoria' field is visible.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the 'Categoria' field value is pre-populated with the previously assigned category value 'Finance' (per precondition dataset).
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Categoria' field displays the value 'Finance' and it matches the expected pre-assigned value.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Next' or 'Proceed' button to continue the workflow (this action corresponds to moving to the next step in the base path).
Steps.Expected Result: The application accepts the current form state and navigates to the screen corresponding to step 5 of the base path.

Steps.Step Description: On the Step 5 screen, verify that the category value 'Finance' has been carried over and is visible in the context where category is required (summary, header, or hidden field).
Steps.Expected Result: Step 5 screen is displayed and the 'Categoria' value 'Finance' is present and consistent with the pre-filled value from the previous step.

Steps.Step Description: Complete Step 5 actions as needed (e.g., confirm/save) and submit final data.
Steps.Expected Result: Submission completes successfully; the final saved record retains the 'Categoria' value 'Finance'.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test account with appropriate permissions exists and is available. 2) Entity with ID 'ENT-12345' exists and has a pre-assigned category value 'Finance'. 3) Network connectivity to TEST environment. 4) Tester is logged in and has opened the form for 'ENT-12345'.
test_cases.Dataset: Entity ID: ENT-12345; Pre-assigned Category: 'Finance'; User: test.user@example.com (password stored in test vault).
test_cases.Expected Result: When 'Categoria' is already assigned, the system displays the prefilled value and the workflow proceeds to step 5 of the base path, preserving the category value in subsequent steps.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only the alternative path where 'Categoria' is prefilled and continuation to step 5; does not cover validation of category list population or base path steps 1-4 in detail.

test_cases.Title: CategoriaPrefill_ReadOnly_XXX_PercorsoAlternativo_Categoria_TEST_Computer_Verify prefilled category is displayed as read-only and allows continuation to step5

Steps.Step Description: Login with a user account that can view the entity form where 'Categoria' is present.
Steps.Expected Result: User authenticated and dashboard displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Open the form for the entity with pre-assigned category 'HR' (use entity ID 'ENT-54321').
Steps.Expected Result: Form for 'ENT-54321' is displayed and 'Categoria' field is visible showing 'HR'.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to modify the 'Categoria' field value by typing or selecting a different option.
Steps.Expected Result: The field is disabled or marked as read-only (grayed out) and user input is not accepted; if a tooltip/message exists it indicates 'previously assigned category'.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Next' or 'Proceed' to continue the workflow to step 5.
Steps.Expected Result: Application navigates to step 5 of the base path without prompting for category change.

Steps.Step Description: On step 5, verify that the workflow shows or uses the pre-assigned category 'HR' and that no inconsistency occurred due to the read-only state.
Steps.Expected Result: Step 5 displays 'HR' as the effective category; the workflow proceeds normally.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Entity 'ENT-54321' exists with pre-assigned category 'HR'. 2) Test user can access the entity form. 3) UI supports display of read-only controls.
test_cases.Dataset: Entity ID: ENT-54321; Pre-assigned Category: 'HR'; User account with viewer/editor permissions.
test_cases.Expected Result: If the 'Categoria' field is previously assigned and marked read-only, the UI prevents editing and the flow proceeds to step 5 maintaining the pre-assigned category.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates read-only behavior for pre-assigned 'Categoria' and progression to step 5; does not cover permissions management or audit logging of changes.

test_cases.Title: CategoriaPrefill_InvalidValue_XXX_PercorsoAlternativo_Categoria_TEST_Computer_Verify warning when prefilled category is invalid and block/handle progression

Steps.Step Description: Prepare an entity with a pre-assigned category value not present in the current allowed category list (e.g., 'DeprecatedCategory') using entity ID 'ENT-99999'.
Steps.Expected Result: Entity 'ENT-99999' exists in the TEST environment with pre-assigned Category='DeprecatedCategory'.

Steps.Step Description: Login and open the form for 'ENT-99999' where the 'Categoria' field is displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: Form is displayed and the 'Categoria' field shows 'DeprecatedCategory'.

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Next' or 'Proceed' to advance the workflow (attempt to go to step 5).
Steps.Expected Result: The application performs validation and either shows a validation warning/error about an invalid/unrecognized category or presents a remediation option (e.g., prompt to select a valid category).

Steps.Step Description: If a warning is shown, verify the message text clearly indicates the category is invalid and instructs the user on corrective action; verify that progression to step 5 is blocked until the issue is resolved.
Steps.Expected Result: A clear validation message is displayed; the user cannot proceed to step 5 until a valid category is selected or the invalid assignment is explicitly acknowledged per business rules.

Steps.Step Description: Resolve the invalid category by selecting a valid category from the list (e.g., change to 'Finance') and click 'Next' to continue.
Steps.Expected Result: After selecting a valid category, the application allows progression to step 5 and the selected valid category is used in subsequent steps.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Entity ENT-99999 exists with pre-assigned Category='DeprecatedCategory' which is not present in the allowed categories list. 2) Tester has permissions to edit/resolve the category if required.
test_cases.Functionality: Categoria validation / Error handling / Workflow continuity
test_cases.Dataset: Entity ID: ENT-99999; Pre-assigned Category: 'DeprecatedCategory'; Valid categories list includes: ['Finance','HR','Operations'].
test_cases.Expected Result: When a prefilled 'Categoria' is invalid, the system warns the user and blocks automatic continuation to step 5 until a valid category is selected or corrective action is taken; after correction, progression to step 5 is allowed and the corrected category is retained.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers validation and error handling for invalid pre-assigned category values and subsequent allowance to proceed after correction; does not test category list management or backend clean-up processes.

test_cases.Title: InterruzioneAssegnazioneCategoria_XXX_REQ-ALT-CAT_AssegnazioneCategoria_WEB_TEST_Computer_PressAnnulla_closes_popup_no_change

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the application with a user who has permission to assign the 'Categoria' field. Navigate to the record/detail page that shows the current 'Categoria' value (example: 'Category A').
Steps.Expected Result: User is logged in and the record page is displayed. The current 'Categoria' value is visible and is 'Category A'.

Steps.Step Description: Click the control/button to assign or change the 'Categoria' field to open the assignment popup/modal.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Assegna Categoria' popup/modal is displayed with the list of available categories and the current selection (if any).

Steps.Step Description: In the popup, select a different category (example: select 'Category B') but do NOT confirm/save.
Steps.Expected Result: The alternative category selection is shown in the popup as selected (visually indicated) but nothing has been saved yet.

Steps.Step Description: Press the 'Annulla' button inside the popup.
Steps.Expected Result: The popup/modal closes immediately and no success/toast message about assignment is shown.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the 'Categoria' value shown on the record/detail page after the popup is closed.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Categoria' value remains unchanged (still 'Category A'). There is no indication that the category was updated.

Steps.Step Description: If network monitoring or devtools is available, review network calls during the operation to check for any request that would persist the category change.
Steps.Expected Result: No API call that applies/commits the category change (e.g., PATCH/PUT to update the record's category) has been sent after pressing 'Annulla'.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user account exists with permission to view and assign 'Categoria'. 2) Test record exists with initial 'Categoria' = 'Category A'. 3) Tester has access to browser devtools or network monitoring (optional for step 6). 4) Application is reachable and logged in.
test_cases.Dataset: User: test.user@example.com / PW: ********; Record ID: REC-12345; Initial Categoria: 'Category A'; Alternate Categoria to select: 'Category B'
test_cases.Expected Result: When the user presses 'Annulla', the assignment popup is closed and the 'Categoria' of the record remains unchanged (Category A). No backend update request is performed.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Interruzione operazione di assegnazione campo 'Categoria'
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only the alternative flow where the user cancels the assignment via the 'Annulla' button; does not cover save/confirm flow or keyboard shortcuts.

test_cases.Title: InterruzioneAssegnazioneCategoria_XXX_REQ-ALT-CAT_AssegnazioneCategoria_WEB_TEST_Computer_PressX_closes_popup_no_change

Steps.Step Description: Log in to the application with a user who has permission to assign 'Categoria' and open the detail page for a record whose 'Categoria' is 'Category A'.
Steps.Expected Result: Detail page is displayed with 'Categoria' = 'Category A'.

Steps.Step Description: Open the 'Assegna Categoria' popup/modal by clicking the assign control.
Steps.Expected Result: The assignment popup/modal appears showing available categories and current selection.

Steps.Step Description: Change the selection in the popup to another category (for test purposes select 'Category B'), but do not click save/confirm.
Steps.Expected Result: The popup shows 'Category B' as selected inside the modal, changes are local to the popup.

Steps.Step Description: Click the close icon 'x' (top-right of the modal) to close the popup.
Steps.Expected Result: The popup/modal closes and control returns to the record/detail page. No confirmation dialog is displayed (unless system design dictates otherwise).

Steps.Step Description: Validate that the record's displayed 'Categoria' remains 'Category A' and that no success notification is shown.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Categoria' remains 'Category A'. No success/toast message indicating update is present.

Steps.Step Description: Check the audit trail or last-updated timestamp for the record (if available) to confirm no update occurred while performing the cancel via 'x'.
Steps.Expected Result: Audit trail / last-updated timestamp remains unchanged or shows no update attributable to the canceled action.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) User with assignment permission is logged in. 2) Test record exists with 'Categoria' = 'Category A'. 3) Audit trail/last-updated info is accessible for verification.
test_cases.Dataset: User: test.user@example.com; Record ID: REC-12345; Initial Categoria: 'Category A'; Candidate Categoria: 'Category B'
test_cases.Expected Result: Clicking the 'x' close icon interrupts the assignment operation: popup closes, the record's 'Categoria' remains unchanged, and no update is recorded.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Interruzione operazione di assegnazione campo 'Categoria'
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates canceling via the modal's close icon only; does not test keyboard Escape or clicking outside the modal.

test_cases.Title: InterruzioneAssegnazioneCategoria_XXX_REQ-ALT-CAT_AssegnazioneCategoria_WEB_TEST_Computer_AutoVerify_no_backend_update_on_cancel

Steps.Step Description: Using an automated test tool or script, authenticate to the system and navigate to the target record (Record ID: REC-12345) where current 'Categoria' = 'Category A'.
Steps.Expected Result: Automation session authenticated and record page loaded showing 'Categoria' = 'Category A'.

Steps.Step Description: Programmatically open the 'Assegna Categoria' popup/modal.
Steps.Expected Result: Popup/modal is visible and ready for interaction.

Steps.Step Description: Select a different category in the popup (e.g., 'Category B') but do not trigger confirm/save.
Steps.Expected Result: Popup shows 'Category B' as selected; no persistence has occurred yet.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger the cancel action by clicking the 'Annulla' button (automation should simulate user click).
Steps.Expected Result: Popup closes and focus returns to the record page.

Steps.Step Description: Automatically query the backend via available API (GET record) or the database to retrieve the current 'Categoria' for REC-12345.
Steps.Expected Result: Backend returns 'Categoria' = 'Category A' (unchanged).

Steps.Step Description: Inspect network logs captured during the test to ensure no write operations (PATCH/PUT/POST) relating to 'Categoria' were sent after the popup opened and before/after cancel.
Steps.Expected Result: No write/update API call to change 'Categoria' is present; only reads (GET) or UI static assets calls are observed.

test_cases.Reference System: Windows 10, Web Application - Backoffice Module; API/DB access for verification
test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test automation account has API access and UI access. 2) Record REC-12345 exists with Categoria 'Category A'. 3) API credentials and DB read-access available to verify record state. 4) Network capture enabled for the automation run.
test_cases.Dataset: Automation credentials; Record ID: REC-12345; Initial Categoria: 'Category A'; Selected Categoria: 'Category B'; API endpoint: /api/records/REC-12345
test_cases.Expected Result: Automated scenario confirms that canceling the assignment (via 'Annulla') closes the popup and no backend update occurs: the record still has 'Categoria' = 'Category A' and no write requests were issued.
test_cases._polarion: Percorso alternativo – Interruzione operazione di assegnazione campo 'Categoria'
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Automatic verification of backend state after cancel; does not simulate other UI cancel variants like Esc key or clicking outside modal.

test_cases.Title: SaveErrorRetry_XXX_PercorsoAlternativo_SaveFunction_Web_TEST_Computer_Return_to_step5_on_retry

Steps.Step Description: Precondition check: Ensure tester is logged into the web application and navigated to the form/page where changes can be made (the base flow up to step 5). Prepare a set of unsaved modifications on the form.
Steps.Expected Result: Tester is authenticated and the form contains unsaved modifications ready to be saved.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Save' button to submit the changes.
Steps.Expected Result: Client sends save request to server.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate server-side failure for the save request (e.g., force 5xx response or return explicit save-failure payload).
Steps.Expected Result: Client receives save-failure response and displays an error message indicating 'save not completed, modifications will not be applied' with actionable choices (e.g., 'Retry' and 'Cancel').

Steps.Step Description: Verify that no changes have been applied on the server (check via API GET or DB read of the resource before retry).
Steps.Expected Result: Server state shows the previous persisted data; the attempted modifications are NOT present.

Steps.Step Description: From the error dialog, select the 'Retry' option to attempt the operation again (this should correspond to going back to base flow step 5).
Steps.Expected Result: Application returns to the form/state equivalent to base flow step 5 with the previously entered data still present and the 'Save' button enabled; user can re-attempt save.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt a second save: click 'Save' again and this time simulate a successful server response (200 OK or success payload).
Steps.Expected Result: Save completes successfully, server shows updated data, and UI displays confirmation of successful save (e.g., toast or success screen).

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester account exists and is logged in. 2) Tester has access to the editable form. 3) Baseline server state is known (record resource state before the test). 4) Ability to simulate server responses (failure and success) is available.
test_cases.Dataset: User: test.user@example.com; Form with fields: {name: 'Test Name', address: 'Test Address'}; Server simulation: first response 500, second response 200.
test_cases.Expected Result: When save fails the client shows the correct error message and options; selecting 'Retry' returns the user to the editable state (base flow step 5) with data preserved allowing a new save attempt; the initial failed save did not apply any changes server-side.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI behavior for retry alternative path and server-state verification for a single retry; does not cover multi-user concurrency or long-running transactions.

test_cases.Title: SaveErrorCancel_XXX_PercorsoAlternativo_SaveFunction_Web_TEST_Computer_End_usecase_on_cancel

Steps.Step Description: Precondition: Tester is logged into the web application and on the editable form with unsaved modifications prepared (base flow up to step 5).
Steps.Expected Result: Tester is on the form with unsaved modifications.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Save' button to send the save request to the server.
Steps.Expected Result: Client issues the save request to the server.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate/save response as failure (server returns an error indicating save did not complete).
Steps.Expected Result: Client displays error message that save did not occur and that modifications will not be applied; options presented include 'Retry' and 'Cancel'.

Steps.Step Description: From the error message, select the 'Cancel' (or 'Interrompere l'Operazione') option to terminate the operation.
Steps.Expected Result: The use case terminates: the error dialog closes and the application navigates to the defined end state (for this application the expected behavior is to return to the previous stable screen or main page).

Steps.Step Description: Verify server-side data to confirm that no modifications were applied during the failed save attempt.
Steps.Expected Result: Server data remains unchanged compared to the baseline captured before starting the test; modifications attempted were not persisted.

Steps.Step Description: Verify client state after termination: confirm if unsaved changes are cleared or left in UI per product specification (record actual behavior).
Steps.Expected Result: Application either clears unsaved modifications or displays them as non-persistent draft based on product specification. In all cases, no saved changes are present on the server.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Valid tester session. 2) Baseline snapshot of server data. 3) Ability to simulate server error responses.
test_cases.Dataset: User: test.user@example.com; Form changes: {phone: '+3900000000'}; Server simulated response: 500 error.
test_cases.Expected Result: When save fails and the user chooses to cancel, the use case ends and no modifications are applied server-side; application navigates to the defined termination state and preserves or clears local draft per specification.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates cancel branch of the alternative path and server-state integrity; does not cover subsequent user navigation beyond immediate termination behavior.

test_cases.Title: SaveErrorMessageValidation_XXX_PercorsoAlternativo_SaveFunction_Web_TEST_Computer_Message_content_and_persistence

Steps.Step Description: Precondition: Log into the web application and open the editable form with unsaved modifications. Ensure localization is set to Italian (if supported).
Steps.Expected Result: Tester is on the form page with unsaved changes and locale verified.

Steps.Step Description: Trigger a save action by clicking the 'Save' button.
Steps.Expected Result: Client sends save request to server.

Steps.Step Description: Simulate server returning a save-failure response. Observe the error UI component that appears.
Steps.Expected Result: An error message is displayed to the user with content indicating that the save did not complete and that modifications will not be applied. The message includes clear options for 'Retry' and 'Cancel' (label text should match product spec/localization).

Steps.Step Description: Validate the error message text against expected copy: in Italian it should communicate failure and that changes will not be applied; verify presence and labels of actionable buttons.
Steps.Expected Result: Error text matches expected localized string (e.g., 'Salvataggio non avvenuto correttamente. Le modifiche non saranno applicate.'). Buttons 'Riprova' (or 'Retry') and 'Annulla' (or 'Cancel') are present and accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Without taking any action, wait for a timeout period (e.g., 60 seconds) and verify whether the error message persists or auto-dismisses.
Steps.Expected Result: Error message persists until user action (should NOT auto-dismiss) per requirement; it remains visible and actionable.

Steps.Step Description: Test keyboard accessibility: focus must be on the error dialog; use keyboard to select 'Retry' and 'Cancel' and verify they trigger the correct flows.
Steps.Expected Result: Keyboard navigation focuses controls; pressing Enter/Space activates the selected action; 'Retry' returns to editable form state, 'Cancel' terminates per TC-002 behavior.

Steps.Step Description: If automation is available, assert programmatically that the client did not apply changes on the server after the failed save (API check).
Steps.Expected Result: Server data remains unchanged; no partial or corrupted data persisted.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test user logged in. 2) Localization to Italian active. 3) Capability to simulate server error responses. 4) Baseline server data snapshot.
test_cases.Dataset: User: localization.it@example.com; Form content sample: {email: 'test.it@example.com'}; Server simulated save failure.
test_cases.Expected Result: On save failure the client displays the correct localized error message with 'Retry' and 'Cancel' options; the message persists until user action; accessibility controls are operable; no changes are applied server-side.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI copy, localization, persistence of dialog, keyboard accessibility and server-state verification for a single failure; does not include exhaustive internationalization coverage for all locales.

test_cases.Title: AssegnazioneMultiplaCategoria_XXX_REQ_AssignmentCategoria_APPAndroid_TEST_Smartphone_select_multiple_items_and_assign_category

Steps.Step Description: Open the application and navigate to the list view where elements with the 'Categoria' field are displayed.
Steps.Expected Result: List view is displayed with multiple elements and each element shows the 'Categoria' field and a selectable checkbox.

Steps.Step Description: Select the checkboxes for two elements (e.g., Item-101 and Item-102) that you intend to modify.
Steps.Expected Result: Checkboxes for Item-101 and Item-102 are checked and selection counter (if present) reflects 2 selected items.

Steps.Step Description: Tap the burger menu/icon in correspondence to the 'Categoria' field (burger menu visible for the selected elements).
Steps.Expected Result: Client displays a popup containing a button for each available category. Each button label follows the format 'Rendi <Categoria> (<N° elementi che possono assumere la categoria>)'.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the popup shows category buttons with correct counts for each category (e.g., 'Rendi CatA (3)', 'Rendi CatB (1)').
Steps.Expected Result: All category buttons are visible and the numeric counts represent how many of the currently selected elements (or elements in scope) can assume that category; counts are non-negative integers and match backend data.

Steps.Step Description: Tap the category button you want to assign to the selected items (e.g., 'Rendi CatA (3)').
Steps.Expected Result: Popup closes and the UI proceeds with the flow described in step 6 of the Percorso base. A visual confirmation (toast or inline message) indicates that the category assignment action has been initiated.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm that Item-101 and Item-102 now display the newly assigned category (CatA) in their 'Categoria' field and that any persisted list reflects the change after refresh.
Steps.Expected Result: Both Item-101 and Item-102 show 'CatA' in their Categoria field. After refreshing the view, the change persists and backend data (if accessible) shows the updated category for both items.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester is authenticated and has permission to modify Categoria. 2) The list view contains at least two elements (Item-101, Item-102). 3) Categories (e.g., CatA, CatB) exist in the system and assignment rules allow changes. 4) Network connectivity to the backend is available.
test_cases.Dataset: Selected items: Item-101, Item-102; Available categories: CatA (applies to 3 items), CatB (applies to 1 item)
test_cases.Expected Result: Selected items are assigned the chosen category; popup shows correct category buttons and counts; changes persist after refresh.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI selection, popup display, button selection and immediate UI update; does not validate deeper backend transaction logs or concurrent user conflicts.

test_cases.Title: AssegnazioneMultiplaCategoria_XXX_REQ_AssignmentCategoria_APPAndroid_TEST_Smartphone_no_items_selected_error_handling

Steps.Step Description: Open the application and navigate to the list view with elements containing the 'Categoria' field.
Steps.Expected Result: List view is displayed and no items are selected (all checkboxes unchecked).

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to tap the burger menu/icon in correspondence to the 'Categoria' field without selecting any items.
Steps.Expected Result: Either the burger menu is disabled/inactive or, if tappable, the client shows an inline warning or popup indicating that at least one element must be selected to perform bulk category assignment (e.g., 'Seleziona almeno un elemento').

Steps.Step Description: If the menu is disabled, attempt to enable it by selecting no items and performing any expected keyboard or accessibility shortcuts that might trigger the menu.
Steps.Expected Result: No action triggers the bulk category popup; the system consistently requires selection. No popup with category buttons is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select a single item and then deselect it; attempt again to open the burger menu.
Steps.Expected Result: Behavior is consistent with step 2: menu disabled or a clear message shown that selection is required before bulk assignment.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester is authenticated. 2) List view is loaded. 3) No items are selected before test start.
test_cases.Dataset: No selected items
test_cases.Expected Result: System prevents opening/using the bulk category assignment popup when no items are selected and provides a clear user message instructing to select at least one element.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client-side validation when no items are selected; does not cover server-side validation or API error responses.

test_cases.Title: AssegnazioneMultiplaCategoria_XXX_REQ_AssignmentCategoria_APPAndroid_TEST_Smartphone_category_with_zero_applicable_items

Steps.Step Description: Open the application and navigate to the list view where multiple elements are displayed. Select two elements that cannot assume a specific category (e.g., Item-201 and Item-202 based on business rules).
Steps.Expected Result: The elements are selected and selection counter shows 2 selected items.

Steps.Step Description: Tap the burger menu in correspondence to the 'Categoria' field to open the popup with category buttons.
Steps.Expected Result: Popup is displayed showing buttons for all categories. For the category that none of the selected items can assume, the button label reads 'Rendi CatZ (0)'.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to tap the category button that shows count zero (e.g., 'Rendi CatZ (0)').
Steps.Expected Result: Either the 'Rendi CatZ (0)' button is disabled/unselectable or, if selectable, an immediate validation message appears explaining why the assignment is not possible. No category change is applied to the selected items.

Steps.Step Description: Select a category with a positive applicable count (if available) and perform assignment to confirm normal behavior.
Steps.Expected Result: Assignment proceeds normally for categories that have a positive applicable count. Items update their Categoria field accordingly.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Tester is authenticated. 2) Items Item-201 and Item-202 exist and business rules make CatZ inapplicable to them. 3) Categories including CatZ exist in the system.
test_cases.Dataset: Selected items: Item-201, Item-202; Categories: CatZ (0 applicable), CatA (2 applicable)
test_cases.Expected Result: Category buttons correctly indicate zero applicability; system prevents assignment of categories with zero applicable items and allows assignment for applicable categories.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates UI behavior for categories with zero applicable items and successful assignment for applicable categories; does not validate server-side rule evaluation beyond UI indication.

test_cases.Title: ImpostaInternazionale_XXX_Internazionale_Indirizzo_TEST_Computer_enable checkbox and save

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application on a desktop browser and log in with a valid user (user with full edit permissions).
Steps.Expected Result: Login is successful and the user is landed on the dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to 'Profile' -> 'Address' edit form where the 'Internazionale' checkbox is available.
Steps.Expected Result: The Address edit form is displayed and the 'Internazionale' checkbox is visible and currently unchecked.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Internazionale' checkbox to enable it.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Internazionale' checkbox becomes checked and UI enables any fields related to international addresses (e.g., 'Country').

Steps.Step Description: Fill required address fields for international address (e.g., Street, Postal Code, Country = 'France') and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Save action completes successfully and a success message (e.g., 'Address saved') is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Re-open the Address form (refresh page or navigate away and back) to verify stored value.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Internazionale' checkbox remains checked and the Country field contains the saved value 'France'.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test environment available and reachable. 2) Test user account with edit permissions exists (username: ui_edit_user / password: Password1!). 3) Address section contains the 'Internazionale' checkbox. 4) Network connectivity to backend.
test_cases.Dataset: User: ui_edit_user; Password: Password1!; Address data: Street='Rue de Test', PostalCode='75001', Country='France'
test_cases.Expected Result: The 'Internazionale' flag can be enabled from the UI, related international fields are available, and the value persists after save and reload.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI enablement and persistence. Does not cover backend payload schema validation or audit logging.

test_cases.Title: ImpostaInternazionale_XXX_Internazionale_Indirizzo_TEST_Computer_disable checkbox and save

Steps.Step Description: Log in with a valid user who currently has 'Internazionale' enabled on their address (user: ui_edit_user_with_international).
Steps.Expected Result: Login succeeds and profile page is accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to 'Profile' -> 'Address' and open the edit form where the 'Internazionale' checkbox is currently checked.
Steps.Expected Result: Address form shows 'Internazionale' checked and international-specific fields populated.

Steps.Step Description: Uncheck the 'Internazionale' checkbox to disable international mode.
Steps.Expected Result: The checkbox becomes unchecked and international-specific fields (e.g., Country) are either hidden or marked optional according to UI rules.

Steps.Step Description: Adjust address fields to local format if required (e.g., remove country) and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Save completes successfully and a confirmation message is shown.

Steps.Step Description: Refresh the page and re-open the Address form to confirm the change persisted.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Internazionale' checkbox remains unchecked and international-only fields are not required.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test account ui_edit_user_with_international exists and has 'Internazionale' currently enabled. 2) Tester has access to the profile address edit feature.
test_cases.Dataset: User: ui_edit_user_with_international; Password: Password1!; Existing Country='Spain'
test_cases.Expected Result: Disabling 'Internazionale' updates the UI accordingly and persists the unchecked state after save.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI disable flow and persistence. Does not verify downstream billing/shipping systems.

test_cases.Title: ImpostaInternazionale_XXX_Internazionale_Indirizzo_TEST_Computer_validation when international selected

Steps.Step Description: Log in with a valid user that can edit address data.
Steps.Expected Result: Login successful and profile page accessible.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Address edit form and check the 'Internazionale' checkbox but leave the Country field empty (do not fill any country).
Steps.Expected Result: 'Internazionale' checkbox is checked and Country field is empty (or default placeholder).

Steps.Step Description: Click 'Save' to attempt to persist the address with 'Internazionale' checked and missing Country.
Steps.Expected Result: Form validation triggers. An inline validation error is displayed near the Country field (e.g., 'Country is required for international addresses') and the save is blocked.

Steps.Step Description: Fill Country with an invalid value (e.g., a numeric string '123') and attempt to save.
Steps.Expected Result: Validation rejects invalid country value with appropriate error message and prevents save.

Steps.Step Description: Fill Country with a valid country (e.g., 'Portugal') and click 'Save'.
Steps.Expected Result: Save succeeds and the 'Internazionale' flag and country persist.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Validation rules for Country field exist when 'Internazionale' is checked. 2) Test user has edit rights.
test_cases.Dataset: User: ui_edit_user; Password: Password1!; Invalid country='123'; Valid country='Portugal'
test_cases.Expected Result: System enforces required/format validation on Country when 'Internazionale' is selected and allows saving only with valid country value.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers client-side validation and basic format checks. Does not include exhaustive country code format validation on backend.

test_cases.Title: ImpostaInternazionale_XXX_Internazionale_Indirizzo_TEST_Smartphone_UI behavior on mobile

Steps.Step Description: Open the mobile web application on a smartphone (Chrome on Android or Safari on iOS) and log in with a valid user.
Steps.Expected Result: Login successful and responsive mobile UI is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Profile -> Address edit screen and locate the 'Internazionale' control (could be a switch/toggle on mobile).
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Internazionale' control is visible and tappable, rendered correctly within the mobile layout.

Steps.Step Description: Tap the 'Internazionale' switch to enable it. Observe how additional fields appear or layout changes to accommodate Country selection.
Steps.Expected Result: Toggle changes state to enabled; additional fields (Country) are visible and accessible; no overlapping UI or layout breaks occur.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to enable and immediately save while on a slow network (simulate throttling if available).
Steps.Expected Result: UI shows saving indicator; request completes or appropriate error/timeouts are shown; no duplicate submissions occur when tapping Save multiple times.

Steps.Step Description: After successful save, close and reopen the app/browser and verify that the 'Internazionale' state persisted.
Steps.Expected Result: The switch remains enabled and saved country value is present.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Mobile responsive version of the site is available. 2) Test user credentials: mobile_user / Password1!. 3) Ability to simulate slow network if needed.
test_cases.Dataset: User: mobile_user; Password: Password1!; Country='Turkey'
test_cases.Expected Result: Mobile UI correctly renders and persists the 'Internazionale' flag without layout issues and handles save under poor network gracefully.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers mobile UI rendering and basic network conditions; accessibility and screen-reader behavior not included.

test_cases.Title: ImpostaInternazionale_XXX_Internazionale_Backend_TEST_API_update and validation

Steps.Step Description: Prepare an API client and valid authentication token for a user with permission to update addresses.
Steps.Expected Result: Authentication token obtained and API endpoint /api/v1/addresses/{id} reachable.

Steps.Step Description: Send a PUT request to update the address payload setting "internazionale": true and omitting "country" field.
Steps.Expected Result: API responds with HTTP 400 Bad Request and a JSON error indicating that 'country' is required when 'internazionale' is true.

Steps.Step Description: Send a PUT request with "internazionale": true and "country": "FR" (valid ISO country code).
Steps.Expected Result: API responds with HTTP 200 OK and returns the updated resource with "internazionale": true and "country": "FR".

Steps.Step Description: Send a PUT request with an invalid value for 'internazionale' (e.g., string 'yes' instead of boolean true/false).
Steps.Expected Result: API responds with HTTP 400 Bad Request and a validation error describing the expected boolean type for 'internazionale'.

Steps.Step Description: Query GET /api/v1/addresses/{id} to confirm the persisted values.
Steps.Expected Result: GET returns the resource with the values that were accepted by the PUT (e.g., "internazionale": true, "country": "FR").

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) API endpoint /api/v1/addresses/{id} available. 2) Valid API credentials/token for test user. 3) Address id exists and is editable.
test_cases.Dataset: Auth token: <token>; Address ID: 1001; Payload examples: {"internazionale": true, "country": "FR", "street": "Rue Test"}
test_cases.Expected Result: Backend enforces validation rules for 'internazionale' and 'country', accepts boolean values, rejects incorrect types, and persists valid updates.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers API request/response validation for field 'internazionale'. Integration with downstream services and audit trail not covered.

test_cases.Title: ImpostaInternazionale_XXX_Internazionale_Indirizzo_TEST_Computer_readonly role cannot change

Steps.Step Description: Log in with a user account that has read-only permissions for profile data (user: readonly_user).
Steps.Expected Result: Login successful and profile page is accessible with limited edit controls.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Address view and attempt to interact with the 'Internazionale' control (checkbox or toggle).
Steps.Expected Result: The 'Internazionale' control appears disabled (read-only) or attempting to change it is blocked by the UI.

Steps.Step Description: If UI allows client-side interaction, attempt to click Save and observe server response or error message.
Steps.Expected Result: Server rejects modification attempts (e.g., HTTP 403 if via API) or UI prevents saving and displays an authorization error such as 'You do not have permission to modify address data'.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the 'Internazionale' value remains unchanged after attempted modification.
Steps.Expected Result: The original 'Internazionale' value is unchanged in the UI and in the backend if queried via API.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Read-only user account readonly_user exists. 2) Authorization rules implemented that prevent address edits for this role.
test_cases.Dataset: User: readonly_user; Password: Password1!; Address ID: 1002
test_cases.Expected Result: Users without edit permission cannot change 'Internazionale'; UI and backend enforce authorization preventing modifications.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI and basic backend authorization checks for the field. Does not cover role management UI or audit logging.

test_cases.Title: SetInternazionale_Single_XXX_REQ-INTERN-001_ManifestazioniApp_TEST_Computer_Set single Manifestazione as Internazionale

Steps.Step Description: Open the application and log in using a valid user account with edit permissions for Brand Spain (e.g., user: spain_editor@example.com / password: Password123).
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully authenticated and the application dashboard is displayed showing Brand selection and Manifestazioni menu.

Steps.Step Description: Select Brand 'Spain' from the brand selector.
Steps.Expected Result: Brand 'Spain' is selected and the UI is filtered to show only Manifestazioni belonging to Brand Spain.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Manifestazioni' list and identify a single Manifestazione whose 'Internazionale' flag is currently set to 'No' (non-international). Note its identifier (e.g., MAN-1001).
Steps.Expected Result: Manifestazione MAN-1001 is visible in the list and displays 'Internazionale' = No (or unchecked).

Steps.Step Description: Open the detail/edit view for Manifestazione MAN-1001.
Steps.Expected Result: Detail/edit view for MAN-1001 is displayed with an 'Internazionale' field (checkbox or toggle) visible and editable.

Steps.Step Description: Set the 'Internazionale' field to Yes (check the checkbox or toggle on) and click 'Save' (or 'Update').
Steps.Expected Result: Save action completes successfully and a confirmation message (e.g., 'Manifestazione updated') is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Return to the Manifestazioni list and refresh the view or reopen MAN-1001 detail page to verify persisted value.
Steps.Expected Result: Manifestazione MAN-1001 now displays 'Internazionale' = Yes (checked). The change persists after refresh.

Steps.Step Description: Verify backend persistence by checking the manifestazione record via API or DB (if tester has access): query manifestazione MAN-1001's 'internazionale' flag.
Steps.Expected Result: Backend record for MAN-1001 has 'internazionale' = true (or equivalent) confirming data persisted correctly.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1) Test user 'spain_editor@example.com' exists with edit permissions for Brand Spain.
2) At least one Manifestazione (MAN-1001) exists in Brand Spain with 'Internazionale' = No.
3) Tester has access to the Manifestazioni list and edit screens.
4) Network connectivity to test environment is available.
test_cases.Dataset: User: spain_editor@example.com / Password: Password123; Manifestazione ID: MAN-1001 (initially Internazionale = No).
test_cases.Expected Result: User can set 'Internazionale' to Yes for a single Manifestazione in Brand Spain; the UI reflects the change immediately and the backend persists the change.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers UI edit flow and backend persistence for a single manifestazione; external integrations (e.g., downstream feeds) and permission matrix full coverage not included.

test_cases.Title: SetInternazionale_Bulk_XXX_REQ-INTERN-002_ManifestazioniApp_TEST_Computer_Set multiple Manifestazioni as Internazionale (bulk update)

Steps.Step Description: Log in with a user account that has bulk-edit permissions for Brand Spain (e.g., spain_admin@example.com).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and dashboard is displayed with Brand selector.

Steps.Step Description: Select Brand 'Spain' and navigate to the 'Manifestazioni' list filtered for Spain.
Steps.Expected Result: List shows only Manifestazioni for Brand Spain.

Steps.Step Description: Select three Manifestazioni (e.g., MAN-2001, MAN-2002, MAN-2003) which currently have 'Internazionale' = No using the multi-select checkboxes.
Steps.Expected Result: The three Manifestazioni are selected; bulk action controls become available.

Steps.Step Description: Use the 'Bulk Edit' action to set 'Internazionale' to Yes for the selected items and confirm the bulk operation.
Steps.Expected Result: Bulk edit dialog confirms setting 'Internazionale' = Yes for selected items; confirmation prompt is shown and operation runs.

Steps.Step Description: Wait for the bulk update to complete and refresh the Manifestazioni list.
Steps.Expected Result: Selected Manifestazioni MAN-2001, MAN-2002, MAN-2003 now show 'Internazionale' = Yes in the list.

Steps.Step Description: Verify via API or DB that the internazional field for each of the three manifestazioni is set to true.
Steps.Expected Result: Backend records for MAN-2001, MAN-2002, MAN-2003 have 'internazionale' = true.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1) User spain_admin@example.com exists with bulk-edit permissions.
2) At least three Manifestazioni exist in Brand Spain with 'Internazionale' = No.
3) Bulk edit feature is enabled in the environment.
test_cases.Dataset: User: spain_admin@example.com / Password: AdminPass!; Manifestazione IDs: MAN-2001, MAN-2002, MAN-2003.
test_cases.Expected Result: User can perform bulk update to set 'Internazionale' = Yes for multiple Manifestazioni in Brand Spain; UI and backend reflect the updated values.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers bulk UI flow and backend persistence; performance of very large bulk operations and rollback scenarios not included.

test_cases.Title: SetInternazionale_NotLogged_XXX_REQ-INTERN-003_ManifestazioniApp_TEST_Computer_Attempt set Internazionale when not logged in

Steps.Step Description: Open the application URL in an incognito/private browser window (no active session).
Steps.Expected Result: Application redirects to the login page or shows anonymous view with no edit capabilities.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to navigate directly to the edit URL for a Manifestazione in Brand Spain (e.g., /manifestazioni/edit/MAN-3001) without logging in.
Steps.Expected Result: Application blocks access and redirects to login page or shows 'Authentication required' error.

Steps.Step Description: If UI shows Manifestazioni list to anonymous user, attempt to click 'Edit' or interact with the 'Internazionale' field.
Steps.Expected Result: Edit controls are not available; any attempt to save prompts for authentication and no change is made to the manifestazione.

Steps.Step Description: Verify via backend (API/DB) that the 'internazionale' value for MAN-3001 remains unchanged.
Steps.Expected Result: Backend shows original value for MAN-3001; no unauthorized modifications occurred.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1) No active user session in the browser.
2) Manifestazione MAN-3001 exists in Brand Spain.
3) Tester has read access to verify backend or API.
test_cases.Dataset: Manifestazione ID: MAN-3001; no user credentials (anonymous session).
test_cases.Expected Result: Users who are not logged in cannot set or save the 'Internazionale' field; application requires authentication and no change is persisted.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates access control for anonymous users; does not cover session timeout scenarios.

test_cases.Title: SetInternazionale_Permissions_XXX_REQ-INTERN-004_ManifestazioniApp_TEST_Computer_User without edit permission cannot change Internazionale

Steps.Step Description: Log in using a user account with read-only/view permissions for Brand Spain (e.g., spain_viewer@example.com).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and can view Manifestazioni list but has no edit capabilities.

Steps.Step Description: Select Brand 'Spain' and open a Manifestazione detail page (e.g., MAN-4001).
Steps.Expected Result: Detail page is displayed but 'Internazionale' field is either read-only (disabled) or not editable; no edit/save buttons present.

Steps.Step Description: Attempt to modify the 'Internazionale' field and click 'Save' if allowed by UI.
Steps.Expected Result: UI either prevents modification (control disabled) or shows an authorization error on attempt to save (e.g., 'You do not have permission to perform this action').

Steps.Step Description: Verify via backend (API/DB) that MAN-4001 'internazionale' value did not change after the attempt.
Steps.Expected Result: Backend remains unchanged; unauthorized users cannot alter the field.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1) User spain_viewer@example.com exists and has read-only permissions.
2) Manifestazione MAN-4001 exists in Brand Spain.
3) Tester can access backend for verification.
test_cases.Dataset: User: spain_viewer@example.com / Password: ViewerPass; Manifestazione ID: MAN-4001.
test_cases.Expected Result: Users without edit permissions cannot modify the 'Internazionale' field; UI prevents edits and backend remains unchanged.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers read-only role behavior; detailed role matrix across multiple roles not included.

test_cases.Title: SetInternazionale_BrandScope_XXX_REQ-INTERN-005_ManifestazioniApp_TEST_Computer_Verify Brand Spain scope enforcement

Steps.Step Description: Log in with a user account that has edit permissions across multiple brands (e.g., multi_brand_editor@example.com).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and can switch brands.

Steps.Step Description: Select a Brand other than Spain (e.g., Brand Portugal) and navigate to its Manifestazioni list. Identify a Manifestazione (MAN-5001) and attempt to set 'Internazionale' = Yes.
Steps.Expected Result: If business rule restricts the 'Internazionale' flag editing only within Brand Spain, the application should either allow editing but it affects only the selected brand, or display a message explaining the scope. Attempt should behave according to system rules (see Expected Result details below).

Steps.Step Description: Switch to Brand 'Spain', locate an equivalent Manifestazione (MAN-5002) and set 'Internazionale' to Yes; save the change.
Steps.Expected Result: In Brand Spain the change is allowed and persists. No changes in other brands occur as a side effect unless business logic indicates cross-brand propagation.

Steps.Step Description: Verify backend that MAN-5001 (other brand) remains unchanged (if policy is per-brand) and MAN-5002 (Spain) is updated.
Steps.Expected Result: Backend shows MAN-5001 unchanged and MAN-5002 with 'internazionale' = true, confirming Brand scope is enforced.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1) multi_brand_editor@example.com exists with edit permissions across brands.
2) Manifestazioni exist in at least two brands (Portugal MAN-5001 and Spain MAN-5002).
3) Business rule regarding cross-brand effect is known to the tester.
test_cases.Dataset: User: multi_brand_editor@example.com / Password: MultiPass; Manifestazione IDs: MAN-5001 (Portugal), MAN-5002 (Spain).
test_cases.Expected Result: The 'Internazionale' flag changes apply to the selected brand only; setting the flag in Brand Spain affects only Spain manifestazioni and does not unintentionally modify other brands' records.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Validates brand-scoped behavior; cross-brand propagation rules should be separately tested if applicable.

test_cases.Title: SetInternazionale_Audit_XXX_REQ-INTERN-006_ManifestazioniApp_TEST_Computer_Verify persistence and audit log after change

Steps.Step Description: Log in as a user with edit permissions and audit log access (e.g., spain_auditor@example.com).
Steps.Expected Result: User logged in and can access both Manifestazioni edit screens and audit/logging view.

Steps.Step Description: Select Brand 'Spain', open Manifestazione MAN-6001 (current 'Internazionale' = No), and change 'Internazionale' to Yes then save.
Steps.Expected Result: Change saved successfully and confirmation message displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Log out and log back in, then reopen MAN-6001 to verify the 'Internazionale' field persists as Yes.
Steps.Expected Result: MAN-6001 shows 'Internazionale' = Yes after relogin, confirming persistence.

Steps.Step Description: Open the Audit Log (or change history) for MAN-6001 and locate the entry corresponding to the change (filter by timestamp and user).
Steps.Expected Result: Audit log contains an entry that records the change: actor (spain_auditor@example.com), timestamp, field changed 'Internazionale', previous value 'No', new value 'Yes'.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that audit entry includes sufficient metadata (user ID, brand = Spain, manifestazione ID, and timestamp) and that entries are immutable.
Steps.Expected Result: Audit entry contains expected metadata and cannot be edited via UI; attempts to modify audit entries are not permitted.

test_cases.Preconditions:
1) User spain_auditor@example.com exists with edit and audit access.
2) Manifestazione MAN-6001 exists in Brand Spain.
3) Audit logging feature is enabled and accessible in the environment.
test_cases.Dataset: User: spain_auditor@example.com / Password: AuditorPass; Manifestazione ID: MAN-6001.
test_cases.Expected Result: Changes to 'Internazionale' persist after logout/login and are recorded in the audit log with user, timestamp, previous and new values.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Checks persistence and audit logging for the change; retention policy, export and long-term archival not covered.

test_cases.Title: AccessoAnagrafica_XXX_AttorePrincipale_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_VerifyAccess

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application URL in a browser and navigate to the login page.

test_cases.Title: ModificaAnagrafica_XXX_AttorePrincipale_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_VerifyEditSave

Steps.Step Description: Log into the web application using a valid 'Utente Anagrafica' account (username: utente_anagrafica, password: Password123!).
Steps.Expected Result: User is authenticated and can access application dashboard.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to Anagrafica area and open the detail view of a specific test record that is editable.

Steps.Step Description: Refresh the page or re-open the same record to verify persistence.
Steps.Expected Result: The modifications remain persisted and are shown correctly after refresh/reopen.

test_cases.Preconditions: 1) Test environment is available. 2) 'utente_anagrafica' account exists with edit permissions. 3) The selected Anagrafica record is not locked and is editable. 4) Backup or test dataset is used to avoid changing production data.

test_cases.Title: AccessoNegatoAnagrafica_XXX_AttorePrincipale_AnagraficaApp_TEST_Computer_VerifyPermissions

Steps.Step Description: Open the web application and go to the login page.
Steps.Expected Result: Login page is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Log in using a valid account that does NOT have the 'Utente Anagrafica' role (username: utente_non_anagrafica, password: Password123!).
